column3: Comment
column11: Took out Saturday night - missed the ambiance of the dining room but the food quality, service, portions and presentation were excellent. Taking out again midweek!

column3: Everything about this restaurant is exquisite from the welcoming fireplace upon entering to the warmed milk served with tea and coffee. Attention to detail is unparalleled.
My first time and really enjoyed it.  Excellent meal and service.  Great atmosphere - perfect Friday night spot after a long week. We will b back
Lovely inn & restaurant, excellent service, very good food
Great food, excellent service, and amazing atmosphere.  I will be returning
Great meal and service!
1770 house consistently has the best food in East Hampton.  The ambiance is wonderful - quiet.  Some may say it's "stuffy" but I disagree. I always have a nice night out eating at 1770 House.
We need to dine there more often   Worth the drive from Southampton
Always excellent food and service.
Fantastic chef and cozy warm space.

The 1770 House is the jewel box of east hampton .the tavern is chic and decorated beautifully comfortable with banquet seating and its  interesting looking at the historic foundation and fireplace.The menu is yummy and the music played  is also a bit of mellow rock and roll history   The lovely tranquil main dining room is quiet with tables spaced well to provide personal space.   Both the food and service in both is first rate. I've been many times and whether it's a regular night.  restaurant week or $17.70 night in the tavern, it's always a special night when we go to The 1770 House.
Every single thing on the menu was AMAZING! Pricey but highly recommended!

Excellent food and great service! The restaurant never disappointed us whenever we went there for dinner. We highly recommend to all white have not tried this restaurant yet. Whatever you order, you will not be disappointed.
Always great food, service is excellent. Great cocktails. Love sitting downstairs in the tavern, very cozy.

My wife and I love this place and make it an ANNUAL MUST during the winter time in the hamptons. We always end up having a drink by the fireplace and before/or/after a fantastic meal. Highly recommend this place for special occasions.
The service was absolutely fantastic. The food was amazing as well.
Mid-winter overnight stay was spectacular! Inn and restaurant were outstanding and the staff couldn't have been more charming.

The hostess wouldn‚Äôt seat us at a corner , private table because she said they were committed (room remained 90% empty for the hour we were there). Not her fault but she seated a loud, obnoxious party next to us. Not pleasant.

No other restaurant in the Hamptons comes close to the atmosphere and food quality of the 1770 house.   There might be places that are 'hot" for a year or two or where you might see more famous people , but this who want fine food in a refined atmosphere go to the 1770 House.   Pricey on Friday and Sat night but the Sunday thru Thursday Prix Fixe is a terrific value.
As usual, food was delicious, device was excellent, atmosphere was great and all personnel were warm, welcoming and professional.

We loved our experience at 1770 house. The food was absolutely incredible, the decor was beautiful, and the wait staff were attentive and helpful. Highly recommend! We look forward to coming back again!
Perfection, love this place!
Food was great!
Always an exceptional dinner here.  And this is one of the very few restaurants where you can have a conversation over dinner.  It's quiet enough to hear your friends.

1770 is one of my favorite restaurants on Long Island. We decided to stay at the inn the last minute and I am so happy we did. Great service and very clean. I highly really recommend it both the inn and restaurant. We will definitely be back.
It was lively. Perfect 20th anniversary meal.
The service was sporadic with one waiter & busboy for the dining room. My cocktail was a watered down run&tonic. The food was delicious.
The Tavern menu and cooking is excellent, and in a delightful and cozy "old inn tavern" below-ground space from the Revolutionary War era.
Organic chicken, Brussels sprout salad and date cake: the best. The service is consistently impeccable.
Everything was perfect! Will visit again!
A perfect restaurant, in terms of ambience, service drink, and food.Our servers were very knowledgeable and skilled  about the menu and gracious hospitality.
Always good . one of the best in the Hamptons you can even hear everyone at the table which is rare these days.

We would go every few months but instead go every few years simply to see if things have changed with the food preparation. They have not.  The menu always tempts but the food is always under-flavored, (not just under-seasoned, which some dishes are), and yet the salad is always too salty.   Frustrating because we are strongly drawn to this elegant room, comforting yet sophisticated inn ambience, superb service, good wine choices, well-made drinks, lovely venue.
Absolutely loved the ambiance and charm of 1770. Waiter was very knowledgeable of food and wine recommendations. The food was amazing we will definitely return !
I love the chicken cooked to perfection on its bed of delicate mushed potatoes the sticky dates cales is out of this world.
Our meal and service were both excellent
1770 House continues to be East Hamptons best restaurant....Creative menu, great service and a sensational value during restaurant week.
Best place in East Hampton. They are consistently lovely. The food was delicious a wonderful dinning experience. Recommend highly.
Such a cozy place and wonderful staff! The food is delicious! They just need to have a heavier pour with wine. That‚Äôs my only suggestion.
1770 House was fabulous, as usual. Going there for Restaurant Week made it a tremendous bargain. I still would highly recommend it even when it is not Restaurant Week.
Words cannot describe the incredible dining experience we had at Arethusa al Tavolo. We were impressed from start to finish with service and food and will definitely go back for another fine dinner.
Food was AMAZING! I would 100% recommend it! The service was great also!
Exceptional experience!  A must experience for any foodie out there and for anyone who appreciates quality, locally produced food.
My wife and I went out for our 26th Wedding Anniversary.  Everything was wonderful and we look forward to coming back.  They treat you like family.  We love this restaurant!Peter Cordeau

Food was unique and beautifully presented BUT the restaurant was so dark that we had to use our cellphone flashlights to see the menu and although the food looked like pieces of art  the room was too dark to really appreciate it.
This is our go to fine dining experience in Connecticut.

This was our second time eating at Arethusa al Tavolo and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. Prices are average for fine dining but the food and service are outstanding which makes it completely worth it. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again!
Outstanding from beginning to end. Our favorite restaurant hands down! From the food to the service!!! Just absolutely incredible. Love our date nights at Arethusa Al Tavolo!

Wow! Usually the veggies play 2nd fiddle in the entree, not here, they were just as much a star of the meal as the rest of the dish. I know they grow their own vegetables on the their farm, but the preparation was fantastic. We are definitely going back.

Lovely destination restaurant...people travel from miles for good reason.  Suggest making your reservations well in advance.  Be sure to check out the Bakery across the street to bring a bit back home (and because you may not have room for dessert) also the Ice Creamery and Cheese shop next door...
Always a great experience! Drinks, food, atmosphere are all top notch. Highly recommended!

Overall I would give a good rating. the service was excellent with there attention to detail . The menu was pretentious  and difficult to understand, too many things in each dish. Less is more would be my recommendation. The ambience is not great with the tables to close together and no evidence of sound abatement. It was noisy and difficult to carry on a conversation. How ever I did enjoy the dinner and would recommend to anyone who does not mind the negatives.
Superb as always

Honestly, this has been the first dining experience I've had in a while where every single step of the meal was noteworthy. We sat down and both my father and husband (who were celebrating their birthdays) were presented with hand written birthday cards from the owner. The wine selection was perfect, the gluten free bread was dynamite. And every part of the meal was amazing. Nothing was wasted.  The dynamics of all of the flavors were flawless. Seriously. Incredible meal. Thank you.

The food was really very good and we enjoyed it. Thanks also for the thoughtfulness as we celebrated our anniversary - the card and ice cream were unexpected so thanks again. Overall we had  great experience and will recommend this to friends too.
Always consistently excellent food and service! Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

This is such a FABULOUS restaurant and the food is delicious. We just picked the wrong night and got seated in the bar area. There were people standing next to our table pretty much the whole night. It was hard for the waitress to serve us it was so crowded. They did try and ask people to move they just kept coming back. I would definitely go back it is my favorite restaurant. I would just ask for a different table OR not go by a holiday ( Valentine's day).
Wonderful valentine lunch.  Great service and delicious meal.  We so enjoyed our visit and would highly recommend having a special lunch or dinner.
Everything is always great. We feel like they treat us like family. Great food, service and never disappointed.
Outstanding service. Lovely atmosphere and exception all food

Without exaggeration, this was the best dining experience I've had in a long time.  Everything about it was superb from the terrific quality and sophistication of the food through the excellent service and overall classy vibe of the place.  The prices are appropriate for a high-end restaurant - it's worth the money.  We will definitely be going back regularly.
As always a great meal

This was hands down the best fine dinning experience I have had. It was so good that I feel I could have randomly been brought anything from the menu aI would love it all. Worth every mile of the drive from Simsbury.
Amazing all the way!
The unique combinations on ingredients are put together to make the most amazing dishes you will ever eat!   Food and service is OUTSTANDING.

This restaurant is a real gem. Everything about it is quality- food, service, ambience. The menu is diverse and creative. It all works to stimulate the senses and make each dish better than the sum of the parts. While the preparation is inventive it remains appealing without being over the top or too fussy. This is one of the best restaurants anywhere.
Outstanding.  Service was impeccable, food and drinks excellent and Robert made our dining experience very personal.
Another fabulous lunch! Service and food 2nd to none.
Fabulous, period.

One word... WOW! This was by far the easiest & fastest review I‚Äôve ever written. This place is special from the moment you enter. There is a palpable ‚Äòpride‚Äô in the restaurant for all the employees - they are part of a terrific experience and make the diners feel it. The maitre‚Äôd, Robert, was extremely attentive, but not intrusive throughout the meal. The servers knew what to recommend (this was our first visit), and the food was delivered quickly and steaming- perfect!Our entrees were the sea bass and chicken - could not have been more pleased with the choices. My feeling is that everything on the menu is superb! Before dinner, we traveled next door to the Arethusa Dairy and purchased a pint of their ice cream. They kept it frozen for us during dinner - a nice ‚Äòservice‚Äô.This is my favorite restaurant in Ct and we will be back for more visits! Bravo!!
Fabulous,wonderful,delicious.....EverytimeConsistent epic food and great service
Anniversary
Outstanding! The food is an 11 on a scale of 1-10. Do not miss trying their ice cream. It is the best you‚Äôll ever have.
My family and I frequently dine at Arethusa al Tavolo and we always have a consistently wonderful time with delicious food and fantastic service!

Great cooking , menu , pace of thd meal and exceptional serviceA trademark of this restaurant.  The wine list is balanced and well thought out, the menu and cooking excellent ( and we are both lactose int),Great pleasure as always.Highly recommended AB
Elegant setting with lovely service and very fine food. Just a little bit pricy for me with only compliments on our experience there.
Best food outside New York City hands down without a doubt at all!
A very special place, I love the ambience, food is delicious and always good service, It is a bit of a drive for us, but worth it, Love it here.
Food was absolutely delicious! Kudos to the chef. Robert and Brandan were wonderful.
Always delicious. Lovely staff.
Excellent food, vibe, and ambiance!
Perfection.

A culinary temple. Each and every dish was a work of art. I loved the way each dish was explained. I look forward to returning. The only thing I would change is the music, it didn‚Äôt go with the experience.
Food is good, not great. In my opinion the price is not justified.
The whole experience was outstanding

If someone asks us where to go for fine dining with New York vibe, this is the place. There is no similar restaurant anywhere in the world. Try their reserve pairing to make the experience even better.
Wonderful in every way! Amazing food and great service.
Absolutely amazing food and service in an intimate setting. I am vegetarian and they made me an entire special menu to accommodate my dietary restriction. A must go to!

Always the best meal of our lives. Services is SPECTACULAR. chef and kitchen are truly phenomenal creating a menu that is nothing short of course after course of taste treat (especially given dietary restrictions). Staff is attentive but not bothersome. We look forward to dining at Atera every year. Special. Memorable and delicious.
Great experience. Certainly recommend.

OK. I'm not one for superlatives, but I have to say that my dinner at  Atera was the best dining experience one could ever hope for. From the minute you are greeted, until your departure 9 close to three hours later), you are pampered and fed like never before. It was our 25th anniversary, and every staff member knew about it, congratulated us (by name), and made our night feel so extra special. Once one of the amazing staff, David, found out that I was Grateful Dead fan, the music (which was played at the perfect volume) featured a wonderful set of Dead tunes. Now the food: in a word-- beyond. Seventeen courses. Not too stingy, not too much. Actually had to make room for the last two savory courses. (There's always room for dessert-- courses 16 and 17). I did the temperance drink pairing-- crazy inventive and fun (not a must, but if you have a few $ you don't mind spending, it adds a nice comic dimension to an otherwise very serious and very delicious tasting menu. Chef Ronny is on hand (and is very hands on) overseeing every detail.  He is 35, looks like he is 25, and cooks like he's been doing this forever. This is one restaurant experience you cannot miss. As an aside: We stayed over at 11Howard- a beautiful boutique hotel nearby. Had the 6pm Atera seating. Went to AIRE ancient baths after dinner (9-10:30pm)-- around the block-- for an amazing post-dinner spa experience. If you want to be a hero, treat your special someone to a night like this-- it won't be soon forgotten!Extra shout out to David at Atera-- thank you for a very special evening.
exceptional meal .  All dishes were superbly presented and perfectly balanced.  I enjoyed all the savory dishes but the last few sweet ones were disappointing.
Small seat restaurant. Two seatings a night. Good wine pairings. Nice food presentation.

My husband and I were in NYC from Atlanta to celebrate his 50th birthday, and I surprised him with reservations at Atera.  The atmosphere is fantastic and the seating allowed for conversation with others if desired.  The tasting menu was absolutely sublime and the chefs and staff were engaging.  highly recommend getting the wine pairings as well.
A memorable and just a great culinary experience.
The food was incredible and the service was wonderful. My friend and I had a fantastic time.
One of my favorite restaurants in the world
As good a meal as I‚Äôve eaten in New York.  Anywhere, in fact.  Wine accompaniment was superb.  Loved the soundtrack too (Metallica, Fine Young Cannibals, INXS, the Stones... ).
Exceptional experience. The chef is an artist and you can feel his inspiration in his cuisine, which is quite rare.
Phenomenal, artistic and joyful. It‚Äôs evident that every staff member loves what they do.
Best restaurant in NYC
Chef Ronny and his team have really brought Atera back to the spotlight in NYC.  Highly recommended for those that enjoy a wonderful evening with great hosts and even better food.
Nice place for dinning

While the food was spectacular, one of the waiters (older gentleman with a ponytail) verbally threatened me for dropping my napkin. ‚ÄúIf you drop this napkin again me and you will have a problem and will need to resolve this outside‚Äù.  As you can imagine this completely ruined my night and I would never imagine that the service staff would speak to their patrons in that manner.  Despite the food, I will recommend to all my family and friends to stay away for the restaurant given my experience.
Divine. The food was beautiful and the service was thoughtful and attentive. It was a true pleasure to watch the care, precision and mastery that went in to each tasting.

Last time I had this fantastic of a gastronomical experience was at Noma, Copenhagen . Chef Emborg meticulously crafted each dish with attention to detail for taste, texture and presentation. Every course was a culinary delight.Hats off to the service crew & staff, bravo! Cheers to Chef, for a brilliant execution and the best evening of 2020, yet. Thank you

I was rather disappointed with Atera.  The food was fine; it is Michelin star grade.  But the atmosphere was too uptight, the chef looked angry and unhappy and one of the Scot servers was rude.  I am not able to enjoy food in a tense ambiance and for the price I paid I expected the entire staff, starting with the chef, to have minimum charm.  Some dishes were rather heavy:  I wished I had seen more creativity rather than the usual suspects: caviar, uni, foie gras and truffle oil.  I enjoyed the opening cocktail, the dumpling and the passion fruit mochi.  I am a bit concerned by the level of cholesterol that comes as part of the entire tasting menu.  Sadly I will not be coming back, nor will I recommend Atera to others.  Good luck.
It is truly a top restaurant and deserve three Michelin stars. Very creative delicious elegant artsy and pleasing menue.
Always a joy! Exciting dishes, 5 star service, hard to beat this!

Amazing meal with 16 courses that ranged from very good to amazing.  Service is perfect.  Love sitting at counter and watching the chefs prepare the courses.  Also enjoyed the music selections that play and keep the atmosphere pretty casual.
They charged us 1,000 for a meal for two. We are not going back to this restaurant.

Very unassuming location but lovely relaxed dining room with guests dressed from relaxed to smart casual. Special mention must go to Messrs Abbick and Manka at front of house who genuinely provided some of the best service I‚Äôve ever experienced at any restaurant - the entire team is incredibly friendly and personable.The food was of a very high standard as you‚Äôd expect and immaculately presented. The team were happy to explain more about each dish and their passion for their work was evident. If you have the funds to go (it isn‚Äôt cheap, we saved months for it), enjoy food and you‚Äôre looking for a fine dining experience in NY, I‚Äôd happily recommend this place.

this was an extraordinary experience. the entire time we were there was incredible. from the food, to the service even down to the music selection....it was all great. the chef is creative, the staff is attentive, the restaurant is intimate and comfortable. with only 14-18 dining at a time you are wanting for nothing. you do pay a price for all of this but it was all worth while!!!!
Everyone made a birthday memorable and delicious
Second visit to Atera. Still my favorite fine-dining restaurant in NYC. Just perfect!

Atera was a highlight of my recent trip to New York. The food and ambience was amazing. Jordan who took care of us was a superstar. I was lucky enough to score 2 seats over the new year holidays at this super intimate place and the overall experience was definitely deserving of its 2 Michelin stars. Just go and be dazzled and oh, get at least one member of your dining party opt for the temperance pairing. Just do it! Xoxo
PerfectEach course was impressive

As a foodie and a 30-year hospitality professional, this experience was absolutely fascinating!  It felt a little "Eyes Wide Shut" when I first arrived; a very small, intimate dining area (there were only 17 guests for my seating), and the staff was completely silent in front of us to begin.  Service was flawless, and the team moved effortlessly among each other for 15 courses.  A great ballet, and amazing to watch.  The cuisine was creative and flavorful (think Kaluga caviar paired with a quenelle of pistachio gelato and IPA), but I can't honestly think of a single course that I would request again.  This show was all about the ceremony of the service and plate presentation.  I opted for the coursing paired with wine, and I enjoyed several varietals I'd never tried before; Bosco (blended with Vermentino) from Cinque Terre in Northern Italy, Mencia from Ribeira Sacra, Spain.
One of the best fine dinning restaurants in NY, had an amazing night there.

Atera is exceptional.   The food (about 17 courses!) was amazing.  Very creative, with combinations of food one might never consider yet they all blended beautifully.  The U-shaped table facing the chefs turned out to be a wonderful addition.  All the staff was very attentive, friendly and as interactive as you wanted them to be (or not!).   The service was noteworthy.  Everything you would expect from a Michelin 2 star...and more.   I have never been to a restaurant where so much attention was given to your personal comfort and interests, in addition to proper and timely serving and removal of food and drink.  I would highly, highly recommend Atera.  True, it is expensive, but given the amount and type of food, it was truly worth the money spent, as no expense was spared by the restaurant in the selection, preparation and delivery of the meal.
Outstanding experience staff and food excellent.
Food and service fantastic as always!
Delicious food, outstanding service, and charming atmosphere. Looking forward to going back soon.
Food was amazing! Good service

We had an important high level business meeting with out of town guests. Barclay prime turned out to be the perfect location. Elegant and impressive with great food, but not too noisy. Impeccable service throughout the night.

Have to say....Not Good.  I have dined at top steakhouses across the US. This was suppose to be one of them according to reviews ,but unfortunately for me it wasn't even in my top 20.   Place was WAAAYY to dark number 1..never before have I had to use my phone flashlight to see the menu.  Waiter was not friendly...seemed he couldn't be bothered.  Saw him once throughout the night.  Took forever to take our order..had a helper who was a bit nicer, but not a super friendly personality.  Food was OK.  Nothing spectacular.  From carpaccio, tuna tartare, and lobster bisque soup....ehhh 5 out of 10. Had a Prime ribeye, was OK....not really seasoned that much.  Dining partner had a Prime Strip...Not Good.  Dessert was Ok having had the banana creme br√ªl√©e and coffee...Overall, not worth the $300.  Would not return or recommend.
The food was amazing! Our server did a great job as well. No complaints and can‚Äôt wait to go back.
Best steakhouse in Philly period. Their Wagyu cuts are insane quality. Fully recommend the American Wagyu Ribeye paired with either a Filet or preferably the Bone-in strip.
Awesome place. Great food!

The best meal I've ever had. Words can not describe the cheesesteak! I can not stop thinking about that indescribable sandwich. We also shared the seafood tower. Extremely fresh and so delicious.  Dover sole to die for and steak done to perfection. Wish I could eat here every day. Service and decor simply wonderful!.
Great as usual, can‚Äôt go wrong with anything to be honest. This was a classic Wagyu RibEye, Bone-In NY, Truffle Mac and Creamed Spinach for my wife‚Äôs bday! Doesn‚Äôt get better
The wait staff was outstanding in their service.  The fillet was delicious but the ribeye steak was tough and had quite a bit of grizzle or tendons
The filet and lamb were amazing!
Waited 3 years for this sandwich omg üòã. Worth the wait #phillycheesesteak #barclayprime #excellent

An overpriced restaurant with few redeeming features.  The waitress was about as snotty as one can be:  I order my meat well- done.  "You mean like a hockey puck."  While the salads were ok, the crab cakes were mediocre and overpriced.  The filet was equally mediocre, but to add a further insult, there was a $4 charge for A1 sauce.  Even though the charge was removed, the Gaul to  place this on the bill shows an utter disregard for the customer.  The baked potato and the martini were ok.Not worth another visit.

Everything was good, but having dined here several times over recent years, something seemed to be lacking to live up to the pomp and circumstance.  Service was off-pace (e.g. appetizers served before the earlier ordered cocktails arrived-which were rather average).  Steaks were good, but not off the chart good-not even the Waygu filet.  The sides were excellent-tater tots and truffle mac and cheese were as good as ever.  Deep dish cookie dessert was uninspired.  I‚Äôd return based on previous experiences, but not in a rush after this visit.
The food was really good. Pleasant surprise with the carrots. The customer service was outstanding. The waiter was extremely personable. The waiter really made the evening special for my birthday.
Great food and service
Amazing dinner ! Will def be back ! Everything from service time food was exceptional !!
Perfect meal, ambiance, service; no better restaurant in Philadelphia or beyond, in my opinion.
Amazing food and service.
The food was delicious. Service was excellent, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a great dinner, will definitely visit again.
It was fine but not for the price definitely not worth it.

My partner loves the ribeye at the Palm and Knife and Fork (in AC). But he says the ribeye he had at BP is best he ever had. Says it was perfectly marbled and tender and flavorful. Charred on outside perfect juicy medium rare doneness on inside. We also enjoyed hamachi crudo and foie  gras starters. Cocktails good but not stellar and expensive. Didnt love brussel sprouts. not done enough but he liked them. loved banana creme brulee for dessert. Two glasses bordeaux good value
We had great food and the service was exceptional.
Everything was done at the highest level. From arrival to departure, everything and everyone was top notch. I highly recommend this as a special occasion restaurant.
Amazing food you get what You pay for. Drinks are a little pricy but overall awesome experience

A special birthday treat for dad.  Started off with cocktails and apps in the bar.  Service was a bit slow during happy hour, but it was friendly.  Our server Erin was helpful and friendly in the dining room.  Thank you for making a kid-friendly pasta dish for my 9-year-old.

Service was terrific. Everything prepared to perfection, from hot buttered brioche to dessert. We enjoyed NY strip, mushrooms, baked potato, lobster bisque - all of it outstanding. We were there for a date, but the rest of the dining room on a busy Thursday evening seemed to be exclusively business meetings (which makes sense since the prices will make you look twice if you are not expensing it!) Our server Jeff was knowledgeable about everything from whiskey to the restaurant‚Äôs history. Classic steakhouse with great seafood options as well!
The caviar with a glass of champagne  was delicious!

THE ONLY THING THAT KEEPS US FROM GIVING A 5 STAR RATING WAS THE BAR SERVICE.  AFTER WATCHING WAITER WALK BY TO OTHER TABLES FOR 15 MINUTES, I HAD TO ASK HOW TO GET A DRINK.  THE EXCUSE WAS THAT THEY THOUGHT I WAS WAITING FOR SOMEONE WHICH I WAS, BUT I WAS GOING TO WAIT WITH A DRINK WHICH I WAS NEVER OFFERED.  NOT UP TO BARCLAY PRINE STANDARDS.
Engagement - amazing service and food
Food was amazing. Service was great. This was my second time back and I love it!
Overall, a very nice and unique restaurant. Perfect ambience for a special night out. However, it is very expensive and quite honestly, given the hype and reviews, the food was just average.
Delicious food, wonderful service. Best steak I've ever had.
We loved the quiet, calm & comfortable ambiance of the dining room. Our server, Allison was attentive, professional & gave us great recommendations!
Great atmosphere and excellent service but the food was mediocre.
Excellent!
Amazing food. Amazing staff. Amazing experience.

As a Butcher and Singer regular, I decided to snap up a reservation at BP. BP has a NYC/ Miami vibe as opposed to an old school east coast chop house which is what Butcher and Singer is. Both are excellent. Both have their niche. You can‚Äôt go wrong with either. Personally, I appreciate the old school vibe and the Porterhouse for 1 at Butcher and Singer which is a Top 5 steak in my travels (Peter Lugars, Gallagher‚Äôs, Keens, Charley‚Äôs in Tampa). However, you do not have to coerce me to have a steak at either establishment.

This place redefines Italian Cuisine. Every time I come to LA is one of the places on my list. As a born and raised Italian living in the US for the last 40 years, It takes a ton. to impressed me, but this place, no matter what you are eating, is a notch above the rest.Consistency is another. key to their success. When you come to a place 10 times and it is always great. that says a lot.One not to miss!!
Amazing experience.  Great dishes.
amazing food! Our waiter was informative and attentive.  We highly recommend this lovely, little, taste of Italy!
Fantastic as always!

Barrique was wonderful! It was a quaint, upscale, romantic dinner for two. Service was excellent across every staff member we encountered. The food was delicious and thoughtfully prepared. My favorite dish was the scallop starter. I felt everything was well priced for the quality and experience :]
AMAZING wow What a treat this place is the best! Truly!!
What a beautiful experience to be out after being home for months. The food was amazing, the waiter super friendly and the ambiance romantic and wonderful. Highly recommended!!
This was the most enjoyable evening!The service was excellent, the food fantastic!We cannot wait to go back and are fortunate to live only 15 min. away!!!!Birte

Our first time dining out since the Pandemic and it was heaven! Everything was delicious and wonderful! We were very comfortable with the health and safety standards they had implemented. Most of the tables in this restaurant are outside but we set inside with some other diners (since outside was full) and felt very safe.
A great spot for a delicious meal! the service was great, made us feel like they knew us. will definitely be back.
Always a great meal! We go regularly, and have never been disappointed.
Great food. Great service. Very romantic! I definitely recommend it.
This meal was beyond amazing!! One of my top five meals in the last five years!! Can‚Äôt wait to go back!!

First dining out in months...  Barrique never disappoints and tonight was not exception.  Happy to see them open and several other couples enjoying the evening.Staff wore masks & gloves and the spacing of tables was appropriate and safe.
Excellent quality, service and ambiance.
Great experience
I would put Barrique up there with any Italian in LA, they also have some specialty dishes that are very unique and can't find anywhere else.
The people were very friendly and very pleasant. I liked the pasta in Al dente very deliciously.
Fillet mignon was on the dry, side.sea-bass was so-so.Nice servers.A bit overpriced.

Excellent service, delicious food, romantic ambiance. Took my boyfriend for his birthday dinner who is a major Italian foodie and he said its his favorite meal/restaurant in LA. Brought our own bottle of wine, for which our waiter researched and then suggested dishes that would pair well with our wine. Will return for any special event.
We loved the food and ambiance.  The restaurant is charming and homey.  Excellent pastas.  Attentive service.  We will return.

My boyfriend and I come here for both of our birthdays every year and we are never disappointed! From the mouth watering food to our favorite server Michael who is so sweet and always provides the best wine recommendations Barrique is easily our favorite restaurant in Santa Monica.
Delightful place‚Äî-food and service were amazing!  Fantastic wine list!
Best scallops and best filet ever.
Barrique is a hidden gem on main street Venice. The the ambiance is romantic and the food is great. It was very noisy however and the seating is quite close.

My first time there and our family spends a lot of our time indulging in great meals. Went in for a blow dry today and was told to go to Barrique! Amazing meal, service and warm hospitality. We loved the prosciutto and burrata and beet pasta as an appetizer. The gentle flavor of the pasta was so delicious and did not make you feel heavy.  The prosciutto was perfect and the serving was so generous. I had the special lobster ravioli with black truffle in lobster bisque. It was as amazing as it sounds. I could not stop  till my husband gave me a piece of his rib eye. It was flavored perfectly with the sea salt that reminded me of Hawaiian sea salt (I‚Äôm born and raised on Maui) it was tender and tasted like wagyu. I left giggling and extremely happy. The meal was so incredible we had to call the restaurant to tell them and spoke to Tony who was so receptive and appreciative. Michael was our waiter and made the dining experience perfect. This is a gem of a restaurant! Our son Keanu has gone there and told us about it and now I know why he raves about it! We will be back!!
Truly wonderful dining experience!Food was amazing and the atmosphere relaxing but romantic.
Best appetizers, pasta, filet mignon!  We sat in the bottom floor next to the kitchen and enjoyed the delicious smells wafting throughout our dinner.  Service, ambience, everything was fantastic!
Very friendly service, perfect dinner experience
Our dinner was amazingly yummy! Our waiter was super attentive. It was an incredibly enjoyable evening from start to finish.
Best Italian restaurant in the area

We absolutely love this wonderful Italian restaurant for a romantic night out together. This was for Valentines and they kept their regular menu which we much preferred. The octopus starter, wild boar ragu pasta, and chocolate desert were all outstanding. And I lived in Italy for 8 years so I can truly say that! Definitely one of the best restaurants in the area.
Everything was great. Only critique was courses were rushed. Entries came out and we were still enjoying the appetizer. Same other tables around us

Food was good - not great - especially given the prices were on the higher side. We went on Valentine‚Äôs Day and, though the brothers-owners were very nice, we felt rushed. Table was tiny and barely accommodated our food, drinks and bottle of water. Outside is nice but upstairs looked even better in terms of ambience.

I am a fussy restaurant goer and I was very pleased.  This was my first time going to Barrique.  I was very pleased.  It was a charming experience and the pasta was delicious.  An added bonus was their fabulous wine list.  I highly recommend it.
Food and service was good. But the place was noisy also little congested.
Fantastic! Great food excellent service and superb ambiance. Love it.
Always delicious, always great service.  One of our favorite spots.
The food was very fresh and such high quality - the steak melts in your mouth.

I was a little disappointed.  I notified the restaurant in advance that one of our guests had an allergy.  When we were seated they acknowleged this.  Yet after ordering and when they started bringing the food our guest was told they could not easily accomodate his needs.  He has eaten all over Italy, and NEVER had this issue.  it would have been more appropriate to let us know earlier, ie when we ordered or call and tell us before we came in
Order the bone in ribeye, it's the reason you came, it's amazing.Also, oysters are great and you cannot lose with the sides

Bavette√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s is by far my favorite restaurant.  We split oysters and shrimp which was very good.  Smoked salmon Caesar salad which was fabulous. Oh....-and the warm bread with amazing crust was divine.  Salmon dish slightly spiced was delicious. Loaded baked potato with diced bacon very tasty. Son in law had a steak that was very good and my daughter had chicken.  Everything was delicious.
Food lived up to the hype!!! But the plate that stole the show was the Brussel Sprouts!!! Never in my wildest dreams did I expect them to be this good! Highly recommend them!!
Amazing steakhouse in Chicago! Great for a date night or birthday dinner! Service was excellent and food was outstanding!

I had been looking forward to my reservations for months.  It was a late night reservation due to availability.  We ordered an appetizer that was forgotten about until we reminded our server.  It was brought out moments before our entr√É¬©e.  This put a damper on a highly anticipated date night for my husband's birthday.  The appetizer was later comped and service was good up until we had to flag down our server to get our dessert wrapped up to go.  Food was good but the service will not have me returning.  There are far better restaurants with top notch service for the price.
Best restaurant in the city consistently top notch
Everything was great, service, food, ambiance. We had to book our reservation well in advance, but it lived up to the wait. Would recommend, and would go again.

Ambiance and food  were outstanding. Possibly the best steak dinner my wife and I have ever had.  We both had the filet . Cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. We were celebrating my wife's birthday and I called ahead for reservations and table on the main floor. Great table but our server never mentioned the occasion to my wife. Would highly recommend for outstanding food,  terrific surroundings and memorable night.
Slow service and did not honor reservation time
Best steakhouse in the city. And the seafood is amazing as well.
The filet mignon was cooked to perfection .  The service from Klause was excellent. We highly recommend this romantic and fantastic place.
Best steak in Chicago.  Would definitely recommend to anyone!

We were sat at a table towards the door last night. Very drafty when the door opened. Disappointing they did not do more to keep the doors from being open at same time.Food was very good. I thought the service was just average. Was expecting exceptional experience, was just pretty good
Our waiter Ben was great, we didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t feel rushed. We sat downstairs in a booth and the music and atmosphere was nice . The bottle of wine we had paired beautifully with our steak .
The best!!
Very enjoyable place to visit, the burger is a must!
One of the best steaks in Chicago! Try bone marrow and ribeye, they are the must.

Steak had to be sent back twice and on the third time it was overcooked and tasted terrible. Huge disappointment but the waiter was very good and they were nice enough to remove my steak from the bill. Sides and apps were delicious. Very very dark restaurant.

I try and get to Bavettes as often as possible - amazing place.  Had difficulty with my prior visit as I had an 8:00 PM reservation (Downstairs - Parlor) and they seated me at 9:20 PM so I was very upset.  This reservation would be my last if that happened again but they were perfect in everyway on this visit.  We sat downstairs (preferred space), waiter was awesome and the food is always the star here.  Bavette's has the best atmosphere in the city - we will be back!

Went to celebrate my daughter√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s birthday- the hostess acknowledged that and then no one after that mentioned her birthday. Somewhat of a bummer as several tables near us were served desserts with sparklers.  We were lucky that Erik finally made it back to our table to get a dessert order let alone send sparklers. Laid back is one thing but Erik takes it to an art form. Food was wonderful, back staff was on the ball, Erik seemed not to care

Very good food, but not exceptional within this price range.  Terrific, friendly and timely service.  Good wine selection at reasonable prices.  Background music is too loud and interferes with conversation.

Waiting for a reservation without knowing how long the table is going to be, being told that it's 2mins which turns into 10mins is frustrating. Multiple times they got the order wrong and I've cooked better $70 Ribeyes at home
Waited 40 minutes to be sat, and then were sat in the basement

Food was good and service was very friendly but timing of food delivery was uneven. We ordered three steaks, all medium...one came out medium, another medium-well and a third well-done. All top quality beef but not as ordered. Sides large and good. We had a booth, which was great.
The food was great and we enjoyed the atmosphere and music!
Food was excellent service and waiting time was right on schedule . Staff did a great job

Took me several months to get a reservation but it was worth it. My wife and I went with my brother and his wife. For appetizers we ordered the steak tartare, shrimp cocktail and half dozen oysters. All were great. For steaks the bone in ribeye and the petite fillet. They were cooked perfectly with great flavor. For sides, the sweet potatoes, crab stuffed avocado salad, truffle mac and cheese and elote style corn. For me the elote style corn was the best but all were good. As for the wine, I highly recommend the Colombo Apertura Pinot Noir. One of the best wines I have had in a long time. No dessert unfortunately but if you see the amount of food we ordered you will understand why we passed.The ambiance of the place was also very cool. The music was great and the noise level was a little high but sitting in the booth we didn't have much difficulty hearing. There is a great bar area both upstairs and down. Only complaint is the restroom situation. They are single restrooms and there was at least one to two waiting in line. Not a big deal.Overall an excellent meal and great scene. Would love to go back so I better get to work trying to secure another reservation. People did walk in without a reservation and I overheard them being told hour thirty to an hour forty-five. Not that unusual for a high-end restaurant downtown but I prefer a reservation.
Amazing food and great service.  Definitely worth a trip to Bavette if you are going through Chicago.  YUM!!
It was fabulous !!!! We love Bavettes ...It is our most favorite restaurant ever !!
Well executed food but the service left quite a bit to be desired.
Amazing service and food was outstanding.

Went to Bavette's for a date night and the food was really good! Only disappointment was the length of time we were there. We ended up being there for 3.5 hours due to the wait time on our steaks. Also, I ordered a bone-in filet cooked medium+ and it was pretty well-done except close to the bone. Still very flavorful though!
We were there for my boyfriends surprise 30th! The staff went above and beyond to make this special surprise perfect!

The first time I came to Bavette's we only had appetizers and side dishes--and it was amazing. I wanted to come back and get to experience one of the best steaks in Chicago. It definitely lived up to the hype and as always, the sides (specifically the wedge salad with their famous bacon and the garlic mashed potatoes) were fantastic as well. The ambiance makes you feel like you've stepped into a classic Chicago speakeasy, especially in the basement and the service was on point. Great spot to celebrate a special occasion.

Bavettes came highly recommended. First of all, it is quite dark in the dining room. The rest rooms are old and small. The bar area has a rather nice ambiance. There is an additional dining room in the "dungeon" which provides less noise and more privacy. The food is pricey and I would suffice it to say that you do not necessarily get your money's worth. The portions are relatively small. The filet mignon and lamb chops were average. However, the crab was excellent! The service is attentive. I think there are many other superior options for steaks, chops and seafood in the area.  We will not be returning to Bavettes anytime soon.
Loved the food! Came out very fast. Service was amazing. Food was hot and seasoned just right. Will be back!
So good! Their Mac and cheese with bacon √∞≈∏¬§¬§
Amazing! Great experience!
Wonderful anniversary dinner.  Impeccable service. Phenomenal food.  My favorite restaurant in Chicago,

My wife and I had an excellent time.  The ambiance was amazing!  The music playing was sultry and seductive.  The food was great!!!! The service was outstanding!!!! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone!!! Perfect date night restaurant!!!
Splendid, best quail I have ever had. The caviar with egg is extremely tasty.
Wonderful evening of fine dining.

We have been wanting to try Benu for years, so were excited to finally make a night of dining here.  The service was outstanding.  The timing of the dishes coming out was excellent and we found the servers to be professional and also very charming.  The food, though, fell a bit short of expectations for a 3-star restaurant.  Most of the starting tastes were delicious, but some of the main courses were not very good.  The xiao long bao and beef courses were excellent, but the soup was rather bland and the BBQ quail had an overwhelming smoke flavor that was unappealing.  After dining at Quince, Acquerello, and Manresa, we were disappointed in the food at Benu.  It was a good experience overall, but not really worth the price in comparison with similar class restaurants.

Technicality wise it is at the highest caliber. Service was impeccable. Atmosphere is very calm and intricate. Personally, it felt amazing to see simple everyday Asian food presented in exquisite ways.Lots of praise for the Benu team
Amazing from start to finish. The food, service and hospitality were unmatched.
Loved every dish and service was superb
Really great food. Some courses were out of this world, some courses were just really good but not worth the cost. All in all a great experience for a special occasion.

One of The most amazing meals of my life. The food was perfect. And THE SERVICE: like a ballet! Also The Ambience, The Music. The beautiful Wine list! A Trip to San Francisco is only complete it if you visit Benu: The Food Cathedral!
The food was exceptional
The xiao long bao is an explosion of flavor - a truly amazing creation!  This alone made this a life experience.  Flawless!
Food is good, no problemNeed a more comfortable chair to be honest.And need to increase the distance between tables defintely.
Innovative and classic at the same time. What an experience!
Absolutely excellent and attentive service of 3 Michelin star.   The food was wonderful.   Thank you
it has actually improved from last time I was there, thought there was no room to move further, but I am wrong, they can do even better than better
Every item of food was truly unique.  The explanation by the staff was very clear and welcome
Amazing. We‚Äôll be back!

I‚Äôm still blown away by the culinary experience and Service. That the Benu team provides. The menu was beyond delightful. Loved the Asian influence and all the delicacies. Pictures speak for itself.
Anniversary dinner!

We went for our anniversary. Very beautiful dishes and tasty as well. I don‚Äôt like raw food so Benu is the right type of restaurant for me. Most of dishes are from China and Korea. If you like Asian food or want to try Asian food, then you will like it
Worth it. It's a month of daycare/preschool for one kiddo. But I like good food/booze, so does my husband, and I appreciated the multicultural, equal gender reppin that night.
Most incredible restaurant on the West Coast, worth every penny and the entire trip!
Outstanding quality of food, drinks, presentation, and service.
An upscale dining experience great for a date night.  The food and service were excellent, but be prepared to spend some serious money.
Each dish looked like a masterpiece. The taste  of the food divine. The minimalist decor soothes the senses and awakens imagination. Excellent service.
Repeat visit to this exceptional restaurant. Interesting dishes, wonderful presentation, excellent wine pairing. Overall, an extraordinary experience.

A new found appreciation for ingredients I grew up with. A fascinating and well thought out twist on Korean and Chinese cuisine. One of the most perfect meals I‚Äôve had. Every bite was a dream and the portions were perfect. Benu is an institution and a must visit if you‚Äôre in SF!
My favourite dining experience to date. We went for our anniversary and the service was beyond impeccable. The flavours were inventive and yet still so delicious. Such a special dining experience!

Each dish, brought one by one to the table at a comfortable rate, was amazing.  It felt like we were dining in our own home as there was continual interaction with the kindly, professional wait staff.  They were eager to answer questions and seemed to enjoy how much we were enjoying the experience.  I loved the presentation of each delicacy in a special bowl or on a plate made just for that offering.  The only flaw to our evening, one which was not under the control of the waitstaff was the loud talking from a nearby table of business people who could not have actually been eating, or at least not really savoring what was being brought to them.  The food itself was totally worth the price, which is admittedly not for the faint of heart.  You cannot get these dishes anywhere else and the ingredients are rare or difficult to source. The wine offerings were similarly stunning and so were the prices for wines by the glass, which added substantially to our final bill.  It was a special event for us, so we didn't mind the loud conversation nearby us nor the final bill-- we were prepared for that .  It was an epic evening.
It‚Äôs really an amazing restaurant which deserved 3 stars Michelin
Hands down the very best service you will ever receive, and the food was euphoric.
Really enjoyed the meal.   Loved the Asian influences.
have good service
I have twice dined at Benu!! The cuisine and the staff are quite amazing! Also, I really appreciated that the tasting menu had quite a few new additions between my 1st visit and most recent visit!
Great Meal as the last time. Great food and service from start to the desserts. Every time will be back to SF will visit Benu. All best for all team great job.
Sublime restaurant experience.

Delicious. Innovative flavor profiles, consistent and excellent execution, thoughtful and perfectly balanced wine pairingsThe service was knowledgeable, professionally enthusiastic, and unobtrusive. Loved our main wait person and the somm was excellent!
Outstanding ! Never disappointed! The food is exquisite, innovative, yet with a respect to the spirit of traditional Chinese and Asian gastronomy. The staff is A+.
Creative and delicious food in a wonderfully sedate setting.
Pretentious & largely tasteless food served by smug, arrogant staff.

Amazing place to have one of the best nights of your life! Special Mention to the wine pairing, it was simply perfect for the tasting menu, which is an artwork from Corey. My most sincerely congratulations for him! Every course was a tremendous experience of flavors and textures in another different level. Also the service was spectacular. Every person knows what they are talking about and they make you feel really nice during the whole experience. Really really happy for being there.

Where does one begin. My God, this place was top drawer all the way. Our server Mathew was incredible,  he asked,  he explained, he was attentive,  on a Saturday night no less w all the craziness that ensues on a busy night.  The food was off the charts,  the stuffed peppers and the Saffron crepe where just intense. The cocktails were beautifully orchestrated,  overall a great time and will certainly be returning when I get back to Raleigh.
Favorite restaurant in Raleigh, hands down. Really special new things to try, along with wonderful versions of classics. Seriously, incredible flavors, amazing atmosphere and design - love.

My second time here and was pleased to bring along three others that had not been to Bida Manda before. It was the perfect experience. From the unique cocktails, amazing apps, tasty entrees and superior service.
Food was great!

I was thrilled to finally be able to visit Bida Manda!  Due to its deserved popularity, short notice evening reservations are hard to come by, so lunch proved to be a great option.  I thoroughly enjoyed the pork belly soup.  It is unlike anything I've ever had.  For a soup, it is incredibly rich and filling.  The portion was so large that I had more than enough for lunch the next day.  Our server Sophia was so friendly and knowledgeable.  The only downside (and a small one for me) is that the table next to us was very very close.  I look forward to going back to Bida Manda and trying some of the other great menu options!
The food was delicious! I'll definitely be coming back!
Amazing meal. The most flavorful dishes I have had. I recommend the papaya salad with duck.
The Green Papaya salad with Lemongrass Chicken is absolutely delightful. Highly recommended.

We attended dinner at Bida Manda for our second anniversary. The staff was very friendly and the food was very good. They start by bringing out some complimentary shrimp chips, which were really pleasant. Our waiter recommended the lettuce wraps as an appetizer and they were hands down the best dish of the night... I‚Äôm not usually a lettuce wrap kind of guy either. We split the Manda Herb Salad with chicken and Tom Khem (short ribs and pork belly) and they balanced each other nicely. The short ribs were a little dry, but the gravy and fatty pork belly balanced them out well and they tasted delicious. The salad was really nicely balanced. The food is about $20 per entree, but we have enough leftovers for both of our lunches tomorrow, so the value is good for the price.After the waiter packed up our food, he brought us some complimentary macarons to celebrate our anniversary. They were the best macarons we‚Äôve ever had, and I‚Äôve been to Paris. To cleanse our palates at the end of the meal, they served us each a small shot of lemon juice, lime juice, and ginger, which was a great way to wrap up the wonderful experience. We‚Äôre moving soon, but if we‚Äôre ever in town again, we‚Äôll be revisiting Bida Manda for sure.
Our server Savannah was fantastic, so was the food and drink. Always a great time!
Really delicious and great service.

Food took over an hour to come out. I had ordered a thai tea and it was not ready. They said it would be ready in 5-10 minutes. 20 minutes later they brought out a tea that was nothing like how it normally is. When the food came out it came out very spread out. over 15 minutes between when my food came out and when my guests did. I was very disappointed by this since I have had good experiences in the past and wanted to share with others but was very much let down.  Food was good unsure if I would bring friends for lunch session again.
Service was super; but too noisy, otherwise great!
Great place, great foodHad a great date time with hubby

Love this place so of course I chose it for my birthday dinner with my best friends. The service is awesome and those waitresses are the nicest people ever! The appetizers are so delicious, it‚Äôs hard to save room for my main course but you have to try it all! My favorite is the lettuce wraps and chicken stirfry. Thank you for the desserts‚Ä¶ So many wonderful choices and so delicious! Try the special margarita and you won‚Äôt regret itüëçüèº

Really good cocktail, strong and flavorful.  Nice atmosphere. Waiter was very nice and professional.  We had spring rolls, papaya salad with lemongrass chicken that could have been boring in bad hands but was extremely flavorful and delicious, and a short rib/pork belly dish that was delicious.  Can‚Äôt find any fault with this place.
Always delicious and fresh!!
The pork belly soup is always great!! Very attentive service staff!
Interesting menu and tasty preparation of both cocktails and food.  One our our favorite restaurants in Raleigh.
Everything was fantastic. Our server was able to answer all of our questions about the menu and give suggestions. Everything we ordered was delicious. Made for a fantastic date night
Exceptional food, service, and atmosphere!  Highly Recommend.
The food was absolutely fantastic and the service was superb. Will most definitely come back.
Diana was a great server.  Very attentive and made sure our dietary needs were met and that our food was spectacular.  Our table was ready on time as per our reservation.
Fantastic as usual.
Will absolutely be back!

Beyond superb service. What makes this place good is how knowledgable the servers are on the food. All these questions they can answer so clearly and simply. The food quality is always superb. The ambiance was great.
ALWAYS WONDERFUL! HAVE BEEN HERE MANY TIMES AND NEVER DISAPPOINTED.
We had an absolutely fabulous time. Ross was very attentive, informative and friendly, and the food was phenomenal! Bida never ceases to amaze!
I had been looking forward to dinner at Bida Manda and I was not disappointed! Food and service were amazing and I would happily go back!

We thoroughly enjoyed Bida Manda! We started with the Lettuce cups and the Summer Rolls. Both were outstanding. I planned to have the Chicken Curry and at the last moment changed my mind and ordered the Green Papaya Salad with flat iron steak. I am so glad I did! The steak was perfectly cooked and the green papaya was crisp and refreshing. My dinning companion ordered the Basil Stir-fry with Tofu. She said it was the best she had ever had! The prices were good too.

Bida Manda became our favorite restaurant from our first visit. The staff and service are always top notch, the food never ever disappoints and the attention to detail in the entire experience is first class. We love this place so much.
We were sat early for our late reservation which was great! Our server was so sweet and very knowledgeable of each menu item. The food was amazing, each bite was better than the last!
food was unique and delicious. Service was fantastic
Delicious, quality food. We enjoyed the ramen, lettuce wraps, and spring roll very much. Our services was also wonderful.  Would highly recommend (make a reservation)!
Waiter was amazing and so helpful! Loved it!
Dinner was incredible! Our server was wonderful! The guests next to us were a bit loud and in a heated discussion but we still had a delicious dinner
Always enjoy Bida Manda!  Original, special, tasty food and OUTSTANDING service!  Helps to book in advance.

Bida Manda is always a great choice for excellent food and service.  It was, of course, full at lunchtime but still got great service.  I had not been there for several years since the first year it opened.  I was a little disappointed at the lack of originality in the food  (quality was great) which seemed much like regular Vietnamese.  My memory was that the menu was more original and authentic with their mother's recipes.  Pad Tai, Pho and Spring Rolls are not what I expect from them.

It‚Äôs been essentially the same menu for years, and yet the meals never disappoint.  Absolutely love the rice wraps, curry, and sea bass.  The room is a little loud but not so much that we wouldn‚Äôt want to go back!  One of our favorite restaurants in the Raleigh/Cary area, and apparently we share the same feelings with a lot of other people!
It was great! The food and atmosphere are amazing!
From beginning to end.. the service wonderful. Took my husband for father's day... He enjoyed every bit of it.
Family was seated immediately upon arrival. Staff was warm and welcoming, yet very professional. Food was very good. Add on portion could be larger, but everything else is fine.
Bones was outstanding.  It always is.  Service is always terrific and the food is sensational.  Whenever a family holiday comes along, we head for Bones.

We were promptly seated. Servers were attentive, however there were a couple improperly wearing facial coverings. Recommend not placing entrees until ready. The server asked for our entree order stating the meal would be spaced, however the main entree arrived prior to the wine. The steaks were cooked perfectly and the corn pudding delicious. Would recommend Bones to anyone visiting Atlanta.
Thanks for the great service!!! Food was great!My son says thanks for making his graduation dinner a meal to remember!
Husband‚Äôs Birthday.
We always come to Bones for special occasions, anniversary, birthdays, special visits etc. it is such a great experience!

Waiter gave good suggestions and was as good as you would want. Anticipated our needs but not in the way. A nice birthday dessert was a complete surprise. Plan to go back soon. Good Covid distancing and safety measures taken by staff.
Everyone was so accommodating for A birthday!
Great food bisque was excellent as well as lamb chops
Superb as always. The two month closure has not impacted in any way the superior food and service that are the hallmark of this establishment. It just gets better...
Awesome service and outstanding steaks!!! Best in ATL!!
Servers are extremely knowledgeable regarding the menu. Excellent bone-in filet! We'll be back!
Have been here several times when in Atlanta. Service and food are always excellent. Probably my favorite place to eat.
Wonderful as always. Food was the best ever with spectacular service.
Always a terrific experience at Bones.  We go for special occasions (birthdays and anniversaries) and bring a nice bottle of wine, although their selection is extensive.  Service is impeccable too.

We celebrate birthdays and anniversaries at Bones, and for the first time since the pandemic, were able to come for dinner.  It was as good, if not better than ever.  The Bones staff has managed to balance caution and attention to patron's safety without sacrificing Bones service or skimping out on some of the smaller things that make them so unique (like confetti on the table for a birthday!).  So happy they are open again - they will always be our favorite restaurant!

Thank you for re-opening your dining room.  This is the only restaurant experience that my family has experienced without being reminded of empty tables and Covid restrictions. A professional restaurant like Bones can survive WELL.Thank You The Dobson family.
Great service, great atmosphere and great food, still at the top of their game after 40+ years.
Fantastic service, friendly environment, waiter was awesome. Gave us a special touch for my daughters 21st birthday.

The standard by which every steakhouse anywhere should be judged. Bone‚Äôs always satisfies. They perfectly cook everything and the wine list offers a multitude of selection across varietals and budgets. If you haven‚Äôt been here yet, don‚Äôt tarry, make a reservation and enjoy what you‚Äôve been missing.
A wonderful experience every time.  Everyone has a way of making you feel special.  The food and wine speaks for itself.  Excellent! Best best of all worlds.
I have never had a bad meal at Bones. I have never had bad service at Bones. I have never had a less than near perfect experience at Bones.

Glad the restaurant is back open. One of the best steaks you'll get in Atlanta with amazing service from the valet parking, to the host/hostess, to the bar tenders, to the waiters. Bones is a great place that we frequent for all our special occasions.
Our dinner and service were as good as ever! We've missed you Bones. Bones staff made our 40th anniversary dinner very special to us. We'll be back, soon!
Loved it as always!!!

Best Service in TownThere are many good steak houses in Atlanta, many with lovely ambiance and service. But, hands down, Bones has the very best service in town. The host, the servers and all of Bones' personnel are friendly, helpful, knowledgable and efficient. We have eaten in Fine Dining establishments all over the world, but none surpasses Bones for service.

Absolutely wonderful experience. Food was perfect, setting amazing, and the service from everyone was excellent especially Monroe our service. He was so so wonderful and deserves recognition. Can‚Äôt wait to come back again very soon.

Everything was flawless. Best Steak in Atlanta, hands down. I have no complaint other than the excessively high price for our bottle of wine 3-4x higher than the market value. I understand restaurants always add a mark up but I believe the higher price should be within reason (maybe double).
Incredible service. Even better food.

Everything was very nice I just wasn‚Äôt happy about my food I order the lemon chicken that wasn‚Äôt good at all I didn‚Äôt finish it at all I told one of the waiter he didn‚Äôt say nothing so I want be ordering that anymore but I will be go back!!!
So glad to be able to return to Bone's.  It was as good as always!!!
always the best restaurant to celebrate a special occasion
Bone's is always fantastic. Best steaks in town and wonderful service.
Still the best place in ATL!!

Every time we go to Bones it‚Äôs outstanding. The lump crabmeat appetizer is incredible with the two dipping sauces. The Bones salad is one of the best salads I‚Äôve ever had. Then the 20 oz. bone in dry aged rib-eye is always perfectly cooked. The grit fritters are a perfect add on along with their saut√©ed mushrooms.
Heading back to college
Bone's never disappoints.  It is the benchmark by which all high end steak restaurants are judged, and this distinction is well-earned and well-deserved.
Food was amazing as always! Friendly staff, and definitely helped to make the night night more memorable.
Another fantastic visit to Bone‚Äôs restaurant. Perfect spot for a celebration or a quiet dinner.

We were super happy with all the food (especially the tuna tarts & miso seabass) until the sushi arrived. You could feel that the fish was good but they simply did not know how to make proper sushi. There was way too much rice which was also over-cooked and the fish was not sliced thin enough. Also, the service was very bad. They walked around yawning and didn't even care to ask us how the food was.

Food was amazing. Staff was polite. Unfortunately, on a slow Saturday night (COVID-19 week), it took us almost 3 hours to get through appetizers, entrees, and dessert. Food came out verrrrrry slowly (there was only 2 of us). Otherwise, amazing and delicious experience!

Food was amazing and ambiance was nice-very dark so extremely hard to read menu.  Our service was so unkind. Would definitely go back.

great service and very accommodating. Food was on point and the drinks are amazing

Let me start by saying we ate here for Valentines day last year and that was probably the best meal i've ever experienced.  So, maybe it was high expectations, but we came again for Valentines last weekend and it was not the same.  The food was mostly pretty good, but certainly not great.  The things i described as wanting from the last time were far off from what the waiter recommended this time.  In general, it was a very disappointing meal.  don't get me wrong, i wouldn't say the food was bad, but for this level (and price) of restaurant, it needs to be great.  Last year i'd give it 5-stars, but this year only 2-stars.

Amazing ambiance and the food was to die for. Downstairs was hype and upstairs was elegant. I can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t say enough good things about this place. We were treated so good. Loved the rose petals on the table for Valentine√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Day. The little box they give you at the end with raspberry white chocolate almonds soo good too.

Waited 45 minutes between drinks, appetizers, and meal on valentines day. I will give them credit that they took apps off my bill, but that really wasn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t acceptable and they acknowledged that. Overall, food was amazing but an awful experience and I won√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t go back. This is my first review and for great food it shows how awful it was
Amazing food and amazing service! Booking again right now after I write this review!

Amazing dinner, exceptional service and a night to remember!

BONDST was overall a good experience. I think that the amount and quality of the sushi we had was not quite worth the price. I understand paying for the cool atmosphere but the sushi prices are just a bit high.

really great food -- imaginative preparations of excellent ingredients with fabulous flavorsvery warm and attentive service jumpin scene with noise to go along, but lots of good feelings all around because all the patrons are so happy with their food and drink

There are SO many features to BondSt that make it my #1 go-to sushi restaurant: the warm greeting, the atmosphere, the incredible staff, the delicious menu and of course, the fantastic cocktails.  Even though, I have been a faithful patron for over 8 years, I still am discovering items on the menu that I haven't had yet.  Case in point: the sundried tomato, avocado roll with garlic ponzu oil and green tea salt.....in a word, FABULOUS!!Chef Mark Spitzer is an absolute genius!  Two weeks ago, I 'discovered' the Sake 'Braised' Short Ribs with Miso Daikon, Roasted Fuji Apple and Red Shiso Sauce.I promise you that whatever you order at BondSt will bring you joy!!

Amazing food and delicious cocktails, amazing service. Hands down my favorite restaurant on palm beach island. Even have had delicious takeout during covid.

Buccan is one of the safest restaurants I have been to during this pandemic.  They are awesome!!!  You will totally safe.  Everyone is wearing gloves and masks and the tables are more than 6' apart.  Not to mention the food is always amazing!!!
We absolutely loved our experience at Buccan. Great atmosphere and service, excellent food. The agnolotti stands out as particularly delicious, and the watermelon martinis were killer.

Fantastic is always.  One of our favorite restaurants anywhere.

Buccan was a pleasure as always! Spacing and cleanliness have been made paramount for the new normal and the menu is, as always, amazing!

Great other than the hostess initially trying to seat us on the Imoto side without giving an option or explaining that in advance. Buccan is my favorite go-to when visiting PB, and the Imoto vibe wasn‚Äôt what we were wanting. All good with the meal after that point once we got our table at Buccan.

I had not been to the Cafe Monarch previously, but had high expectation based on the reviews. It turned out to be one of those rare instances in which the reality exceeded the high expectation. The staff are friendly and upbeat, the service is attentive but not intrusive, the menu selections are imaginative, the wine list is more than impressive .  My meal was outstanding and I'd say the experience captured ' fine dining'.
Simply and absolutely Amazing !! No better service in Arizona.
We went to celebrate a birthday and the service was impeccable. They gave us a few surprises which was so kind. The food is outstanding as well!
Anniversary

A very very classy evening dinner done to perfection. From the moment you arrive it is obvious this is a top line establishment in decor, staff attentiveness, the table settings, the extra service staff, the comfortable and perfectly spaced seating. Be aware they practice all the social distancing and CDC guidelines with masks, etc. the menu is pre fixe but with several choices at each of the 4 courses. But it is really a 6 or 7 course dining experience if you add their chef‚Äôs little tasting, the foie gras that is a MUST, and of course a dessert. An extensive wine by the glass, creative cocktails and special wine pairings are in addition to an even more impressive wine list. Plan on 3 hours of bliss.

Quite possibly the best meal of my life! We celebrated my husband and I getting married this past Saturday. This is our honeymoon trip and we couldn‚Äôt be happier having had the opportunity to dine at this spectacular place. The food was incredible, the staff were the kindest, and the ambiance was unforgettable. We will definitely be back!
Amazing ambiance, amazing staff, amazing food!
Great staff start to finish. Very attentive. Good menu choices. Food prepared perfectly.
Our favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. Can't wait to go back.

Richard was amazing, very professional, fun and knowledgeable. The food was second to none, and as promised, we didn't leave hungry. Perfect anniversary dinner. We will be back and definitely highly recommended.
One of the top fine dining restaurants in Scottsdale, no question.  In Old Town.  It should definit be on your list, so go add it now.

Food and service are excellent with wonderful romantic ambiance. We have been going to Monarch Cafe for several years and it never disappoints. The staff is impeccable and Richard, our favorite among the staff, always provides great service. We highly recommend.
One our favorite places to go for date night in AZ.

Cafe Monarch is a nice AZ fine dining restaurant with good food.  Service was okay, but did not measure up to the hype.  Our waiter seemed like a super nice guy but forgot which course we were on, tried to pour us the same wine we already had with a previous course, got confused who was having what to eat and seemed nervous and not confident.  For me the service can make or break a dining experience and I am saddened that our service was sub-par for the expectation/price of the meal.  The food was good, but not great.  Cauliflower soup was the best course for everyone.  Mushroom stack, blah, skip it, too greasy, veggie lasagna was over sauced with what tasted like tomato paste.  On the other hand, the cocktails were great!  At the end, we wished we sat at the bar and just ate the soup and drank the cocktails! We all left feeling like we were let down.

Wonderful experience! Definitely one of the most romantic dinner environments I‚Äôve ever been too, with unparalleled service, a very courteous and professional staff, absolutely delectable tasting options, and a vast drink and wine menu. Albeit a very costly dinner as a whole, it‚Äôs something everyone should try at least once if you are celebrating, looking for a great date night, or just searching for for a quiet, enjoyable and immersive culinary adventure. Top notch
Excellent service. Top notch.
Won‚Äôt disappoint and great value comparatively

We always love coming to Cafe Monarch when we are visiting Scottsdale. We were again blown away by our dining experience everything from our waiter to the food and the wine pairings. Our waiter Chris was very professional and knowledgeable. Can‚Äôt wait to go back. Will make sure we ask for Chris when we return.

Applaud the restaurant for caring enough about the diners to have wait staff wear masks!This is a very special place  for very special events.  The food, drink, ambience, service and attention to the diners is in a league of its own.  No other restaurant in town (and I‚Äôve tried them all) can compare!  Don‚Äôt miss this one.

We went for our 42nd wedding anniversary. Once seated in the outdoor patio area, we were immediately congratulated and presented complimentary glasses of champagne. The amuse Bouche was a spectacular pork filled dumpling served on an apple  slaw. A bite that brought back the flavors of pork chops and applesauce. We each had a different offering on each of the courses, except for the third course of lobster raviolo (truly a must have). By the time we finished our four courses, there was no room for the complimentary desert, however, the wait staff promptly boxed it up so we could enjoy it at home. They then presented my wife with a unique ring box as a recognition of our anniversary. The total experience made this one of the top dining experiences we have had
Superb every step of the way!! We were treated like honored guests from beginning to end with the most gracious staff. By far our favorite restaurant across the country.
Wonderful patio dining.  Somewhat pricey for quality and quantity of food (I had the duck breast which was mediocre), but nice for the special occasion. Service was excellent.

Fabulous restaurant!!  Every little detail was taken care of here, they didn't miss a beat.  Food was great, service couldn't have been better and the ambience was over the top.  I highly recommend Cafe Monarch.  It's not inexpensive, but worth every dime especially for special occasions.
The creativity in combining flavors and ingredients was outstanding not to mention the creative presentations.

My husband and I ate dinner here on June 8. I had the Chilean Sea Bass and my husband had the Rack of Lamb.  Everything was.....fine.  My sea bass was overcooked.  This is a dish I look for and order whenever I can and it is amazing when cooked well - this was definitely overdone. The rack of lamb we ordered "on the rare side of medium rare", and it was overdone as well.  Everything was still "good", just not great - especially for a meal we paid over $300 for.   We came away having had a nice evening, but not sure I would go back.

Amazing place!  Amazing food!!  Amazing people!!!  We are from Boston and this one easily competes well against the best of Boston.  Love the menu.  Kudo's to the chef and the staff for a job very well done.  We will be back.  See you soon.
Beautiful experience from start to finish! Do not hesitate to go!

Truly great food, outstanding & friendly service -- what more could you ask for? This was our first time dining out since the lockdowns and we were a little apprehensive but the outdoor patio worked out really well.
Anniversary
