Wonderful all around. They make things you would never even think to be delicious.. Exactly that.. Delicious. Creative and elegant dishes that you'll never forget. The ambiance is gorgeous, and the wait staff is impeccable. Not stodgy feeling at all, yet still classy. We were made to feel comfortable, and I appreciate that.The only issue I've had (the two times I've been, had the same problem each time..), is that the dinner scallops, although perfectly cooked.. Had sand in every bite. I can't get through a whole one without struggling. Other than that.. Everything was on point.
Great dinner with friends.  The perfect place to go out now that things are reopening again.
Wonderful birthday dinner!Only drawback was small table and no masks!
Fantastic overall but plan to spend $150 per person

We dined outdoors for my birthday dinner and it was spectacular. The service was tentative and gracious, the ambiance was romantic and soothing with candles and detailed decor everywhere. The food was incredible! I want to go back weekly, but my wallet won‚Äôt allow it. However, I will be back. They even gave me a memento for my special occasion! This place is memorable and I‚Äôll be back ASAP!  P.S. they have dessert that makes your mouth water!
Time and time again... the best dining experience in KC.   Fabulous food (try the veal), ambience as genuine as if you were sitting in a France.  Wonderful service.   A joy, every time.

Did the 4 course prix fixe tonight. Smoked salmon, potato salad - crisp potatoes with tasty salmon with a CinsaultCorn bisque, pesto - this wowed us! Sweet and savory with a sparkling white wineSkate wing, brown butter, haricot vert, tomato with a muscadet - what you would expect from one of the best French restaurants in the country! Lemon, cherry and cassis verrine with cr√©me chantilly - excellent finish to a great dinner. Tart cherries... French press coffeeWe had staff did 1/2 glass wine pairings for us. Excellent service. Social distancing done tastefully inside. Only 7 tables and 2 bar seats available. More seating outside with distancing n mind too. All staff wore masks and never lowered them to talk. Love Cafe Provence will continue to return!!!
Great food. The staff was friendly and helpful.
I adore this beautiful French restaurant! The food is fantastic. The service is exceptional and the ambiance is quaint and transport you to France. I come here often.

This was our 1st time back after the COVID-19 quarantines. The food was excellent as always. The service was also great

Best french restaurant in kc
It was delicious. Outside seating and our server was wonderful.
Cafe Provance never disappoints.  The food is always fantastic.   The service very professional and polished.   We usually do lunch because it's a greater value .
I always bring my friends here for a get together or special occasions. Today was for a friend‚Äôs birthday. The food and service was exceptional as always. Thank you for making our day special.
Just fabulous as always! My favorite restaurant in town.

As one of our favorite restaurants, we were so excited n go there for meal.  Food was outstanding and service as always - excellent.

The food is classic and always delicious.  My only criticism would be for a slightly larger wine list offering some value new world wines.  However I have found their wines by the glass always have something to tempt the palate and support the great food.

Amazing food and service. Will return.
My wife and I came here for our anniversary. She had the crab cake and I had the rack of lamb. Both were amazing. Our booth felt intimate and the staff was very courteous. Will be coming again.

The gnocchi with pea puree was easily one of the best dishes I have ever eaten. The halibut was as always perfectly cooked and served with an artichoke, potato puree and a lemon, caper sauce which had a delicious tart flavor tempered by the fresh peas. The service was great as usual and everything was perfect.

This is my favorite restaurant in theater Kansas City!  It was also our first time to venture out since the pandemic began and the restaurant takes all precautions and has social distancing in practice!  Bravo to Cafe Provence!

Cafe Provence is my favorite restaurant, I used to go a lot and haven't been in 1.5 years. I went back on Saturday and it was as amazing as ever. Very excited for the opening of their new restaurant "Verbena" to open in the Meadowbrooks Development on 95th and Nall this April!!
Fabulous food wonderful atmosphere!!  Great service! I‚Äôll take one of everything to go please.

We took out-of-town guests to Cafe Provence and we all truly enjoyed it.  Both the beet salad and the butter lettuce and goat cheese salads were wonderful.  All entrees ordered were excellent.  The only complaint I heard was that one party thought that the vegetable and potato sides were just average instead of something special which is what he expected.  Great atmosphere and and conversation could easily be heard vs. what we find at many restaurants these days.
Food was very good. Could be a little picky about some items, eg escargots were pretty heavy with garlic but still very tasty. Scallops very good. No complaints. Will go again for special occasion.

We were lucky enough to have a wonderful dining experience before the closure of all local dine-in restaurants. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic! Thank you! We look forward to returning when this mess is over.

The food was exceptional! Can‚Äôt believe this is the first time I have eaten at Cafe Provence-it will definitely not be the last! The wine list is extensive, service was prompt and polite, the menu has something for everyone. My only complaint is regarding the restroom -get some ventilation in there! It was damp and stuffy and smelled way too ‚Äúbathroomy‚Äù. Not a good way to finish off a meal.
The best ambience in the city. Lighting, music, decor. Perfect
Superb food. How lucky are we to have a lovely French restaurant here in the middle of the U.S.!

I‚Äôve lived on all three coasts, and although I‚Äôve found good food wherever I‚Äôve lived, I have never found better food than I get every time I visit Caf√© Provence. Although it is relatively small, everyone in my area knows about it and salivates at the mere mention of their name.
Food is fresh and deliciously prepared with a lovely presentation.

My favorite restaurant!  I love the way the menu is presented with no categories.
By far, the best restaurant in Baltimore.  Cindy Wolf is a creative genius.  She  also keeps the restaurant performing like a well-choreographed dance.
Outstanding menu, wine selection, and service.  An experience not to be missed.
Wonderful for a special occasion. Food, service, and ambiance are all outstanding.
Best place for a romantic night out or special occasion with amazing food, and great service.  The lobster curry bisque or the she crab soup are both delicious.  Local and fresh ingredients are used.

Outstanding food and impeccable service.  What else do you need?!! The perfect place to celebrate a special occasion and now a more casual dining opportunity in the bar.  Charleston is expensive, but worth every penny!
Formality reigns with kindness and gentleness!  Delicious dining experience.
Special occasions with wife. Always more special here at Charleston.

Memorable food experience. We went for a special birthday, and the meal lived up to the hype and the price. They pay attention to details and you feel special about being in the beautiful place eating gorgeous and delicious food.
I've been here twice for special occasions and absolutely love it.  The food is spectacular and the service is outstanding.  Completely worth it.
Cindy Wolf's oldest is still her best and food shines at Charleston
Cindy Wolf knows how to run a restaurant.  Charleston has been renovated since it's inception but there was never a time the food wasn't top notch. Innovate and delicious.
Some of the finest food and service in the area.  The best sauces and selections of foods.  Super wine list and pairings.  High quality everything.
Great restaurant wonderful food and service never had a bad meal.
Baltimore's finest restaurant. Every detail is perfect, from the drinks, food, service, and decor.  Pricy but worth a visit.
It has been several years since I ate there but it remains the best restaurant/meal/evening I have had to date.
Definitely a special occasion spot, never disappointed, exceptional food and service.

So here's the thing. The food wasn't bad. It was good. It just wasn't $500+ for two people good. My husband and I have been to exceptional Michelin star/bib gourmand restaurants in the United states, UK, and elsewhere. These places provide you with an excellent experience and fantastic food that we feel are worth the amount they charge. The bottom line for us was the service was nice, the food was good, but it was absolutely not worth how much we paid especially when compared to world class restaurants that charge nearly HALF the price for an unforgettable experience. Not for us.

The portions were very small and very rich.  I ordered a filet mignon medium and got rare,  The cheesecake for dessert was the size of an ice cube.  The service was outstanding.  Overall, it was nice; but I did not consider it a good value.
We hadn't been to the Charleston for many years.  We were not disappointed.  It was a wonderful experience.  The food was great and the service was superb.
Baltimore institution. Wine bar with most delicious food in the world.
Fantastic private dinner for 16.  I will return whenever I'm in Baltimore.
A top notch experience from start to finish!
Best Restaurant ever!! Wonderful experience all around!!! A must when visiting Baltimore.

One of my favorite restaurants! My wife and I frequent Charleston celebrating many momentous occasions and the New Year's menu is always extra special.  Charleston is one the best restaurants in the United States. Everything is perfection. I have had the pleasure of dining here many times and it always amazes. The lamb I had here recently was the best preparation I have ever eaten. The truffle soup with foie gras I had recently is something I'll be thinking about for many months. Quiet honestly you just have to eat try the diversity of the menu to experience it. No review could describe quality and taste of food or does justice to all the flavors. You just have to eat it!   A true culinary experience. The service is truly professional and friendly.  No better way to start a new year.
Imho the only destination in Baltimore for true fine dining. Opt for the pairing menu to get the most out of most food and wine.
Dinner was outstanding from start to finish. Great service and great food.
Closed. No reservation confirmation. Went to Anson instead
Best crab cake ever!!

We really enjoyed our dinner!  Taylor introduced himself as our server and that Steve would be assisting him, however we had at least 2 others assisting. The service was outstanding! We did the the 6 course, my husband did it with the wine pairing. They were very generous with the wine, there were a few wines that he really enjoyed and he was offered a 2nd pour. Food was very good and Taylor was very helpful in helping us choose the selections for the courses.The restaurant also had a jazz type band, they played at just the right volume so that you could enjoy the music and still have conversation.If this restaurant was located close to our home, it would become a "go to" for us!
Always a pleasure to dine at the Grill. The staff was outstanding and every morsel was delicious.
Food was great. We are vegetarian and there were enough options for me and my husband. They are very kind people and they have a fantastic service.
Great service and very good food.Wine selection was superb.
Food and service was outstanding! I am looking foward to sharing great times with friends and family here.

We went to Charleston Grill for our anniversary. They treated us so well and the food was outstanding!  My wife felt it was one of the best dinners she had ever had!!  What a very special night for us. Every aspect of the dinner was perfect!!  Great serving and great taste!
Amazing highly recommend this dinner!
Just an amazing perfect meal!  Came for a girls weekend and this meal and our server Adam were truly a highlight of the trip.
It was fantastic! Highly recommend and would definitely come back.

If you‚Äôre looking for superb service and delicious cuisine - look no further. Make your reservation now. Every request was accommodated with a smile, from our preferred seating to the pace of our meal. Our waiter, Jerry, was personable and knowledgeable. He went out of his way to make sure we had a perfect experience. It felt like we were the only guests in the restaurant. We are excited to return.
Great food, great service, very attentive to our 2 year old granddaughter!
Great date night location! Love music until after closing time, great drinks and a variety to choose from. Service and food was outstanding, can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Absolutely fabulous dinner, from start to finish! Great wines also.... cannot wait to go back!

Have stayed at the Belmond several times.  This is our second time dining at Charleston Grill located on the property.   The service was exceptional and the food was awesome.   We had the crab cake and I must say one of the best I have had.  My husband had the oysters.  I had the flounder and it was delicious.   Next time will definitely try the tasting menu!! Can‚Äôt wait to return.
Spectacular evening!  We did the tasting menu and wine pairing.  Food was delicious and wait staff impeccable!  A must if wanting a fine dining true experience!
Last night in Charleston was the best dining experience we had all week!  Amazing food, outstanding service, and quiet and romantic ambiance.  Everything we could have asked for in a dinner date!
Everything was excellent!  My husband had the steak and said it was one of the best he had and I had the linguine and enjoyed every bite.  Bread offerings were great and drinks were wonderful!
Wonderful meal, great ambiance and excellent music for the occasion
Nice food, expensive, and where are the young clients?.

The service and wine list were great, but we were both disappointed with the food. We ordered oysters and the 4 course tasting menu. They weren‚Äôt kidding about tasting, we did not get much, what we did get was not very impressive, definitely not worth it. I would not go back or recommend it.
It was our belated Valentines dinner. We especially enjoyed the little extra touches: the treats after dinner, coffee from a french press, etc. Service and food was excellent.

Got off to a very slow start waiting for our drinks. They were not as good as we‚Äôve had elsewhere. We did the chefs choice tasting  - amazing crab cake. Everything else was nice but very rich. We all had stomach issues later in the night.
We went for my husband‚Äôs birthday dinner.  The staff treated us so well & made it very special!
Amazing food and service!
Outstanding food and service. The crab cake was the best I have ever had(and I have had many)!  We will definitely be back!
Fantastic food and service - would highly recommend!!
Lovely food and service. Excellent selection of white Burgundy. Order the crab cakes!
A great dining experience...‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶...
Amazing food!! Great service. wonderful dessert. A bit pricey, but well worth it.I'd recommend this as one of the great restaurants anywhere.
Wonderful evening celebrating our 30th Anniversary!

Everything was wonderful. The Williams Duo music was fantastic!

We love the food! The restaurant is beautiful and the valet service wonderful, but the food is the star.I always order the caviar and am never disappointed. We also ordered the sunchoke side to share, and it was the best thing I have literally ever eaten. Amazing. In addition, the service is great and you will leave full, as the wait staff brings snacks along the way throughout your experience. Even cute little dessert bites.Definitely in my top two places to eat in Charleston.
Great food and service.  The staff was attentive and responsive to our every need.  Charleston Grill is one of our favorite dining stops in the city.
My wife‚Äôs birthday and the meal and evening were fantastic, great food, superb service!
Excellent in all aspects. The hydroponically grown salad leaves were delicious and great to see the current technologies being brought to the table for our enjoyment
Wonderful in all ways. Crab cake was amazing!

Chez Billy Sud was recommended to us as a great place for a quiet family birthday dinner, great ambiance, excellent food and for just being a perfect place for French dining. It had all that and met all expectations and more. The staff are super friendly. I wish the inside seating opened soon. It is filled with vintage things, there's an old woodburning fireplace and it just smells incredibly. Definitely looking forward to coming back.

It was so great to get back to Chez Billy Sud a few days after they re-opened. The staff here does such a great job and it was great to see them after all this time. We sat out on the patio and the weather was perfect! The food - soft shell crabs - just outstanding!! Still the best soft shells in the city! Love this restaurant. Looking forward to coming back soon!
Always fantastic! Currently, they have a limited patio menu but it is still delicious.
Absolutely the best preparation and presentation. For me, THE go-to special occasion place.
Service was amazing. I would definitely go back with friends the scene is great! Perfect for a quick French bite or drinks with friends.
Wonderful service as they opened back up. Lovely!
Exceptional. The dining room, the ambiance, the meal, the service - bravo! Thank you, Debra and Chez Billy Sud, for a delightful evening.
A great little intimate and delicious restaurant. Steak and mussels were wonderful, as was the Caesar salad.
Just a perfect date night spot. Cosy bistro seating. Super friendly staff. Tasty dishes, both seasonal offerings and French classics. We will be back!
Great experience. Service and food were fantastic. Great atmosphere for date night.
Chez Billy was amazing!! I can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t say enough good things about our experience. The food was amazing. The ambiance is perfect, very quaint and chic. Will be back !!
Fantastic food and ambience!  We will definitely come back.

In my opinion, it's the best overall French restaurant in DC.  Yes, better than Le Dip.  But please don't go, as I don't want it to get any harder for me to get a table here.  Service is always attentive and professional.
The three of us had trout, tuna, and salmon, all was excellent.

Beautiful little French restaurant in Georgetown with gorgeous interior and perfect menu. Went to brunch and every detail is magnificent!  Service attentive and friendly. The Ni√É¬ßoise salad was delicious and be sure to sample the beignets.

Chez Billy Sud is a true neighborhood restaurant that works well for either a casual night out or a more special date night. The food is always on point and the execution is true to the classics. Nothing is 're-imagined' or 'interpreted', just technically cooked extremely well. Our server (whose name I didn't catch, regretfully) was tremendous and seemed to be handling 1/2 the dining room incredibly graciously. We had drinks at 3 different restaurants during our night, and the ones at Chez billy Sud were the most consistently executed and well-balanced. Consistency is a sadly overlooked attribute when everyone wants to be 'new' but Chez Billy Sud continues to exemplify the idea that care and execution are the real drivers of success. We'll absolutely be back, especially for the patio and rose in the summer / spring.
This is an 'casual' vibe but upscale French restaurant, elegant, charming, with impeccable service.  The food is outstanding.  Highly recommended.
Dining experience was spectacular as always. Party included a 90 year old. Service was courteous. Noise level low as we were seated in small front room having few tables, and tables wee well spaced.

We came for lunch at 12:30 on Saturday and it was EXTREMELY noisy.  It finally quieted down later.My salad was good once they cooked the tuna a little more.  The waiter could have been more attentive.  He seemed to disappear at times.  We thought it was odd that they don't offer espresso or cappuccino.  Maybe simplicity is better for them, but we thought it was a bit inhospitable. He said there were so many coffee places nearby... Not a big problem.  Overall, it was a very nice lunch.

This was a wonderful evening out from the warm bread served with the salads and appetizers to the complimentary champagne that came with dessert  (the attentive waitress had figured out there was a birthday being celebrated). The mussels were particularly delicious, and my husband and I loved the sea bass with fennel. Lovely.
Great experience!!!
Amazing experience - perfect table!
Wonderful restaurant. Great food in great area. Service was excellent too.

The croque madame was good, not great--too bread-y and not enough gooey stuff. But the caesar salad was one of the best I've had in a long time, the burger and fries were very good, and the  cotes-du-Rhone--new to the menu as our wonderful server told us--was a lovely choice. The sweet, light-filled and calm ambiance of the restaurant is a welcome respite in trying times, and we'll definitely go back.
Excellent dinner for a celebration with my mother!

The beef cheeks were great!  My wife steak was ordered medium rare and came medium to well done.  A new steak prepared which was burnt on the bottom but cooked to medium rare.  The frites were a complete failure.  This is a high end restaurant.  Those frites should have never made it past the kitchen doors.  They were limp, oily and had no seasoning.  At that point the wine bottle was finished and I had finished my meal so we decided to not complain further but pay the bill and go home.

The food is not consistent. I have come here a few times and generally order the same dishes like the trout and the escargot each visit. The fish was totally over cooked and dry this time. It seemed deep fried and flavorless. In the past it was not this way. The escargot dish was mostly puff pastry and mushrooms, barely any escargot (and for $22?!). The staff is a bit fussy so good luck trying to get something redone.
Traditional bistro style menu with offerings that few restaurants continue to provide.  Very fine meal.

Don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t usually take the time to write reviews but we had such a great time last night celebrating my fathers 72nd birthday I felt compelled to share our experience. Place was a little noisier than expected but it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s hard to get super quiet during peak dinner hours and my dad is hard of hearing anyhow. Food was amazing, we enjoyed the Allen Brothers steak, Duck confit and Ahi Tuna for entrees. The chicken liver mousse and the country pate√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s for appetizers were amazing. Service was impeccable, I can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t remember our waiters name for the life of me but he was a young 23 year old blonde guy and was super personable and on top of his game all night, very attentive but also not overbearing. My husband and I are in the service industry as well and we were super impressed with everything. Props to Chez Billy and the entire FOH & BOH staff for a wonderful night to remember. :)

Absolutely.  We have been there several times and this was our best experience yet.  The food was really divine, and the service was pleasant and we did not feel rushed.  Too bad the street is so torn up making it difficult to come and go.
Mom was in town visiting and wanted a nice place to take her. She loved it
Great food and great service.  A gem in Georgetown.
Having been here twice before we were prepared for a great brunch and we were not disappointed.
Food was good.  Service OK.  We were wedged between two other tables for two - much too close for comfortable dining.

This is the best meal I can remember having in forever...really, the food & presentation & service was over the top.  Wish I lived closer to go more often...& wish I didn't pay $25 for the parking garage--ugh!Truly, this is a restaurant not to be missed!!!
Server Deborah was a lovely woman. They were clearly understaffed for Sat brunch. Food was good. I love the restaurant. Wine was served warmer than room temp for a Chard (Mersault).
Beautiful restaurant
Nice place tucked away in Georgetown.  Food and service both very good.  No need to dress up if you don't want to--casual ambience.

Top notch. Everything was really great.  The friendly people who work there, the understated appearance of the place, the delightful selection of  menu items, the taste and quality of the food, and the efficient but not intrusive service. I can't think of much more that I'd want from a restaurant.
Great time. Wife and I don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have many nights out to ourselves but this place was perfect - drinks, dinner, service. Just a great night out.

Those steaks were super delicious as well as salad, side of veggies and deserts :) It was in the evening a day before all LA restaurants started close and serve only take-out orders. Seemed many customers cancelled reservations, very unusual to see empty tables, dining just few customers. Top class food for sure, at same time cozy and casual atmosphere, I wish they make a little more reasonable prices. Like, 36 oz bone-in ribeye steak was $205 that perfect size to share for 2, $102.50 each person, probably $20-$30 higher than Mastro‚Äôs, BOA, etc.

My experience here was amazing. Great food & impeccable service. We had many things on the menu & they were all exquisitely done. For meats, the Porcini rubbed short ribs are fantastic. If you can afford it, the 36oz Ribeye (or NY Steak) is a must for the table. It was dry aged spectacularly. Truly one of the best steaks in all of LA.

I don‚Äôt know where to start. I arrived and several of my guests preceded me. Their wine has been decanted but no water poured as they waited. After about 5 minutes the waitress appeared and I told her that we would start with champagne, foccacia and salad immediately but she responded that we had to order everything at the same time or the chef wouldn‚Äôt even look at the order. So we sat and decided the entire order which I then shared with waitress. I ordered lots of food and then asked if we could order more just in case we wanted more afterwards and was told that it depended on whether or not they needed to turn the table. The sides came out first and after a few minutes we served them and them finally ate them before the meet arrived. I brought the service issue to my servers attention and she then proceeded to avoid me even though I had told her earlier that i was picking up the tab for our party of 6. Empty water glasses and plates left on the table between courses. I flagged down other servers or personnel to get service. It was a rather  unfortunate series of events that made for a less than special evening for the birthday celebration intended.

Extremely disappointed with the steak. My group and I tasted nothing but salt on a $200 bone in. I was excited and looked forward to our visit but I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the food.
Fantastic dining experience! Loved the food and wine. Excellent service. Fun vibe. Very expensive, but felt like a special night out. Would highly recommend!

Our sixth visit was unfortunately our least favorite. We LOVE Chi Spacca. Even this off night was pretty wonderful. That said, we noticed a pricing issue between what was on the menu and what we were charged for an item, and one of our meat dishes was far too rare for us to enjoy, which was especially disappointing since we had ordered the same thing three times before, and it was fantastic. Service is always terrific, and if this had been my first visit, I probably would have loved it, but since we have seen Chi Spacca at its most spectacular, this visit was a bit of a letdown.
My wife and I celebrated our 25th anniversary, and the food, service and ambience exceeded all expectations. Although the restaurant is pricy, for a special occasion it is more than worth the money!
Always a fantastic experience.   One of the best in LA for a reason.

Most of our food was outstanding. The oil-soaked bread with burrata, the little gem salad, the plate of citrus (a wonderfully refreshing palate cleanser before the main course), the broccoli, and the lemon posset with balsamic were all delightful. The only dish that my made my partner and I look at each other and say anything other than, "Wow, this is perfect," was, surprisingly enough, the meat entree. We ordered the Porcini Rubbed Beef Short Ribs, and I have to say that the salsa verde was more enjoyable than the meat itself. They tasted overcooked and were somewhat lacking in flavor. That being said, we still cleaned the plate as the short ribs would still blow most out of the water - even if they didn't live up to the chi Spacca standard. Our service didn't meet the typical standard of a award-winning restaurant, either. Our server was not very attentive and we had empty, dirty plates stacked in front us more than once, though I suppose this is better than an over-attentive server, and it may be because we chose counter seating rather than a table. All in all, I would recommend chi Spacca with an 8/10 stars.

We had a reservation but it wasn‚Äôt honored. We waited 25 minutes in a very small outer space with no seating and the door to the actual restaurant was kept closed so we couldn‚Äôt look inside.The look and feel of the restaurant was very nice and the wait staff was fine . Certain dishes were delicious (the focaccia bread in particular) while others were very disappointing (the tomahawk pork chop). Not cooked thru and I disliked the seasoning of fennel pollen. Will probably not return.
We loved the food but is not very often resturant to go for bcuz is pricey but overall I will recommend
The food wasn‚Äôt worth the price
Amaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaazing!
by far one of the best restaurants in los angeles. the quality and value of food is so perfect. everything on th menu is amazing. especially the salad with bacon vin. and the diablo chicken

Had the pleasure of dining with Lidia Bostianich as she shared recipes from her newest cookbook.  Great food, great wine and great company!
Loved the special event on Feb 10
Too much Salt.......I didn't think the food has maintained it's level of taste.  It's not the same ChiSpacca as it was and I've been dining there once it's opening!

The overall experience was okay but not exceptionally great. We asked a member of the staff for help with taking our photo and he responded that he was busy and did not stop, come back or made an attempt to help us however when they were setting up a new table next to us with new guests they gave them all their attention. felt that we were not valued as guests, disrespected and we will not be dining here again.
Great Dinner due to Eduardo. Great service from him. He was so knowledgeable and efficient. All food was delicious. Would definitely return. Duck was on point.
Fantastic!!
Fantastic as always.
Outstanding meal!!!!  Wow!

This place is next level. Sit at the counter for a great experience and to interact with the chefs. Sometimes you might get a little surprise tasting. food, menu, service, ambiance are all top notch. Can‚Äôt wait to be back here again.
The BEST Italian food in LA. No one makes Caesar Salad better than chi Spacca. It's right there with Tricolore Salad at Pizzaria Mozza.
Simply outstanding!

WHAT A GREAT EXPERIENCE. SET UP A RESERVATION WITH AN EARLY 6PM TIME. AND EVERY DISH WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. ORIGINALLY CAME FOR THE TOMAHAWK AND ENDED UP BEING BLOWN AWAY BY EVERY PLATE THAT WAS BROUGHT OUT. THE SALAD WAS FRESH AND ZESTY AND A GREAT SPIN ON A CEASAR. THE SWEET POTATOES WERE SURPRISINGLY SWEET IN THE WAY YOU WOULD HOPE THEM TO BE. THE TOMAHAWK WAS DELICIOUS AND HUGE, COOKED AS THE CHEF PREFERRED AND THAT DID NOT DISAPPOINT. THE STARTING OF THE SAVORY BREAD AND BURRATA WAS A CLEAR SIGN OF THE GOODNESS TO COME. I WILL HAVE DREAMS OF THAT BURRATA.
well service is always excellent!!, food outstanding!price very good!we love it!thanks!angel
Our favorite restaurant. The food is phenomenal. It‚Äôs expensive but worth every penny. Run don‚Äôt walk to chi Scappa
The best pork chop I have ever had. Sit at the bar!
Best meal ever!!!!
Top 5 restaurants in Los Angeles. Maybe even better than Sonoratown. (Crack at LA Times food critics)
Excellent birthday dinner!
One of the best restaurants in L.A.
The chicken is Magical ‚ú®

One of the few restaurants that we can say is authentically enjoyable to eat as the food is prepared so well and so fresh with taste unbelievable and so enjoyable.  People are laid back and natural, we do not get the feel of coming to a place with attitude.  We will rank it as in our top 3 to go in LA.  And we have been around many of the top places in Europe.  Totally recommendable.
Chi Spacca was one of the best restaurants that I‚Äôve ever been to. From service to food this restaurant was outstanding.

I really wanted to like this place. While the food was about what was expected, the entire experience was a huge let down. First, we were seated 45 minutes after our reservation, and then it took another 30 just to get service. The restaurant has about 5 tables total, so the fact we RARELY saw our waiter the entire TWO HOURS it took to eat was also extremely unfortunate. The courses came out 30 minutes apart, which was very strange to have a bowl of mashed potatoes sit there for half an hour until the first meat came out. Our waters were never filled, and I think I only got one beer the entire meal because our waiter literally never came back after we ordered our food. Except one time to apologize for how long everything was taking. I will say they gave us complimentary sorbet at the end, probably because it was now 11PM and we were just eating. While the food is tasty, I really don't believe the restaurant is as fine as it seems to have convinced itself it is. For how much it costs, I would definitely go for a more exemplary dining experience elsewhere ie: Bavel.

Too much lemon in all the salad (Caesars salad), stuffed squash flowers, and broccoli.  Roast chicken was not well cooked - the meat near the bone was pinkish/a little raw.We were overcharged for the water... US$3.00 per person but they charged for 7 guest to my table of 6.They brought a happy-birthday dessert for the celebrant at the table, but charged us for it.The waitress/sommelier was obviously pushing us to order too much for the table. For the table of 6, we had a roast chicken, a lamb shoulder, and the US$220 steak, aside from various vegetable dishes.

Hard to find, darkly lit outside so I wasn‚Äôt sure this was the restaurant‚Ä¶ no one out front to greet us... so I went inside. No one working made eye contact so I walked further in until the host came in and snapped at me that I‚Äôm not allowed inside. He then seated us and I calmly said I didn‚Äôt appreciate the way he spoke to me... He replied ‚ÄúOk‚Äù and didn‚Äôt apologize.  So I asked, ‚ÄúIf we stay, would you be our waiter?‚Äù He said yes he would, so we left. In an era where businesses and especially restaurants are struggling, rude service like this is unfortunate.
Great outdoor seating area, & food is always amazing! Tables are small so wouldn't recommend for larger group, but absolutely perfect for date night. One of my favorite places in Boston.

We enjoyed our dinner at Coppa, the seating was along a nice quiet street and staff were very friendly. Portion sizes were perfect and normal, and not the huge American sized portions we‚Äôve been receiving at other restaurants. The pizza was the best pizza my husband and I have had since being in Italy (hubby lived there for some years and I visited often). The food was delicious and we‚Äôll definitely be back!
Great bday dinner!
Always fabulous food...great outside atmosphere and great service. So glad they are open again!
Wonderful adaptation to extended patio dining. I felt safe and was served quickly and courteously.
Great service, restaurant performs like a well oiled machine. Flawless, I've been many times, and I plan on going many more times.

Wonderful meal. I felt like every precaution was taken to ensure my safety in these crazy times. Lobster Bucatini was delicious. Meatballs were amazing. First sip of the Aperol Spritz had me grinning from ear to ear. Thanks Coppa!
Sitting out on the sidewalk worked out fine. Food and service were great. Was very pleased with their commitment to safety and cleanliness, very well thought out.
They are handling the COVID situation well and it‚Äôs a nice neighborhood spot to grab some food and drink.
Nice outdoor dining! Somewhat expensive but delicious and lovely
Awesome. They're dealing with covid so well. Can't say enough good things.
We had a great dinner at Coppa and were pleased with how they handled a tough situation around reopening during COVID. Food was great, service was great, and it was great to be eating outside again!
Jen was great! Super nice and had a great personality! So glad they are back open. The food was killer
Great experience for brunch. Food and drinks were so good! We look forward to things resolving with COVID-19 to come for a full dinner.
This is me and my friends go to spot when we want pasta! Always the best!
Cozy little place. Fabulous pasta. Good wine. Cute neighborhood.

Food was delicious and our waiter was very nice and attentive . My only negative is how small the restaurant is and how closely you are sitting to others. Also they don‚Äôt have a full cocktail menu mostly just wine but food is very very good
Good quality of food Very little portions and way too expensive for that. Service was unfriendly
Our favorite go to spot for any occasion. The perfect ambiance for date night or dinner with your Italian dad :)
Perfect neighborhood restaurant, serving simple but delicious good.
V romantic
Never disappoints.  Special place.

Excellent food  hostess  very friendly although small restaurant did not feel rushed . Waitress was good but very busy our table near the door so it was cold every time door opened . I would go back !
Classic South End Spot for Italian inspired Small small plates. Get the Caesar and Meatballs or Grinder. Can't lose.
Excellent food in a casual, intimate setting!  I highly recommend Coppa!

COPPA REVIEW 3/3/20We ate at Coppa 5pm yesterday and it was our first negative experience there, such that I am asking: ‚ÄúDoes Coppa have a new chef ? ‚Äù Well the surprising answer, for me, is No. But why does he want to obliterate the clean dependable Island Creek Oyster flavor by over soaking it in a strong cranberry vinegar? All I can figure is that maybe the chef‚Äôs ego is greater than his wanting to showcase his excellent local product. The answer for me was to lift each oyster out of its overpowering vinegar bath , blot it, and eat it as is. Fantastic. The Celery Caesar was as scrumptious as ever. The scallop app. was nuanced and layered with unctuous treatments. The Arancini remain our favorite in the city. The very disappointing entrees were the Gemelli with its muddled flavors, and the Pizza which the menu description never mentioned- was covered with chili flakes. Our waitperson [she must be new] was slow and inattentive no matter how much we urged her to deliver our food. This affected considerably our overall experience there.We will wait for some menu changes before returning.
Top 5 lunch of all time. Outstanding all around!

Perfect spot for a date or dinner with friends!  Great food, good ambience, and an intimate setting all while keeping prices relatively affordable.  It's a small place, so be sure to make a reservation.
Wow! Attentive service, incredible food. I can‚Äôt believe I waited so long to come here. One of my favorite meals to date in Boston!
Always delicious. The tagliatelle with pork sugo is equivalent to a bolognese but without the beef! A non-beef eaters dream.

Coppa was outstanding from start to finish. We had a couple of cocktails at the bar before our reservation, and the bartender made us a couple of great cocktails, and also let us know about his favorite menu items. Our server was on point and gracious. (Thanks for chasing us down to let us know we forgot a pair of glasses!)Each dish we ordered was superb, particularly the house made pasta dishes. Make sure you order the zeppole, and if you are into amaro, go for the flight of three.
Gluten-free friendly, but not gluten-allergy friendly. Make sure you indicate allergy as it was clear that there is a lot of cross contamination that occurs in their kitchen.
After trying all the new, hyped places around town - it was nice to be back at Coppa with some new dishes and mainstays that knocked it out of the park

Laid back atmosphere, fairly small restaurant. Fun drink options including variations of the aperol spritz. My favorite was the Alessio Spritz - nice and light. The cacio e pepe pasta (Gemelli) was melt-in-your-mouth good. I loved the sopressata pizza (always enjoy a nice combo of spicy sausage and a drizzle of sweet). Lastly (although first thing we ate), I enjoyed the Insalata salad. Big enough to share for two, and it had very thinly sliced pecorino on top that complimented the greens nicely. Will definitely be returning to this lovely spot!
Everything was delicious and the service was friendly.  I will definitely go back.

Crazy overpriced for mediocre food masquerading as authentic Italian. We booked a reservation here after researching places and expecting it to rival our favorites in the Nj and NYC area. No such luck. Cheese was pre-sluced and dry on the charcuterie boards, pizza was overly salted and with only small drops of real mozzarella. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

We went last night for family dinner into this cozy little restaurant.The staff was very friendly and helpful making us feel really wellcomed !Everything we tasted was amazingly delicious!The best and unique cezar‚Äôs salad so different from any other we have ever tasted! The Roasted broccoli and the arancini supported our estimate of an interesting diner to follow The pizza was excellent and crustyThe tagliatelle con sugo simply unforgettable!At the end Zeppole was awaiting us! Fluffy donuts with nutela The most appropriate closing to a delicious dinner experience !Definitely we will visit again!
Perfect night, perfect food, perfect service

I've loved coppa for a long time but this visit was a disappointment.  Server neglected to bring us bread, even after we asked.  Pasta dish came out first and servers kept trying to take it away before we were finished -- we were waiting for bread to try to enjoy the remaining sauce.  It's a $20 something plate of pasta and not particularly large so we didn't really want to squander it.  The crudo used to be maybe 8 small pieces of fish with fun garnish.  Now it's 5.  The rest of the meal was okay.  Disappointing overall.

Absolutely loved it! We celebrated our son‚Äôs 20ish birthday and it was spectacular. We had a party of 6 and each one ordered something different, all equally delicious I must say. Our server was very attentive and recommended some dishes and wine. Anita the owner checked in on us to make sure we were ok, as she did with everyone else in the restaurant. We had a fabulous time in an amazing restaurant that did not disappoint. We will definitely be back.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants. Always excited to visit as I know the experience will be awesome.  The environment is very relaxed, plus they always go above and beyond to accommodate; never any complaints on the food.  Definitely a must on anyone's list of restaurants.
Wonderful Excellent service. Food was incredible

I always receive an online request to give my feedback about my experience at Crust. It‚Äôs honestly never a chore because I love telling everyone how awesome it is. From the moment you walk in Anita or someone welcomes you and makes you feel like you‚Äôre at a family dinner. That kind of hospitality doesn‚Äôt end with the welcome but continues on with the service until you‚Äôre saying goodbye, ‚Äúuntil we see you again‚Äù. On top of the amazing hospitality, the food, it is absolutely delicious. Never had a bad dish here. Explore the menu and enjoy something you don‚Äôt normally have or stick with a favorite classic. No worries everything is great!  Hands down one of the best restaurants in Miami.

We ordered several things , the problem was the salad it had old walnuts, when we called the manager, she from the first moment affirmed that it wasn‚Äôt like that, that the chef was her husband and that he had to try it to confirm our complain. Then she returned with sarcastic attitude denying our claim. She brought a punch of complete different walnuts and asked to us with the same attitude what we wanted another salad or discount the older one from the account. Very disappointed an arrogant attitude to be honest.
Great Italian food.  Good service.  Will return.
Always a pleasure to dine at Crust. Anita welcomes us like family. Highly recommend!
Food was great service was meh
Flew to East coast just to eat at CRUST before driving to our destination on west coast. It‚Äôs that good!!

It was as it always is ‚Äú GREAT. I love the food, owners and there server‚Äôs, as they always make you feel at home, my only complaint is that they are not closer to me but whenever I am somewhere near I always book my table at Crust.
Very personable staff. Work very well together. Was extremely impressed by the teamwork and happiness shown by the employees.

The staff was amazing the hostess was over the top and so friendly and nice. We had a cranky 2 year old and the staff was super nice bringing coloring books and interacting with him to calm him!  Best Italian and so much food!!
It was fantastic.  From the hostess to the servers.  The food is amazing!!!!  This is our place when we want to have great Italian food!
Always an extraordinary experience!
Great food just to much

Excellent!! Must make a reservation .
The food is amazing! The service is really good. If you want a quiet place for a date, this is not the place to go. It is very lively and has a very energetic ambiance.
Great food, great service

We went for my mom‚Äôs 85 th Birthday before going to Hamilton at the Ziff.  So we‚Äôre greeted by the owner with birthday kisses for mom. The portions are huge and wonderful. Sharing is a great idea!!! Definitely on my favorite list. We will be back soon ( after I finish my left overs which have lasted all weekend ü•∞).

Great food but portion size was to large my pizza would have been much better with half of the ingredients on top and seen  some of yhe pasta dishes getting delivered and the were huge. Very off putting

Truly an incredible place every time I go! Food, service, decor, ambiance to name a few is always on point! Thank you for making it such a DIVINE place to dine!XOXO...Belkys Sanchez

So enjoyable. Worth the long drive from boca raton!
One of our favs
As always, food was delicious.  Service was a bit spotty, and it was a bit noisier than usual (even though we went very early!).

The owner‚Äôs warmth sets the tone for the whole experience. Everything about this place is an embrace ‚Äî from the plentiful menu choices to the robust portions to the special touches that make you feel like a treasured customer even when you‚Äôre not a regular (yet! we will be after this).Really an exceptional, special place. These people are doing what they were called to do, and it‚Äôs all about love.
Wonderful! Portions are large though! The eggplant parm serving feeds 4! Service is great, food is fantastic!
More Italian food for your money than I have ever seen any restaurant ever serve.
Great food atmosphere was fantastic definitely recommend sitting outside on a nice day.
Love this restaurant!  The meal and service were spectacular as always!  We will be back soon!  Thank you!

If you're into great spaghetti sauce, this is definitely the place. The portions are ridiculously gigantic. More than enough to feed 2 people if not 3. I was disappointed that I could not swap out the pasta I wanted with my main choice. But they did tell us in the beginning that they wouldn't do what I wanted them to do. The prices were reasonable, but I want a place to give me what I want to eat.  I had to change orders to get what I wanted in the sauce.

The Crust  salad with beats, walnuts and house mustard vinaigrette was delicately balanced to present a delicious blend of flavors. The Crust salad was extraordinary. My partner had the Caesar salad which was an average salad. If we had known the portions were so large we would have paid the split charge and shared the Crust salad.We had the ‚Äúindividual size‚Äù pepperoni and pineapple pizza and the Crust Pizza. Again, huge portions, and if we had known we would have paid the split charge and shared. We noticed other diners around us with pasta ‚Äúentree‚Äù that were also huge portions. We ended up leaving half of each pizza. The pizzas were good; not outstanding. We were expecting an outstanding pizza after all the awards and publicity about Crust. If you go to Crust remember the portions are extremely large. Plan on paying a split charge to share or taking a portion home for another meal.
Always stellar service! Great food.

We came across an article stating this was one of the 25 best pizza places in the US. Sadly, we completely disagree. While we acknowledge the service and hostess in the restaurant as being pretty extraordinary, having greeted us as we walked in like she couldn't wait to have us for dinner, and the server was quite attentive checking in to see we were good, the pizza was such a disappointment. Based on reviews we'd seen we'd say CRUST over-promises and under-delivers.Our Margarita pie came right out of the oven piping hot on a glass plate. Having lived in Brooklyn, worked in Manhattan for years, plus spending many yummy times at Pepe's in New Haven, CT we can say their crust just lacked flavor and crunch. Really no char on this crust. In fact, it was slightly soggy and really sort of tasteless. It needed salt. None of the lovely oil from the cheese running down your arms will be found here. We also shared a mediterranean salad. Vinegar to oil ration was off so the dressing was a bit heavy with the vinegar, but the ingrediants were fresh. I'm gluten free (not the pizza eater in the family) and CRUST was really great about managing my dietary needs. I had the chicken picatta, which was nice because they grilled the thinly pounded breast vs flouring it. Thumbs up for that. As posted by other reviewers the portions are large and you will be bringing some home. (Sharing plates in the restaurant $3)
The give way to much food out. One meal was enough to feed four. The food was just ok. Would not go back.  The service was good.
Fabulous service. No rush. Wonderful assistance in explanation of every course. As always our did our explanation
First class throughout.

My daughter and I visited Daniel while on a spring break trip to New York. We ordered the tasting menu, which was a nice way to sample various items. The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was lovely - quiet but not stuffy.
The experience lived up to the legend and hype. The beautiful location, wonderful staff, and incredible food made an impression on all our team during a constructive trip to New York.

I love Daniel but haven't been to this restaurant in years.  Some of the food was "overdone."  Abalone had a sauce on it and I didn't even recognize the abalone.  Fois gras was fabulous.  Duck was grand as well Il flotante overdone, dry.  Wine pairings amazing.
I haved a wonderful and exciting timeü§ç
Chef Daniel comes out to each table and makes it an incredible personal experience! Beautiful dining room, delicate and delicious food, impeccable attentive service.

I haven't provided a review in ages.  This was an extraordinary dining experience.  Truly extraordinary.  Every dish was perfectly executed aesthetically and mind blowing delicious.  The service was flawless.  We had a girl's night in the city and my friend is vegan, and they accommodated her restrictions without hesitation...and I enjoyed a non-vegan tasting menu that was beautifully executed.  The wine pairings were also done to perfection.  We had a lovely and most memorable evening -- this dining experience goes down in our history books.   Five stars, a standout in a massive city with so many restaurants, it's hard to choose.
Absolutely AMAZING experience! If you haven‚Äôt dined at Daniel go now! Wonderful melt in your mouth experience from beginning to end. ‚ô•Ô∏è
The ambiance was pleasant. The service impeccable. The food innovative.

Exquisite is the best way to describe  the food, service, and ambiance.  From the moment you enter you are made to feel as though you are their only guest. We tried the 7 course tasting menu with the wine pairing and it's obvious that Daniel has everything perfected. The tastes my tongue experienced were out of this world. I can say every dish exceeded my expectations.  The bison and mushroom aperitifs were my personal favorite and I'm usually not a fan of mushrooms.  They even provided personal touches that made it a night we'll never forget.  The staff were so attentive and not in any way rushing you.  I cannot wait to return and of course I highly recommend Daniel to all.
Celebrating an anniversary
Wonderful service and amazing food at Daniel. Made a special night even more special.
Perfection

Do you really need a review for what is arguably the best restaurant in NYC?  It is not inexpensive, but really, if you're reading this, you knew that already.  Service, impeccable.  Food, outstanding.  No better place for a special occasion.   Bonus, Chef Boulud was in the dining room.  I don't know, maybe he's there all the time, but it was cool to see.

This was our third year going to Daniel for our birthday dinner. My daughters share the same birthday, three years apart and I follow a couple of weeks after so we have made it a tradition to go to New York to celebrate. Our first time at Daniel was so amazing we decided it would be our yearly tradition and it has never disappointed. Not only is each plate beautiful and delicious the service and ambiance simply cannot be matched!
Food and service excellent as always. They even made a special dessert when I found I couldn‚Äôt eat what was offered.
Amazing as always!!!  Thank to Elvir for the kitchen tour and chef Will!  Amazing food and service!

My wife and I loved the experience it was superb in every level.I want to give props to the manager Kareem who made sure everything was perfect thru our evening and took us to the kitchen for a photo up.We will definitely be back.
Daniel is amazing! Unforgettable dinner.
Best restaurant in Manhattan,  just amazing food. The service and ambiance are reminiscent of the best Parisian places.

The service was remarkable and outstanding.  The hosts, the sommelier, and the servers went over and beyond to ensure our comfort. We had the four course tasting.  The dessert course was amazing and kept getting better with each offering.  However, the other three courses were very disappointing.  the presentation was good but the taste was not what we expected from a restaurant of this caliber.  It was not pleasing to our palate. Considering the price we pay at this restaurant, we were expecting a lot more in terms of taste.
Incredible tastes and service. They handled dietary restrictions with ease. Very special place

Without a doubt one of the most outstanding meals of our lives. The finest combination of cuisine, service, and ambiance in the United States, if not the world. We were awed by the tasting dinner. Every staff member was superb. Special appreciation to our sommelier who recommended a wonderful wine that was also a good value. We‚Äôll always remember this great evening at Restaurant Daniel.
First visit to this legendary restaurant and it totally lived up to it‚Äôs reputation.Will return.
a fabulous dining experience. Outstanding Menu , great Presentation and first rate service.A true memorable culinary experience!!!

The experience at Daniel was absolutely AMAZING. Everyone was very kind and thoughtful for our special day. The Chef even sent us a customized "Congratulations" desert made with white chocolate and exotic fruits - we very much appreciated this attention. As well as the fresh and warm Madeleines, a delicious french Canelet and mini home-made chocolates using the finest chocolates from all over world. And Thank you again for the very pretty customized menus printed in grand elegance for us. Daniel restaurant  is a true highlight for people who want to experience something which is truly special and unique. We will come back soon. Merci infiniment.

Thank goodness there is still an exceptional dining experience around. I‚Äôd almost given up on dining out. Every place was the same uninspiring Upscale gastro pub trying to put a new spin on old recipes. So many places didn‚Äôt live up to the hype. Daniel is the definition of fine elegant dining. Every bite was creative and perfectly balanced- a foodie‚Äôs dream. Checks all the boxes of what I look for when seeking a new exciting experience. 1. He created things I would never imagine- familiar flavors blended into something new and sensational.2. I could never create this in my house.3. Creates a whole world and experience. For three hours I was removed from time and space and enjoyed one Devine culinary sensory sensation after another of taste smells and textures.Hit every note perfectly like a symphony- the room decor, the lighting, the service, the timing, the wine,  and of course the food.If you are a true foodie ( in search of the next great bit- no matter where - fine dining to food cart) then you must experience Daniel and if you miss and are in search of a whole true fine dining experience put Daniel somewhere top of your list.

30th wedding anniversary meal went 5 years previous and did not disappoint nothing‚Äôs cheap in New York really so well worth a visit for a special occasion with a quality taste experience and very attentive staff
Very classic and nice setting. Was lucky to see the chef and have a picture with him.
Valentine‚Äôs Day; the special menu was astronomically priced even in relation to other fine-dining NYC tasting menus
Absolutely amazing. Better than Le Bernardin.

One of five must go spots in Manhattan for special occasions. Very pricey but you get what you pay for. Our Valentines Saturday lunch was superb with unmatched seating due to the earlier time. From the reception to departure the highly trained staff makes you welcome with knowledge and lack of pretense. All the four courses were elegant to behold and a symphony of flavors. The dessert course is a profusion of riches crafted under the supervision is the Pastry chef Ghaya Olivera and is equal to the best in the world. Drinks are special with a stellar and expensive list of curated wines. Very highly recommended for anyone‚Äôs bucket list. Bravo!
Dinner at Valentine‚Äôs Day.The food was great as always. Price was double due to Valentine‚Äôs Day. Table was close to the entrance door. Rush service. Unfortunately, I felt it was a sloppy night.
Great time with another couple for V day ,
Elvir is awesome!!!
It was wonderful!

This was one of our favorite dinners Ever!! The service was impeccable. The food was extraordinary. The wine was spectacular!! We will continue to eat at Daniel every time we make it to NYC!! Thank you Daniel for an exceptional dining experience!
Fantastic restaurant in Classic Style. Appropriate interior design. Great service. Amazing food.Overall excellent experience.
Love Daniel been there few time always excellent on every way!!!
Great meal and experience before everything had to shut down

Everything was excellent‚Äî the food, the service, the space. We dined here because our first and second choices were closed due to COVID-19. This was not our first or second choice because there are many other restaurants with just as excellent food and service but much better value.

The brodo was too salty.  The Sommelier was fantastic and did an outstanding job of pairing our food selections.  The pork was impeccably done -  beautiful taste.   Overall, a great restaurant, but the price is over the top so it is always going to be a treat.

We were adventurous & selected the chef‚Äôs table 8 courses with wine. Totally fabulous! We had such a wonderful evening with friends that was fill with conversation & good food. The pasta was so light light & delicious I‚Äôm envious of the still of those tiny cheese or potato filled delights. My husband loved the flavorful soup course. Best part I stayed on my diet & still lost weight! Gave me new meaning to portion control! It‚Äôs so relaxing to be be not rushed to next course to turn over the table. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Outstanding meal and service is perfect.

Visited from California for our 10 year wedding anniversary. They sat us late for our reservation. Took a long time to get served wine. Somal√≠es was unfriendly, uptight, and not helpful. She accidentally poured my husband a glass of red that he did not order spilling it in the process then when she realized she accidentally poured it she made a big scene of taking it off the table. When I asked her what she did with the glass of wine she said it‚Äôs a wash it‚Äôs just sitting in the back. For the price of the meal you would think she would just leave the glass for my husband to enjoy.  The restaurant is beautiful looks like a movie set but the meal and service was not worth the price of a fine dining experience.
Visited with my college daughter and teen son on a visit to NYC. It was the highlight meal of our trip, as in the past.Love everything about this amazing restaurant!
Overpriced but worth it! Great food and service as well as ambiance!
Mind blowing food experience
Inventive but excellent food, soothing surroundings, and top-notch service!

Hubby and I went here after dry January to have an amazing dinner and delicious drinks. I mean is Mario‚Äôs restaurant so it‚Äôs gonna be sick!!! Our server (forget his name) was awesome. Loved his Italian accent and when he explained the wine pairing with each course. We did the 8 course menu which every bite was better than the first. The wine was sooooooooo good. Can‚Äôt wait to go back. You‚Äôre gonna pay when doing the wine pairing but it‚Äôs soooo worth it. You only live once.
Amazing dinner. Top three restaurants in the US!
Just perfect

I took my husband to DelPosto for his 56th birthday after seeing it being mentioned in a Daily News article as one of the best Italian restaurants and confirmation of same by a good friend.  The ambience, food, staff and service were all impeccable from the time we walked in the door until the time we left.  Such a romantic restaurant. Great for date night, birthdays and Valentine‚Äôs Day! We had the 5 course tasting menu.  Every dish was excellent even though our favorites were the linguine with geoduck, the shellfish stew, the branzino and the antipasti with sweet potatoes and pears!!!!  All delicious! The warm bread stick with the clotted cream and olive oil was addicting!  The whole team made our experience memorable especially Damiano and Jaziel! They didn‚Äôt miss a beat!! They even gave me a small foot stool to rest my handbag on so it wouldn‚Äôt be on the floor!!! Who does that???  We will definitely go back again!

Del Posto is one of the most elegant restaurants I‚Äôve ever been to. We did the Captains Menu where you tell the waiter your preferences and he selects the 8 courses. Every course was delicious. It was definitely pricey but well worth it for a special occasion.
This is my all time favorite restaurant in the world.  I make sure when I travel to NYC that this place is on my dinner list.  That is a lot to say coming from an Irish guy from Chicago üòâ
This is one of the best restaurants around.  Quality of food and service is top notch.  You‚Äôre going to pay for it, but you won‚Äôt forget it.
Excellent, elegant, extravagant, and extraordinary are just a few descriptive words to express how wonderful Del Posto is!

Absolutely one of the most disappointing dinning experiences EVER. The ambience was dark, cold, sterile. Wait staff, though reasonably attentive was stiff and not friendly. Prices were exorbitant for vert average food e.g. $39 for a tossed salad, tuna entree ( 3 tiny medallions for as I recall $70)Would NEVER recommend to friends.
Everything - food, service, decor, ambiance - was perfect.
This just wasn‚Äôt good. Wasn‚Äôt worth the price. So much disappointment all around. It definitely lost its flare!
Great Restaurant in every aspect. I feel it was better in prior years.
Amazing food and service to match. Deep wine selection coupled with knowledgeable sommelier. Fabulous experience. Wowed the pants off our guests.
The restaurant was beautiful but I expected much better with regard to the food, especially given the cost.
Great space, great service, and exceptional food.  Perfect spot for a romantic date night.
Del Posto is wonderful for lunch.  The prix fix is a great value for this fine dining restaurant.  The food and service were top notch.  It's lovely for a special occasion.

Absolutely the most overrated Italian restaurant I have ever been too.  Beautiful with great service, but the food was subpar and outrageously expensive. $500 for two adults and a child.  We ordered two salads, two main dishes and one child‚Äôs pasta with three adult drinks. The main dishes and salad were bland. The child‚Äôs past was good though and my daughter loved the butter. Lol.  The largest portion on the menu was the butter.
Outstanding service. A very enjoyable last evening in New York.
New Year‚Äôs Day

I had a high expectation. When I got there nice specious entrance and dining area. Service was good and attentive. Wine and salad was ok. But 2 pasta was unacceptably salty. I mentioned it. Then main dish Branzino was again salty. Tuna for my wife was as well. I don‚Äôt mind to pay 600.00 but not for this. Very disappointed.

Family of 4 wearing jeans and sneakers seated in main dining room for New Years Eve Lunch. I recall once in the summer i was wearing a suit with dress sandals and not allowed to eat...No longer serving cocktails at the bar, only food service (the bar was empty) no one came to take drink order in the ‚Äú lounge‚Äù seating, decided to just go to tableLive piano music no longer at lunchSeveral dishes not up to previous standard, lasagna tasted like burnt tomato pasteLunch Prices raised.Bathroom towels and hand soap no longer superior.Table service excellent as alwaysAmbiance- stellar as always

Best deal in NYC for a pre-fixe lunch....wonderful setting, superb service compliments what is a fantastic tasting lunch menu.  It's not inexpensive but it will be a memorable meal with one of the most extensive wine lists in the city.  Enjoy a classic Italian meal in a sophisticated and inviting setting.

Most of the dishes were too salty.  I ordered waguy beef which was so tough.  The steak knife was so dull.  with the tough beef and the dull knife, it was not an enjoyable meal.  I have dined at Del Posto a few times in the past and I would not return again.
Excellent service dining experience combined with an amazing meal and wine pairing experience We did 5 course tasting menu
It was wonderful and one of the best meals ever!!
The host should of been more welcoming. I had to interrupt them so we can be acknowledged. Everything after that was amazing. I will give them a second chance.
Mike was a great host and server etc.
My boyfriend and I had a fantastic experience dining at Del posto.I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends and family
Incredible evening for a special occasion. Unique dishes, endless wine list and great atmosphere.
Food was superb! Service was excellent! It was a bitter cold grey day that was warmed and brightened by the caring attention we received. We look forward to our next visit.
Perfect in every way!
Wow! My guest(s) and I couldn‚Äôt get enough of the Chef‚Äôs tasting menu until we were full. Definitely a special occasion/date night experience to be remembered.
Exquisite sushi, robatayaki and other Japanese dishes, well plated with friendly but not obtrusive service. Would be very happy to return once it is safe to eat out again!

Double Knot is situation in an intimate location downstairs from Sampan and the bar area.  Ambience is hip and a bit darker, so perfect for a date.  Noise wasn't too loud, so I could easily hear my date across from me.We did the tasting menu, which is excellent value at $60 given the amount of food we got (we had a lot of leftovers for more meals afterwards!).  The quality of the food was great as well and I'd definitely recommend this to others!

I went to Double Knot with some colleagues and we not only found the food superb, but the service and ambiance were delightful as well. Great for girls night out, larger groups or sexy time with that special someone. Great vibe overall.
Unfortunately, I found the food bland.  And while the ambiance and drinks were good, it wasn't worth the money.  I will not go back.
This is our second time visiting and we love the atmosphere and the food.  Everything was great.  The service was outstanding and the food was delicious.
It wasn‚Äôt clear that the bar reservation wasn‚Äôt eligible for happy hour specials
This place is top 5 in Philly easy.

Our second visit. really love everything about it. all the small plates so interesting. Evening menu has nine sections!  Incredible variety and assortment can be a bit overwhelming! First visit we did the tasting menu but this time we felt confident enough to order a la carte. Unfair to call it a sushi restaurant since it is much more than that. You may wish to peruse the menu online before you go. In the cold section we loved hamachi and avocado salad. I was not a fan of the king oyster mushroom but partner liked it. It's too rubbery for my taste.On the  "crispy" menu, the wings were wonderful. next time I'd like to try the Japanese fried chicken. We had the beef dumpling in broth that was delicious. My menu said beef soup dumplings which they are not. Partner's menu just said the correct "beef dumpling." Crab udon delish but not much crab. My favorite offerings at the restaurant are the Robotayaki especially the ribeye and Kobe beef. You may want to order double and triple of those. The lobster claw was also great. No room for dessert. Schulson does a great job with decor and fun experiences which enhance the whole experience and also manages to hire staff that are really friendly, professional and knowledgeable. They seem to be having fun even tho they are working.

Dinning at Double Knot was definitely an experience. We had a reservation and ate at the counter downstairs. We had the chef‚Äôs tasting menu and they accommodated my shellfish allergy and it being lent. My one complaint is that we felt rushed and like we needed to eat as fast as possible. At one point we had four plates arrive at the same time.

The upstairs bar area where you wait smelled horrible.  A mixture of bleach and feet.  Nearly left while waiting.  It‚Äôs not a good way to start and end the evening Food and service downstairs was excellent.  Sad that the experience was tainted

This was our 3rd time coming to double knot and we enjoyed it just as the last one. I had the lovers knot cocktail which was amazing. Me and boyfriend ordered the Japanese fried chicken as something new to try. Flavour explosion in our mouths. It was the best thing ever.  Our waitress was Caydie and she was a sweetheart. Very informative on the items on the table and attentive to us.
Service was excellent! Food was excellent except Brussels sprouts had too much balsamic vinegar.

While the food was good, as always, this time we had a new server/bartender who didn't understand that soy is in all soy sauce. In fact, she argued with me about it until one of her colleagues that explained to her, very patiently, that soy, by the very nature of the thing, is made of fermented soybeans, and is not related to its gluten content. With my soy allergy, this is rather an important point. Still, she meant well, and other than this, we had a good time there.

Omakase chef's tasting was delicious.  Server and female manager were rushing our table, clearing plates before we were done; the manager even took away my empty water glass after dessert without bringing it back (or refilling it). It was so obvious that they wanted to flip the table.  Unprofessional and not appreciated; our party of 3 spent $400 on dinner.
best sushi place in town considering location ambiance and food!
Happy hour was good cooked food apps are good  sushi was very meh.  Waitress was great.Would go back and only get cooked food.
I forget our waiters name but he made the night with his wine and food recommendations.
Excellent, as always! It‚Äôs on our rotation for business and pleasure!
Omakase is a great way to go here - trust the chef.  Service was very helpful is selecting different beverages to pair with all the different courses
On the pricey side but some of the best sushi I‚Äôve had in quite some time.

We love to come here. It‚Äôs a great date spot. The staff is very knowledgeable and attentive and they make great recommendations. We always order a bunch of dishes, and have the server recommend at least one of them so we try new dishes on each visit. Yum!!

Six of us went to Double Knot at the recommendation of a friend while we were in town for the Flower Show.  It was a fabulous and fun dining experience!  Our waiter, Manny, walked us through the menu since it was our first visit.Everything we ordered was delicious from the Edamame Dumplings to the skewered  Octopus.  The tapas menu allowed us to try many different menu items and everything was great!
Awesome dinner! We did the Chef‚Äôs Tasting menu and each course was better than the last. Cocktails were great, food was amazing, service was top notch.

Went here for my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday. We did the chefs blind tasting menu along with a few extra courses of sushi and a couple round of cocktails. Everything from the drinks to the multiple courses were amazing. Our server was very informative and every clean plate was almost instantly cleared from our table. I must recommend: octopus sushi, duck scrapple, any robitiaki item, and their mochi ice cream. Overall, it was a great experience for a special occasion
Our server was great at providing recommendations based on our preferences!

Definitely my new favorite date night spot! We decided to order A La Carte instead of the chefs tasting menu and everything was amazing. Everything was prepared fresh and deliciously. Will definitely be returning!

Always enjoy our time at Double Knot! Service is top-notch, the downstairs area is great for a date night, and the food is spectacular. We did the tasting menu and chose our selections. Everything was delicious and it let us try things we wouldn‚Äôt normally order. Food came promptly as it was ready, and, as fast eaters, we appreciated the pace. I believe the portions were smaller with the tasting menu but we did not leave hungry. We sat at the bar and the bartender was super helpful and patient as we made our decisions. One male bartender was a bit loud and I heard him complaining a bit, but other than that, we very much enjoyed the whole experience. Definitely a place for a special occasion or to take visitors!
Great food but was way too dark inside

Exceptional! We had the special menu and were extremely pleased! The cool vibe and original design, the impeccable service, and the whole experience make this our regular go-to in Philadelphia. The hard part is getting the reservation.
It was good! Pricy but good!
Excellent staff excellent food

Everything was amazing. The attention to detail was great as well. Was worried about our seats at the counter downstairs but it was cool seeing the cooks do their thing behind the counter. The sushi quality was some of the best I‚Äôve had in a long time. Definitely looking forward to coming back again.

Carissa was amazing at the sushi counter. Was disappointed to have made a reservation to get there and wait for 10 minutes to not have a table ready. The food is superb so that was the least of our worries.
Excellent food, good service

Happy hour upstairs was fantastic!  Delicious choices from the HH menu, but also had to have an order of the tuna rice crackers from the regular menu.  Brussels sprouts are so good, we ended up ordering two!  YUMMY!  (Only thing we were not crazy about was the ‚Äúroasted‚Äù broccoli, which seemed steamed. ) Great dinner before a show at the Academy!
Always a great overall experience

The service is top notch along with the stunning atmosphere. They really make you feel like you‚Äôre in an old speak easy. We did the chefs tasting which was fabulous. Definitely can‚Äôt wait to go back.
I just cannot say enough about Double Knot - reserve a table and do the Chef's blind tasting - you will NOT be disappointed.   Service was superb! Ambiance great!
Awesome. Best seafood in the South Bay and one of the Top 3 seafood restaurants in all of LA County
Always fabulous! Best raw seafood in Los Angeles.

Wait staff was great.  We made a reservation and table wasn‚Äôt ready for about 10 mins, but they felt bad about that and brought out a few oysters and a round of cocktails, on them! We sat outside and they moved heater for me as soon as I asked.  Octopus appetizer and crab cakes were incredible! Highly recommend! Also had the halibut entree, but didn‚Äôt like the tomato corn salad, we didn‚Äôt finish it, unfortunately.  Other than that, atmosphere, service, aesthetics were all great.  Recommend!
So good we will be back again soon!!!

My friend was concerned about her first dine-in meal during the COVID-19 pandemic, so the restaurant seated us in a less busy corner of the restaurant (that was really nice of them).   The service people were very nice, and wore masks and gloves.  The seafood was very fresh, and the lobster sandwich was delicious.   I highly recommend the bread pudding for dessert.
Amazing food and cocktails!!
Love the outdoor tables!
Had a fantastic meal at FWD and the service was safe, thoughtful, and well done.  We loved every item on the menu and can‚Äôt wait to go back! Raw bar is amazing!!!!

Our table took 1 hour to free up (we had an 8pm reservation and weren't seated at our table until 9pm), but I appreciate that we were compensated with scallops and a tostada on the house. The manager handled it very well.

We enjoyed a lovely ‚Äúsocial distancing‚Äù dinner the other night. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us and even offered a delicious complimentary appetizer while we waited for our table. The food is unbelievably fresh and delicious even though the menu is limited right now, we had no problem finding a variety of delicious options. The cocktails were inventive and the wine selection is carefully curated. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable and chef Alice makes a point to come out to greet the patrons.
