There is a reason FWD is such a favorite spot. It is well worth the advance reservation and the wait, if it comes to that.
Love FWD. Fresh seafood, great cocktails, great service.
Staff was incredible from Caroline to Jack and our waiter. Great experience!
Service could have been better. Restaurant was half full and it took a while to get drinks. Had to ask for new sets of new silverware three times.
So good! Amazing and passionate staff - over the top culinary creations. Don‚Äôt miss it ! And a super friendly chef.. destined for continued success. Try the craft cocktails!
Food is amazing - it‚Äôs small and claustrophobic, but worth it :).
Was absolutely incredible.  One of the best meals I have ever had.
Great raw platter and steams king crab!
Quality of service and food was excellent
Great small spot in Manhattan Beach. Everything on the menu was great. From the fries and mayo to the ceviche to the rice. Great bartender and cocktails too. Will definitely be back!

Good place ! Great location. When we were there, it was very busy. So service was slow. But, the bartender /waiter was awesome. He explained which oysters there were and the sauces. Just an excellent place. Oh, and the hostess was great too.

You will not find this menu at many restaurants.  Really caters to the shellfish / seafood lover. The variety is great without sacrificing quality. Oyster fans will find it hard to say there is a better place than this. The raw scallops are great as well. people talk about having the best clam chowder but I've never seen it prepared this fresh and tasteful. Great food and great value all around.

Love seafood! Fishing with dynamite serves up the best! Oysters , amazing, scallops, sensational. Excellent wine and I‚Äôm in heaven. Have mother but good words about this restaurant. Highly recommend!
THE place to eat in Manhattan Beach. Get whatever the server recommends
Amazing food
What a meal! Kenneth the bartender took great care of us and his oyster recommendations were spot on. #BrineBombThe hamachi is always a must and we loved the Spot Prawns, which are a seasonal treat.
The service is always outstanding!  The food is simply delicious.  One of Our favorite restaurant in MB!
Great spot. Will be back
Fresh seafood with nice flavors and very interesting souces

The food here is really quite exceptional. Great rahbar offerings and a lot of other inventive seafood and different types of entr√©es. Great service, limited but quality wine list. My biggest problem is the playlist, for somewhere so nice and so hard to get into, you would think the music would match the quality Of the place. Stone Temple pilots,

Frequent visitors to this restaurant, and our last experience was completely out of character. Shrimp was rubbery, scallops were not as fresh as usual, and the drinks (TomJoads) were completely watered down (literally with water). Hoping it was a one-time bad experience.

This was our first time (reservations are difficult to get there--and now I know why!). The food was absolutely fantastic. Even the nutty "I've gotta be gluten free" folks were dipping that amazing bread into the sauce from the fish dish and sopping up every drop. Fresh fish platter was fantastic! And our server was excellent. We will DEFINITELY be back!

This was our second visit after a truly magical first visit 1 1/2 years ago. While the food was just as great ‚Äî I dream about those Peruvian scallops ‚Äî a few things could have been better. The music was pretty loud, which given the size of the restaurant, seemed off. And the tables could have been a bit more spaced, so that we didn‚Äôt have to hear every word of our 2 neighbors conversations.
Amazing food. Love it! Had to wait a long time even with a reservation but they were very gracious and offered us a few appetizers while we waited.
If you like oysters, go to FWD.  Worth the wait!  Stop by, put your name in, and walk around lovely Manhattan Beach until they have a seat.  You must!  AMAZING.
Consistently a great dining experience!
The most amazing food!!!

As usual, counter sat in front of the poor dudes shucking all the oysters.  Justin, the barkeep, took care of us mighty fine as we splurged on the Queen Mary shellfish platter, gem salad, squash rolls, fish&chips, bigeye tuna tartar, and a Thai-curry sweet potatoes dish.  All washed down with Tito‚Äôs Vodka.  At $95, the Queen Mary is still a great deal and perfect for two.  Everything including the Key Lime pie and Banana Pudding were fantastic and I claim this cramped, noisy joint ‚ÄúDas Best Beach Scene Seafood Boot!‚Äù

We really liked this place and enjoyed everything about our early reservation. We seated on time and enjoyed a great sunset view. Our service was spectacular and really added a lot to our experience. The food didn‚Äôt disappoint either.  We had oysters (a must); a crab cake (my hubs said it was the best he ever had); the sweet potato dish (that was dynamic and the highlight of the meal for me): grilled prawns (which were cut in half and served in the shell); the mixed greens (this dish was a perfect pallet cleanser); and the finale was thE key lime pie (wowowowow)!  I would highly recommend this for a great date night on the town!
Consistently good food, service, and a great vibe. I never hesitate to return to FWD!
Love this spot! Girlfriend and I came here last weekend and decided no better place than here to come for Valentines. Will be back very soon
Delicious food in a lovely, intimate environment.
We got the tasting menu for $65 per person, best value!  Each dish unique and with many layers that complimented each other in the dish - 8 different plates that each stood on its own!
Great service, and one of our dishes was outstanding, but overall the food quality did not match up with the high prices.
Simply the best! Frances always delivers.
Very friendly service. Always love the bacon fritters. I had a delicious fresh little gem salad with crab and a cauliflower soup with date pur√©e.  Delicious.
Frances never disappoints, one of my favorite places in the city for a nice date night. The house wine was great, and make sure you save room for dessert!
First time at Frances and we'll be returning! The food was flavorful and delicious. The service was warm and knowledgeable, and the ambiance was cozy.

After coming to Frances for over 8 years--typically for my birthday or my partner's birthday--I've never been able to get the coveted window seat...until the 22nd! We got lucky. Stars aligned.  We ate family style which was a value for us and our friends who eat smaller portions. And did I tell you the service was extra special? It was.
Amazing, definitely will return.
Love this place.
Had been here before and it was amazing.  This time the food was good, but the server was dismissive and not very nice.
We always love going to Frances.  It‚Äôs our favorite casual restaurant in the Bay Area.  Frances never lets us down, and actually seems even better every time we go there!
Still lovely spot with excellent food and service. Definitely get the lumber jack cake!
lovely intimate cozy restaurant with quality ingredients and nice portions.

Perfect‚Äî great food and friendly service ‚Äî and we went for Valentine‚Äôs Day‚Äî which can often be a tough night for restaurants.  But Frances pulled it off perfectly!  We always particularly like to sit side-by-side at the spot right next to the window‚Äî fun to watch the world go by.

Frances continues to be my favorite restaurant in the city and one of my boyfriend's favorites as well.  Between the carefully curated menu and wine list, and the neighborhood feel of the venue, it was perfect for Valentine's Day dinner this year.
My favorite restaurant in the city. From the quality of food to the cost, it is my favorite spot.

Options for vegetarian and vegan food were not plentiful and not great. Ended up not eating entree-not special at all. Good wine list. Somewhat inattentive staff, by the time they asked if my food was okay or if I wanted something else, it was time to leave. Disappointing anniversary experience-not what I remembered in the past
excellent service! love everything!
We had the nicest person helping us! Food was delicious and ambiance was so perfect.
Frances is always a terrific experience.

Everything about this meal was special.   The wait staff was very friendly, helpful,  & attentive. The food was beautifully presented and expertly crafted by chefs who clearly know their ingredients & love what they do. Although it's a bit off the beaten path it's well worth the effort to get to this hidden gem.
Excellent service, food, wine - looking forward to returning!

Chickpea fritters and bacon beignets with dips were amazing! Housemade bread and lumperjack cake are also not to be missed. Our server was very attentive and easy to talk to. Do the tasting menu so you don't need to make an decisions becuase it's impossible to anyway ;) Everything is outstanding!

The overall dining quality hasn‚Äôt changed. We‚Äôve dined there since it‚Äôs opening and the food and wine choices plus preparation remain top drawer in SF. The service excels: the wait staff is warm but discretionary, and knowledgeable about the menu preparation and wine list. The diners are a good representation of the City, while still retaining its neighborhood feel. Still, the standout  food is the star!

Frances is the perfect spot to start an evening out to the theatre, symphony, ballet or opera. The skilled and thoughtful staff will work with you to get you on your way on time. The fun, vintage F-Market trams are only steps out the door that take you on a nostalgic ride down market to your entertainment destination. Every dish that came out of the kitchen was perfectly prepared. Hint: order an appetizer or two, and a couple of side dishes, instead of an entre.

We hadn't been to Frances for a while but we are SO happy that we returned last week for this very special dinner. Everyone was very welcoming and gracious and the food was amazing!We will be returning soon and often!!
I love everything about Frances.  Tasting menu was an incredible value and I left stuffed.

Wonderful restaurant.  Would highly recommend.  Not particularly child friendly but I took my 7 year old daughter  (it was my birthday dinner).  She is well behaved...not loud, anything like that.  I had never been there, it is a very small and you are very close to the other tables (the staff literally pulls the table out for you to get in the booth seat against the wall).   The staff was very kind and did nothing that wasn't "child friendly".  But, if I had known the ambiance of the place, I probably wouldn't have brought her.
The hostess told us our table was needed for another reservation before we got to dessert. It was really, really disappointed.
Love the food, the staff and atmosphere. Such a gem.

Frances is back on top form. We shared a variety of bouch√©es and small plates. The favorites (smoked bacon beignets and the chick pea fries) were still outstanding - the beet side accompanying the chick pea fries could have had fuller flavor. The sour dough bread was very tasty. The brussel sprouts with tahini sauce were tangy and delicious and the pasta excellent. The only miss was the grits-consistency polenta - I would have preferred something less runny. Service was quick, friendly, and attentive.
Lovely dinner, delicious food, attentive staff, a very enjoyable first time experience at Frances.
The food was delicious and the service was great. Highly recommend this place üëç
A continuous favorite with exceptional, small, curated menu and amazing team both in/outside the kitchen.
Our favorite special-occasion restaurant, the vegetarian main-courses are great, and the music is always great too.  Small and cozy and not too loud.
Always satisfying, high quality, comfort food.  Ample quantities.  Fixed price chefs menu is an excellent value.  Professional staff.
Excellent food, great service.  A great treat.
Magical as always!  Such a special place to dine in San Francisco.
The sampler menu is great.
Great. But have more attentive waiters. Improve coffee making. In total, I had a great experience with my boyfriend.
Very  nice restaurant, amazing food and service but , very very expensive.

We selected the six course tasting menu. There wasn‚Äôt one dish that was disappointing. This is easily the most refined cuisine I have experienced in NYC and is probably in a class with some of the top restaurants in the world. Good luck in these turbulent times.
We had eaten at Gabriel Kreuther before and the food and experience this time was excellent. We will be back!

This was a surprise birthday dinner at Gabriel Kreuther.  It was a Monday night and tables were at 30% (perhaps due to the coronavirus?)  There was sophisticated jazz piped in and low decibel level.  The plethora of staff was professional from greet to exit.  GK has two tasting menus: nine course Heritage at $195 and the nine course Chef's Carte Blanche at $245.  While the restaurant recommends you allow 2 hours for the Heritage and 3 hours for the Chef's Carte Blanche, the prior lasted 2:35.   Do not be fooled by the food : time - we left quite satisfied by the portions.It was an amazing dining experience with our favorites being an early course Pistachio encrusted Foie Gras and the Grilled Dock to Dish Tilefish.  Choose from Grilled Berkshire Pork Culotte or Aged Long Island Duck Breast Smoked in Hay as your meat entree.Cocktails of various categories consistent with neighboring Bryant Park range from non-alcoholic, to classics, and signatures.  Pours of wine by the glass were short.As a nice touch, we were presented with a printed menu of the day on exit.
I prefer to relay my experience at a later date via email.
I've been to GK several times both in the main dining room and lounge.  Both experiences are always special and a cut above other high end restaurants.  We love coming back.

I picked the Heritage menu and it was incredible. Foie gras Terrine, pasta with truffle, caviar mousseline and tenderloin were to die for. Wine pairing was very good, it didn‚Äôt blow my mind (except for a surprising German Riesling and a phenomenal Chateauneuve du pape) but went very well with food. Price in line with the quality and the Michelin stars, very high but worth it.
Delicious and creative food , superb service but very noisy.
2 Michelin quality food, service, ambiance, cadre... Perfect for business lunch, ideal for romantic dinner or dinner with friends. Amongst my fav restos in NYC.
What a special and wonderful experience!!!  The chefs came out to meet us and the service at every level was outstanding!!!
It's an incredible space with outstanding food, and exemplary staff. I would wholeheartedly recommend this fantastic restaurant!
Great experience!

This is a one-of-a-kind experience.  From the moment we walked in and checked our coats until we left - there was not one misstep.  The room is lovely, understated, with a nice bar for a pre-dinner drink.  The service was impeccable.  We had the Long Island duck breast and all the many courses that came before it (loved the langoustine tartar and fois gras) and then the sorbet that followed.  A really lovely touch is the little box of chocolates that you get on your way home!  Yes it is expensive - but s worth it!
Wonderful preparation tasting menu but problems out front. Wine service late with courses. Near end help was leaving and transition left us temporarily forgotten.
One of the most elegant and incredible dining experiences in New York.

We had a lovely romantic dinner. It was our first time trying out a tasting menu and had the best dining experience.  From the moment we walked into the restaurant, we felt welcomed. The service was exceptional. My partner has a shell-fish allergy, and our server was attentive and accomodating to his dietary restrictions. I was impressed with the plating and overall presentation of each of our dishes. The ambiance was romantic and lovely. Overall, it was an incredible experience and can't wait for the next time!
One of the best meals I ever had!
Amazing flavors and great wine pairing !!
One of very best restaurants in the US.
we were surprised that the service neither did ask if we would like to order a 2nd bottle of wine nor if we would like to have Cafe or Espresso to 'conclude' our dinner.
Amazing dinner. A sensory adventure. Every bite makes you feel more alive. All beautifully, meticulously presented in a welcoming atmosphere.
amazing plating with equally amazing taste. Impeccable service with an amazing dining experience make this a truly delightful place for all occation.

We ate at lunchtime.  Everything worked well.  However it appeared that the smoothnessdid not conceal the obvious comparison of LeBernadin--same price, both have excellentwine lists. Food good but not exceptional--and cost-cutting was obvious.  One kind of senses that Gabriel Kreuther will be closing soon. Definitely not in LeBernardin's class forservice, atmosphere and food.

Let me get right to the point - this was a very disappointing experience for us. For the amount we paid for this ‚Äúspecial Valentine‚Äôs dinner‚Äù (we were celebrating my husband‚Äôs birthday), the 7- course menu (excluding the amuse bouche and petit fours) was ‚Äújust ok‚Äù. I didn‚Äôt want to use mediocre to describe it, as there were some fantastic elements like the Dry aged duck and red apple consomm√© en gel√®e.  Everything else fell flat in my opinion. I just didn‚Äôt think it was worth that kind of money. For a very steep price tag of $1K, every bite should‚Äôve elicited a ‚Äúwow!‚Äù, but it didn‚Äôt. Not to mention from a Michelin rated restaurant at that. To add insult to injury, our server announced at the start of dinner that they have added a dish to their menu which is Risotto and black truffle for an additional $50 pp. We declined, as we‚Äôve anticipated a wonderful evening ahead of us. We couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong.  Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere. Per Se, Jean Georges, and Le Bernardin would be considered reasonable compared to GK, with amazing food to boot. Alinea in Chicago is very much worth the price tag - from start to finish. You would leave on cloud 9 and have the fondest experience ever ( we still dream about it to this day). And if you are ever in Oslo, Maeemo is top notch.  We will not come back.
Exception food, wonderful ambience, terrific service.  Couldn't have been better!
Amazing !!! Nothing else to say ! Couldn't be better.

Not enough foodA tasting sit down should not last 4 hours Left the restaurant very hungry For what I paid for dinner 1,300 all of the above comments should of been addressed Portions were extremely small only to have to wait a minimum of 30 minutes between each course.If your are to charge these prides, all of these issues should of already been addressed.Overall, the salvaging grace was that the food although  not sufficient was in fact very good.Dissatisfied customers should have an reinvite to correct the wrong with some type of a courtesy reduction in order not to lose a patron.Dr. Malpeso,
Our trip was
Excellent food and service - what more can you ask.

The food and service were outstanding. The setting was lovely: a subdued, pleasant ambience that allowed for quiet diner conversations.However, as with many high-end restaurants, the portions were very small. Certainly not satisfying for anyone with a hearty appetite.
Good but too expensive compare to similar fine dining restaurantes.
Second time here in the last year. Not to be missed when in NYC.

Let‚Äôs start with the fact that the restaurant was virtually empty, but once I received the check and saw that my guest had two scotches at $50each, it started to click. This restaurant has some brilliant moments of epicurean magic, and the wait staff is superb, but the expense relative to the actual food and wine is ridiculous. We ordered on the low end of the wine spectrum and it was still $500/ person. This is absurd and nothing about the dinner was remotely memorable.This was my third and last time dining here.
Quite an excellent meal. The main dining room only has a multi course price fixed meal so make sure you leave enough time or eat in the bar area.
Fantastic as always
It was a dining experience.  It was expensive, but you don't go to a place like this without expecting to spend.  It was lovely all around.

My first time at this restaurant. It was absolutely fantastic! From staff, who accommodated us in the dining room but with lounge menu option ( we were in a rush for the show), thru meals and desert. Food was incredibly tasty, well prepared, fresh ingredients, fantastic combinations of flavors! Really really liked it. Ordered tuna tartar, sturgeon appetizers, beef filet mignon, sea bass, chocolate desert... super delicious!Super pricey. We really enjoy our dinner. Thank you.

This place was as good as it gets.  The food was incredible and service stellar.  My mom took me for my 60th birthday.  We had the 9 course tasting menu and walked out in awe of the whole experience.  Definitely will be back.

This was my third visit and it was by far the best.  We chose the Chef's Carte Blanche menu.  We had an 8:00 reservation and time was not an issue.   If you choose this menu, be aware it can take more than four hours, which may be too long for some.  We felt every course was exquisite and the service impeccable.
This is a great place for a special occasion. Food and service always five stars. Friendly, unpretentious staff. Great location in the City Different .

Geronimo is Santa Fe's best restaurant, bar none. My wife and I have birthdays ten days apart, and we both chose Geronimo as where we wanted to celebrate. We also took our family there recently, and each time, the service was impeccable; friendly and just enough. The rooms are quiet and handsome, and the cuisine is flawlessly prepared. I consider myself a decent cook, and I always am impressed and delighted by the food. The miso seabass is fantastic, as is the elk. The starters always lead the way, being tasty and light, and their wine by the glass choices are excellent matches to the dishes. This restaurant has maintained its high standards for the ten years we've been in Santa Fe. Hard to do, but they have managed it. Kudos.

For me, Geronimo is one of the best restaurants on the planet.  The old adobe provides a wonderful environment.  The service is exceptional...always.  And the meals are extraordinary.  This visit was no exception.  The Elk was prepared to perfection.  My wife loved the flavors blended together in the chicken and my daughter loved the gnocchi.  The Tiramisu and Banana Cream Pie were both excellent and plenty for the three of us.  Can't wait for next visit.
Perfect dining experience. Our waitress was wonderful. The outdoor dining option is perfect during this pandemic time. The food was great!  Highly recommend this place.
Miso sea bass the best!Refreshing summer beer & burrata salad! And Chris Harvey the best owner/host!
Lovely, lovely evening. The lemon crepe is out of this world. Thank you.

Geronimo continues to provide our favorite dining experience in Santa Fe, and that is high praise in a city famous for it‚Äôs fine restaurants. The wait-staff is professional, knowledgeable and engaging. The food I excelled and the ambience lovely. Additionally, the wine list is superb. Don‚Äôt miss Geronimo!And book early.
Absolutely amazing!!! We will certainly be back again!
easily the best restaurant in Santa Fe.  Excellent service and fabulous preparation and presentation of food.  we will be back soon!
Awesome as always!  This place is about as good as it gets.
Phenomena birthday dinner!
The prawns / massive shrimp were amazing, and the presentation was perfect.
Simply outstanding cuisine and service, as always.

We celebrated our anniversary at Geronimo.  My wife and I both had the elk tenderloin and split a Caesar salad.  Both were excellent and the service was both professional and friendly.  As far as we are concerned, Geronimo continues to be the best restaurant in New Mexico.  Already looking forward to our next visit.
Beet & avocado salad, crab cakes, miso sea bass
Reggie was great!
Great job all around‚Äîfood and service outstanding
Mitzi as always, was wonderful. Our favorite place to eat in Santa Fe.  Xoxo
Best team, food, beverages, and ambiance on the planet.

The food was exquisite. The elk was fresh and tender, everything was beautifully presented, and the delicious desserts were works of art. The attention to detail you expect in a fine dining establishment. (One young gentleman struggled to keep his thumbs out of the plates, but I also noticed they limited him to mostly setting tables.)Atmosphere, comfort, quality, and service; all top notch.
Delicious food and great service. I was especially happy since they gave me a taster of the mushroom bisque during my wife‚Äôs second course (I only ordered 2 courses) so I wouldn‚Äôt be left out.

Always terrific.  The state's 50% rule should be relaxed when tables are this far apart already, it just limits how many people can enjoy Geronimo's at one time, and reduces what their staff can earn, but doesn't add any additional safety. Tip well, they deserve it!
Our favorite Santa Fe restaurant, great food, atmosphere and service, all the way across the board! Our server Michelle was wonderful!Consistently fabulous!
first night out since COVID. We felt very safe and had exceptional service and an outstanding meal. Thank you.
Fabulous! So glad G is reopened! Still offering takeout too!
I had the gnocchi. My husband had the elk. Shared the mushroom bisque. All were fabulous as always.
Had an anniversary dinner there. We were seated in a romantic quiet location and had a perfect night.
Always a great choice. We decided to make this the first place to visit after the lock-down and it met every expectation.
This was by far the best meal I‚Äôve had in NM. I‚Äôve been looking for a place like this for the 3 years I‚Äôve lived here. I cannot overstate how good the meal was.

Wow. Have been in Santa Fe for 7 years and finally tried Geronimo. They live up to their name. Vegetarian four course was fantastic. Wine markup was surprisingly reasonable. Have you ever had that one great employee at a restaurant? Everyone was like that. The valet, the hosts, the assistants, and the servers. The only downside is that no one else can live up to this experience! Dining will never be the same for me. I'm really glad to see a restaurant doing it right. I actually went in with high expectations too so Bravo!
Best beef I have ever had - center cut with 4 dipping sauces. Service as usual was perfect. I am glad that my favorite restaurant in Santa Fe seems to have weathered the corona virus shutdown.
Wonderful as always. Geronimo‚Äôs was the first restaurant on my agenda when the restaurants became open to indoor seating. Missed you guys!Debbie Conway

Excellent as always. Pear salad was tasty as was my wife's tuna appetizer. The new salmon and chicken dinners were delicious. Service was excellent. It was my wife's 60th and they made her feel special.
As always, our dining experience at Geronimo was wonderful. The food and service were outstanding. Even the valet was great. We had a great evening. We look forward to our next dinner at Geronimo.

This was one of those experiences that are worthy of our BEST DINNERS EVER label. The food was scrumptious, well portioned, beautifully presented and different enough to make it interesting. Our waitress was knowledgeable and efficient and made several suggestions that were on point. Whenever we go back to Santa Fe, Geronimo's will definitely be on our list. Thank you for a lovely evening!

Simply First rate, ALL the way around.  Elk, and salmon both terrific, as was the crem br√ªl√©e....Service was informed, polite and perfectly executed by Dan.  I wish we had eaten there two nights in a row, as our other Santa Fe selection was not nearly so good.  Professional staff from reservations to departure.  There are VERY few menus in which several entrees look tempting.....it was honestly a bit difficult to decide! Looking forward to coming here again as soon as is humanly possible!
The ribeye was very tough and flavorless; the fish was amazing!!
Would highly recommend, the food and service was fantastic!
Highly recommend Geronimo's if you are in the Santa Fe area!  Atmosphere, service, cocktails and food were ALL ON POINT!
Our favorite restaurant in Santa Fe. Never disappoints.
Amazing! Food atmosphere and service alway spectacular√∞≈∏Àú≈†
Beyond pleased with the food and service... the unique flavor combinations are unmatched!!! Highly recommend this dining experience... goat empanadas!!! Enough said...

The server was amazing and really helped us understand the menu! He had amazing recommendations - we were not disappointed in anything that he helped us order! The service was the best I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve experienced in a long time and not to mention the food was outstanding!! Highly highly recommend!!
Server at first was quite cold, but warmed up eventually :)Everything I had was outstanding, from drinks to desert !!!Will be back next time im in Chicago :)
Amazing everything. Staff food atmosphere could not be better. Great experience!

So incredibly good.  Unique dishes but not with things so far out there I didn't know what I was eating.  I can't wait to go back.  I will plan a trip to Chicago around when I can go to Girl & the Goat!
Everything I had was amazing.  Would definitely recommend to anyone.
AMAZINGGGGG EVERYTHING 10/10 holy moly I can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t even believe how deliciously amazing that was
Great food and service! Will definitely be back
Great creative food made to share.  Good cocktails as well.  Highly recommended for all foodies!
Every bite was delicious and our waitress went above and beyond to make sure our anniversary was special. Loved it!
The meal was very delicious and server was nice and helpful.
We enjoyed dining at Girl and the Goat. Everything is served family style which made it really easy to taste many things. Fun and delicious!
Exciting,unusual and delicious food choices. What a wonderful experience!
Best dinner of my life!!
Phenomenal experience from the food to the service!
Great food and great drinks!

Food is good - not that great. The duck was really good. Goat was good too, but too unconventional and the flavors didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t work that well. Some dishes were good, none were exceptional. Kind of overhyped. There√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s better food all along that block.

definitely good to check out if you haven√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t been before. Went for a date night... I would go back again with some girlfriends and sit at the bar next time. A little noisy to have a discussion. The Pork shank and the green beans are awesome!
Great food. Great service. Will come back again soon

Drove into town a night early because we were able to get a reservation here and it did not disappoint!! Every dish we tried was phenomenal. The seating was a bit tight, and when our allotted reservation time was up staff began to hover, but for the people waiting, I appreciate that. Go for the food!! But don't go to linger beyond 2 hours ;)

We haven't had this much fun dining out in a very long time.  Girl & the Goat is an utterly delightful restaurant, especially if one gets to sit at the "chef's table" which overlooks the long counter of prep/grills/etc.  If you want to be able to watch all the prep and interact with the chefs, go early.  If you want to watch an eye-popping and frenzied ballet as the chefs create your dinner, go later in the evening.The waitpeople are personable, unhurried and offer excellent advice as they guide you through menu.And now to the food.  Inventive, unusual & most of all delicious.  Of the 6 varied dishes [veggie, fish & meat] plus dessert, we particularly enjoyed the duck tongue and the goat liver pat√É¬©.  Not a single misstep.   Thank you Girl & the Goat!
Fantastic food, one of the best restaurants I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve ever had
Scrumptious as always!
delicious foods, recommendations, and ambience. highly recommend it. short ribs were the best!

Innovative and flavorful food that is beautifully presented.  Service was excellent.  We had the walleye tempura , chickpea fritters, goat empanada, and pierogis.  All were prepared with different combinations of veggies, fruit and spices.  Sourdough bread was fresh and tasty.  The goat cheese cheesecake with blood orange sorbet was exquisite and light.  One of the best restaurants I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve ever eaten at.  Can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t wait to return on my next trip to Chicago!
Fantastic food!!! So good.  Everyone√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s needs to come here.
Excellent service, knowledgable waiter and great ambiance. Go hungry because you need to try a variety of dishes.   Their vegetable dishes are super satisfying.

We had a 5:30P reservation on Tuesday night and were lucky enough to get seated at one of the Chef√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Table. We had the opportunity to watch Chef Izard expedite orders and the chefs in the kitchen. The chefs interacted with us as their workload allowed. It was an awesome experience for foodies. We ordered the bacon Gouda bread, kohlrabi salad, branzino, crispy short rib, and goat belly confit. The bread was good, but unnecessary if you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re looking to save room and calories for other items on the menu. The kohlrabi salad was delicious! My non-veggie eating husband went back for seconds and thirds and named the dish his favorite of the meal. We highly recommend it. The Branzino was my favorite dish of the meal. The chef responsible for preparing the fish was stationed right in front of our table, so we got to see its preparation. Served whole, this dish may be intimidating to some, but the crispy skin, tender meat, and the crunchy farro paired with the sauce was the PERFECT bite. Another dish that we highly recommend. The crispy short ribs were perfectly crispy on outside and tender on the inside and were paired with grapefruit and avocado. The meal itself was delicious, but the dish itself wasn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t our favorite- too citrus forward for our liking. The goat belly confit was paired with crab and a vanilla sauce, and a composed bite of that dish made me drop my fork and close my eyes. It was PERFECTION!! Chef Izard ordered us a mini portion of the green beans on the house, and they were delicious! The beans were so perfectly charred and paired with sliced cashew and a garlic sesame sauce. Neither of us are huge fans of green beans, but this dish challenged our opinion. Again, highly recommend. To finish the meal, we ordered the Carmel corn & malt balls. Our server mentioned that it was one of their most popular desserts, and it was truly delicious. There was an unique contrast between the luxurious ice cream and the crunchy corn. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!
Second time here and still fantastic. The broccoli is amazing, don't miss it.

Celebrated my birthday here with a big group, and everyone had the best time! Service was great, food and drinks were amazing, everything went very smoothly! This place definitely lives up to the hype.
Awesome, incredible food

This is my third visit in seven years and the food is always top notch. We ate the Ora King Salmon Poke, Pig Face, Duck Tartare, Pork Shank, Escargot Ravioli, Apple Gjetost Pierogi and drank the Goat's Choice (Scotch, Beet Juice, Lime) and Don't Carrot All What You Think. We had the Gets Better with Sage and Fireside at the bar while waiting for the table; top notch drinks. The Ora King Salmon Poke was the most flavorful and impressive dish followed by the Duck and Pig Face. The Pork Shank was surprisingly over salted so we took it home to add some sugar for balance. We sat at a two seat, slim table behind a barrier to the people getting trashed at the bar. I understand the West Loop is getting more expensive with each Instagram-flex post and want to make use of each square footage, however, the restaurant should reconsider the layout of sitting a two person table near the super loud bar and kitchen area that will make any introverted foodie lose their enjoyment of food. Luckily, my significant other thoroughly enjoyed herself on her birthday even if the Girl and the Goat staff did not acknowledge her. Kudos to our bartender and servers for an enjoyable evening.
Overrated.  Expensive. Service was mediocre.  Interesting menu.
My daughters and her boyfriend.
Amazing food, excellent service!  Our party of 3 shared 8 plates including desserts. Impossible to pick a favorite!
Absolutely incredible small plates. Couldn't believe how good the Duck Tartare was.
Great experience. I recommend to every one that lives in our visitors
We had a very gracious, efficient, and accommodating server. The food was amazing and very delicious, especially the duck tongue and duck tartare.
There were some dishes that were too salty (scallops, ribs, and broccoli) . Everything else was good.
Was amazing! Such a fan of Giulia. Kinda, friendly serving staff. Amazing food. Lives up to the hype, and well worth the money.
Really good dinner here our server was wonderful. Very knowledgeable about wines and the food. Gem of a place on Mass Avenue. We will go back.!
Great food and service, thank you!!  Loved all the dishes and flavors. Noise level is a little high--maybe some sound mitigation?

Really enjoyed my first and much anticipated visit to Giulia.  Everything was outstanding.  Had the signature pappardelle with wild boar with the fresh black truffle add on (such a treat!), veal pasta special, housemade sourdough, burrata with lentils (so good), live scallop ceviche with fermented muscat grapes (so so good), octopus and squid with chickpeas, and an excellent primitivo at the server's suggestion.  Pricey yes but not out of line with the quality/creativity of the meals.  The pasta was perfectly cooked.  Got a last minute res via open table.  Will def be back.
The pasta here is not to be missed. Always try something new.
Terrific small Italian great local food and friendly service
Excellent food, wonderful service. It was worth a visit. Wouldn't say it's in my top 5 but definitely top 8. A word of warning - parking is TOUGH. If you can Uber or use public transport, do it.

Hands down one of the best in Cambridge, if not Boston. Beats the north end by a mile. Tough to get a reservation at a normal hour, which is frustrating, but you‚Äôll forget what time it is when you‚Äôre inside enjoying the incredible food. The menu seemed to be heavy on homemade pastas (which were amazing), so not sure if they have many gluten free options - though I didn‚Äôt ask.
Amazing as usual! The top handmade pasta in MA. The bar sometimes has the best seats for interactive experience.
Fabulous!!!
Fantastic!!  Worth waiting for a reservation.

Our waitress was incedible... she was extremely knowledgable with the wine list and her service to our table was awesome.. the food was some of the best we have ever had in a local restaurant.... would definitly return...

It‚Äôs very deceptive.  The opening  photo of the restaurant on Open Table is NOT of Giulia Restaurant.  The atmosphere is quite pub like and not an elegant restaurant with white table clothes.The food was a B+ but not worth the cost.  Service was exceptional.
The fixed price menu was not disclosed on opentable. This information is critical. Dinner was much more expensive than expected as a result

This Has to be the most unwelcoming restaurant I have ever been to! If any of the bartenders smiled I‚Äôm quite sure their faces would‚Äôve cracked! The food is good but I won‚Äôt go back because of the service. The ambience is not that great either and the chairs terribly uncomfortable.
Extraordinary food, extraordinarily knowledgeable and helpful service.  An extraordinary dining experience.
Reserve WAY in advance !  Food is fantastic, space intimate, wait staff friendly and knowledgeable.  Wine and drink selection excellent.
Kerri was one of the best waiters I‚Äôve ever had at any restaurant, highly recommend requesting her!

Came for the pasta, but thought the apps were going to steal the show after having a taste. They didn't. The pasta was even better. Probably could have cut back on the salt by about 15-20%, but still one of the absolute best restaurants we've been to in Boston.

First, everything was perfectly cooked ... to the point where the smoked octopus/squid was in my top 3 ever.  Our server was knowledgeable, friendly, and added to our overall experience.  We thought that, given the difficulty of getting 6 pm to 8 pm reservations, that the food would be more ‚Äúmemorable‚Äù .... undoubtedly an expectation that is somewhat unfair. I would return, but would limit myself to octopus and pasta,  the two strength areas, which would also keep the tab at a more reasonable level. Wines were delicious and worth the price ..... particularly liked the aglianico and nebbiolo.
Wonderful as always!
The food was off, rosemary in all the dishes, food salty and not edible/
Fantastic appetizers and a bit too greasy and heavy entrees. Anyway that‚Äôs is the best restaurant in Boston (so far)

What a wonderful restaurant! My boyfriend LOVED absolutely everything on their menu, and even though I have some dietary restrictions, our waitress kindly offered an adjusted dairy-free version of the dish I wanted. The starters, the mains and the desserts were delicious. It is one of our favorite spots in Boston, and we are definitely coming back there again!
Excellent appetizer, entrees and dessert. Wine selection is great but expensive per glass. Great service. Difficult to get a table without reservations.
This the second time we have eaten here and it did not disappoint. The drinks, food and service were amazing.

Outstanding, as ever. My husband and I struggled to narrow down our choices of tempting offers and were helped by our terrific server to choose a pasta and the Branzino with some apps. That paired with cocktails and the trebbiano wine was the perfect meal. Guilia's always hits it out of the park!

This was our third visit at the restaurant. The food quality is well above the North End Italian restaurant. I had the celery root gnocchi and it was very rich with seafood and the souse was very tasty. My spouse ordered the whole grilled branzino and this was a very generous portion and made very well. the sfizzi and antipasti portion on the other hand were relatively small. We will return.

I wish the initial question above had an ‚Äúinsure‚Äù option.   The appetizer and antipasto options were great but I thought the main entrees or the secondi section had only one vegetarian option.  Also the wines understanding were all Italian wines but it would have been quite useful to have better descriptions to those less familiar with Italian wines.Also it was a bit of a tease to hear a one minute plus  description of the special entree only to discover the price of the dish was $65 inflated by the addition of truffles.
New Years eve

All our food was absolutely delicious! Our venison appetizer was so fresh and clean tasting. We both ordered pasta and I don‚Äôt know whose tastes better ‚Äî they were both incredible. For dessert we got the chocolate terrine and the chocolate gelato was so creamy! Service was very attentive. Would definitely come back for other special occasions.

Giulia has been on my list to try for awhile, as one of the top Italian restaurants in Greater Boston. It lives up to the hype. This was a pre-theater dinner for 2 couples. We tried the flatbread, scallops, and prosciutto appetizers all of which were terrific. Then we all ordered different pasta dishes. The pasts was all perfectly prepared, with interesting and complex flavors well-balanced. Desserts were also delicious. The only hiccup was when the kitchen missed our dessert order, and our server had to intervene to get desserts to us before we had to go to theater - in the end we were a little rushed. No big deal. We will definitely return, and Giulia is an excellent value!

We finally got a reservation and were not disappointed! Service was great,  everyone warm, welcoming and funny.  Food from appys through dessert was awesome.  There is a reason this place is extremely hard to get a reservation. Don't let that stop you it's worth the effort. For those who like to eat at the bar, it's first come first served.
I wanted to go for a very long time but the place is so "famous" that it only happened a couple days ago and it was definitively worth it!I do recommend!
This place was incredible. I am not a fan of iyali3and they blew my mind away!! I already booked reservations again after the first app came out. Chicken liver crostini

Generally Giulia lives up to its high reputation; among other points, it is an entirely successful Italian substitute for the sort of high-quality classic French cuisine that has more or less vanished from Boston in the last decade. Our octopus starter with Umbrian lentils was delicious, but outmatched both by the pasta and steak, both of which my partner and I shared. Although everything was done to perfection, the mushroom and kale elements in the pasta sauce and the aioli accompanying the steak were particularly superb. The selection of Italian wines by the glass was slightly narrow but excellent.In reviewing a restaurant of Giulia's quality, it is surely not churlish to cavil at minor slips. Prosecco was rather too close to room temperature. More seriously, the pudding selection was unambitious and strikingly Americanized: no proper Italian pastry was on offer, nor was a cheese option, which by definition requires comparatively little preparation. Nonetheless we found the evening entirely satisfying.

Great food in a setting with a neighbourhood feel. Hard to understand menu but really good simple Italian food. Do ask if there are any off menu additions like truffles - unfortunately, my rather disinterested waiter failed to volunteer any information.
Pasta can't be beat.  Amatriciana is perfect.  Wine recommendations always spot on.
Amazing waiter and sommelier. We will go back.
The three of us got 4 pastas to share and a glass of wine each for about $50 per person. Everything was perfectly delicious. We left happy and full
Fantastic!
We enjoyed our starters and desserts. Didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t love our main dish, chicken and veal
Wonderful birthday dinner.  Exceptional food and service!

We had a reservation in the main dining room and decided to do the seasonal tasting menu, one with the wine pairings, one without.All of the courses were varied, expertly prepared and delicious. We especially appreciated the spacing between courses, which allowed us to not only enjoy the flavor of each course, but also the overall ambience of the restaurant.The service was outstanding from beginning to end and they easily accommodated special requests.We highly recommend the Gramercy Tavern!
One of the best there is.  Service is impeccable, unobtrusive, and extremely professional.
This was one of mine and my husbands best dining experiences we have ever had. (And we have dined in some great places.) We would definitely return.
One of our best fixed price meals ever!  The seasonal six course dinner was great!  And the service is the best of any restaurant!
Good was just okay. Nothing special. Overall feels like a tourist restaurant that has seen better days.
As good as advertised. Food is superb, service is outstanding, wine list is imaginative. We√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ll be back.

We ordered the lunch tasting menu with wine pairing at Gramercy Tavern. What a fantastic value! The amount of food and wine we received for the price (which already included tip) was impressive. The food was wonderfully prepared and presented and the staff were very flexible to accommodate dietary restrictions and make substitutions as necessary. For the price for the wine pairing (about $50 a person for 5 courses) we were expecting lower-end wines, but the wines were the same quality as that used for their much more expensive dinner wine pairings. I would definitely recommend going to Gramercy Tavern for lunch for a memorable meal at a great value.
√∞≈∏¬§‚Äî delightful indeed Thank you very muchChris
Birthday lunch

How Gramercy Tavern earned its reputation for good (or great) food is beyond me, my husband and our two dinner guests.  The chefs/cooks appear to have dumped nothing other than salt on all the food.  My entr√É¬©e was so bad that it got sent back.  My appetizer (pasta with Bolognese sauce) was drowning in oil; it was disgusting.  At the end of the meal our waiter did the right thing; she took the cost of my dinner off the tab.  If someone gave me a gift certificate to this restaurant, it would be thrown in the trash.
Great combinations on the tasting menu.  Look to return soon.
The food was excellent and the staff was amazing, especially our server Toni who made our experience memorable and added her personal touch of hospitality.
Way too expensive!
The food was superb. The service was first rate and really attentive. The deserts were impeccable. Gramercy Tavern will remain in my fine dining rotation for many, many years to come!!
Great choices on the menu. Outstanding service. The wine list is outstanding. Arrived early and had a drink at the bar. Very well organized as they transferred my bill and sat us easily.
Reservation honoured 20 minutes late. Place was so busy that main courses were served a bit less than hot! Hostess was dour and overstressed. Could not handle the pressure!!
After reading your cookbook and all of Mr. Myers√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ books I had been  so looking forward to GT and you lived up to and exceeded all expectations.  Our enthusiastic server was a delight!

Our dinner experience at the Tavern's dinning area was nothing short of spectacular. The food was excellent, but even better was the service. I was there with my son and daughter celebrating her birthday. Our server made sure everyone was happy, he provided excellent recommendations and was very friendly. The food was fantastic and the dishes were both the right potion and executed to perfection. Would love to come here again.
We came to celebrate my daughter, Meghan, birthday and  it was wonderful.  Carolyn, our waitress, was terrific.Thank you for making her birthday a treat.The Grosso Gals

I particularly enjoyed the tasting menu at lunch.  Considering the reputation of the restaurant, it was up to expectations.  Interesting dishes at a reasonable cost for the kind of restaurant it is.  Excellent service, friendly and helpful in a comfortable setting.  We liked the idea of the no tipping policy.  We will return.
Ridiculous meal√¢‚Ç¨‚Äùout of sight amazing! Service was impeccable. Our favorite restaurant on our trip!
Good food, beautiful presentation, but did not blow me away. For the price tag and the Michelin star, I was expecting more.

This restaurant never disappoints. The dining room is staffed with lovely people who are attentive, kind and love the food they bring to you. And everything is delicious. This is cuisine in a great setting.
We loved the atmosphere and beauty of Gramercy Tavern. The staff was friendly and genuine. The restaurant was beautiful and the food was just perfect.
Great place to eat worker are super friendly and a great experience
Second time here with my wife. Probably our best dining experience
Just wonderful in all respects. Kelsey is a gem!Thanks to all for a great experience.
Very welcoming. Lovely service and great food.

Sad to report that after many years going to GT standards have dropped. The food was Average at best on the seasonal menu. The duck was hit but the portion size was tiny. The pasta was sausage and clams a complete miss quality you get at a bad diner. As mentioned portion size are so tiny that my kids left starving - which make it expensive given the 184 for the pre set dinner. Hopefully a one off miss.
We had a most enjoyable late lunch. Everything we ordered was delicious including the relatively inexpensive market lunch menu and the complementary salad.
Great lunch! Delicious food! Kind service!

We are carnivores but look forward annually to the summer vegetable tasting menu.  Chef Michael Anthony is known for his prowess with vegetables.  The creativity and deliciousness of this tasting menu is testimony to his genius.   Not to be missed!

Food and service was impeccable as always at Gramercy Tavern, however that level of expertise does come at a price! I like the "no tipping" policy, but was a little disappointed to find that the only options in the dining room were a three course or six course prix fixe menu. No a la carte options available. I'll be back at GT, next time might dine at the bar where there are more options.
Still remains one of the best! Food is phenomenal and service is fantastic.

The food was good (the chef likes it spicy), but ridiculously high prices for beer and wine by the glass, 3 - 5 Dollars more than Michelin three rosettes restaurant Le Bernadin; staff is strained, maybe because they do not get tips, that's why the prices for beverages are so high - they say.

I loved my evening at Gramercy Tavern! The food was incredible, and the service was terrific. My only critique was the noise level, but considering the architecture and room size it wasn't surprising that it got a little loud. On the upside, the general cacophony covered the borderline pornographic sounds I made while eating the tilefish course!!
Double birthday

The last night they were serving food in Florida. What a beautiful way to eat our prior to quarantine. Filet mignon, mushrooms, luscious chocolate cake and the bread. So fortunate to enjoy a wonderful meal in such a surreal time. Stay safe, healthy, and well. Thank you the grill!

The whole experience from the food to the wait staff was absolutely 5 star!! Scott is a true professional server and made my family and I feel very special! Hats off to the entire team at The Grill-Ritz Carlton Naples!!
Not just exceptional, beyond five stars to the entire staffs, Cheft and facility!  Very grateful to have a place (Cheers fans)where everybody knows your name and glad that you came !

We chose the Grill for our anniversary dinner and it was a wonderful experience from the moment we were greeted to when we left.  The service, food, and ambiance were great.  We were not rushed as we enjoyed our meal.  We ordered many dishes from recommendations from the server including the souffl√© for dessert.  Everything was wonderful.
Fantastic birthday dinner- our waiter Altemar was hysterical and wonderful!
Staff is attentive and food is prepared with a special flair.
Great spot for special occasions - pricey.  Nice presentation.

The Ritz is a perfect end to our Sunday. Food is always wonderful and it is always lovely to see our friends at The Grill. They are all wonderful people whom we have come to know very well since our first visit.  The Grill is our No. 1 restaurant in town.
Outstanding restaurant. Matt the server was terrific. Only complaint is the noise level.
First of all we had the best waiter - ever!
Cannot fault the excellent food and service.
The server was excellent! I especially loved the artistic look of our desserts, and they were wonderful to eat!
Good service, nice ambiance and a wonderful wine list when combined with quality food is always a winner! Nice job by the Ritz Carlton
Food and service was great. Would highly reccomend.
Birthday celebration, it was great.

We had a beautiful birthday celebration in the Grill Room at the Ritz Carlton.  All the staff made our table feel special.  The meal was delicious from apps to souffle dessert.  Thank you Ritz for a very special birthday dinner!
It was our annual stop, and the reason we keep coming back is that we are never disappointed from our high expectations. Can‚Äôt wait for next year.
One of the finest dining experience in Every way!
Amazing as always. David is the best waiter. We always ask for him
amazing service and menu!!!
Excellent food and service.

I told the waiter three times that I didn't want the salmon MUSHY - it had to be prepared well-done,and it was served MUSHY!!!  I tried to explain but we got nowhere.  We were seated next to the kitchen, and it was very annoying.  We had an older couple with us, and they were equally distracted.  It was difficult to talk with all of the traffic.  We look forward to visiting this property when we are in Naples, and this visit was extremely disappointing.

The meal was a huge disappointment.  Nothing was outstanding.  My Delmonico steak was tough - even though cooked to proper temperature.  Wedge salad was bitter and under dressed.  Rolls we just ok.  Foie Gras was marginal at best, not cooked properly and taste was off.  Sauturne wine offered with it was good.  For a $300 meal for two the very nice atmosphere did not make up for a marginal meal.  Would not recommend for the food.
Wonderful service and food.
All servers are outstanding and Lamar is an excellent wine sommelier
The food,  drinks, service and ambiance were all terrific!   It will be our new ‚Äúgo to‚Äù spot in Naples.
It was lovely to see all our friends at The Grill. Wonderful food as usual. Always our ‚Äúgo to‚Äù spot when in town.

While everything was good, it was not great, primarily due to the side dishes.  Lobster mac and cheese nowhere near as good as Capital Grill and much smaller.  All sides are small (we also had creamed spinach and au grautins) and just not that good for the prices.  All steaks were very good and cooked to perfection.  Breads are good but should be served warmer.
Excellent!
food and service was great however the kitchen was extremely slow over 3 hour dinner too much time between salad and entree.

Aldemar, our server was outstanding!!!Ritz very accommodating to my food allergies (gluten, lactose, preservatives)...which is saying a lot!Fabulous gluten free French fries, chocolate souffl√© , foi gras.  Delmonico was disappointing but when I mentioned, taken off the bill!  Loved the Ceasar salad.  French fries done in separate oil to perfection!!!

We arrived 20 minutes before our reservation and they seated us promptly. Unfortunately the table was in a busy traffic pattern for waiters and customers. My main course arrived cold, and it took them a long time for them to bring another replacement, and I was still eating after my husband was finished with his meal.  My food was delicious hot. Overall, we felt the waiters were not as attentive as previous visits. We saw other ladies receive a red rose  and small sampling of sweets, and we were over looked. Finally, when we were ready to leave, they finally brought it Felt like an afterthought......
We were celebrating Valentine‚Äôs Day. This is our 3rd time there. It never disappoints.
Excellent menu and very good wine list. Ambience is excellent and quiet enough for good conversation. As part of the Ritz-Carlton, the service was predictably superb.
Overall good. Service was slow. Filet was warm and slightly over cooked. Ambiance excellent.
Great service and an excellent menu and dinning experience. Highly recommended.
This was our second year in a row at The Grill.  The space is pretty good for a hotel but the food is great and the service is exceptional.  Def. dine here if you are staying at the Ritz Carlton.

Very elegant with delicious menu options,  The service was excellent, just as you would expect it to be at a Ritz Carlton.  I had the shrimp cocktail which was delicious, the shrimp were large and very tender.  My husband had the burrata which he said was very good.  We both had  the bronzino which was deliciously prepared.  We split a chocolate souffle, which came with hot chocolate and whipped creme to top the delicious chocolate with.  It was to die for.  Highly recommended if  you are a chocolate fan.  They had other souffle flavors  and you also could order them in a sampler with all three flavors.   A very delicious dinner in a very nice setting that we both enjoyed.  Highly recommend the Ritz Grill for a special dinner.

We had an excellent and patient waiter named David. The service was very good. There  was follow up to make sure everything okay, even for more bread. It was a wonderful meal and made us feel special. Highly recommend this place for special event dining. Although not required a sport jacket was most common.
Beautiful service , great food. nose bleed prices. Great venue for an anniversary
great steak house , elegant good wine list one of the best
Service was superb, food couldn‚Äôt have been better, value was exactly what you should get
Great location! Exceptional food and service. This place is must visit if in Charleston.
Best in Charleston and maybe in the USA. Food-Service Perfection

We decided to try Halls for dinner since everyone said it was so good and man it was AMAZING!! I would definitely come back to this restaurant and recommend it to everyone. The filet was awesome and the best side was the creamed corn! I got the Filet over mushroom risotto. Everyone that was with us enjoyed their meal and did nothing but raved about it all weekend.
A very enjoyable experience from start to finish. Tyler and Shawna were both awesome.
Absolutely amazing food and staff! Can‚Äôt wait to take my wife back! Get the bone in filet if available.
Just incredible-we loved our evening there!

Our meal was superb and the service was outstanding. Loved the special birthday dessert which was generous, delicious, and came with champagne for all! A perfect family celebration of a special birthday.

Unbelievably the best restaurant we‚Äôve ever been too! From the greeting at the door to the wonderful service from our waitress Megan we were blown away!!! The steaks are amazing and cooked to perfection! Bread pudding is a must for dessert! Can‚Äôt wait to go back when we are back in SC!

The meal was exceptional! Even received a hand written thank you card in the mail afterwards! Didn't like that you needed to Valet park and the it very noisy but the food was out of this world. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Our server was delightful and very helpful. We were 2 women, and didn‚Äôt want to overeat, so w truly appreciated her guidance with the menu selection.  We started with a Pomegranate martini, and it was delicious. The veal chop was perfect, as were our sides.  It was our first time in Charleston, and I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll be back, and definitely come  back to Hall‚Äôs.

This was our second visit to Hall's Chophouse, but our first for their brunch.  We both enjoyed a cup of she crab soup, I had the crab cakes benedict and my husband had a bone in rib eye with mashed potatoes.  Both dishes were outstanding!  I wish I could eat there every day.  Loved talking with the owner and the staff.  They made us feel welcome and they were glad we decided to join them.  Oh, and the gospel singers were out of this world.  We had a great time.  We'll be back.

This was our first time and the waiter was very helpful.  He asked us what we like and then made suggestions based on the information we gave.  It was my birthday and I do like the fact I didn't have to pull my drivers license out to prove it.  I look forward to the next time.

Full disclosure: I never made it to dinner.Restaurant staff informed me that they would call me and let me know if they would be open following a recent hurricane scare.  Never got a call and missed what I had hoped was going to be great birthday for my wife.  Things get crazy on the coast during a hurricane event and things like forgetting about a reservation you promised to call are going to happen at even the best establishments.  I really want to like this restaurant, as they have plans to open a location near me, so I will wait another 3 months for a Saturday night to open up and give it a second chance.  This review will be updated at that time.  In the meantime, I would recommend other diners be vigilant and double check reservations and conversations with restaurant staff.
Absolutely an amazing experience!! The food was out of this world and staff was exceptional. This is an absolute Charleston MUST!!!!
Birthday dinner was phenomenal
Excellent food and service.  We love this place.  Best food and service around.
Awesome every time‚Äî a must stop while in the area Great bar dining as well
HANDS DOWN THIS WAS OUR BEST RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE EVER!!

We are Charleston locals and finally made it to Halls to celebrate my husband and I‚Äôs Birthdays. The service was impeccable and our dinner was perfect. We had very high expectations going in and they were exceeded! We will definitely be back to Halls!
Went above and beyond to make it a very personal experience for a recent engagement

Visited after relocating from Texas to Charlotte.  This was the best meal, service & steak that I've ever eaten - EVER.  The owners are people friendly, and love to mingle amongst their guest.  GREAT JELLY BEANS!!!!  This is a restaurant you will not want to miss!!!
When in Charleston dining at Halls Chop House and other Hall Family owned restaurants is a MUST!

Billy Hall is a legend . Went down for my Bachelor party with a group of 12. Outstanding steak and great service. The owner ( Billy) shakes everyone‚Äôs hand as they walk in and visits every table. The personalized dining experience is a lost art.
The place was phenomenal.  The food was spot on.  Would recommend for dinner.

We consider Hall's Chophouse Charleston to be the finest restaurant in Charleston.  Plain and simple.  We walk in the front door to be greeted by Billy Hall who immediately makes us feel like family!  We are always greeted by genuine smiles by the entire staff.  The waiters / waitresses are routinely right there when we need them and inconspicuous when we don't need them.  The food is cooked to perfection (once delivered to our table, the waiter always makes us cut our steak to check the cook of the meat).  The waiter's knowledge of the menu is extraordinary.If I had a complaint, it would be that our dinner is always so delicious and filling that we never have room to try your desserts.  We're gonna have to work on that!Thank you Hall Family and Hall's Chophouse for always making us feel like part of your extended family.

We had a fantastic meal, visiting for a special occasion. For starter, I had the best onion soup I have ever had. It had the addition of onion rings piled on top and I have asked my wife to add it to her own recipe!I then had a delicious steak whilst my wife had the succulent lamb. I finished with a yum bread pudding with a whiskey sauce. Not a cheap meal but absolutely delicious and I would highly recommend a visit.
Great time with visiting family. Folks were great with our 3 grandsons!!
Our favorite Charleston spot by far!   The staff and the family of Hall‚Äôs are incredible.   Food is always amazing.

Have heard of Halls for ages, but never had indulged on one of my frequent trips to Charleston. The reputation is for excellent food and outstanding service. My son, on an earlier visit with friends, proclaimed to the world that he had enjoyed the best steak he‚Äôd ever eaten. My two friends and I concurred that the service was superb and the steaks among the best ever. However, there was one shortcoming: the onion rings!!! I consider myself a connoisseur. The onion rings served that evening were very large - fine - but coated in a heavy, doughy batter. The batter must be light, flaky. Overall perfection is so close. Let the onion rings lead Halls to its culinary apotheosis!!!
Best Restaurant in the US!!!
Food and service were absolutely amazing and the handwritten thank you note that followed was definitely a special touch.  Probably the best restaurant I've found in SC.
Service was amazing! Worth every penny! Dina was our server and went above and beyond!

BEST EVER!  We went for the gospel brunch and decided to go back for dinner the next day.  We never repeat restaurants when on vacay but this was a must!  The owner was extremely hospitable and made us feel like VIP guests and looking around the restaurant, everyone was treated that way.  Best food and service in Charleston and probably the US.  I will visit every trip and tell all my friends!

If you know you will be in  Charleston on a Sunday morning, please make reservations for the Gospel Brunch at Halls.  The food was fantastic, the service was flawless and the music was great!  Billy Hall was there the moment we walked in the door with a lovely greeting, and he even checked in a few times to see if were were enjoying our meal.  I have never experienced customer service like this.  True southern charm.  We will be back the next time we are in Charleston.
Waiter was very attentive. We had reservations and got seated promptly. Or steak was cooked a perfect medium rare just like we requested.

Literally the best dinner of my life. The customer service and quality of food were amazing! Mr. Hall was there and was so kind and took care of two of the guys who‚Äôs birthdays we were celebrating. We got a thank you card in the mail after. I would go back in a heart beat and plan on it!
Excellent service as always.
Love coming to HB, they make great drinks and have an amazing atmosphere.

Went on Friday & had a great time. The ambiance was on point. The old fashioned and the wine was delicious. We did a half meet & cheese tray and found it was very good. Minimal with the cheese, but delicious. Plan to spend what you would on a "fancier" date night. We will definitely go back.

The food and drinks were excellent, but our service was pretty lousy. We were seated in a booth and our server rarely checked up on us (we only got our water refilled once, I ended up taking my glass with me when I went to the bathroom). My boyfriend had trouble getting in because the host didn‚Äôt hear him knock, which was really awkward. Also, the pen they gave me to sign the check completely exploded over my hands. I think it‚Äôll be ok for drinks - they really were fantastic - but I wouldn‚Äôt come back here for dinner.
Such a unique and enjoyable environment - staff is always courteous and engaging. Unparalleled cocktail preparation and presentation. Perfect late nite spot

This is our fav date spot in DC. It‚Äôs not pretentious but lovely, dark, and romantic. It‚Äôs well run, attentive, but we‚Äôve never once had the awful experience of being deep into a conversation only to be awkwardly interrupted by a server who could care less. I also love that it‚Äôs not loud. The drinks are wonderful and they can make anything you like.
Great place. Friendly service. A little pricey but they certainly know what they‚Äôre doing. Highly recommend just giving the bartenders some guide rails and seeing what they come up with.

I had an amazing time at Harold Black on a Tuesday night.Speakeasy rule -- sit at the bar if you can. You see the art of creating your drink. You hear interesting tidbits and stories. You bond with your bartender and your imagination won't run wild with ideas that you're not important or that this speakeasy is too pretentious. It's not.While the drink menu was a little more limited what I had was great. A truly spicy cocktail with smoky mezcal? Sign me up. Best part? The bartender can customize to your tastes and needs. My friend thought her old fashioned was too sweet. 'No problem, allow me to make you something like a vieux carre and here's exactly why I am using what I am using.' And then thoughtful bar bites which weren't an afterthought for the drink but actually tasty? Gimme that Chicken Tinga Sandwich and an order of the lamb chops for my homegirl please! The R&B music (yaaasssss! to that) had me swaying, the drinks had me relaxed and the convo had me joyful--  this was a laid back speakeasy experience (And trust me, I've tried many in the area).Four stars because it was great time but it truly was a LITTLE too dim and there could be more drinks but I loved this place. Will be back!
Great cocktails. Pricy but great atmosphere. Not too loud. Great service

It was our 22nd anniversary and I thought we‚Äôd do something a little different. Found this gem on a top places to go list and immediately placed a reservation. The ambiance was amazing, food was excellent the bartenders kept us entertained. Seating, well....for an anniversary date, I‚Äôd rather not have to sit at the bar but we made due. I wouldn‚Äôt suggested it for a special ‚Äúspecial‚Äù occasion. Great for a nice date night or outing with friends.
this is one of the best bars in DC. a hidden gem in the heart of the city with the best bar tenders, service and ambience
Outstanding experience. Beautiful atmosphere and every drink was delicious. These guys are experts.
Bartenders not friendly.

This place was the perfect date night spot. The ambiance was perfect. The music was on point. The food and drinks were amazing and the bartender (Denasha) provided excellent service and great conversation! We will be back for sure!

LOVED our time at Harold Black. It has such a cozy, cool and chill vibe. The drinks are delicious. Loved the dark ambiance lit by candlelight. Good for conversation. Service was great - a balance of attentive vs. letting you be, to enjoy your time. Cocktails were delicious. Awesome music too. I did not want to leave!! Take note of their house rules too - most importantly tables are for two hours since the joint is small.
We enjoyed everything about it!  Great, attentive staff.  Delish small plates.  Creative cocktails.  Fantastic, intimate 'date night' spot.
This place never fails for good drink and intimate settings.  They have light fare menu--which is great to have while drinking.
Good date. I have spoken

Ambiance was nice but the host asked us to leave after we had got done signing our bill. We were also seated where ‚Äúguests are placed when they don‚Äôt have a reservation‚Äù - in the back corner. But we did have a reservation for my 30th birthday. Disappointed in the treatment by the host but it is what it is
Food & drinks were good. Waiter very friendly. However, a food order & a drink order never made it to the kitchen or bar. But waiter very apologetic & gave us a complimentary very good cheese board.

I thought the ambiance was fantastic and the bar tenders were really friendly. My only criticism would be that the bar tenders did not dress according to the theme of the establishment. It would have added so much more had the bar tenders worn something of the period. Suits, hats ect... to keep the vibe persistent.

Fabulous in every way, except no one told us there was a two hour time limit due to another reservation after ours, and they asked if I wanted a third drink with 10 minutes left. I would have liked more time so as to enjoy the drink instead of gulping down a $15 cocktail when we were told our time was up.
This place is a joke. Save your money.  Service is poor. Staff is rude. I would never go back to this establishment.
Great drinks in a cool atmosphere.
Very cool place! Will definitely be back!
Just a very chill vibe. Relaxed. Great cocktails.

This is a great speakeasy for a date-night. The menu isn't extensive, but the execution is solid and they don't skimp on you. We got the cheese plate, meatballs, and brussel sprouts and were quite satisfied. The cocktails we tried were also really nice.  One thing to keep in mind is that the music is kept fairly loud even when the restaurant is not very full, which may not be the vibe you're looking for.
Cool speakeasy venue. Stairway dark. Cool hidden bathrooms    Fun atmosphere. Limit food choices.  Pricey. Won‚Äôt take cash
As usual HB delivered great atmosphere and wonderful drinks!
Excellent ambiance, service and people! Perfect for a date

Fun speakeasy in Eastern Market.  The third time we've been there and we bring different friends each time.  The drinks are great, and to really take advantage of their mixology skills you need to give them a few hints and let them create something for you.  We didn't get any food this time.   It is expensive but the experience is worth it.
One of the best speakeasy bars in the city! Loved the drinks and the ambiance.
Terrible service. Sat there for two hours and was only served two drinks
Fantastic ambiance! Cocktails were fine but honestly nothing special special about them. Service was ‚Äúmeh‚Äù. Worth it for the ambiance though!
As always, absolutely amazing experience. Great service and talented bartenders.

Unfortunately one of the bigger disappointments I‚Äôve had in DC. Wonderful atmosphere and decor, but the worst bar tending experience I‚Äôve had. The bartender asked order, made several drinks in front of us, and then after 15min, asked our order again. 15min later, she asked us again. Then after another 10 she brought us one drink (there were two is us) that wasn‚Äôt remotely what we ordered. So 45min after we first ordered we got our drinks. There were only about 12-15 of us in the entire bar so it was rather surprising. Throughout the night the bartender also repeatedly spilled iced on the bar and therefore us. Heard so much about this bar, but unfortunately this wasn‚Äôt its night.
Great speak easy with an old world vibe. Walk in a secret entrance and knock on an unmarked door to enter a candle lit, quiet, rustic bar.
Service was not great, as usual, there and in Aqua al Due, its owner.  Hoping it will improve soon.

Harold Black is a great ‚Äúspeakeasy.‚Äù  Exceptionally good cocktails, fine bar snacks, and super service.  To illustrate: the bar snack we ordered was a bit too highly seasoned for my companion.  So the server arranged for the kitchen to produce another version of the dish without the spice!  Amazing!  I shall return to Harold Black!
Very cool speakeasy, enjoyed myself thoroughly and it was a huge plus for my date (who is a bartender) who said that she loved it. Earned me bonus points for finding such a cool bar.

Awesome cocktails, delicious lemon-artichoke hummus (I‚Äôll be back for the chocolate cake) and flawless service. The bartendress was very engaging and made us feel most welcome. We had such a great time that we had to reminded to leave after 3 hours to let the next reservation come in ;)
Husbands Birthday!

I'll begin this review by saying that I had been looking forward to, and tried to find an occasion to visit Heirloom Cafe for a very long time. I've lived in San Francisco now for a year and have had dozens of dining recommendations, but I found this one on my own and was excited to visit a local gem in my neighborhood of the Mission. When one of my hometown friends visited, I wanted to bring her, and my local friend in SF for a ladies' dinner on a Saturday night. The food - delicious, presentable, a great portion. We had the fettucine and salmon and both were divine. The wine selection - abundant, knowledgeable, perfectly dry white and ros√© to our taste preferences. The ambiance - candlelit, dim, great for close colleagues, friends, or a date. What completely turned us off however, was one of the servers.1. She seemed to be under the influence. Her words were slurred, and she approached our table in jerky movements.2. Our third guest arrived a bit after us, and about a minute after sitting down, the server came to our table and said "What's the gameplan" without asking to see if she had a chance to review the menu and decide  3. She accidentally knocked over the entire water decanter onto my friend's seating area, lap, and jacket. she didn't apologize but instead said "it can be refreshing". she continued to wipe it while not noticing that she was carrying 2 more decanters in her arm that continued to pour out - luckily a few other servers came to dry up the area 4.
