We left a nominal tip instead, and she came to the table while we were sitting there, stared closely at the receipt, and marched away to show her manager. Heirloom cafe: your other servers, from what we could tell, seemed to provide good service. We also spoke a few times to who we believe might be an owner and he was great. You should re-consider this server that has left an incredibly bad taste in our mouths and we will not be returning, nor recommending it.

We introduced our friends and neighbors to Heirloom the other night. They were very impressed with the menu and presentation and overall excellent repast! I am certain they will be back to experience the restaurant again.  We, of course, visit as frequently as we are able. Thank you - Heirloom crew - for always providing a terrific dinner for us and our family.
Great neighborhood restaurant. We had the halibut ceviche and the pod salad.  Entrees were the Salmon and steak babette. Added the oatmeal chocolate cookie and bitter sweet chocolate budino.
Low key and excellent, fresh food. Service was also excellent! Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

I ordered the halibut ceviche and the bean salad while my partner ordered the chicken with corn salsa looking thing...the bean salad was exceptional. His chicken was good but too salty. Overall, a solid B+.  My ceviche had some big pieces of fish and when I pointed it out, the waitress said that is the way the chef likes it...Duh...I was not born yesterday and I do know how to make better ceviche.   And the waitress was either drunk or high on something the way she moved...not cool for her or the restaurant.
Service was excellent - friendly and knowledgeable- made good recommendations.

We had a wonderful dinner and service was spot on. Bacon and onion tart was flakey crust and perfectly seasoned topping. Salad pulled from the prix fixe menu was refreshing and had some unexpected ingredients, probably listed on the menu but forgotten in the interim. Roasted king salmon with veggies was delicious but tr√©s petite. And dessert of berries with polenta cake was tip top. Loved the French-sourced sauvignon blanc. Restaurant was loud but it's hard these days to find one conducive to conversation where cuisine holds no surprises, however well prepared it may be.
We love eating at heirloom the people the food it‚Äôs all outstanding!!!
We were disappointed.  Portions were very small.  Overpriced.  Noise terrible.

Heirloom brings a sophistication to comfort food that makes it a great weeknight choice. A summer evening with corn chowder and the (off-menu) burger is a delight.  Service is friendly and attentive.  Tables are a bit tight, and noise can be a bit of a distraction, particularly when seated next to a couple of folks convinced they are about to conquer the world.   While not regulars, we have returned to Heirloom regularly over the years and never been disappointed.
Best servers. I want to be friends with them. Food is always on point.
Always very special hospitality. Fantastic wine list!
The  succotash was tasty but the chicken was very dry and not good

We loved the Heirloom Cafe! The food was excellent. Our waiter was so nice to us. We thought he was exceptionally so. We would definitely return but it would be a special occasion destination for us considering the cost.
Amazing, always great. A little pricey, but nothing out of the ordinary for SF. Enjoy!
Lovely food snd lovely service
Excellent food! Great service! It was noisy and hard to have a quiet conversation.

A waiter that wasn‚Äôt present and pretty incompetent and since the restaurant was loud could hardly hear what he was saying. He spoke so softly. And didn‚Äôt seem to have a knowledge of the menu. Also not a lot of personality or attention to our table.
Went to dinner after a show; the food was SO delicious and what wonderful service. Have come to Heirloom Cafe several times and have never been disappointed.
As always, great dinner.
Very good food; generous portions.  Matt, the owner is a pure delight and the wait staff was excellent.  Wish it wasn‚Äôt so noisy for us seniors .
Mussels were so good that I ordered it twice!
I love Heirloom Cafe and don‚Äôt dine here often enough.  The neighborhood feel, friendliness and competence of the staff, and the sumptuous authentic food keep Heirloom at the top of my list!

The waitstaff was underwhelmed to see me and I them. The burger and salads were quite tasty but the fettuccine was undercooked. Plates were small and not elevated enough to be worth the price. I can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant.

I really enjoyed my overall experience at Heirloom Cafe and would be somewhere that I return. All the dishes were quite tasty and incorporated flavors that you can't just simply make at home. Nothing was too salty or bland. The wine suggested was superb and paired well with the food. The waitress was warm, funny, sweet. The ambiance was cozy and romantic (dim lit with candles, wooden tables).
Food and service was simply fantastic. It has an old feel with modern food. Felt like a great modern community feel.

We had a number of guests in our group of 8 with specific dietary needs. The staff went above and beyond. Highly recommend. They even have a large table that easily fits parties of 12 which a real find in the city.
Heirloom Cafe is the best. Food, wine and service are top of the top. Love it.

Dining at Heirloom is one of the great pleasures of living in the Mission -- or of visiting it.  Once the most tagged corner in the neighborhood, this sweet little spot now serves fresh, beautiful food with a simple, elegant aesthetic.  The staff is lovely and the meals are beautifully prepared.  The seasonal menu is complemented by a thoughtfully composed wine list -- and to say the atmosphere is charming doesn't begin do it justice.  Behind the gauzy curtains, the hubbub of the City fades away in a grand, open room that quickly fills with a pleasant crowd of diners who've dressed a bit for the occasion, and whose convivial conversations punctuate what always turns into a memorable night.  Even if we didn't live on the same block, we'd love it just as much as we already do!

Great place before a show(Beautiful- Carol King). fun art deco vibe and bar drinks. meal was superb. parked a couple blocks away and had to negotiate sketchy street scene but worth it once arriving.  amazing kale salad!  will return.
Great place that's reasonably priced for the quality of food. Not a lot of selection, but everything was delicious. The wine paring is great with pre-fix menu.

Delightful neighborhood spot for celebrating our anniversary. The food and wine were exceptional. The house made fettuccini is a must order (I don't even like mushrooms and this was a standout dish). They also let you share a single order of the prix fixe which is a fantastic deal as it includes generous individual pours and the perfect amount of food to share when you add in an entree. We were both full, but not uncomfortably so. There's no way we could have eaten more! Especially pleased with how perfectly the wine complemented the food (really smart pairings) and how we got to try wines we wouldn't have otherwise known anything about. Will definitely recommend Heirloom to friends and family and look forward to the next occasion that brings us back here.
The food and service were absolutely solid. I eat here fairly often and have had almost no misses. This time I brought a friend with me who had never eaten at Heirloom - he was impressed!
Lovely, per usual. Beautiful setting and the food is always simple but perfect.
Great service Delicious food
This was our first time dining here and really enjoyed a midweek birthday dinner. Service was so warm and welcoming and every dish was delish! Looking forward to a return visit soon.
Nice restaurant. Good service from quality people. Excellent wine list.  Could use a broader menu selection.

Neighborhood gem, but timing was a bit off. We were served our dishes randomly so no one ate together. They were aware, and apologetic. I‚Äôm sure it was just one of those things that happen. Great place otherwise. Wine menu is fabulous. Highly recommend.

Service was very good, we were seated promptly at our reservation time. Our server was warm and friendly. Background noise was quite loud which made it difficult to hear and the lighting was very dim. The food was beautifully presented but the tuna tartare was bland. The duck salad was slightly dry but had a nice flavor. The burger was definitely the tastiest. The wine was awesome and reasonably priced. Overall the experience was pleasant but with so many other places to choose from, I don't think we'll return anytime soon.
Great service. Amazing food. They never disappoint.
Service was outstanding, pizza was amazing - highly recommend! Def. need a reservation, walk-ins  esp on weekends are unlikely.
Their food is absolutely delicious. Love coming here for cocktails or special occasions.
Every time we go, it is the best food I‚Äôve ever eaten.
Awesome. Period.
Hersh's is  a great date night spot! The pizza is delicious as well as all of the apps. We tried the Il Rubicon pizza and loved it!
A bit on the expensive side, but definitely worth it for a special occasion. I'd definitely go back!
Magical as always - Hersh's always delivers with a fantastic meal
One of THE BEST pasta dishes I‚Äôve had in my life. Server was great and knew the menu well.

Never had anything but a 5 star experience here!  New people we brought were just as impressed.  Never lets us down when bringing new friends.  Best pizza, frehsest homemade pasta, and those meatballs!  Mmm...Josh and team kill it every. single. time!
We love Hersh‚Äôs. Food was excellent as always. Service excellent as always. Really fun date night spot.

Hersh's is the best overall restaurant in Federal Hill, without doubt. Consistently great food, service and atmosphere.  You can always count on a few menu staples, yet they mix it up just enough to keep it interesting. Special shout out to long-time staff member Shannon!
Love this place! Food, wine & service are consistently very, very good.

A wonderful meal once again.  New item on the menu, pork belly with shredded brussel sprouts and almonds was amazing.  Also loved the arugula salad and scallops with cauliflower risotto.  Hershs never disappoints with an amazing chef and a super efficient, friendly staff.
We love this place! It is consistent and delicious. Their happy hour drink specials are a good deal - we go at least once a month
Great! My new favorite spot for cocktails and high-end eats. I recommend the chopped salad!

There were 5 of us so they put us upstairs. The decor is quite minimal. The drinks were good. We all liked the meatballs, the Brussels sprouts, the octopus, La Salsiccia pizza, the Atlantic cod. We didn‚Äôt like the clam pie, too salty and the Tagliolini had a lot of sand in it and lacked flavors. For dessert, we shared the Haze Bomb which was just ok and the donuts which everyone liked.
Always excellent!!

We love this place! We go for special occasions, everyday dining and family get togethers. The food is quality and always on point. They have a great happy hour on fridays and if u like wine or beer this is the time to go. It‚Äôs pricy but so worth it. It is literally our favorite restaurant In the world and we have had pizza in Italy! It is better here. Trust me
Outstanding as always!
Fantastic meal start to finish!!!
Never disappoints! Try the eggnog! Chopped Salad had a great spice to it.
Great food!
Hersh‚Äôs never disappoints!
Good time with family- food was good a bit pricey and small portions- service not as good as other reviewers experienced
Food is always good and creative. Service very good.
Never disappoints ever!
Hersh's is always good. House-made pasta.  Good whiskey, beer, and wine.  During the week they have happy hour until 7, featuring a $5 red or white, cocktail specials, and flights of beer.
It is a small menu but the food was good

We love Hersh‚Äôs. Food is always generously seasoned and eclectic and different than anywhere else in Baltimore. Service Is always good too. The portions aren‚Äôt big enough though. We usually have to order a lot of food to leave satisfied. Still, we come back for it because it‚Äôs always a pleasant experience.
Our new fav place! Food is incredible staff is great vibe is perf!

Good like always.  My wife and I dine there frequently. Several dishes are available in small and large size choices.  Thant's perfect for us as were can share appetizers and each get a small dish.  We usually split a salad and an octopus, then go for any of their pastas.
When you walk in on a Wednesday night and the place is full, you know it‚Äôs good!!
Can‚Äôt get enough of that wood fired pizza! The pumpkin app was delicious and we were excited to have made it for happy hour drinks!
Excellent dinner as always!  Service was great, and food was outstanding.

The menu changes daily. We decided to split the chopped salad which was delicious.  We each ordered a pizza, one with various meats and the other, mushroom. The pizza was tasty, thin crust but a little bit too oily for my taste (mushroom). Had I known, I would have asked that they hold on adding oil.  The server was excellent.  She checked back often and it was clear that they wanted us to be happy.
Our server didn't write our order down and ended up forgetting two items, but we didn't care because we love Hersh's so much! The menu changes with the seasons and everything was delicious!
Service was a little slow but food was incredible!
Great food and good atmosphere!

One of my favorite restaurants in South Baltimore. Great food - small menu means they focus on making a few dishes really really well. The homemade pastas are incredible especially the smoky cheesy carbonara. Pumpkin appetizer was creative and tasty on the first crisp evening of fall. Nice wine list. Great servers - knowledgeable and really friendly. Outdoor seating is a plus! Highly recommend.
Best romantic I ever had with my wife. It was everything I imagined it to be and more.
Wonderful ambience. Impeccable service , fabulous food!
Foods and services at this restaurant are excellent.  Very nice and cozy decoration.  Highly recommended!

The atmosphere is exceptional.  The food portions were perfect.  There were several offerings compliments of the chef.  We consider ourselves foodies and have dined inside and outside the U.S.   The chef‚Äôs selections were delicious.  However, the price for the dining experience, especially the wine pricing was unnecessarily exorbitant.  The wine we ordered was $40 per glass or the wine pairing was $170.  These prices could not be justified.  It was a once in a lifetime experience and not to be repeated.
Sommelier and waiter we're fantastic. Met chef O'Connell when asked. Great experience and food.

We visited the Inn last night for our 5th wedding anniversary. This was our first time at the Inn and we appreciate the opportunity. I am going to be honest with my review and please keep in mind that this is my personal opinion. It might sound nitpicky but I think that you earn the right to nitpick if you shell out this amount of money for food :)I have been to one other restaurant with a similar structure and that is Marcel's by Robert Wiedmaier in DC. We went there for our 1st wedding anniversary so I will compare both restaurants.The quality of the cuisine is similar at both restaurants and there is very little that sets them apart. The wine pairing and selections was outstanding at both restaurants. Marcel's provided multiple "entremets" between courses and the Inn did not do so. When it comes to table service, the only area where the Inn performed better than Marcel's was the enthusiasm and interaction we received from the waiter, Andrew. However, the waiter at Marcel's was still very good. He performed all his table service at a higher level of technical service. The table was cleaned thoroughly and properly in between courses by Marcel's while at the Inn the table was just not cleaned and cleared properly. The waiter at the table next to us dropped used utensils on a customer which is a massive offense for a 3 star restaurant. Additionally, the sommelier at the Inn poured the incorrect for the wine pairing at dessert. While the experience at both restaurants was very good, Marcel's provided a slightly better dining experience. We certainly did not leave hungry from the Inn and are glad to have the opportunity to dine at an acclaimed restaurant, we think that these little things are worth noting when dining at a restaurant of this level.
This restaurant is a true gem.  The quality of everything is amazing.  A good place to splurge on a special occasion.  But you must make reservations as far in advance as possible.

Our evening at the Inn at Little Washington was exceptional! They made my husband's birthday feel so special. The food, service, and ambiance were all delightful and memorable. Every dish was perfectly composed and delicious. Service was perfect, we never wanted for anything but were left alone so we can carry on a conversation. Everything felt intimate, romantic, and serene. The highlight was being able to see the kitchen and meet Chef O'Connell. My only small criticism is with the wine pairings. I didn't love a lot of the selections and especially did not like the Riesling. It was so sweet I didn't even drink it. The server who was pouring the wines noticed and commented on my full glass yet never offered a replacement pairing which I would have appreciated.
Interesting place and very odd staff.  Food is excellent.

From the moment we arrived until we left this was a unique and incredible dining experience. Food and service are impeccable. Thank you for a great experience both dining and lodging. We will be back.
Delicious food although a tad inconsistent. We also had to wait wayyyy too long for the cheese and dessert course. To their credit they comped the cheese course.
Birthday & Anniversary

The best meal of our lives. The food is worth  a trip from any corner of the globe. Wine lovers are better off pulling a gem from their cellar rather than the pairings which, while varied, were somewhat pedestrian.

From the moment we crossed the street and were greeted with an dapper seer-sucker dressed man with an umbrella, to the moment we left, with all staff wishing us farewell, it was an amazing experience. Thank you for making our first anniversary as special as it felt. Keep up the excellent work!

The experience was exquisite replete with visual beauty, heavenly aromas, in captivating textures and blissful flavors. This is the best dining experience in the New World. Thank you for the memories!
Disappointing, considering it is a three star Michelin restaurant.

No words can describe how wonderful our visit was...every little details were tended to from the beginning to the ending of our meal. We will have to come up with more reasons to celebrate at the Inn...soon!!!!
Splendid experience, as I had expected.
Best meal ever!  Elegance around every corner.

We had an extraordinary time at the Inn at Little Washington! The server Jessie was wonderful, and made great beverage recommendations. All of the little details!! Customized menus, goodie box of treats to go. It was unbelievable. Each course was amazing and flavorful. They were extremely accommodating to my gluten free dietary restriction. 10/10 would recommend going here for a special occasion.

What can I say about dining here that hasn't already been said. I'm always afraid that I'm hyping this place so much that those who join me will be let down but the Inn consistently exceeds my expectations and those of my guests. I cannot get enough of Cameron and the Moo Cow cheese cart. He is the maestro of cheesy humor. I'll be back again and again.
Creative, perfectly seasoned food paired with excellent service.
Fantastic experience from start to finish.  Amazing food, wine pairings, and staff.

A wonderful time was had by all. The food was delicious and the staff was wonderful. A celebration of birthdays was made even more special by a wonderful and attentive staff. The young man at the front door who welcomed us and parked my car, the welcoming hostess who showed us to our table, Chris who oversaw our dinning experience, the wine expert who suggested a fine bottle of wine, and everyone else who had a hand in bringing food and drink, they all made the experience special. We were seated in an area with five other couples which made for an intimate dinning experience. It was really nice, it made you feel special with all the attention and care.It was really wonderful.
World class!
Beautiful experience! The food was beyond amazing. Words do not do it justice.
It was our 31st Anniversary dinner.  A once in a lifetime dining experience.

Everything was wonderful.  The food, the wine pairing, the explanations, the cheese cart! This was my partner's 60th birthday and they created a keepsake menu.  I had called ahead and paid for a copy of the cookbook and it was waiting for him.  Lovely evening in every way.
Five stars all around. There‚Äôs a reason this is a three Michelin star restaurant! Absolutely the finest dining ever! Patrick O‚ÄôConnel is a genius!

The Inn at Little Washington is a world class experience in every way. It doesn‚Äôt get any better. We are so fortunate to have it in our backyard. It‚Äôs worth the trip it every time, no matter how far you are traveling to get there!

Its a very nice place but just not a good value. For what it cost it should blow your mind and for me it just didn't. To be fair, its not really my kind of experience. That said, I have been to some highly rated and very pricey restaurants around DC. i.e. Bourboun Steak, Bond 45 and others and was much more satisfied. The service is top notch of course I will give it 5 stars there. But negatives were the seating is close quarters; we were sandwiched a foot away from tables on each side of us and more than once an obnoxious woman next to us jumped into our conversation univited.  Food was good but not mind blowing by any means. Not exactly what I expected for a dinner for 2 at about $750.

Everything from valet service, to meal service, to quality... all excellent! Staff made us feel like family for our Easter gathering. The selection of menus provided excellent choices for each of us. The wine pairings were spot on ‚Äîand each wine was described in detail, as were the menu items. I really love this place and will go back as often as I can!

Fantastic. This is a jewel.  It has been 20 years since our last visit. We decided it‚Äôs worth a visit a couple of times a year. On the way out we were greeted by Luray, the owners Dalmatian. What a treat.

Truly deserves our 6hr drive from NY to enjoy the 5 course meal at The inn at Little Washington. Every service staff from the door man hold the umbrella when we got out of the car to our server and sommelier, and the manager who kindly gave us a kitchen tour are all fabulous. Food was fantastic, truly an amazing experience.
The Inn is always consistent‚Äîamazing food, creative presentation, excellent service. Always lives up to our expectations and never disappoints.
Cannot find a better location for comfort, ambiance, great food, and attentive staff.  Can't wait to return.
Worth the hype. Worth the money. Just do yourself a favor and go!

Overall the food and experience was good. TLDR is, it's not worth the price, and DO NOT get the wine pairing. Wine pairing was $170/person. It didn't add anything to the dishes, and you only got 2.5 glasses. Getting a cocktail instead of the wine would have saved us at least $200, and would have had the same food experience. Not only did the wine not add to the food experience, but some were just bad. Some of the dishes were amazing, but for those prices I was expecting every dish to blow me away. Can get similar food/experience for 1/4th the price at nice D.C. restaurants. Portions were small, which is to be expected. But when the tasting menu works out to about $60/dish (before tax and tip) you expect more than one scallop.

Simply outstanding.  Dining at The Inn at Little Washington is a life experience.  It's not for the shy of pallet nor wallet, but that should be expected for a restaurant with _three_ Michelin Stars. The service is exceptional and extremely accommodating; ask and it shall be provided.Plan for as much as three hours for your dining visit.  Lots of courses and many little extra offerings in between.  Dress your best and take your special person for the night of their life.

Delicious and very good but not one of the best meals I‚Äôve ever had. Not necessarily worth the price we paid, but a great experience.  Worth it as a bucket list thing.  The ambience and the service were impeccable.
Always a reliable spot and we hope to return as soon as the health emergency abates.

Dined here on the last night before the mandated shutdown of Chicago restaurants. Food was superb as usual, perfect branzino, sea bass, and mahimahi. Sorry they have to close for a while, but they are doing their best to cooperate in this crisis. The upside was that in the empty room one didn't have to shout to be heard at table. Takeout, carryout will continue, so Joe's good cooking will still be available.
Joe's never disappoints. Denise took excellent care of us from start to finish.
Loved Karen. She is an amazing server.

From the minute we walked in the door we were attended to quickly.  Got  a drink in the  bar  then moved on to our spacious booth where we had the best waiter.  Got me a great deal on small order of crab  legs and entertained us while giving us the best  service.   The place was packed but we had quick service and great ambiance.  Will definitely be back!
We loved our server, Denise! Everything on the menu from the cocktails to the dessert are delicious!

Always lives up to its reputation of excellence.    We had Seafood salad & steak salad both were deliciouskey lime pie. Peanut butter pie and birthday surprise brownie dessert made for a superb festive event.
Steak was delectable. Cooked and seasoned to perfection. Our waiter was very knowledgeable of the wine list and recommended great selections to my party. I would recommend to anyone.

The service at this restaurant is spectacular. We walked in the door and were immediately greeted by numerous servers welcoming us and telling us to have an enjoyable evening. We did have a fabulous evening. The food is incredible!  But, the best part was how well we were taken care of at this  very special restaurant.

This is such a great place to dine! I was I. Town for work and I made reservations for me and my friends. You can never gone ring with a menu choice. While I usually order the stone crab claws, this time I opted for the seafood pasta and finished dinner with key lime pie. It was great! Will always return to Joes!
Highly recommended if you want great food and service.
OutstandingThe Gold Standard in Chicago
Great experience, wonderful staff, best steak I have ever had (Bone in ribeye). The crust on it was very good and flavorful. The restaurant was loud but you could hear those at your table well.
Our Server was outstanding - she was exceptionally knowledgeable on recommending oysters to start.  An absolutely sensational meal and experience.
Enjoyable experience - good food well cooked - good service.  People at the next table were a bit awkward but the staff handled it very well.  Would certainly go back.
A birthday lunch. The steak was great as usual.
Everything was fantastic and we look forward to coming back soon!!  Our waiter was phenomenal!! Food was delicious!  Drinks were amazing!! Dessert was to die for!! Overall an incredible experience!
Delicioso y excelente servicio
Excellent food and service.
Wonderful experience with extremely good food and the most attentive waiter!
Always the best

We were able to get a last min reservation and once we walked in we were seated right away. Our server was nice and explained the menu to us and we truly enjoyed our meal. It was the best steak I have ever eaten and we have eaten a lot of steak.
food and service were great.  had an 8pm reservation and didnt get seated until almost 830pm which was the only negative
Celebrated a Birthday for My Brother-In-Law.  Great service !
Excelente, muy buenos los crab cakes, pero imperdibles los stone crab!!!!!
For cient entertainment you cannot do better than Joe's because everything on the menu from steak to seafood and everything else, is absolutely delicious.

Took my son for his birthday. The food was excellent (the Dover Sole has always been my favorite) and our server, Michelle, was on her game, both engaging and efficient. We had a great time. Definitely recommend.
My Dover Sole was over cooked & dry. Everything else was great.
One word comes to mind, phenomenal!
Awesome fried chicken and onion strings! Cole slaw mixed at the table. Yum!

One of the single most superior restaurants not only in Chicago, but possible in the country !You MUST ask for Denice as your server and if her team includes Jose Luis, be prepared for service fit for the Gods !However, the remainder of the FOH staff is stellar as well !Kudos to the kitchen for quality preparation and impeccable coordination with the server.Three people: Oysters Rock; warm King crab; three orders of stone; and, split a prime bone-in rib eye steak.  Superb !Key lime pie; hot fudge brownie; and, apple pie ala mode.  YUM !Yes, it's expensive but worth ever morsel and ever smile on our faces that Denice put there !

Food was amazing !! Service was also great. The atmosphere is very nice, very upscale and elegant. We will be back soon! Appreciated it being a quiet restaurant so we could actually have a conversation
We went for my hubby‚Äôs birthday and had a wonderful experience. Our server was one of the best and our food was fantastic. We will absolutely be back!

I had saved up many LEYE points to use last night. At the completion of dinner I was told that they were not valid on Saturdays.   That was an expensive surprise and frankly, as a person that spends what I spend in a year at LEYE restaurants, I think a better agreement could have been reached.
Wonderful food and service on a Saturday evening. We were seated late and though we did not complain, they comped our desserts.

Amazing, truly a fabulous evening at Joe's. The atmosphere is classy from start to finish, the service was exceptional (Chris, our waiter, was wonderful) and the food was stunning.Crab claws were really tasty, the steaks were done to perfection and the desserts.. OMG!Go to Joe's, you'll love it just like we did!!

It was 330 at the Field Museum and my wife thought let‚Äôs do Joes. I easily booked a table for 5 and even though I was off by 1 seat, all 6 of us were seated at 430. Early enough for the Saturday rush, but top notch service and flavors all around. Our service team lead by Mary treated everyone to a wonderful experience. This was a test for the kids but it made a great impression. The oldest son said next we time we all dress up, which was refreshing to hear. Can‚Äôt wait for date night with my wife.

The food is the best thing about Joe's. The noise level, the chaos, the fact that they have no bar seating while waiting for a reserved table, the fact that they have loaded their bar area with "walk in tables" on a first come, first serve basis, really detracts from the overall experience of the restaurant. I would never ever go again on a Saturday night. And to do this, we had to make a 4 pm reservation. Given that it took until 5:15pm to get our food and the fact that we had a 12 year old who was really hungry made things work out in an acceptable fashion. And our waiter saved the day.  Without him, we would have left. The actual dining room area of Joe's is quieter, and somewhat less hectic. but there is a chaotic element to the entire experience.

Siempre vuelvo!!! Llegamos una hora temprano a la reservaci√≥n porque as√≠ salieron los planes y nos acomodaron inmediatamente y con gran amabilidad. Mil gracias. La comida siempre excelente y variada
Must go place for sure! Great location on Rush Stree.
Great food as usual. Very attentive
It is a good place to celebrate birthday and the environment is good and food is delicious!
very good love the experience
The food, service and ambiance were all exceptional.
Outstanding.  Across the board.  Maybe the best NYC restaurant experience in 25 years.
spectacular food, lovely service, quiet atmosphere a perfec tplace for a special occasion
Our Third year wedding anniversary
Absolutely phenomenal. It was a unique experience of creativity with delicious plates, with atypical takes of high-class dishes with a Korean flair. Would definitely recommend and go again

We dined at 4 other 3-star Michelin restaurants. This one is on par with our other top one in San Francisco Quince. If it was our decision we would give it that final third star to elevate it the highest level. Wonderful presentation, beautiful execution of flavor profiles, service  was well-educated and descriptive while providing attention without interrupting the intimacy of the meal.
A delightful experience, beginning to end. Thank you for an amazing evening!
Incredible tasting menu! Tim was really fun! Thanks great experience! Will be back
Great hospitality, couple unique things they did such as a name on the menu and piping happy birthday on one of the desserts.Black truffle cone was out of this world

As always, Jungsik lives up to its two Michelin stars and demonstrates that it deserves a third star unlike Eleven Madison Park‚Äôs oversalted food. The balance of flavors and textures of each dish were spot on, including the cook on the proteins. While the depth of flavor this time was a little bit lower than usual, that‚Äôs more if you‚Äôre nitpicking and know how good the dishes are usually. Tim, our main table handler, lived up to the standard I have with regards to service, a high bar that was already set by Oscar. The staff is always very personable and welcoming and I look forward to coming back when they make more changes to the seasonal menu and potentially bring dishes over to the NYC branch from Seoul!

The food was really good and creative, the service was great and atmosphere very calm and pleasant. I felt it was a little overpriced, but in general it was a great experience and would recommend it for sure.
Everything was superb! One of the best dining experiences I have had in years.

Excellent. The food, the service, the atmosphere, all excellent. Every bite makes one pause to savor the amazing combination of flavors. Each course brought a new favorite after thinking the last couldn‚Äôt be topped. It was a 2 hour drive, a train ride and a cab to get there from home and we would do it again without a second thought. Truly a memorable dining experience.
Amazing !!
Easily one of my favorite meals of all time.Excellent food. Excellent service. Great wine menu as well.
Amazing Michelin two star restaurant that‚Äôs quiet and perfect for dining with your loved one or a group. The Korean food was unique and a memorable Experience

It is very special when you can walk in to a restaurant and feel like you‚Äôre dining surrounded by family..that is the feeling we get every time we walk in to Jungsik. Our meal this evening was wonderful, as usual. Every course was delicious. Finally getting to try the truffle cone was the highlight of the night. Now I can‚Äôt wait to have it again. Many thanks to George, Catherine, and Tim for another memorable evening.
Very amazing
Great dining experience. We opted for the Chefs tasting menu and it was outstanding !

Staff were really nice there. People are talking about the dishes in a great passion. The food tastes more like a French cuisine than a Korean one, but they do use some Korean spice and sauce to tune up the tastes. The desserts were also good. Most of them were not sweet so that I can finish them even if I was already really full. The Pinot Noir grape juice was awesome!
The food was amazing! Attentive waitstaff, nice ambience, but the food was the star of the show.
Loved our evening at Jungsik. The food and the place were incredible, with the service very pro.
Awesome experience!
Amazing! Enjoyed every moment
Food is really good
Great experience in NYC!
A bit too much introduction to food

Amazing service - everyone was attentive but not overly so. The food was thoughtfully put together, with some surprising flavor and texture combinations here and there. We were celebrating a special occasion, but I‚Äôm planning on bringing my parents next time they are in town because they need to experience something like this.
Very good tasting menu, just overpriced by about double what it should be.
We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. The ¬´¬†banana¬†¬ª dessert was my favourite part!
The Overall food quality is great. Yet some dish are bit salty. Love their dessert!
Outstanding experience!  Food and staff are amazing!  Oscar is wonderful!  We loved the evening!
We were celebrating my boyfriends birthday and the entire staff treated him very special unlike anything I‚Äôve ever experienced.  The waiter was very charming and attentive.  Totally recommend!
Fantastic experience - beautifully orchestrated courses delivered by talented staff. A definite destination while in NYC.
Beautiful food with creative flavors ‚Äúinspired‚Äù by Korean food. Best way to describe it is French-Korean.

I selected Jungsik for my birthday dinner in NYC with my mom and wife. I couldn‚Äôt of been more pleased with the selection. The service was best in class if not better than some of the finer restaurants that I‚Äôve eaten out in Europe. The ingredients were extremely fresh, very different than your standard fine dining food, and I couldn‚Äôt of been more pleased with the selection. The service was best in class if not better than some of the fine restaurants that I‚Äôve eaten at in Europe. The ingredients were extremely fresh, and very different than your standard fine dining food without being ‚Äústrange.‚Äù  The staff was so friendly and extremely attentive. We had the signature menu and I am so glad that we did. I would recommend this restaurant anyone anyone who is looking for a unique fine dining experience that is extremely memorable and fun!
Great food. Highly recommend

Went here for an anniversary dinner a few weeks ago and it was a terrific experience.  We used to live in Manhattan and couldn't help comparing the experience to the likes of Le Bernardin, Babbo, etc.  It was definitely up there in all aspects- attention to detail, knowledgeable wait staff, perfect execution.  The actual dining room itself was okay but we were there for the food and I was definitely glad to be surrounded by 30+ age group diners.
A very special restaurant!
kinship is a calming, soothing, elegant oasis where the food is taken seriously but the people are down to earth. it is a lovely dining experience.

Our evening at Kinship ranks up there, with memorable dinners at the two or three top restaurants in the Washington, DC area.  Our visiting out-of-town friend, who regularly travels around the world (literally),was awed, as my spouse and I were, with the consistently superb quality of every dish, the perfection of preparation, and the elegance of presentation. All of this was enhanced by correctly recommended wines, highly professional service, and a "classy" ambiance. We can't wait to return!
Food was great and service was exceptional

The experience here was fantastic. Our server was knowledgeable, astute, and friendly. Food was all fantastic, and my boyfriend's drink was the "best old fashioned he's ever had." We had a small food allergy and they were more than accommodating about it. We will definitely come back for more special occasions!
The food is simply exquisite.  We enjoyed the flavors of each dish very much.
Excellent service and very accommodating. We had a baby with us and they were more than willing to help in any way possible.

I was pleased with my experience at Kinship, but I don't believe that I will be going back. I enjoyed about half of the dishes that we ordered, including the tuna appetizer, the grilled shoat, and the Vietnamese banana fritters. However, I was underwhelmed by some of the other dishes. I enjoyed going to Kinship as a one-time experience to check off the list, and I'd recommend it for adventurous eaters willing to take a chance and potentially be disappointed. Service was really amazing, and the ambiance is exquisite.
Sam AND his barback/assistant WERE AWESOME!!! Had a great Sunday, we mentioned we would be back EVERY SUNDAY.

Lovely, cozy setting with very attentive staff! Sunday dinner so we were all going for a lighter dinner, so order several apps to accompany a shared entree. Sea bass to share was lovely, came with roasted cauliflower, mini-porter house rolls. We enjoyed also the crispy taro root appetizer, too. We also enjoyed the Vietnamese banana fritters for dessert.
One of the best meals I've ever had! The Kinship chicken is a must.

Remains one of the very top restaurants in DC.  Beautiful setting, great service, excellent wine and amazing food. And Chef Eric having red chile chimichurri on his menu?!  Definitely try the piri piri beef.
Great birthday experience with my boy friend. I will definitely be back again!
Birthday for wife
Our waiter was incredible and the food was even better. Is it a bit pricey? Sure, but it's also worth every penny. The Chicken is as good as everyone says it is.
A perfect dining experience.Food, service, ambiance...  5 stars

What I can say about Kinship is....... it all makes sense. From the walk through the door you are welcomed by people who care and want to make your experience an exceptional one. It was our anniversary so when sat at the table there was a card to congratulate us and I knew we were in for a great meal. The service is almost robotic in a way where it doesn‚Äôt seem fake but a gui√±e care for the customer. Food pace is perfectly executed while the service team replaces and replenishes your water, silverware, and bread. Food is being prepared in the back awaiting for the arrival.The food is just as amazing as the service. The sunchoke with Avocado and Aj√≠ Dulce peppers is a must try. So is the quail. Entres of Duck confit and Braised Shoat shoulder really sent it over the top. Eating here you really understand and see what a great restaurant is about. The team here has all bought into the concept and work like clock work. It‚Äôs a pleasure to come here and I will continue to sing the praise of your team and your restaurant. Very well done Kinship! Thank you!
Great server.
Great good, great atmosphere, and great (very friendly) service. We‚Äôll be back.

Impeccable service with genial and well-trained staff. Food was incredible. Small plates with distinct flavor profiles that reflect the skill and talent of the chefs. Each waiter is also sommelier trained and had excellent wine recommendations with each course. Very accommodating with allergies (gluten free bread is unreal!) and thoughtful touches for birthdays. We are definitely coming back!!
Amazing!!!
the taste of food is a little bit heavy for us

Celebrated Valentine‚Äôs Day dinner at Kinship.  The customer service was wonderful. The cocktails were great.   As for the food, am not sure if I am happy or disappointed.  I mean, it was great overall. However, comparing it to other fine dining restaurants and/or one starred Michelin starred restaurants, I don‚Äôt think they are at par with them.  For example, if I haven tried Marcel‚Äôs boudin blanc, I would say it‚Äôs great. But, I have to say Marcel‚Äôs is better.  And, I would stay away from their Moulard Duck Foi Gras Confit.  I love foi gras and never had a bad one. I have my favorites and not, but I would say theirs is the worst for me.  Overall, it‚Äôs a great restaurant. I just can‚Äôt say it‚Äôs the best one out there.
Food and service was excellent! Really enjoyed our dining experience.
I would absolutely and have already recommended Kinship to multiple friends and colleagues.

Some of the best food I have had in DC, the menu was exceptional, the lobster french toast was out of this world, and the service and ambiance were something I would expect from a much more expensive restaurant. I would go back in a heartbeat, the staff decor and food were an experience unto themselves. Will recommend to anyone looking for an elevated food experience in DC

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at kinship. The portion size was just right.  The quality of the scallops and the overall venison dish were superb. The Jerusalem artichokes and pommes anna were very tasty starters.  The 4/5 stars was because of the chocolate tart with lapsang souchong; very smoky taste.  Maybe others love it, but we found it a bit odd. Service was outstanding.  We will be back often.

I specifically selected anniversary under special occasion when I made the booking, but nothing was done differently for the occasion. We found that surprising and disappointing, epecially the fact that the two tables next to us received cards, complimentary desserts and were wished a happy anniversary.
Very well taken care of and everything was timed out at a nice pace.
service was great - food was a little better than average given the price point.
Incredible service, amazing innovative food, all-around fantastic experience. Top 3 must try...lobster french toast,  Maine scallops, chocolate souffle cake.

This was our first time to kinship, but not our last. The menu is creative and organized in columns of "style/feeling" with a couple of starters, a couple of entr√©es, and a couple of desserts in each. The food was first-rate and well priced for the quality. There were a number of locally sourced meats and produce. The wine list was smart with a good variety. Especially noteworthy was the list of very good 375ml bottles.
Kinship is simply outstanding. Great place to celebrate a special occasion. The food and service are terrific. Can't wait to return.
Amazing and creative dishes with excellent service
Excellent meal at Kinship. Service was polished, food was spectacular.
Fantastic experience. Service was amazing. Food was amazing. Just go.
Great meal!  Loved the lobster appetizer and roasted chicken.  Service perfect!  Thank you.  Ill be back soon.

Exceptional in every way though you can‚Äôt have the 4# chicken unless you can commit an extra 80 minutes to the cooking process. The sausage and cod were our second choices and they didn‚Äôt disappoint

Truly enjoyed your unique dining experience.  Loved the booth we sat in for the 4 of us.  Food was fresh, flavorful, eclectic, right size portion, that allowed each of us to taste/enjoy each others dishes.  All of the staff was most helpful.  Recommendations for tasting multiple different dishes was great!
First visit to a restaurant during Covid pandemic.  Great food, great service.  Tables were separated well and staff all had masks.

Tried this place out after they re-opened due to covid.  Miso black cod was a great dish, the rest of the dishes including the sushi was mediocre.  Service was pretty sad, I ordered a dish and asked to change it ONE MINUTE later, and was told by the waiter ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry I already put the order in.‚Äù  What stupid service and restaurant doesn‚Äôt let you change your mind?  He should have said - ‚Äúyes I‚Äôll change the order immediately.‚Äù  Doubtful I‚Äôll go back given the poor training of the servers.

Everything from the moment we walked in was outstanding.  We have just found our favorite LA sushi place.  We ran 20 minutes late due to PCH traffic and they still seated us right away.  Our server was exceptional and the food was terrific.

There were signs up notifying of mandatory masks that need to be worn when entering the restaurant. Many customers were not wearing masks as they walked in, or whilst speaking to host, nor whilst walking to their table. Several tables are NOT 6 feet apart (ours at most was 3 feet from the tables next to us, and the booth). However, they did a great job with the booths providing Perspex dividers to separate the booth seating. The servers/waiters did an excellent job providing a service that is very difficult now with gloves and masks, they provided a top notch service to us, food was excellent as always, and if they can figure out how to distance tables we will keep coming back
Great place to go on a date
Koi has their act together as they reopen. Sign of a professional organization. Food ambiance service all great as always. Drinks were delicious too. Will be going back regularly.

Tony was an amazing server! There were guys smoking in the patio next to our table which was gross. The bartender with the white hair was rude; when my friend wanted to order a drink with Mezcal he asked, ‚ÄúHave you had that one before?‚Äù to which she replied no. He responded ‚ÄúThen get something else.‚Äù Luckily we were able to order them through Tony at our table. Do better.
Excellent food and service. We're a regular and happy to come back time after time. You have to try the crispy rice with filet mignon.
Thank you for great experience! Friendly service, delicious food!!!
A must, when you are in LA.  Only negative is the high noise level.
Things are always great at Koi.  Food and Vibes are perfect.
Always a treat. Exquisite taste and service is great
Server messed up a couple times after asking for specific things but not the end of the world
Spectacular food. Creamy shrimp is pure heaven on the plate; sizzling rice takes this item to the addictive level; and, the sashimi is fresher than any you‚Äôll find anywhere. Brilliant.
Exceptional attentive complete. service with outstanding food and good advice from waiter.A tiny setback was slight rudeness from valet Parker but this was quickly forgotten
This ain‚Äôt real sushi.   Overpriced for run of the mill pieces of fish.   Meh.   Very loud lots of kids playing video games loudly without headphones .
Bad service long wait for drinks
Amazing!!! We booked Koi to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday and we loved it!!! The food , service and ambiance were outstanding!   Highly recommend this restaurant.
Had a reservation at 9:15.... wasn‚Äôt sat till 10:30
Absolutely horrible. We had a reservation but still waited an hour and ended up just sitting at the bar. The service was terrible they were very rude to us.
We had a reservation for 9 PM. We weren‚Äôt seated till 10:20. People who came after us with no reservations were seated before us. When we asked about the wait it looked like they forgot about us.

The host was understandably frustrated and was trying his best as all reservations were behind but we weren‚Äôt seated till 9:45pm with an 8:30pm reservation. There aren‚Äôt enough seats at the bar so people have to sit outside where it was cold. I understand that Valentines is a busy night but to wait over an hour past my reservation time was a bit extreme. Plus the bartender didn‚Äôt know how to make a paper plane, bummer since they have such great whiskeys available. At least the food came out quick and was delicious but it would have been a better experience had they comped some edamame or something for making every reservation wait such an extreme amount of time.
Food was great but waited 45 minutes to sit down
Kiiro roll is A+
Perfect spot in LA for any occasion

Thank you and the team for always making us feel special and welcome. Also the food is always insanely great!
Great food and service.
Great birthday dinner celebration

Amazing food, fantastic staff and beautiful space. Rich the bartender was wonderful!  Our reservation was for 8:45 and we waited a bit at the bar which was fantastic. The gentleman who seated us was so apologetic that we had to wait a bit and we truly didn‚Äôt mind. The evening was wonderful!
The Manager at the hostess stand was so amazing! His personal touch makes the restaurant!
Overall experience is still good but It‚Äôs a bit dark in our seating area. Dim is good but not too dark.
Always on point for the food. Management is stellar. My to go place.
Always fun. Let the waiter choose for you and just relax.
Amazing food always! Consistently great. No complaints..I love Koi. 10/10 recommend

food was excellent overall.  Sunfire roll was fabulous as was the creme brulee with added chocolate.  Crispy rice with truffle avocado was to die for.  Edamame was a little tough and too little salt.  Kobe potstickers and crispy shrimp were great but not as good as the aforementioned items.  Service is unbelievably good-----several people making sure you have water, delivering plates but non intrusive.  Ambiance excellent.

Koi was excellent- the food was scrumptious and the service impeccable.I am still dreaming about the black cod - among the most delicious dishes I‚Äôve had. When we arrived at 6:30 pm, the noise level was good - lively and bearable but by 8 pm, we had to yell across the table to each other.... unfortunate when you are dining in such an elegant venue.
Great place: excellent food and service. Recommended
Always a fantastic experience. Seth was our waiter and we really appreciated his attentive and engaging demeanor.  Food was spectacular as always.
I suppose we could have moved, but the party behind us was very loud. Millennials don‚Äôt understand the idea of using their ‚Äúinside voices‚Äù.Excellent food. Strong cocktails. Amazing service.
awesome place.  great service, great food, a little noisy.
Family dinner prior to our daughter‚Äôs wedding...
Excellent, as usual :)
Simply the best restaurant in San Francisco. Consistently fabulous, great service, and a lively and happy crowd.
Our waiter was amazing!  Food was excellent!

We always enjoy Kokkari and Sunday was no exception. We shared spanokkopita, avgolemono soup and the wonderful Greek salad, followed by the lamb shank and a bottle of red wine. Our meal was topped off with baklava and icecream. Couldn't be beat in our opinion!
The kataifi ekmek was a delightful dessert.
Had a wonderful meal with friends. Service and food were excellent.
It was our first date since having a baby! They gave us a great table, we had great service and food! They went the extra mile to make it extra special for us.
Experience was amazing it‚Äôs our go to place for special occasions or really nice datesThe food is amazing the ambience is great
Really consistent amazing food - worth every dollar!
One of my favorite places to dine. Ambience has you wrapped in white table clothes and the true aroma of Greece.Excellent service and polite employees.What more would you ever want!!

Of course this place kills it on every level. I‚Äôve been coming here for special occasions for at least 15 years and it‚Äôs consistently amazing. Always try the kataifi dessert if it‚Äôs on the menu!!

The lamb and octopus were as amazing as my friends described it would be. However, everyone in our party commented that the host was very ‚Äúsnooty.‚Äù I think stoic and unfriendly would be better descriptors.
Fantastic food paired with exceptional service made for a fantastic evening.
Super delicious. I really enjoyed the appetizers. Definitely recommend for a date night.
Love the food offerings!!
Great quality creative kale salad loved the octopus chicken was a bit dry great wine selection loved the Greek white wine we had
Wonderful place great food ,service and ambience  very well prepared chicken, lamb, beets, and broccoli sides. We will return
Always a great dining experience at Kokkari. Nice special occasion restaurant.
Food and server were great!  Noise level so loud can't hear people talking at the table.  We had a special birthday celebration, and we all had a wonderful time.  Thank you so much!  Holly C. Kully
One of the finest dining experiences San Francisco has to offer. Quality of food is exceptional, and service very professional.
Great food, as usual. Valerie couldn‚Äôt have been any better as a server. Knowledgeable and sweet and always there when we needed her.
In spite of arriving 40 minutes before reservation time, they were 10 minutes late in assigning me a table .Food was delicious
Everything was super tasty and I loved the ambiance. I‚Äôll definitely have to go back so I can try more items on the menu!

First time in San Fran. Came on the recommendation of a friend. Food was perfect, service was warm and friendly but professional and knowledgeable. Very helpful. Everything was fresh and perfectly cooked. Loved it.
Muy agradable lugar al que no suele llegarse como turista.Excelente comida
I wanted to hail, I believe her name was Alana. She couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. Both of my guests had never been there before so it was a real thrill for them.Thank you.Katie
Lovely ambiance and wonderful food. Always enjoy Kokkari!
Amazing food and amazing service. Very authentic and makes you feel like you transported to Greece
Enjoyed the dining experience.
Great meal and terrific service!

The grilled octopus was out of this world and I‚Äôd go back just for that! The Greek salad was under seasoned and the tomatoes were mushy, and we had to send one of the lamb chops back because it was very rare. Greek potatoes and saganaki were definitely impressive with the cheese still sizzling on the skillet, delicious!!
All was very good. Hostess was very accommodating offering us a choice of seating
Lovely food, staff knowledgeable on the wine list. Will be dining again
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco for more than two decades!

Kokkari never disappoints!  This time they outdid themselves. Not only was the food excellent but the service was incredibly thoughtful with just the right balance of friendliness and distance.  A standout was the fresh plump squid stuffed with feta and olives on a bed of watercress. Sublime. The coffee is the best I have tasted in ages - even the decaf. And they brought out a scoop of baklava ice cream with a candle for my friend;s birthday even though we did not order any other desserts. The decor and atmosphere are of a class and elegance it has become all too hard to find in San Francisco or anywhere else these days. Kokkari is a wonderful experience whether for lunch or dinner.
Waiter wasn‚Äôt very friendly but the rest of the staff was great. Food is very good and the place is really charming.
We are outside and it was lovely. The food was great!
Very nice as always.
Always an excellent dining experience.

Chez Francois is a Northern Va. gem. A gorgeous restaurant in a beautiful woodland setting! The food is superb and the service is wonderful. Try to get a table on the patio ( which now has a tent to protect from the rain) and if you are truly lucky you might get one in one of the two gazebos. You will have an amazing evening in a true Alsatian l'auberge setting!
t was wonderful to return to our favorite restaurant.  Our meal was delicious and we will be returning soon.

I've been coming to this restaurant for decades so I was there for its first reopening lunch. The outdoor seating is fantastic--a sturdy tent with fans in a beautiful garden setting. The indoor seating has been halved. Your favorite waiters are back. The food and drink are very good. And you feel safe.

The service and ambiance here is wonderful. The food is also great. The price is a bit higher compared to restaurants of similar quality and service in the area. Two people will cost around $200 quite easily. This is a great place for dates and special events.
Amazing meal...great birthday celebration!Thanks for making it so special!
Excellent Food, Service and Company.Just a Brunch with Friends but with Sanda an excellent Server.
The meal, service, and experience at this restaurant is always outstanding.

The food was devine.  I just closed my eyes and savored the flavors.  In between courses they brought out small sweet desert type dishes, chocolate truffles, sorbet, etc...That staff was very attentive.  My new favorite restaurant.

Dining here has always been a special pleasure. The setting is quaint and secluded. Two people in our party enjoyed the Dover sole, a dish not often on menus, I had the rack of lamb which was perfectly prepared. Special touches like the amuse bouche, a mushroom soup which made you sorry when there wasn‚Äôt more, and the dark chocolate tart were delectable. We always promise ourselves we‚Äôll return soon.
The Auberge is a long time favorite that over many years never disappoints--what a wonderful restaurant to have in the DC area.
We were celebrating our granddaughters birthday. Chez Francois provides a great experience every time we dine there. The food was great and our server, Sammy provided outstanding service.
Service, ambiance, and of course the food....all excellent.
The food and service is always a notch above all others. I am never disappointed.
L'Auberge always comes through.  We celebrated a big birthday, and the atmosphere, food, and service could not have been more perfect.  Thank  you!
Wonderful restaurant!
Great time with Friends. Food and service are always outstanding.
Amazing experience as usual. Always a special place for our family!

My husband brought me to L'Auberge Chez Francois to celebrate my birthday. From the moment we walked in to the front door, until the moment we left, the service, food, ambiance was impeccable. Our waiter was extremely friendly, offering suggestions when we were stuck with decision making and ensured our water cups were consistently filled. He didn't rush our evening but rather perfectly timed all of our courses. They brought out a special dessert for my birthday, which was greatly appreciated. The food...the food was delicious. Savory. Flavorful. Perfectly portioned. I could go on. The management was visible, stopping by to ensure we were enjoying our evening and told us about the history of the restaurant as this was our first visit. It's pricey but so is going to Capital Grill where everything is a la cart and the food quality/service has declined considerably. I'd rather spend my money here and enjoy my evening. We will definitely be back.
Excellent meal and outstanding service.  So many options for each course. It was very relaxing to sit and enjoy the meal without being rushed.
The sole was delicious!! Lovely experience as usual!
Great meal, great service, great ambiance.  It‚Äôs our favorite restaurant!
There is, quite simply, no other restaurant that continues to provide a consistently elegant dining experience.
Superb meal and dining experience, as always
Service was great. A true surprise for a last-minute reservation on a Sunday night. Great place for a special occasion
Having dined for special occasions at this restaurant since 1978, we have never been disappointed.  Yes, it is pricey but the value and memories make it worth it.  Enjoy the total experience.
They made my birthday lunch great! Food and service were spectacular and management was very understanding and helpful.
As usual, a great treat to eat and be served here

Excellent--as always.  This is our third time dining at L'Auberge Chez Francois.  Every time has been a special event (anniversaries, a birthday) and every time we not only had a meal worthy of going but a memorable event.

L'Auberge has been my go-to restaurant for special occasions for more than 20 years, and my most recent meal on February 29 yet again reconfirmed this long-held view.  Incomparable food, service, and ambience at less than half the cost of many competitors.

L'Auberge Chez Francois has been my favorite restaurant for many years.  I escaped from Northern Virginia 25 years ago but still return several times a year.    Pat and Freddie are our favorites waiters who make the dining experience so special.    The food is always exceptional!
The restaurant is always a special treat. My only issue would be the anise flavored sorbet and cookie. It is a strong taste that many don't prefer.
The food was absolutely amazing!
The food is always fabulous. The staff is so wonderful and friendly.Our waiter Erik was wonderful. He is such a awesome waiter we request him when we make reservations.
Birthday and they gave a free birthday dessert with candle!
Excellent in all areas.  Like the lunch option very much. First dinner was when restaurant was still in DC.
Great as always ! Staff accommodated last minute change from 4 to 2 persons. And sent home a birthday cake slice for missing birthday guest-  very thoughtful. Thanks.
Everything everyone  had was delicious My wife  especially  enjoyed  her veal dish.

This is our second time dining at La Grotta and the experience never disappoints! The food is superb, the wine list is extensive, and the service is unparalleled! We‚Äôve had Juliano and Danny as our servers and they are true gems!

This was my first experience at La Grotta after many recommendations. The food was phenomenal and the staff was extremely friendly. It took almost 30 minutes past our reserved time to be seated because COVID related reduced capacity.
Delicious meal great service! One of our most favorite places to eat! Treated like family.
La Grotta never disappoints. The service and food was outstanding. The best mussels and lamb chops in the city. My only complaint was that were were seated next to a very loud party of four outside.
The experience and food were great. Billy was a great waiter and made sure all of our needs were taken care of.
We‚Äôll be back!
Excellent food and service!!!
Amazing Great food. Great service. Superb experienced staff
This restaurant has been around for over 30 years, and there is a reason for that. Simply put; the best Italian restaurant in Atlanta.
Just was not as good as it has always been Disappointing
We enjoyed a wonderful meal on the patio.  Both the service and food were excellent.  La Grotta remains one the best values in Atlanta, if not the very best.
I was extremely happy with my service, food, and atmosphere at La Grotta. Everything was delicious!
Fabulous restaurant. Nice to dine in after months of pick up
Lovely evening with excellent service and delicious food. So glad La Grotta has reopened. Had the escargot appetizer. Wonderfully creamy and tasty. Cannot wait to go back.
My favorite restaurant in Atlanta by far!!
Amazing meal. No sign of corona virus here!!  Packed at 8:30 tonight. Everything was great except the service was awful.
Awesome food!
Amazing !!!!  Not too much else to say.  Loved the food and the service, highly recommend.

The best Italian food in Atlanta.  Service was impeccable.  We celebrated my daughter's 18th birthday, and they treated her like Royalty.  This is as good as it gets in Atlanta for both food and service.

I have to say that the food was absolutely delicious!  A bit pricey but nonetheless, delicious!  The wait staff was wonderful and very attentive except towards the end of the meal when the place got busier.  I had to flag the waiter down to bring us the check.  I would have wanted the tables to be spaced out a bit further than they were.  During our meal, which was a joyous occasion, there was a lady who was obviously not happy with how things were going at her job and  we got to experience it like we were at her work with her.  She was just loud, obnoxious, and rude.

I am not one to write reviews unless it was memorable in either direction. It was my second time at La Grotta. Tony was our server - he made us feel very welcomed. Professional, funny and intuitively attentive without ever making us feel rushed or ignored. He made a work dinner a special night. The food was incredible too. If you ever wanted to try quail, this is the place to do it. It was cooked to perfection and the sauce .... oh the sauce!
Pretty great, except the clams which they removed from the bill. Otherwise it was a great meal and experience.
Food is excellent with good portion size.
Myvwife and I celebrated our 35th anniversary at La Gtotta and it was a wonderful experience. Great food, superb service and warm atmosphere is a winning combination.
Excellent wine .  Great food and service.  Room was a little loud, but a lot of happy folks tend to make some noise.  Would go again.
The food was amazing.
Consistent, classic, always a notch above in all arenas!
Impeccable dining experience.
Everything was excellent. This is a must place to dine

The service was quite good; the ambiance very nice;  however, the food was really much below what it shoujd be for a fine, expensive restaurant
