We dined here for a friend‚Äôs birthday. It was easy to make the reservation and multiple times were available on the day that I chose. We were greeted prompted by valet when we arrived (it‚Äôs complimentary). Once inside, we were greeted by the host who wished my friend a ‚ÄúHappy birthday‚Äù along with each staff who we encountered. The service was great! Food & drinks were excellent.

HelloTo be Honest.. Very Very Disappointing .They could not get us out fast enough for the next seating ... not even to talk ... Faster than The Fastest CHINESE Restaurant... all my party annoyed ... we went to another location afterward to have a post dinner chat !
La Grotta is always a classic, delicious dining experience. Second to none in Atlanta.
La Grotta is absolutely fabulous, as always! I love this restaurant, and their exquisite service, and authentic food.
AMAZING!! As always!! The staff and food are  just wonderful!
Absolutely incredible in every way. A must go in Maui.
As always, they did an amazing job!!!

We had a wonderful time. Everything was enjoyable from the cocktails, to the delicious entrees, and the dessert. The waitstaff were superb. You can tell that they have been well trained.  Kudos to the management.
Awesome meal and fabulous service!!! They treat you like you are the only ones there. Very welcoming and accommodating.
Hands down the best food we had in Maui! We loved it so much we went back for dinner two consecutive nights! They confidently handled my Celiac safe dishes and had numerous GF meals available. LOVE!

Our 4th time coming here in many years...this is the second time we have been here for an anniversary dinner. The fish special was AMAZING.  The wagu ravioli for an appetizer is always good but the sauce is too curling good....get extra bread to clean up every drop of the sauce.  The beet and goat cheese salad was good as well.  Atmosphere is great. Lisa M our waitress was just delightful....great smile fantastic personality.  Just a wonderful experience AGAIN.  Be back next March and do this again.

I am fortunate to travel to Maui every 2 years. While in Lahaina  I enjoy sitting @ the bar at Lahaina Grill because I am single and the bartenders are very friendly and remember me. At my last visit on 3/16/2020, the owner was there. He made a point to introduce himself as the owner to the couple who sat next to me @ the bar. It was their first time @ the restaurant   He continued visiting many many of the customers at the bar and restaurant area. However, he made no effort to approach me. I felt I wasn‚Äôt a valued patron because I was a single woman.
The food and service were excellent. Unfortunately, they have crammed too many tables into the space causing excessive noise and very tight seating areas.
LƒÅhainƒÅ Grill is terrific. A special experience and amazing food every time. Service by Jillian was top notch.  We are happy to recommend this place, if you know the pricing going in.

It‚Äôs always such a treat to eat at Lahaina Grill. The staff is wonderful! The food is always exceptional!! And even if we eaten too many rolls( the herb butter can‚Äôt be beat!!),we can‚Äôt pass up the triple berry pie!!! The wine list and cocktails are exceptional too!! Lahaina Grill is one of favorite restaurants on Maui!!!
Always Fabulous!!
We could feel the wonderful ambiance from the minute we entered the restaurant .  The service was outstanding as well as every bit of the food we ordered.  We will definitely go back!!
Great restaurant.  One half block off water - no ocean view - but excellent food and artwork in dining areas.
As usual great food and great selection of fine wines. The service was outstanding .
The food was amazing and the service all over was the best!!
We were celebrating a birthday and couldn't have asked for a nicer experience. Server Michael, the food, the wine and our birthday pie ... Amazing!
Love the ambience of this restaurant!!Food was delicious and cherry berry pie very good!

Exceptional restaurant with exceptional food and service. We were seated in the quietest area, which was helpful. Otherwise, we would not have been able to hear each other. However, we will be going again this week, right back to table 34!
Wonderful experience as always.Everyone‚Äôs meals were fantastic and Lisa our server was spot on!

Michael our server was phenomenal!! Everyone working there went out of their way to chat with us and assist us. Michael even gave us the recipe for the berry pie as well as the penne and meatballs!!!  We can‚Äôt wait to return soon!!!

This restaurant is charming, and the service is perfect.  We each enjoyed a delicious drink (one alcoholic, one not) and a seafood entree.  Although the food was very tasty, we each felt it should have been warmer.  We were warned that the plates were extremely hot, which they were.  Unfortunately, the food was not.  It wasn't cool enough to merit sending it back, especially since we were there at 5 pm and it was already really busy.  For the high price, however, the food should have been excellent, rather than just very good.  I still rated the restaurant as excellent, however--everything else was terrific.
Great service and best food we had our entire vacation. We are both vegetarians and the options did not disappoint.Highly recommended!
Wonderful dinner! The food is excellent. Prepared perfectly and presented beautifully. Our server and other staff were super attentive.  Noise level is a bit loud. We will be back!

Another wonderful meal from LG. It's no wonder I come back every time I'm on the island. This time I started with an amazing seared tuna and foie gras plate followed with the opakapaka special. So goooood!! Buddy was a wonderful server, she's a blast. There is just so much warmth about the place.
The food was outstanding.  We had the special red snapper, it was absolutely delicious.  The service was excellent as always.  I dine here every time I visit Maui. Highly recommend!
Enjoyed the food and atmosphere.  Staff were excellent.
The meatballs and the short ribs were awesome and Maui onion soup andMy special birthday berry pie!!!!And Buddy was a character/awesome person took good care of us!

Unquestionably,  this is one of the finest restaurants we have ever dined in. And we have eaten all over the world. Everything was superb - wait staff, food, ambiance, decor, etc.  You are taken care of from the time you enter the restaurant to the time you leave - and if you leave something behind at your table when you leave they will come running after you to make sure you get it back (in my case my hat). The owner goes to each table and introduces himself and makes you really feel at home. This is a top notch organization and the results show it. A real gem!
Anniversary
50th anniversary
Scottie was a wonderful server. Type of place that focuses on the details and treats you with class. Wonderful food.

Wife and I went here after receiving a $100 gift card from my sister.  To be fair, we would never have gone here if not for the gift card after seeing the prices, we just don't dine at expensive restaurants.  Wife had Pacific Salmon ($49) and I had Boneless Short Rib ($46).  Neither of us drink alcohol.  Wife's Salmon was to come with Asparagus, came with String Beans instead.  Waitress and table assistant did come by a bit but nothing special about the service (I would imagine if we got drinks and an appetizer they would have come by more often but not much of a need with just us getting the dinner plate with no desert).  Her Salmon was OK as was my Boneless Rib but nothing special tasting.  Inside was nice but nothing special and a bit noisy even though we weren't in the main dining area.  No place to park close and plan on $10 or more paid parking unless a few blocks away ($5).  Gift card covered the meals, gave a $20 cash tip.  If you like expensive dinners this place may be good with you, check out the cost with the online menu. We much prefer the Okazuya & Deli Honokowai at 3600D Lower Honoapiilani.  If you've never been there go (take cash, they do not accept credit card and closed on Sundays).  Average dinner price is $17-18, the Mahi Mahi (includes two sides) is unbelievably good as is everything on the menu, it's TAKE OUT so it's perfect for beach dinning or at a condo lanai.  Wish sis had given us cash for us to use where we wanted, but her thought was in the right place.
Amazing food and service üíï
Awesome place. Food and service was amazing.
Have been to Maui several times but this is the first time eating here..... everything was awesome! We will be back for sure!
Don‚Äôt miss the Lahaina Grill.  A must while on Maui!

Went for our anniversary dinner and had asked for a special table, we ate in the middle of the dinning room. The waitress was nice but had a very odd personality that didn‚Äôt seem like she really cares to be there. The tomato in the tomato and mozzarella salad was hard, underripe and had been blanched to peel. Odd. Can‚Äôt believe they can charge so much for one tomato and some cheese! The entrees, one being the special for the day, were a let down as well. Not sure what all the hype is about this place.

We've enjoyed many evenings at the Lahaina Grill and everyone is special.  Among the many fantastic restaurants in Lahaian and on the island - the Lahaina Grill is our favorite and we believe the best.
Great food and staff
Ask for a table away from the bar. Very loud.Wish they could get a better parking experience. There is no handicapped parking near by.
Excellent food and service

Always a Home run of a dining experience. Food and wine are excellent and staff is knowledgeable. My only call out is the server seemed a little annoyed we ordered dessert/dessert wine. Understandably she wanted to close out her tables and go home but otherwise great experience.
Consistently excellent. We brought people who hadn't been there and they were very happy. Service was great, seated promptly, food came out in an orderly and timely manner.
Outstanding as always! Love the new expanded brunch menu and excited that you'll be open for brunch on Saturdays too!
Both the food and the service are consistently good.
Great place. Awesome pasta.
The food tasted very nice, only the serving size could have been bigger

The crudo  was outstanding, the wait staff professional, knowledgeable and friendly.  I was disappointed in the Branzino  it was overcooked and over sauced  and Brussels undercooked; but my husband‚Äôs Halibut  was excellent!  Wine list and wine excellent!
We had a nice brunch, nothing life-changing but good  - the portions are huge though. We ordered way too much - wish the waiter would have told us?!!

Start to finish, the service, suggestions, and presentation were tremendous.  And as for the food?  Again, never missed a single beat, the quail, tuna tartar, spaghetti, there was not a crack in any of the dishes. Finishing with the olive oil cake with creme fraiche was the perfect closure. Bravo to this restaurant that again came through.
Amazing. So hard to get a reservation but l‚Äôartusi was amazing
Amazing brussel sprouts and french toast. The pasta was good, but a little over priced.

Went for Brunch. Not many true Italian options, not sure anyone on the staff even spoke Italian. Restaurant decor was dated and sloppy. Despite all the stellar reviews we were underwhelmed by the whole experience. Food was good but, pretty standard.  Service was OK.  Didn't make us want to try to get on the list for dinner.  We talked about how disappointed we were the rest of the day.  We'll be going to Rafele from here on out.

Service was a little slow, after the food was delivered - it felt almost like our table was forgotten. It took awhile to get a check (we had to flag down our waiter after the first time we asked for it) and once we put down our credit cards even longer to get back the check to sign. To be fair, they may have been short staffed. It was fairly busy. However that said - when we did get service at the table, everyone was friendly and accommodating. Food was outstanding.
Excellent brunch! The pastry basket was filled with delicious homemade treat. Our service was stellar.

The food was excellent but was very disappointed with the service. Dined here once before and thought the food was good but was blown away by what I thought was the best service I had ever had. Then this time I went, waited over 20 minutes past my reservation time, server was inattentive and the gap between appetizer and entree was far too long. Food was good but poor service overshadowed it this time.

We had a reservation at 8:30 and they sat us at 9. They gave us a glass of champagne as an apology which was nice. Otherwise the experience was great, server was knowledgeable. Food was good but did not exceed expectations.
The food here is amazing, especially the pasta, but the ambience and service have suffered from the popularity of the place. Still overall one of my favorite restaurants in Manhattan.

We have been several times to this restaurant for dinner, this was our second time for brunch and we were so displeased with the service and how much they rushed us through our meal. It was a late brunch reservation and they cut off service because they had to get ready for the dinner crowd. My recommendation is not to allow customers to make late brunch reservations if the service level is diminished  because they have to turn over for dinner.

Clearly this is a very popular restaurant but to my mind, it is overrated. The dishes we ate that night were overseasoned with far too much emphasis on chili in every dish. One of our favorites!
Always incredible.
Phenomenal food and absolutely amazing service. Our waiter went above and beyond to make our first l‚Äôartusi experience amazing. Food is insanely good.

Love love love L'Artusi. This place knows what it's doing. It has amazing food and the best, nicest, most competent waitstaff and management. In a city with so many good restaurants, this is the one I go back to again and again as my favorite.

It still seems de rigeur for city restaurants to court noise level beyond the ears of most human diners.  That said, L‚ÄôArtusi was a wonderful culinary experience, with a thoughtful sommelier who was touchingly unaffected, and a waiter with a sense of irony.  The butter lettuce salad was a marvel, the pasta (kale pyramide) far from the ‚Äúpile of greens‚Äù its name tends to imply to Americans.  That we were the oldest diners in evidence is certainly not a complaint...just a regret for lost dining innocence!

We came for our anniversary and the service was amazing! We had a 10pm reservation but popped in around 7 and they were able to seat us early right away. They provided complimentary champagne at the start which was special and thoughtful. Our waiter Dan was perfectly attentive, helping with recommendations and kept the speed of the meal at a relaxing, welcoming pace. The experience overall was one I can‚Äôt wait to recommend to others! We will be back!
Was very good! Food was delicious. Minus 1 star for the noise level

The food is always great here! It is a special place because my fianc√© and I ate here before he proposed to me in April. The food is so good that we have come back just because and to bring visiting friends and family.

Unfortunately the hangar steak this time was not up to the usual lartusi standards. It was tough and not just one piece but all of it. So disappointed. I have been here 5 times before with no issue. Plan to go back again and try it. Made the whole dinner a fail for a new guest.
Service was attentive without being intrusive.  Crab avocado appetizer was delicious.  Perfect for a great date night or special occassion.

The old world elegance is a rare thing, and we value their focus to make sure that everything about the dining experience is excellent.   I highly recomend this restaurant.

It was wonderful to dine in at Le Bilboquet. I was celebrating my 70th birthday with my husband and another couple, friends of ours.The staff was excellent. Accommodating in every way. We were never rushed and really enjoyed the ambience.I had the crab and avocado salad for my entr√©e and it was delicate and lovely to my palate. My husband was thrilled to see the Frog Legs were on the menu and indulged. I had gazpacho soup for my starter and he had the grilled endive, which I kept eating from his plate. It was prepared beautifully. The restaurant gave me a complimentary peach tarte a la mode dessert for my birthday which had a brilliant sparkler on top. Our dinner was a perfect experience.

Great servicePatio is quaint Quality / price on the food is the issue The  foie gras is a Demi cuit but had no taste ..... the brioche that came with it was on the other hand excellent The escargot where small and  overcooked The halibut was fresh but the dish itself boring The scallopini where good well prepared The profiterole were okThe flotting island with the creme anglaise was a 7The waiter was great

When it was brought to mangers attention it was made to feel as though I was being extended a curtsy to comp an extra glass I ordered rather than a apology. The manger then pointed out to me that 3 small wine glasses of Prosecco is a normal amount per bottle. I don‚Äôt wish to be insulted on a Sunday morning and then have my intelligence questioned. It was our anniversary but we didn‚Äôt think we told them. Possibly it was in our profile. Regardless, they brought us dessert and helped us celebrate. Everything was wonderful. Might be our be fave!

The food, service, and ambience were all fantastic.  The services provided by the professional management and staff are the main reasons that we keep coming back. Love this place, I'll be back!Everything is well done and the service is friendly and professional.The only criticism I have is the space is well worn and may be in need of a simple refresh.Looking forward to going back soon.

Our dinner was superb!!! And our waiter, Carlos, was wonderful. I think Le Bilboquet has some of the best food in Dallas! The food, service, and ambience were all fantastic.  The services provided by the professional management and staff are the main reasons that we keep coming back. Lovely space - food was fabulous. Took a little time to get any service/ welcome at the table, save water delivery. Nice wine choice via sommelier. We‚Äôll be back. Love the Paris-based Spring.

Waited too long to be seated. Especially when we were seated at a mediocre table. Right next to the entrance. Cold draft every time someone opened the door. Le Coucou was outstanding in every way. Beautiful space, with great lighting and generous spacing between tables, which allowed for easy conversation (at normal volume) at our table. By far, our favorites dining experience in the states.  From the moment we walked in until we left every moment and every detail was impeccable. My boyfriend ordered the quenelle de brochet and duck.  It was as good as any I‚Äôve had in Paris.  Thoughtful and approachable wine list exciting novices and aficionados alike. One of our favorite places. Never disappoints.

It was my mom‚Äôs birthday on Jun 17, I was really excited to take her to the restaurant so she could try the duck √† l‚Äôorange dish. However, due to COVID 19 they don‚Äôt serve that entree, which was not a big deal at all.It started to rain when we came in, we sat outside the patio, later on the rain was heavier, so I asked the waiter that was it possible could we move the table to inside a bit cause we sat right on the edge of the patio so my mom got wet. He explained that he couldn‚Äôt cause of the social distancing. We all got it. Then I asked him was it possible could him pull the rain cover down a little bit? He answered ‚Äúsorry I cant‚Äù. Then he walked away. We had 5 people, and there was a big table behind us, it was enough for 6 people and he even didn‚Äôt bother to ask do we want to move the table or not. Even he saw that we will get wet when we sit there.The service was really bad!! He barely took care off us. He let us sat there more than 20‚Äô. So I walked to the host and asked her could we change our table? Then she said ‚Äúyes‚Äù. Foods came out. We order 4 portions of Beef Bourguignon, I got the Half chicken. The chicken was fine. But the beef were really salty. Nothing like I expected. I didnt mean to say everything had to be perfect. But I did trust Le Diplomate is a good restaurant to take my family there to celebrate because I had been there many times. It was good though. Not like this time. We all understand that due to COVID 19 everything is getting harder, but as a big restaurant with good reputation, they should had done so much better than that. I didnt want to complain anything about what happened, but this time it was bad. Overall,I want to give some feedback so the restaurant could improve their performance in advance.
Lovely lunch!

The food and drinks were delicious.  It was the best French onion soup and trout amandine I‚Äôve had and the mussels were of ideal consistency and flavor.  We felt safe because the outdoor patio tables were placed far away from each other and the servers and other customers were very respectful of social distancing and infection prevention precautions.  A great first outdoor dining experience in uncertain times!
Always a lovely time at Le Diplomate.

This was our first outing at a restaurant since the Covid pandemic and our server made sure our family had a beautiful meal and experience, despite the hot and humid weather.  His cheerful attitude made all the difference, and he timed our meal perfectly. Thankfully, the hostess seated us in a very shady spot and she did a great job of making sure everyone was socially distanced.  Amazing service as per usual!!
Felt very safe!  Best first meal out of quarantine!!!  üôåüôå
Get the burger it is absolutely awesome!!!!  The drinks and cheeses are good as well.
Great Burger!!
The steak tartare was amazing; and the shrimp salad too!
Restaurant was closed due to COVIT-19.
Sunday Brunch was very good.  Plenty of options.  Need to make a reservation early, as this is a popular Brunch spot in DC.
Super efficient and friendly service. The food itself was delicious with a juicy medium rare steak, crispy potatoes, and a silky smooth lobster omelette done French style.
Le Diplomate has maintained its wonderful food since it opened.    One can count on the highest quality food and service every time.
Our server was fantastic, and we could not have been more pleased with his menu guidance and friendly service.
Great ambiance and great staff.  Feel like you're in Europe.   I keep trying different things on the menu and they never disappoint (and the bread is fabulous).

It was way too loud and the server made a mistake with a drink order and did not correct it properly. The wine was corked and we had to return it twice. We were there to celebrate our birthdays but could hardly hear each other.

Service was excellent. I would definitely go back. Very friendly and professional staff, and our server was amazing. She made sure we were comfortable and the food was just as she described it to us out of this world.

Well the food was pretty good but despite empty tables, they first sat us at a table right next to where the waiters go in and out (and kind of touched you both ways).Then upon request, we were sat elsewhere. But the new table was squished in between another table and the waiters. Then the waiter didn‚Äôt bring the wine until after the food came and after I asked. Same with the bread. In general the waiter was for some reason seemingly overwhelmed. Finally the mussels were disappointing‚Äîjust ok.
Server was very knowledgeable, friendly and efficient.

My girlfriend took me here late on a Tuesday, and it was AMAZING! The service was excellent (they were very gracious when our outdoor eating plans were foiled by rain), the food came quickly, our server was super kind, and the entire restaurant is good for an Instagram post. I will absolutely come back.
Spectacular gougeres and wonderful Tarte Tatin. Noise level was a bit overwhelming. Overall, I had a great meal worthy of France.

Perfect French Restaurant with great service. I had the special Lobster Risotto which was great. My daughter had Ricotta raviolis. It was great. The bread is crazy good and homemade. They have a great menu and the wine list is AMAZING. I had a delicious cocktail called Romarin. It‚Äôs a grapefruit type cocktail. Get reservations. Go earlier. It got crazy fast.

Authentic delicious food with the best home made bread I have had in DC. The service is top notch, the wine list is extensive.

Our only gripe was for the price ($270) we would hope not to sit in small, dinky chairs directly in a major pathway.

On my radar since first DC visit. Food is traditional and delicious. Bread basket assortment is so, so good. We shared the cheese plate and charcuterie. Steak frites, skate, and lamb entrees all fantastic, my side of pommes pur√©e sublime. Extensive wine list. Only negative was the initial interactions with our waiter! We are warm and friendly people, well-dressed and mannerly. Regardless, there is absolutely no reason for snobbery. And we were served it. He loosened up a bit in the end and we overtipped as usual, but less attitude would have made a more gracious dining experience.

Breakfast was fantastic, though we really did not eat breakfast food other than, perhaps, mimosas. The oysters were sublime. Les pommes frites everything you could imagine. The shrimp salad lovely and the burger a bulls eye

After this experience, Le Diplomate is off our list: the food was undistinguished and couldn't justify the price point.  It's definitely a fun place: pretty people in a fun neighborhood. This is not only our favorite restaurant in Palm Springs, but anywhere.  It is expensive and a special occasion kind of place.  We make it a point to dine here whenever we visit.  Highly recommend!

We typically come here on special occasions like anniversaries, birthdays, or Valentine‚Äôs Day. It is truly an outstanding dining experience in almost every way.  My wife always feels special when I take her here.  Sitting in the courtyard under the ficus trees and lights is classically romantic.  For food lovers, the menu is unique and diverse, you‚Äôre guaranteed to find something special, quite the food adventure, and I‚Äôve never had a dish that isn‚Äôt delicious.   The wait staff is very courteous, prompt, friendly, all the things you want.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a special night out.
Wine by glass very expensive but a great wine list
Lovely courtyard

Le Vallauris is probably the best 'fine dining' restaurant in Palm Springs.  I actually like having lunch there more than dinner because during the day you can see the beauty of the patio.  We got the 3 course lunch for $44.50 and it was worth every penny.  The staff is lovely and they know that to dine there is a special treat, so you are treated very well. Simply the best Palm Springs has to offer.  The food is spectacular and the outdoor garden area a very beautiful place.

This is an elegant old Palm Springs place, great outdoor patio eating.Lobster bisque was gorgeous. Not the cheapest place, but fantastic wine list and excellent food.
La Vallauris does not disappoint.  As always, the entire experience was remarkable - the food, service, ambiance.

This is my favorite restaurant in Palm Springs, if not anywhere.  The service is attentive without being overly pretentious. The pre fix menu is a bargain for what's included.  I always look forward to returning!

Celebrated my wife‚Äôs birthday accompanied by her older sister, who was a little slow getting ready and we were going to be 15 minutes late. Called to let them know and they held our table, no problem. Service was wonderful and attentive, moving heaters to keep us comfortable. Escargot was very nice and garlicky. Wife and I had duck that was nice and crispy as advertised. Sister loved her lobster salad. Martinis were acceptably priced at $15, but the least expensive wine by the glass was $18, which I think is way too high. That‚Äôs my only complaint. Otherwise, an enjoyable meal and evening at a beautiful venue.
Charming, gracious and lovely in all catagories!
Wonderful Sunday Brunch, Would recommend going. Make sure you sit outside it is beautiful .
Sunday brunch with lovely free flowing champagne is wonderful experience. Staff ver6 att3ntive despite busy time and sitting out amongst trees very pleasant.

I had one bite of my entree and knew it would make me sick if I ate the whole thing, it was too greasy. I tried to send it back but the manager came out and told me that no one else had complained and they charged me full price for the disgusting dish. Never had such a rude waitstaff.
Wonderful experience as always.

We were most disappointed with the service. Our waitress was aware that we‚Äôd asked to speak to the sommelier to order a 3rd growth Bordeaux but still placed our food order   Our first course arrived before we‚Äôd ordered our bottle of wine as we were waiting for the sommelier. It was unacceptable. We should have returned the food, but most importantly she should have postponed our first course. What was to be a beautiful evening became a most unpleasant evening as our first course was cooling off as we spoke to the sommelier. We were rushed which is unacceptable when you spend over $400 on an evening dinner for 2.

From the moment we were greeted by the maitre‚Äôd we knew this was going to be a memorable experience. The wait staff was over-the-top attentive and the waitress engaging and knowledgeable. We have dined at Alinea, Le Bernadin and Daniel to name a few of our most remarkable experiences and this ranked with the best.While a bit more expensive than the standard Palm Springs/Palm Desert fare this was worth every penny of the additional cost. Great fine dining in Palm Springs. Old school classy restaurant.
Top notch all the way. Management is present at the tables and everyone is friendly and professional. We ate there two nights in a row.

Our first night in Palm Springs and we had reservations for 6pm. The owner/Mature D came out after us and asked why we left, he offered to seat us in the patio!!!  It was a really nice experience!  The sea bass and lobster were fantastic!  We would recommend this fine dining experience!
Delicious, great service and wonderful ambience! We‚Äôll be back !

I took two special friends to Le Vallauris to thank them for their help. This is ALL of our favorite restaurant EVER!! We all feel very special when we dine there. Excellent food and service

Our first dining experience since the Covid-19 closed everything down 2 months ago... couldn't have been better!! Linwoods is one of our favorite places - it was a beautiful evening - the outdoor eating setup was great - service was excellent (Annie) - and our food was delicious! It was a great welcome back to almost normal!

Linwoods did a great job with their outdoor seating and safety - cleaning measures to ensure their guests had a safe environment. The food was amazing , service was impeccable and Linwood came to table to personally thank us for dining there! Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to go back !!

tempura lobster.... sadly....   no where near as epic as it used to be....     no honey. sweet flavor....     brussel salad lovely octopus cooked perfectly.     WAYYYYYYY to much other stuff on the plate.. all octopus flavor went away
second time in a week - food and service was outstanding

As always the food and service were wonderful.  We were also very impressed by the steps taken to make diners feel comfortable, as the restaurant had only recently reopened to outside dining during this crisis.  The tables were well spaced, everything seemed very organized and clean.  We felt very comfortable eating there, and look forward to going back.
Don't let the outdoor dining stop you from visiting Linwoods.  They still do it Right!
We ate outside glad to support our local restaurant been coming here for years
We had our dinner on the patio outside because we are still in phase I of the virus regulations.  It was chilly and windy but the weather did not stop us from enjoying our meal

Hole pretty much any food would have been fantastic after being cooped up for months, the quality was amazing. It is as if they picked up right where they left off. I was so impressed by how hard everyone on the staff was working hard to make this strange time feel ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù
A wonderful special occasion restaurant.
Delicious and unique fresh food, amazing staff, present and invested owners. Highly recommend.

The food and service were excellent, as always.  Two of us had the special rack of lamb that came with just two chops.  While we were told it was a 6oz portion, we felt it was a very small portion for the price.
Consistently great food and service. Fixed prix menu is great.
Geeat i cannot wait to go back for another delicious dinner
Excellent service, excellent food, only problem for us was noise level when it got crowded.   We've been coming here once a month for a few months and really enjoy it.
This is our favorite restaurant ever. We have come every year for our anniversary and just love the food and service. Thank you

Another wonderful meal at Linwoods! One of our favorite restaurants. Our server, Holly, was excellent as always - super friendly and attentive. Our food as always was delicious and well prepared. Highly recommend!
Food was excellent. We really had a lovely time. Thanks

We had a lovely evening at Linwoods.  As always the food was excellent and attractively presented.   Linwoods is always a wonderfully relaxing way to spend an evening.   Oddly, which is VERY odd for Linwoods, the service was not particularly good.   Other than that we had a great meal
The restaurant was full but neither the food or the service suffered as a result.  A little noisy but overall a lovely evening.

I enjoyed it more than my friend. She ordered the Chilean Bass dish, but the server didn't inform her that the lemon butter sauce was on the side. It looked so plain that she exchanged it for the salmon dish. However, when she got it, the grilled fish was overcooked and dry. She used the lemon butter sauce of the first dish to eat it. She asked for Old Bay seasoning for the Maryland crab soup appetizer which needed help in flavor.My experience was much better than hers. The oyster appetizer and the short ribs over polenta was very good. The only thing was they needed a bit more salt for seasoning. So I used the salt shaker to further season them to my taste.

Linwoods is always spectacular.  The food, service and overall quality are consistently excellent.  Our server described the menu items completely and anticipated our questions.  She recommended a new menu item - Caesar salad with brussel sprouts - which was one of the best salads we have had.  The cocktails were generous and delicious.  We were celebrating a birthday and were treated to a wonderful complimentary dessert.  It has always been one of our favorite restaurants and will continue to be so.
Outstanding food, service, and ambiance, as always!
Outstanding as always!!
Wonderful food and service, they always deliver!
Everything about MF is amazing. The food. Wait staff. Ambiance. I can‚Äôt say enough about it.

The food was excellent especially the Halibut en Croute, which was exceptional! I really wanted to try the very popular Chili Lobster with Texas Toast too, but my friend couldn't have lobster üò≠. Next time for sure! Our server was the best as well. She went above and beyond to hook us up with little "extras" during the course of our meal, which made the experience that more wonderful. I look forward to my next dining experience at Marc Forgione.
Outstanding as always!
Service very poorHalf way thru wsiter just started ignoring usOrdered coffe capucino etcIt never came but was on the checkBig let down from prior visits

I have enjoyed several birthday dinners since the restaurant first opened in 2008 (I think), and as of Tuesday night the quality of the cuisine, service, and experience has not been diminished in any way.  That almost never happens in NYC!  Thank you for another delicious and fun evening.
Great upscale-casual atmosphere, amazing food, and the staff went above and beyond to help us celebrate.We had the halibut and the black cod, and I couldn't imagine how to improve either dish.

Above and beyond anything that could have been expected. After visiting Peasant, and meeting and talking with Chef Forgione (and being absolutely blown away by the food) only a week ago for my first dating anniversary with my boyfriend, I decided to take him here for his birthday. We were treated like royalty from the second we walked in, and the food matched the service. We ordered the chicories salad to start. It may sound/seem simple, but that was one of the best salads we‚Äôve ever had. We were also given the Hiramasa tartare dish, which my boyfriend declared the best tartare dish he‚Äôs ever had. I had the half chicken (cooked under a brick), and he had the halibut - both outrageous. We had the carrot cake for dessert, but we were also given what the waiter called, ‚ÄòThe Egg.‚Äô He basically told us to move back in our seats a bit as he proceeded to toss a white chocolate egg filled with passion fruit into a plate ... it was as hysterical as it was delicious, and my boyfriend does not like passion fruit. There are no words that can properly describe this experience. From the card my boyfriend received when he sat down wishing him a happy birthday from the restaurant to the desserts to the sparkling wine to the everything bagel amuse bouche to the amazing atmosphere, this was a one of a kind experience. Simply outrageous, and we will be back.
Amazing as always!
Bad service and the food is over priced for what it is .
Incredible food from start to finish !
This is a superb restaurant.    The chicken is spectacular!
Good place for a business meal. A bit overpriced.
Outstanding!!!
Always terrific !
Great food, service.  Expensive but worth it
This place never disappoints. The food and wine were perfect.
Consistently some of the best food  and service in NYC. One of our favorite restaurants to go to for special occasions.
Good was excellent and so was the service. Server was very knowledgeable and offered great advice about certain dishes. A little pricey but worth it for a special date night/occasion
For my first NYC dinner I was blown away! Will definitely revisit
Great service and food. Restaurant is extremely loud with no sound dampers. Go early for the food and miss the noise volume.
Love this restaurant Wonderful staff Great food
Absolutely amazing service and delicious food!
Terrific all-around dinner.  Love the chicken for two, as well as a pear desert.  Service was attentive and efficient.  However, some of the appetizer portions were a bit small.
We LOVE this place, and dine at least once a week here.

Every year we sneak down to this beautiful and cozy space eagerly awaiting the Singapore Chili Lobster, Halibut with Sauce Proposal and the brick chicken.   Loved the Laotian sushi during our last visit.  So thoughtfully prepared and lovingly executed each and every time.   One of our very favorite beacons for a perfect meal.   When we haven‚Äôt made it down to NYC in a while, our home bar can always pour the iconic banana Jameson, yet that always seems to make me ready to plan our next visit.
I‚Äôve wanted to go to this restaurant for years. I went for my birthday and it did not disappoint. Highly recommend!

Working in NYC for a month, I decided to have my own restaurant tour mostly chefs that I‚Äôve seen on the Food Network. It‚Äôs also my birthday month, so I am going all out! I am thrilled this was one of my top picks! Everything is amazing! The staff, ambiance, food, little treats between courses, everything! I tried food I do not typically like venison. Being from Louisiana, someone is always cooking venison, and is not something I like. However, it was recommended by my waitress that it was her favorite. I figured if anyone was going to change my mind about venison, this maybe the only hope. Oh my, it was delicious! I can‚Äôt believe how much h I enjoyed it! My friend had the steak. We would giggle every few bites because the food made us that happy! Thanks for an amazing experience!
Exquisite from start to finish. Exceptional service. Delicious and creative food.
Food is very good. Trout was perfectly grilled with Chanterelles and gnocchi with butter and sage. I‚Äôve dined here several times and will come again.The servers are efficient and discreet.
We had an excellent experience; great food and service.
Servizio eccellente ma cibo davvero nella media, mi aspettavo molto molto di pi√π nella qualit√†.Prezzi esorbitanti, dolce buonissimo.

This is a perfect spot for Christmas Eve dinner with close friends and family. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, the food superb. Our waiter was well informed and efficient. There was one thing that really had a decidedly negative impact on our experience: the presence of a waiter‚Äôs helper who paced back and forth constantly during our entire stay. I could feel eyes upon me as if watching every bite. When I put my fork down I was instantly approached ‚ÄúAre you finished?‚Äù I‚Äôm just sorry I did not ask the waiter to have this person removed. I understand the need to turn the tables on a busy night like Christmas Eve but must say that I will think twice before returning and, if I return, I would request to be left alone by the waiter‚Äôs helper.

Not impressed at all were waiting to eat here for months and when I did I only liked dessert and I couldn‚Äôt believe that there‚Äôs such a hype over this place. I‚Äôve been eating everywhere from NYC to Miami Michelin started restaurants and mom and pop shops this was not good. I would not go back many other awesome places to eat right around the corner.
My favourite restaurant in all of New York City - never disappointed and I make sure I go every time I visit

Fabulous experience from start to end.Knowledgeable professional staffIntriguing / manageable cocktail menu and wine selection.Amuse established the mood for a creative competent kitchen.Shishito peppers simply salted and grilled ...Chicken under a brick - crisp skin floated over succulent half a chicken served 2 with sizzling halved potatoes.Two chocolate chip cookies did not benefit from the purposely melted ice-cream ...certainly abortion meant for sharing ... but whyüòâ.
Great food, excellent service! The tasting menu was very good.
I Love this place. The ambiance is amazing, food is great, drinks were phenomenal‚Äî service impeccable. One of our favorite NY restaurants.

Our second visit here was a bit of a disappointment.  The place was very full and very loud.  The menu is quite limited, which we knew, but the starters and appetizers did not have much appeal, and the peppers were considerably more spicy than described by our waiter.  Many people, ourselves included, seemed to be there for the chicken for two.  It was fine, but roast chicken can accumulate a bit too much pan juice, which makes it seem greasy and less appetizing, which is what we experienced this time.
Our fabulous server, Lise made the whole evening extremely enjoyable!  Food was amazing and we loved Marc‚Äôs signature ‚Äúperfect bite on a spoon‚Äù!

A classic dining experience, starting with delicious drinks at the bar and an excellent jazz pianist. The Tasting menu offerings are exciting and choices are flexible. Excellent spot for a special occasion.

My husband and I had dinner at Marcel‚Äôs before attending a performance at the Kennedy Center. We opted for the theater menu. It was one of the nicest meals we have had in DC in a while. The service was impeccable ‚Äî they even provided a selection of reading glasses so my husband could read the menu. Service was attentive without being intrusive or rushed. Service was great, and not just by DC standards. The food was excellent, as well. They even have a complementary car service to the Kennedy Center. I would definitely go back again, and we will certainly make this our go to dinner spot before heading the KC.
Fabulous as always!

It was such a pleasure to go to a restaurant where you are taken care of so completely. The QUIET dining room allows for normal and even whispered conversation. The wait staff are extremely professional remembering everything you‚Äôve order and examining every plate prior to serving your dinner for quality control. I can not recommend Marcel‚Äôs too highly.

Our entire evening could not have gone better.  They were out of our selected caviar, so they upgraded us at no charge.  The scallop starter and the squab were outstanding.  The staff was impeccable, warm, knowledgeable, just the right amount of presence.  The decor sumptuous and restrained.I know we will return again and again.
Terrific meal.  Each dish was special. with a unique blend.
the restaurant met our expectations in terms of food that was delicious, elegance and  courtesy of the staff

We had a fabulous evening at Marcel's. The service from the front of the house was perfectly balanced between attentiveness and discretion. The food was beautifully prepared and presented and delicious in every way. Marcel's is elegant and we enjoyed the evening very much. What is Musak everywhere else is a the gentle jazz piano in the bar at Marcel's. The perfect atmosphere for a special evening. Recommended.Two items that detracted somewhat, but never interfered. There appeared to be some tension between the wait staff and the support staff - maybe just the usual search for perfection but we overheard more than one impatient comment. Second, for a prix fixe menu offering we were surprised there was no option for wine pairings and when we asked if one could be provided received a frustrated response that sure, we could do that if you wanted. That said, the pairing were from the wine-by-the-glass menu and were splendid!

Always an exceptional experience. We had the 4-course menu option and sat at the bar before our show at the Kennedy Center. We loved all our dishes - I had the black cod, salmon, and lobster timbale. The poached pear dessert was delightful. Highly recommend!
Lovely dinner, we were well taken care of, and the food was outstanding.  We'll be back!
We had a great experience. And they offer a car service to the Kennedy Center, which was an added bonus.

This was our second time; it won't be our last. Jonathan is the epitome of five-star service, perfectly paired with Chef Robert's exquisitely delicious and beautifully presented dishes. The dining room is an oasis of peace away from the noise of this area. Gentle jazz and live piano play softly. Sight, sound, smell, taste, texture - Marcel's perfectly attends to every sense. There is a reason Marcel's is in Tom Sietsema's Hall of Fame for DC dining. We look forward to our next experience at Marcel's.

Another enchanting evening at Marcel‚Äôs - a wonderful dinner with great service.  The creativity never stops.  There is always something new to try.  And Marcel‚Äôs will always accommodate food allergies without compromising quality.
This was our second time here, and it was equally good. It is a new favorite for special occasion/Kennedy Center evening dining. What a nice dinner out should be.
Great food and amazing service.

Great for special events.  We celebrated our 28th wedding anniversary and our son's acceptance into the MD and DC Bars.  We chose the 5 course tasting menu.  Everything was perfect.   Great job by Vinny and Staff.  Kudos!

Soup to nuts, outstanding in every way -- perfect service; beautifully plated; lovely wines; and correct portions for me!  We loved the food, the service, particularly our waiter, and the seamless experience of dining, having Real French Food, with nouvelle twists, and the car service to and from the Kennedy Center is a terrific perk!
Always fabulous.
Food and service were impeccable. The three course pre theatre menu is full of great choices and a good value. The chicken in tarragon buerre blanc was amazing.
Vinny is a fantastic server. Highly recommend
One of the best restaurants in Washington DC now and form many years. Great food, quiet lovely ambience and attentive and pleasant service.
Phenomenal food, great service and nice ambiance. Good wine list but overpriced. Easily 4x market prices.
Meet an old classmate you haven't seen in years

We had an excellent time - food, presentation, service, atmosphere all exceeded expectations.  It was one of the few top-notch restaurants where you can have a decent conversation.  Yes, you pay for that privilege (tables aren't crammed together) but it was surprisingly reasonable given the quality of the experience.

We are coming back within two weeks of our first visit. It is rare to have a nice place live up to expectations, but Marcel's did. My husband said this was his favorite meal since we went to French Laundry, and that was about a year-and-half ago of regular restaurant going (West Coast and DC).  We go out to eat a fair amount in all price ranges and in this range, once expects more than just good food. We got great food and great service executed by professionals, not just folks who want to wait tables for a couple years before they move on to their "real job". And, yes, it is not a bargain dining hall, but we felt it was a good value for the quality, portions,  presentation, and vibe (great jazz pianist in the lounge, complimentary swank ride to the Kennedy Center for show). Plus, the wines by the glass were priced very accessibly and tasted like much more expensive price points. If you appreciate a more traditional fine dining experience with professional, adult staff and are tired of dropping a couple of bills only to see everyone around you dressed like slobs, make your next date at Marcel's.
Excellent special occasion location. Great food and service.
We have been dining here for 5 years. Always had a great meal.

I took my wife for our 29th anniversary and I wasn‚Äôt sure what i was get into.But then. The show stared. Amazing food. The unique taste of each plate, was unreal. Henry the waiter. 5 stars. And then i had the honor to meet David. Not just an amazing chef. A true gentleman. I don‚Äôt know when i will go back. But for sure i will
Food was delicious and service, exceptional.  We were within hearing distance of the pianist in the bar; loved that!

We have been to the fine dining room a number of times and love it.  We were eager to try the Bar special menu.  Our reaction was that the food was fabulous.  However the amount was  on the small side and the wine pairing was minuscule.  There was no dessert included.  We were sort of in and out in a short time.  Generous on the bread service.We would not go back for the bar experience but would go back to the fine dining room.

This wasn't just dinner out--this was a dining experience. Go when you can take your time and enjoy being pampered by the service, wowed by the presentation and flavors and relaxed by the elegant ambiance.  It'll be the  kind of evening that you'll talk about for a long time.  I can't imagine rushing through dinner here to get to the theater but I guess people do. I didn't want to leave. The food was amazing. There used to be a Washington Post food critic, Donald Dressden (goes way back) I think his name was--when he went to a great restaurant he said the "food sang" yep, the food sings here, like Pavarotti on a plate, or something.  You have to go, save up your birthday, anniversary, special occasion or just 'cause you deserve it and spend it here.

This restaurant is without doubt one of the top in the DC area if not the country. My only regret is that I did not try it earlier. The staff - from the owner to the waiters to all who assisted us - were kind, punctual, caring, and welcoming. The chef and cooking staff really know what they are doing and the food is sourced fresh and of highest quality. We ordered from a tasting menu from which one could choose four, five, or six dishes. We chose four, which was more than adequate. Among the three of us we had salad, fish including shellfish, venison, pasta, and several desserts, inter alia. The vegetables were fresh and the cooking afforded succulent, wonderful tasting options. The wine selections ranged from reasonable to pricy, and we were able to get a bottle of a recommended red wine by the glass that was excellent, from a vineyard and vintage that we knew. Expect to pay twice what you would a most high end restaurants but the result will be more than twice as good. I was reminded of an Inn in the countryside in Virginia that has great food, but Marcel's is  better and less expensive. We'll definitely be back!
A perfect evening from the impeccable service to the menu choices to the presentation and taste of each course.
Wonderful complete dinner- all aspects were first rate - Vinny took exceptional time care of my wife and I

This is a wonderful French restaurant with smart service, a creative and skilled chef and a lovely wine list. Each dish has deep roots in traditional French haute cuisine that have been married expertly to our time. It is the perfect place for a special occasion.
Highly recommended.

Marcel's has always been one of the best dining experiences for us. We were there for our Anniversary last weekend. We told our waiter/host Mark that we wanted a picture with Chef Wiedemier for our Anniversary and he came through for us. Mark took great care of us ... very professional, attentive, good natured. Like talking to a friend. Mark loves his job and it shows. We especially enjoyed the Foie Gras, lobster appetizer, sea bass, but everything was a foodie treat. Ambiance is classy and even though restaurant was almost full, it was not noisy and you could enjoy having a nice conversation in a soft voice (a rarity nowadays in restaurants).

The service was top notch, which you would expect for a restaurant of this caliber.  The presentation of the food was wonderful and the flavors were distinct and exceptional. The tasting menu was right-sized and  perfect for the amount of courses chose. (Four).  The wine pairings were well thought out.  Overall a wonderful experience.  A call out to our head waiter Adam.  Spot on service.
One of the top French restaurants in Washington.  A traditional, delicious menu--no foam-filled balloons.   Just great food beautifully prepared and served.

Impeccable service and a wonderful wine list. The best parts of the menu are the starters ( scallops, boudin Blanc consomm√©) but the duck entre was average.This restaurant is heart attack expensive and I would have expected better.
Great all around!
I wish I could give it 6 stars. This place is a gem.Food and service are outstanding. Excellent wine list.
We had a fantastic evening. Staff were gracious, professional and attentive. Dishes were excellent. Looking forward to returning soon.
Fabulous gluten free pasta   I loved the truffle and anchovy sauce. Perfection.
As always amazing!

Marea is an elegant restaurant from the decor to the food to the service. Great attention is paid to every detail to make the experience luxurious and special. We were there for a birthday lunch starting with excellent cocktail and wine (don‚Äôt miss the delicious bread as it‚Äôs brought around) into appetizers of a variety of crudi (thinly sliced raw fish) and entrees of halibut and steak. We ordered sorbet for dessert then were pleasantly surprised with a special birthday dessert plus cookies and small tiramisu portions. All were excellent and beautiful. Adding to the overall atmosphere is the elegant china, cutlery, glassware and serving pieces. Dining here made it an occasion.
Always perfect! Best place in New York

My husband and I enjoyed an amazing dinner at Marae last Sunday. We treated ourselves to the five course tasting menu with the wine pairing. Everything was delicious, especially the halibut and the Tagliatelle with a sauce made from bone marrow. The chocolate dessert balls were also scrumptious.  Each wine paired nicely with its dish. The service was exceptional. We shall definitely return and hope the Tagliatelle is on the menu that night.
It was perfect and my 2-yr old daughter really enjoyed the food as well as the setup.  Really appreciated it.

The atmosphere and the wait staff are absolutely stupendous! The food however, ranges from good to very good. Nothing reached a level of excellence. At these astronomical prizes, I would expect to be blown away by every morsel.Certain dishes were cooked perfectly and we're quite tasty, however others seem to be overcooked. (Not a good thing with seafood.) Parts of the grilled octopus we're just downright dry tough. Regarding the Brodetto, The broth, while absolutely delicious, was served warm to start with and cooled to room temperature by the end of the dish.If you are looking for calm, culture, civility, this place is it. If, however, you were looking simply for amazing food, you may find yourself a little disappointed. Overall, a lovely dining experience with a phenomenal wait staff, but I just wish the food had lived up to the rest of the experience.
3rd visit and every meal outstanding! Pointless to explain just to! Not stuffy like most restaurants of this caliber
Great place for lunch!  Great menu and beautiful space!
Excellent food, service and ambiance.  Going back very soon.

Marea keeps getting better and better.  The setting and the service are magnificent, and the food is extraordinary, every time.  The service is so smooth and predictable that it is an easy choice for pre-theater dining, even with 4 courses.
The Branzino was awesome. Great ambience. Beautiful room. Definitely would go again.
First time on a Tuesday evening and did not disappoint - love this place!

Enjoyed another wonderful lunch. Tuna crudo, octopus starters very nice. Sent back a bottle of wine and got replacement equal value - no problem. Mains of scallops and striped bass very tasty. Special thanks to somm! Can't wait to be back.
Extraordinary combination of atmosphere , service, and culinary delights.
Consistently delicious!  Always great service!  My most favorite place to eat!!
Wonderful service, atmosphere and food.  My favorite NYC spot!

Very attractive, sleek and comfortable dining rooms.  Warm welcome, excellent service.  Very extensive wine list with a good selection of under-$100 bottles. Prix Fixe lunch @ $67 or will offer a la carte.  Very good tuna crudo, tatare.  Very good pastas ( garganelli, Agnolotti).  Attentive service. Quite expensive for lunch.
Marea always is outstanding ‚Äî wonderful good quality and service.   It is expensive, however.
Everything was delicious.

I was celebrating my kids first trip in New York and after two days of cramming tourist attractions and activities all day we needed to unwind and relax while enjoying a delicious meal that warmed the heart... though it‚Äôs a fancy restaurant and very upscale I can say my kids and my husband and I enjoyed the best spaghetti with butter we had in our lives... the rest of the more intricate food items like the lobster risotto the steak the halibut the burrata lobster were divine. Definitly if your kids are not too loud ( my son Definitly was so i gave him my phone to keep entertained) it‚Äôs a definit must go restaurant for food, comfort, and that finesse touche.
Terrific food and great service
Marea has exceptional food, wine & service - always a perfect experience!
The food was wonderful and the atmosphere was perfect for indulging
it was a really great experience for a special occasion.

We went to this fabulous restaurant over the holidays, had a delicious dinner and could not wait to return when back in a Manhattan from South Carolina.  This time I booked an afternoon Valentine meal as we had concert plans for the evening.  We chose the five course tasting menu and had one of the best experiences ever!  We thoroughly enjoyed each dish, mostly consisting of exquisite seafood and specialty pasta, paired with some fabulous wines.  My partner stayed with the white wine accompaniments while I enjoyed the lighter reds that were selected.  Service was outstanding, and there was still an air of romance at the corner booth despite it being 230 in the afternoon!  Marea will be on our calendar every time we visit the Big Apple!
Marea made my husband's birthday very special, giving us a wonderful seat and bringing a festive dessert, on top of the amazing food!
Valentines
The food was superior.  The service was superior.  The staff was efficient and appropriately friendly.  The best meal during our trip to NYC.
Perfect spot for our birthday celebration!!!
Marea never disappoints, it was amazing as always. Michael provided excellent service.
We go every year for dinner on our anniversary and few times during the rest of the year for a special occasion. Never fails to exceed our expectations!! We love this restaurant!!!
It's one of our favorite places in New York. Food ,Service, location, ambiance is always excellent
Marea Continue to provide a restaurant with pleasant ambience relaxing atmosphere excellent cuisine and attentive but obsequious service.
The food is outstanding at this restaurant.  The service is top notch also
One of the top restaurants in the city.  My wife and I were saying afterward that it was literally one of the best meals we have ever had.  Amazing restaurant start to finish.

Food was amazing. Servers changed often and didn‚Äôt inform us. Nobody offered another glass of wine until ours had been empty for over ten minutes. Seemed like our table was forgettable. Probably won‚Äôt return.
Always an amazing meal at Market! We go every time we are in San Diego. It‚Äôs worth the ride!!!
Very innovating dishes with great taste. You won't get bored here. There is something for everybody and all dishes are expertly prepared. Great wine list and exceptional service. Well run machine
Food was outstanding maybe as good as I have every had and that includes the French Laundry.  Service was not as good as the food a little slow.

Service was a bit slower than previous visits and entres took longer than expected (based on experience at Market) to come out of the kitchen. Food was, as always, excellent. My wife's gluten allergy was forgotten (waiter asked when we arrived as they always do) when the restaurant brought out a cake based desert to celebrate our aniversary - somebody  dropped the ball.
One of the best meals I‚Äôve had. Creative dishes. Friendly attentive wait staff.

We went to Market to celebrate my wife's birthday. Market is one of our favorite restaurants. The food is always great. The decor of the restaurant is lacking (needs a refresh) but the food is amazing. We both did the tasting menu and I have to tell you it ranks up there with the few times I've eaten at Addison. Since the portions are bigger at Market I would say it was my best dining experience in the 5 years we have lived in San Diego. We will certainly visit again but really wish they gave the place a face lift.
Great meal.  Food was excellent.

The unpleasant part of this evening for me was that the A/C was blowing directly on my shoulders all evening long and there was no way of getting away from it. And believe me I always love A/C everywhere I go.

The ‚Äúcomplimentary valet‚Äù is a confusing concept... you still want to tip the valet, but who carries cash these days? So just be prepared to bring cash so you can tip the valet.Hostess was not warm, as a hostess should be. However, the waiters were exceptional! Thank you. Very friendly. I don‚Äôt think management should require them to memorize specials of the day, as it comes across very rehearsed, awkward, and off-putting. Save them the embarrassing stress & just write it on a simple menu card. I love a dark, cozy ambiance & this place is that exactly. The food was good but I noticed on the tasting menu the same base sauces and ingredients were repeated a few times. If you don‚Äôt like salmon, don‚Äôt order the trout... it tastes identical. The Cabernet braised short rib was insanely delicious. I was accidentally given a restaurant week menu & the manager was kind enough to honor the discounted prices on the menu I was presented with. Thank you. Very generous gesture.Some of the side panel wood near my table was very dusty (attention to cleanliness details always appreciated), and there were a few annoying gnats buzzing around that I had to keep swatting away & this interfered with my relaxed dining mood.
Always an amazing experience eating at Market. Food is truly awesome!!
Just outstanding. The food is the best in town.

Market is in my top two restaurants in San Diego! Always delicious, service is great, a fabulous experience. My only wish is that some of the tables were a little bit further apart so we don't hear every word of the conversation next to us. Of course, this will not keep us from returning again and again for Chef Schroeder's amazing cuisine!
We are never disappointed. The food is amazing matched only by the service.
Food was salty. Our main dish came late.  I will not come back again. It's our 2nd time here.
PROBABLY THE BEST RESTAURANT WE HAVE VISITED IN SAN DIEGO...AND WE HAVE VISITED QUITE A FEW.  FOOD WAS JUST OUTSTANDING!  WOULD LIKE IT EVEN BETTER IF IT WAS A BIT LESS EXPENSIVE.
I really think the food is way too salty. Too saucy, drenched in sauce, to be honest.If you claim to use great ingredients, let the flavor shine through.

This is one the few restaurants in San Diego that we go to if we want a special treat.  We partook of the SD Restaurant Week menu and it was outstanding, beautifully plated and wonderful flavors.  No skimping on quality.  The waiter was respectful and knowledgeable.  Highly recommend.

We were impressed by the way you creat each dish- subtle but colorful balance of the well chosen ingredients! Particularly blue cheese souffl√©. Only one disappointment was the beef for the main- it was a little too salty and was the sauce, too. Other than that all great and we will come back in future.

√úber Jahre hinweg konsistent bestes Restaurant in San Diego. Wir wurden noch nie entt√§uscht. Immer innovativ, wunderbare Zutaten und wunderbaren Kreationen. Service regelm√§√üig ausgezeichnet. Gro√ües Restaurant mit vielen G√§sten und trotzdem logistisch perfekt organisiert.

Dinner for 4 during restaurant week.  Arrived a bit early waited at the bar and were seated promptly at the reservation time.  The dining room is set up nicely and (kudos) for once no stupid tables.  The place was busy but the noise level moderate!!  Food overall was excellent - an interesting take on a tuna tartar,  excellent corn soup with smoked port.  Entr√©es were trout, duck and beef tenderloin - all very well prepared - portions very adequate.  Desserts yummy.  Attentive, efficient and polite service!!!!Bar selection OK - not really great and along with the wine list insanely overpriced.  A clear indication that they are catering to the Rancho Santa Fe crowd. In all a very enjoyable evening and will visit again when in the area
We really enjoyed the food and the service was excellent. We will return for next restaurant week.
Ate off the restaurant menu with wine pairing.  Great food, and our waiter was outstanding.  Expensive, but still great value.
Always love Market and this was no exception. Delicious.
Amazing food and service, as always at this gem of a restaurant!

Have eaten here many times... thought the food was heavy on the salt as did everyone else.  Two meals were fish, two were beef.  This has never occurred before.  We were disappointed as the the food has always been perfectly seasoned...the desserts and wine pairings were wonderful.
Our favorite restaurant in San Diego! The food was and is always amazing. Service is top notch!
Loved the atmosphere , food, service. They‚Äôre truly professional . Enough waiters so you don‚Äôt feel left out. My favorite üòÑüëç
Simple put, there is no other restaurant like Market. The food is always delicious and unique. Its our favorite place to dine.
Restaurant week and date night. All was amazing but the tenderloin was too salty. The wine pairing was great. The green apple sorbet and berry dessert were amazing. The pear salad was to die for!

We dined during Restaurant Week and had a great experience.  Nice selection of starters, entrees and deserts.  Our waiter was terrific.  The wine pairings were not quite as well paired as in the past, but were still interesting.  Of course, we'll keep coming back to this marvelous restaurant.
Perfect and delicious
Birthday - was wonderful!
Best restaurant in the San Diego area. The freshest ingredients, exquisite on the palate, awesome wines.....Market has it all!

Went to the Market for my wife‚Äôs birthday - overall an enjoyable evening.  We started with the corn soup (great) and burrata cheese & peach salad (good) - we then shared the forest mushroom ravioli (good but incredibly rich & salty) and the grilled beef tenderloin/lobster combo - the tenderloin was again much too salty.  Both my wife and I left with a lingering salty aftertaste and told the waiter as much.  The waiter was very attentive & we appreciated the birthday dessert - just cut back on the copious amounts of salt.
Great staff and food!
great neighborhood favorite. we order the market salad (off the menu).the fig salad was very good.duck special was excellent.
Good service and staffs, Amazing cuisine!
We had a delicious meal.  Party of four and we each ordered a different app and entree so that we could try a variety of menu items.  Everything was wonderful. Best meal we‚Äôve had in a long time.

Food here is ALWAYS amazing!!!We did not love our server this visit though... she was below par the others we have had in past visits.We will absolutely return... just hope to have a different server that‚Äôs a true representation of this fine dining establishment.
My favorite restaurant..Recommend it to all my friends
Great food, great service.Observing all the necessary precautions.You can dine here with complete confidence.

Very good experience overall. The service was great in spite of the social distancing requirements, the food was outstanding for every one of the four people in the party. Would highly recommend this establishment
As always, it was such a great experience. √∞≈∏¬•¬∞
Food is always excellent and love the flour less chocolate cake
Limited menu upon just opening up but most favorites there, including tuna tartare
Always a pleasure to dine at Mistral! Soooo glad they're open again!
I like the French atmosphere. The food is good.

First let me start by saying it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s my wife√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s favorite restaurant. She was so excited for our sat evening reservation, being that it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s so hard to get in there. service was slow and we had an issue with both lamb chops and steak. Came out in a pool of oil. Was really bad. They did take it right back and off the the check as they should off but nothing else was done and I ended up paying 120$ for soup salad and bottle of wine. Very disappointed. Evening was ruined. Hope they can make up for it
Food was astounding. Warm goat cheese salad, beautiful fish, juicy pork tenderloin. Great wine. It was a delightful dining experience.
We love Mistral!!   All our special occasions are celebrated there!!!  Staff and food over the top!!!
Best restaurant in L.A.  Very romantic. Outstanding food and service. A neighborhood gem.  Highly recommended.
waiters are most attentive and made our evening dining experience very comfortable.  food was delicious.
Best tuna tartar ever, especially with special of added lump meat crab. Bronzino with crust skin delicious. John Dory great too.  Terrific french fries  with their mustard and not ketchup.

We went for a birthday celebration and had a wonderful experience.I had already had lunch here and enjoyed it but this was my first time dining.The food is exquisite, the staff attentive and knowledgeable. We had a fantastic time and will be repeat customers.
Great as always!  Our neighborhood favorite.
Always feels like being on vacation in a French cafe! Warm and welcoming owner & staff and food never dissapoints
Friend√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s birthday dinner

We have been there before and had an amazing dinner, however....This night, everything just seemed off! The food was mediocre, the menu was different and the noise level was so loud we couldn't hear ourselves talk when this was supposed to be a romantic dinner.  For the price, I would have expected much more. We were very disappointed
All around excellent!
Always a treat.   I've never been disappointed with dining here.
Mistral is the best! Everything about this restaurant is first class!Always coming back.
Great service, awesome food. Will definitely return!
Always a special treat going to Mistral's the food and service are ALWAYS

I have loved Mistral since it opened. I go back 30+ years. I had my 40th birthday dinner and countless others there. Unfortunately, the expense has made it a special occasion place for me now. Even still, on those occasions, I always enjoy being there. The food, its quality, the service and decor all make Mistral one of the best restaurants to which I have been. I recommend it without hesitation.
From the service to the food, excellent..I had the lamb chops which were delicious.
Too too loud and table too close.  Not for the price.  Food was delicious and good service.
My favorite place to go! Henri and Raul (and entire staff) are amazing! Food is delicious!
Great cooking, top-notch ingredients, attentive, fast and helpful service, very friendly staff. Excellent bar and ample and expertly selected wine list.  Street and valet parking.
Our favorite place for date night or out with friends. Absolutely love Mistral --Excellent People, Food, Service and Bar. Thank you Raul, Henry, Frank & Dana!
Celebrating my dear friend birthday
As always, food, drinks & service was excellent. Love this restaurant.
I love this restaurant. Mistral has the best French cuisine and excellent service in a pretty setting.
Excellent restaurant with superb food and service. I go there regularly for special occasions or not.

It was dine L.A. however, we'd been several times when not dine l.a.   Everything is done beautifully - every morsel delicious (no skimping on portions), excellent service.  definitely French.  Valet. Bar.
I love this restaurant. The food is great, the staff very friendly, and it feels very homey.

Dine LA menu is fabulous, generous and luxurious. Aquarello rice risotto with escargot and wild mushrooms,f followed by an entire butter-poached main lobster.Chocolate souffle for dessert. Stunningly prepared! The service is great altogether welcoming milieu.Catch this amazing meal!
These guys are the best in Sherman Oaks! Fish, Pasta, souffle', bread pudding amazing!
first time here and will be returning. the food was great but the service and ambiance was stellar!
Love going to Mistral . . great spot, great staff and consistently delicious food!  Enjoy it every time!

Mistral is consistently very good. This time, it was really excellent, from the amuse bouche to the souffle. My entree was duck confit, which was served with Brussels sprouts, squash and potato puree. I made myself stop eating halfway through the very generous portion so that I could enjoy dessert, but I made sure to take the rest home because I wasn't going to miss a single bite.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Dinner was fabulous. I can't wait to go back! Of note was our wonderful waitress. Thoughtful, knowledgeable and just lovely.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The food was a bit too salty. However the presentation of the food, room ambience and service was excellent.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Lovely menu, well-executed dishes.  Interesting wine list and excellent service.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: One of the best Michelin starred restaurants in NYC with zero stuffiness. Incredible value. I am going as much as I can. Need I say more?

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Great little hideaway bar with interesting history at Grand Central Terminal.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: my favorite restaurant in NYC these days. go go go go

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: We always love coming here. The atmosphere manages to be intimate and buzzy at the same time. The service/food/wine is impeccable. Since it is a no-tipping restaurant, the price point ends up being well below other restaurants that aren't even on its level. Definitely recommend!

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: While the food was very good, the service was NOT attentive (unless you were the wealthy couple sitting near us who had chefs come out from the kitchen to fawn on them).  We had to ASK our waiter for a refill of our water glasses and then nobody actually did it until we finally stopped a suit clad higher functionary who actually did the work himself.  Staff training is needed (as is an attitude adjustment).

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: While waitstaff is polite and knowledgeable, they were slow during a midday rush.  Perhaps too few people for the guest load.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The food and the service was outstanding!

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: After so many years, the Modern has maintained its high standard with food, service and ambience! Its a reliable place to go back to!

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The atmosphere, the service, and the food make this our favorite place to eat in New York.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Great casual place. The food is creative and delicious, the service was great.I highly recommend it.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: I have dined at the Modern Bar room dozens of time-never had a bad meal-you can't go wrong if you decide to eat there and it is also very popular for just drinks.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Great food

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Everything was great. The setting, the food and the wait staff. We had a lovely evening. Will definitely visit again

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Great as always!!

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: With the MOMA renovations causing closure of the art museum temporarily, we had to skip our annual visit. However, the Bar at the Modern was available so we were able to enjoy a marvellous Saturday lunch.  Service was skilled and our waiter was very well informed on the options and preparation details. Every course of our three course meal was amazing in taste and presentation.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
