column3: I cannot believe the huge disappointment I experienced at The Bar at the Modern, which has been one of my favorite spots in NYC since it opened...we even celebrated there the day of the birth of our first grandson eleven and a half years ago...and I always want friends visiting us in NYC to meet us at The Bar at the Modern.I brought a friend who had never been to the restaurant for lunch, specifically to try the tart d'alsace.This was a new food for her...when this rectangle that looked like a slice of pizza arrived I was shocked.That is not a tart d'alsace,  I thot...it had a lot of red and green in it...not the creamy white I was accustomed to...and the taste was unidentifiable...my friend said all she could taste was salt.  I did not complain...at least I thot the tart was edible, but could not explain the taste.My baby gem lettuce salad was ok,  but not as lovely as I expiated, to the eye and the tongue.My friend was aghast that the soup of the day cost 24 dollars, but she ordered it as she was not very hungry (we lunched early...ll:45 )...I was so devastated that I considered, and still am ,  writing directly to Danny Meyer.  He would be horrified had he been at our table yesterday Aug 30. I will not be returning to The Modern, unless an explanation is given.  I can get a beautiful tart d'alsace at BENOIT, as I did on Aug l9...the size of the tart was generous and share - able with 5 other people at my table for drinks and small plates...the size of the MODERN's tart was not even enough for two.Ah well..in the big picture of life I can handle such a disappointment.  But this indeed feels like a loss of one of my favorite places in NYC.Patricia Lahrmer Ross on Aug 3l 20l9

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Great service, fantastic food, highly recommend

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Great dinner!

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The overall experience was top notch.  This proved to be a perfect choice for the night.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The food and service at the Modern Bar Room were excellent.  I was also struck by the quality and presentation temperature of the wines by the glass.  Many restaurants in nyc serve very poor wines by the glass kept at the wrong temperature.  This was not at all the case at the Modern - the wine was excellent.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The food is so high quality and the tastes explode in the dish. The crispy salmon was tremendous.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: We had an amazing meal here, and it really made me want to experience the main dining room someday. My spouse and I each ordered the three course tasting menu, choosing an appetizer, entree, and dessert. I had the wine pairings as well, while he ordered a Manhattan.  Every single thing I ate was perfect. My very favorite was the charred avocado with peekytoe crab. The flavors and textures of that dish will stay with me for a long time to come. I cannot recommend it highly enough. My spouse started with the corn soup, which I had almost ordered. It was very tasty, but nowhere near as good as the avocado. The service was very attentive, with our water frequently refilled and being checked in with regularly. The time between courses might have felt long if you were in a hurry or very hungry, but for us it was the perfect pacing. The room definitely has a lively atmosphere, which is nice, though the tables are quite close and it was hard to tune out the conversation at the table next to us.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The bartenders were very attentive and demonstrated great mixology Skills as well as menu knowledge.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Caesar was just an amazing service provider - his suggestions were spot on and so was the service provided by every other member  at this restaurant, thank you for making a huge difference in the way you treat your guests.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Food was terrific.  Staff was very accommodating.  However the room smelled of fresh paint.  That is very unappetizing.  Perhaps the restaurant should close on days when it is freshly painted.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: As always a most pleasurable dining experience. The wine list is extraordinary as are the prices with only a handful below triple digits.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Fabulous restaurant week menu ...we both had the salmon that was cooked to perfection. Service was excellent...waiter/waitresses friendly and professional..

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: The ambiance, door and service were spot on. The ‚Äòannouncement‚Äô of each dish was over the top and unnecessary, particularly when some of the dishes were repetitive from one diner to the next. It seemed silly and disingenuous. $18 for a glass of white wine had us passing on spirits at lunch. It would have been nice for the iced tea drinker and the coffee drinkers to be offered seconds for the price of $7.00 for an iced tea and $6.00 for a cup of Joe. It‚Äôs the little things...

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Perfection!  Fabulous food, great service, lovely ambience.  Can't wait to go back :)

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Was visiting this place twice during a restaurant week.  Amazing a nd delicious food, great service!!! Thank you!!!!

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Fantastic! Wait staff excellent. Picked two course restaurant menu for lunch. Amazing salmon and cavatelli dishes. Cocktails sublime. Also, the modern is a no tip establishment but you wod never know it, the service was impeccable.  Only negative was we had planned on going next door to MOMA but its closed until mid October.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: We really like and enjoyed the service and the food! We go to upscale restaurants sometimes. This one is at the top of the list of the restaurants we went in terms of the food taste. Highly recommend.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Service was very nice and sweet. Food is of great quality and value. Went there for the restaurant week but will certainly go back again.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: This was a terrific evening made all the better by the attentiveness of Maitre d' Michele Molier.  I had managed to put our reservation on the calendar for the incorrect date.  We showed  up a day early and could not have returned on the next night.  Michele  led us to the bar and then went to work finding us an  table.  Shortly we were escorted to an ideal table for memorable dinner.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Disappointing from start to finish. We have come to value the Modern on our ‚ÄúA‚Äù List of fine cuisine. We selected the Restaurant Week offerings. Servers lacked adequate knowledge of the vintages. ‚ÄúShort‚Äù pours dominated. The Main course was bland and tasteless. Two slices of bread were an additional charge. Rather insulting. Wine pairings were delayed with food arrival. The meal was rushed although there was ample seating. Our servers were not attentive. The only redeeming part was the support table staff. The Modern has been always exceptional. Unfortunately this experience falls into the ONE STAR category ... at best.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Wonderful time. Everything is perfect from start to finish.

column1: The Modern - Bar Room and Dining Room
column3: Exquisite!
Outstanding food and service.  If you like tasting menus it doesn't get much better.
Absolutely fantastic. Food and staff were both amazing.
What a great experience. Nice staff, amazing food, and a good wine pairing.
Absolutely amazing experience. Highly recommend it if you‚Äôre looking for a treat. The atmosphere is lovely.

The entire experience from start to finish was excellent. We were there celebrating a special event, the staff made special arrangements for us and brought in some items from outside vendors for us. Food and service was top notch, chefs were engaging energetic, friendly and professional. I cannot emphasize enough how on top of their game this group, both front of house and chefs are. Actually what comes to mind when thinking about our experience is how impressed we were with the entire team. Tasting menu was off the charts as were the drink pairings. We are not from the New York region so do not know when we will be back, however the evening is one that we will always remember. A special thanks to the entire crew for a magical evening!
Great food, great service. Highly recommend doing the wine pairing. A great night :)
Excellent all around. It deserves the 2 Michelin stars that it has.
The entrance was hard to find, but located in an alley. Astoundingly delicious meal. Service was top notch. We would gladly return.

Goes without saying. This place is among the most amazing tables in the world. Eating at Ko is equivalent to receive a doctor's prescription, have a major update about taste and receive a masterclass about service, all in the same time.
Super!!!!Ich liebe es!!!!
Amazing food and amazing service, what more could you ask for?!
Wonderful food paired with excellent wine.
The most memorable tasting menu experience! Excellent food, non-pretentious and focused on intense flavours. Loved the relaxed setting and impeccable service. #PartyInMyMouth

We had a fantastic dinner. The flavor combinations were innovative and incredible. The service was wonderful. Not only were they attentive, but they engaged with our questions and made us feel like they cared what we thought. We also went to Le Bernardin and Eleven Madison Park on this trip and Ko was our favorite of the three.

Everything was wonderful.Food and wine pairings were excellent.My only gripe was the lack of detailed explanations on one or two courses of the tasting menu. But at that point, I'm just splitting hairs.Overall, I had a fantastic experience.

One of the greatest eating experiences I have ever had. I am a loyal listener and follower of David Chang and this was my very first time to experience one of his restaurants.My sister took me for my 60th birthday. I truly was not ready for such a great experience . The staff was so engaging and connected with my sister and me beyond anything I had ever experienced before in a restaurant. I tell everyone that I would not order anything we had on a menu , but everything was delicious and so much part of the experience.  We had listened to the pod cast that day about Ko and we had so many questions (need to meet Sean and Sue) . The person who worked with us truly connected and kept adding to our experience.  We asked about the Japanese Cheese Cake mentioned in the pod . She told us she could not get it for us - They it appeared with a candle in it. You should know that we posted on Face book and you are going to get a lot of new people . If its David Chang we are in

Momofuku Ko was an incredible experience.  We got to sample things we most likely never would have eaten if it wasn't for this night.  Service is exemplary, and the food is Incredible.  We also enjoyed the Alcohol Pairing.  Be prepared for an expensive night out, but one you will never forget.
Great food  and pairing
Everything was perfect from start to finish.   Loved the playlist üé∂
I had a great time with my girlfriend celebrating Valentine‚Äôs Day week.

Food was okay. Wine was great. Service was good. We went for the tasting menu and it went on for 3 hours through no fault of our own, and they asked to move us for the next people. That was absolutely wild to me. Not worth the $1,000 we paid.
Impeccable food and service! Well worth the splurge for a special occasion. We look forward to returning for our next anniversary, and will be visiting the bar in the meantime!

Loved it!  All of the good things about a pretentious tasting menu (impeccable service, delicious food made with great ingredients) with none of the pretense. It was casual, fun, and laid-back but definitely still something special. Highly recommend!

They were trying to do sushi and wagyu yakiniku, but when it's so easy to find authentic Japanese restaurants in NYC with chefs from Japan with years of experience, I felt like their attempts were not quite successful. Given that the majority of their courses were very much focused around the Japanese cuisine, I would probably just go to a Japanese restaurant.

Great ambiance. Nice to sit at the counter and watch the meals' preparation. Very interesting creations/compositions, most of the 12 dishes are a success  (sea urchin and chickpea puree, what?!) and only a couple of "disappointments" (seabass only "so so" / "whatever" ...). Enjoyed drinking sake too. No surprise with the bill with the unique menu (and service is included)
Semplicemente tutto TOP...Grazie ragazzi di tutto.
A wonderful experience - a combination of creativity, great service and a comfortable ambience.

such thoughtful and imaginative food in a welcoming ambiance. I go once a year, but was greeted as a regular, my champagne choice was remembered, had enjoyable, non fake chats with chefs and the manager. Such fun to watch the chefs and wait each surprise. Nearly always perfect balance of tastes and texture. Umami often, acid balance, little spikes of salt. My favorite NYC meal!
The 4 hour lunch was a fabulous gastronomic adventure - priced a bit higher than where I think it  should be, but still quite an experience!

An exceptional dining experience. Got to try foods and wines that I'd never have had access to otherwise. The preparation and experience were elegant but didn't alienate me as the guest. A must-do for anyone that takes food seriously.

One of the best meals I‚Äôve ever had. Granted I don‚Äôt eat like this often, but if I had the money I‚Äôd do it again. It was a once in a lifetime opportunity for me and I‚Äôd do it again, in an instant.

David Chang does not cook here. It‚Äôs the farm team - everyone is working hard and professionally - and seems about 23 years old.Specified a pescatarian menu in response to management‚Äôs solicitation some days in advance.  At the resto a chef asked ‚ÄúWhat do you think of duck?‚Äù  I think duck is not a fish.The place is maybe fine for tourists but not for NYC locals looking to be wowed.  It delivers neither the wizardry of an Alinea nor the solid reliability of a Le Bernardin.
Amazing. If you‚Äôre thinking about going - don‚Äôt hesitate just do it
Very personable and knowledgeable staff! The tasting menu is an intricate blend of flavors, decadence, and most importantly texture. A must visit!

One of my best dining experiences! Thank You so much to the team at Momofuku KO for making me fool so at home and looked after me sooo well! I HIGHLY recommend a meal here!!!! The Rice Cream should be permanently on the menu... just saying!!!
This was one of the best meals I have ever eaten!
Unbelievable experience. Amazing food and attentive and warm service. The people there are the best!
Amazing meal every time. Must do "wine" pairings, which includes other drinks besides wines. Sit at the counter. Cooking can be a spectator sport.
Absolutely wonderful experience throughout.
Yule present to each other.
Great job with socially distancing and masked staff.
Our server was fantastic!  Wish our table wasn't right in front of the kitchen though.  We had a great time and the food was amazing.Looking forward to our next visit.
Fabulous as always, from the ambience and service to the food. My favorite!
Best food! Best service!!  Love this restaurant!!
Everything was outstanding. The service & food were fantastic
Excellent service and amazing food!!  The staff made us feel very comfortable. We can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Been eating here for years and EVERYTHING is delicious!  I always go for the fish special because its always fantastic.  Hubby loves the Fish & Chips.

First time back since the re-opening and it was very good. Staff and service was excellent, they followed safe distance and hygiene protocol as required.  All the food was terrific, one exception being the pasta special, which had overcooked sauce with a burned bottom of the pan taste to it and the noodles were undercooked-to the point of being a bit stiff. Overall very pleased that one of our favorite places is open and will only get better!

We were there to celebrate my husband‚Äòs 35th birthday. Everything was spot on, from the service to the food to the drinks. We really appreciated how seriously they took social distancing and Covid precautions. Will definitely be back again soon! Have already recommended to my friends who are leery about going out to restaurants right now.
Favorite place in Dallas!!
We had an amazing night here this week! Can‚Äôt wait to go all the time now !
Food was delicious as always, and wonderful service.
Fun atmosphere, great service, and outstanding food.  Will definitely make this one a regular stop.
Knocked it out of the park in the new norm with safe environment, service and best food in the city-dare I say world right now!
Always a favorite!  Food and Service was outstanding!
When we arrived they were closed yet we had a confirmed reservation. It‚Äôs a great place. We will try again.
It was closed when we arrived. we‚Äôve eaten here many times and it is Excellent!  But so disappointed to arrive to a locked door and no notice.

Last time we were at NHS prior to the stay at home order and it was as good as it always is. I miss it so much! GM Julia is always so helpful and accommodating with my dairy allergy and we had Marcus as our waiter who kills it every time. My boyfriend and I cannot wait until our next visit! Miss you guys so much.
As always, the best place in Dallas!
The schnitzel, fried chicken and fish were all delicious. Good drinks too.

A wonderful dining experience each and every time! Make sure you book your reservation early as this hot commodity books up! Though you can always eat at the bar where Rob and Alex will take excellent care of you!
Great vibe and great food.
Food and waiter were very good.  Felt rushed as the restaurant became busier and they wanted to turn the tables.  It is really the only negative I would say about the restaurant.
The hostess Emily makes every visit special! We will be back soon!
A wonderful dining experience!
Always great food, service and ambiance.
Same as usual - excellent.Waiter was outstanding and had everything covered without being intrusive.

We were celebrating our friends recent engagement (haven‚Äôt seen them since) and we chose NHS to treat them as a surprise. I‚Äôd put in the comments of the reservation we were hoping for a nice table or booth to celebrate this night out. Instead, we were placed right in front of the noisy, highly trafficked kitchen. We felt that the service was rushed the entire time, from when we first sat down and were asked if we want to put in an order for food before our drink orders were taken to when our water glasses were stripped from the table. Also, we had very little time to enjoy our cocktails before being rushed to order a bottle of wine with our dinner. Overall, the food was very good, but when we chose to pay a premium and spend our money on a special occasion I would expect better service and treatment.
Excellent service and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Thank you!
Delicious food, very good service but very noisy.
Great food and service as always.
Food and service were top notch, as always!  Consistently the most enjoyable place in town!
Always always outstanding food and service!
Love the food and service, but too many tables leading to too noisy an atmosphere
Place is great. It‚Äôs been a go-to spot for anniversaries, birthdays, and just a nice dinner out.  Love it here.
Delicious as always. Neighborhood Services is consistently fabulous.
Great service, good food..hard to have a conversation across the table
Superb meal with a delightful ambiance.
Great food and service!
Valentine‚Äôs Day

We have tried various "high-end" restaurants in Cincinnati, but none compare to the  Plam Court at the Netherland.  From the elegant environment, personable and knowledgeable wait-staff, to the unparalleled cuisine, one is never disappointed!

Wonderful dining experience. From the moment we arrived we were treated as special guests. The food, service and ambiance was all excellent. The room is one of a kind and sets the stage for a wonderful evening. One of Cincinnati‚Äôs very best restaurants.
The service was attentive without being overbearing.   The restaurant is beautiful with a feeling of elegance.   The food was superb.  Overall a very memorable dining experience.

It was our 25th wedding anniversary and we had a lovely time! The hostess, bread server, and our server, Chris, all wished us happy anniversary, as well as as a card from the restaurant! The food was fun and delicious!

We've had lunch buffets (Easter, Mothers' Day, etc. at Orchids. They were all very good. Our first opportunity to dine at Orchids was a real experience. Comparing Orchids to the old Maisonette, Boca and Restaurant L (the three legitimate 5-star restaurants we've been to) is a real challenge. Orchids' service staff was above outstanding. Quiet and efficient, the table was cleaned and readied for the next course. The food was wondrous. The seared foie gras, Spanish mackerel, made us want more. The first plates are intentionally small and left us wanting more. Our Monkfish was superbly prepared and surrounded by great food. The chocolate dessert was a wonder. We can't say enough positive about Orchids/ We can also mention that the price was relatively low. Orchids is an unqualified winner.

Service was excellent! Enjoyed our first and second courses immensely, especially bleu cheese beignets and Spanish mackerel. However, we had the monkfish and ribeye entrees and felt that both were lacking and not impressive. Monkfish was dry and seemed overcooked, bouillabaisse was one note and didn‚Äôt hit the mark for us. Ribeye was cooked perfectly and had beautiful presentation, but the flavor was not great, I‚Äôve had much better steaks at chain restaurants.

The Orchids is in a spectacular setting in the historic Netherlands Hotel in downtown Cincinnati. The setting is idea for a relaxing, romantic dinner, or intimate small gathering. Tables are elegant and widely spaced, so very conducive to conversation. No other ambient noise or music. The service is highly attentive and the pacing of the meal was spot on. It was fascinating to watch the choreography of the staff (and the service is clearly choreographed). The staff was friendly, but with a degree of professional aloofness given the more formal dining setting. The prices are expensive although not out of range for the setting. However, the food itself, while well prepared and presented, did not have the distinctive, memorable taste that would befit the prices. I had the ribeye which was well prepared and tasty, but not distinctive. My wife had the flounder which was disappointing in the portion size, taste and accompaniments. We opted to not have dessert, but the restaurant provided some petit fors which were the highlight of the meal. Overall, this is a wonderful place to make an impression and to enjoy a leisurely meal, but is very expensive for the quality and quantity of food. We would recommend, but with caveats.
Morgan, Tate and Oscar are wonderful and made our night fabulous.

The food was good, but bland.  The short ribs had a musty smell initially.   The risotto had good flavor except for the celery root.   The blue cheese salad was good.  Service was impressive and everything came out hot.  The restaurant itself is amazing and the Jazz band was a very nice touch.
Wonderful dinner with a friend in town for a visit.  Tate was amazing as our server, food and drinks were great, everyone we encountered went above and beyond, and it was a special time.
Incredible food and service.  Can see how they recently received the highest rating.
Chris and his team provided wonderful service!

Absolutely amazing food and service. Staff was knowledgeable and very friendly. I am pescatarian, no meat, and they catered to my diet and gave me a delicious chefs tasting that I will never forget. If you‚Äôre thinking about going, just go. You won‚Äôt regret it.

Great experience.  The food was excellent and complex, but delicious.  My wife and I each ordered four courses, which over the period of 2 hours was just the right amount of food. Service was excellent, and although the menu might be considered haute cuisine, our waiter made us feel very comfortable and at ease.
The food, service and ambiance are consistently superb.
Wish the meal had been better. Service and ambiance awesome.

I have consistently had excellent meals here, both at dinner and brunch.  This was an exception.  Service was lackluster, and the food was inconsistently good.  I knew we were in trouble when the bread arrived and was stale.  Overall, this experience did not match the price level.
Fantastic food, service, and hospitality in a beautiful environment.
This is our 2nd time coming here for a special occasion and it was fabulous, just like the first time. The food is exquisite and the service and ambiance couldn't be better!
This is a great restaurant for a special  occasion or just a very good dinner.  The presentation is especially good and the service is excellent.  I highly recommend Orchids.

Food was quite good.  The bouillabaisse was insultingly modest (filled with potatoes and little seafood [no monkfish as advertised].  For $48, you HAVE to do better!Service was very spotty.  Busing of the table barely occurred.  For a five star restaurant?Seemed like there was no one managing or guiding a VERY young staff.  Simply not impressive.Go to Restaurant L or Jeff Ruby to see how fine dining is done.Music was fantastic.  Ambience?  Fantastic.  Good waiter that had little support.
Everything was great!!  The food was perfection and service wonderful!!

Food and service were outstandingin every way, but the noise from the nearby bar was a little high for our taste. When dining at a restaurant of the quality and price point, a quieter atmosphere would be appreciated.

This has become an annual tradition for my wife's birthday.  Each year we continue to be impressed with the knowledge and attentiveness of the wait staff.  The food is always excellent and the ambiance unmatched.  Many thanks to Orchids for a memorable night on a special occasion!

This was my second time dining at Orchids at Palm Court.  The first time I dined here was last year and it was fantastic.  This year was a different story.  To start off, it should be noted that this is a relatively expensive restaurant and therefore comes with certain expectations beyond food, service and ambiance being two of them.  We were seated by a very friendly, knowledgeable, and professional greeter, Morgan.  Our server, Oscar, was also very professional.  However, it took 40 minutes from the time we were seated to meet Oscar.  He was extremely busy and for a Saturday night Orchids was poorly staffed--labor cuts?  In any event, we were looking forward to the actual meal.  My wife ordered the blue cheese beignet salad, popcorn grits, and scallops.  I ordered the beef cheek perogies, maitake/cappelletti, and lamb.  My wife's salad was very overdressed and almost seemed as if there was too much salad dressing on it, then the chefs decided to pour olive oil on it--what a disappointment.  The popcorn grits, on the other hand, were flavorful and delicious and I would definitely recommend this unique and tasty dish!  And my wife's third course of scallops were cooked perfectly.  My order was a different story.  First, my perogies had absolutely no flavor whatsoever-no salt, pepper, herb, or sauce-and therefore was unsurprisingly very bland.  The maitake and cappelletti were terrific and cooked perfectly, and the sauce was a perfect pairing (you should order this).  But sadly, my entr√©e was lackluster.  The lamb was almost rare and had, once again, no flavor.  The entr√©e did come with two bites of lamb sausage and creamy polenta, but the what should have been the star of the plate, the protein, disappointed in flavor and the way it was cooked.Along with service being painfully slow, the staff always seemed rushed and in a hurry to leave the table.  The staff was so hurried that for our second course they gave my wife and me the wrong second course.  Loud patrons.

A fantastic all-around dining experience once again. The consistency of excellence with food, service, and ambiance is truly amazing and makes Orchids a must-do for any special occasion, celebration, love of life, or a memorable date with your loved one(s). The beauty of the art-deco hotel, restaurant, and bar in general...along with the spectacular ceiling, walls, lobby, and furnishings... make this a world-class venue and a fine-dining opportunity you do not want to miss.
The food, ambience, details, and service at Orchids made the experience very special.

Beautiful surroundings in an old ‚Äúart-deco‚Äù environment. Good food, not great food a bit disappointing considering the price. Very, very slow service. We were there for 3  1/2 hrs for dinner.   It‚Äôs nice to make an evening out of a nice dinner but this was just too long.

Everything was handled with great aplomb and the effort to create a very pleasant occasion! Obviously, the staff wanted my wife and I to celebrate our wedding anniversary in exemplary fashion, and succeeded.  The only drawback was the telephone call to our residence to confirm our coming.  I always try to surprise my wife on such occasions, but she answered the phone.

We hadn‚Äôt dined at Orchids for many years and decided to go back this past Friday night. We were greeted promptly and noticed a lively happy hour going on at the bar. We were seated promptly at a nice intimate quiet table for 2. Service was flawless except a slight delay getting cream and sweetener for our coffee and tea. An apology was issued and offer to pay for our hot drinks which was very nice. Our food was delicious and well paced with chef surprises to taste along the way. The drinks were tasty and popcorn grits delicious as were our scallops and short ribs. We shared a chocolate dessert and enjoyed the sweet surprises at the end. All in all a lovely experience. We‚Äôll go back soon!

I literally couldn‚Äôt wait to review this restaurant- and I NEVER leave reviews.  Unbelievable execution in service.  The food was great but the beef cheek pierogi was by far my favorite thing.  Tate, Chris and Morgan made the experience that much better as I enjoyed chatting with them.  Cant wait to come back!!

Great aesthetic but the menu was disappointing compared to the level of restaurant it is. For Cincinnati it‚Äôs towards the top of the pile but if you‚Äôre coming from a larger city with more like options this place falls a little short.  Service was fantastic but the food needs a bit of a refresh and the pricing isn‚Äôt appropriate for what you got (a bit high for the area and quality). Overall would say give it a shot but coming from Chicago with such a rich food scene this place fell flat

The food was heavenly as was the overall experience. The entire staff goes above and beyond to ensure your experience is great. They even called the valet to make sure our car was there waiting for us.
The service and experience at Orchid were outstanding. The food was delicious but comparable to other upscale restaurants in town.
We went for a romantic Christmas dinner, service was lovely and the food was interesting.

My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at Orchids and had the best dining experience ever! The service was wonderful from the valet parking to the wait staff. We felt well treated. Our waiter Chris was perfect, informative, attentive but not intrusive.  The ambiance is legendary in its beauty. The jazz music provided was very enjoyable.  The food was delicious (we had the scallops as our entree) and beautifully presented. The whole experience was  classic fine dining.
Tate was amazing!!
Outstanding food & service

We have dined here several times before and it has always been a memorable experience.Not so much this time. Service was outstanding but the food was mediocre for some and uninspired for others.  Not one, in our party of five, said their meal was great. I might try it again but with reservations.
We had a wonderful dinner to celebrate the Christmas Season. All of the food was delicious and the service was impeccable
We absolutely loved Oriole! The food was so tasty & the staff was very welcoming and accommodating. Ask ahead a few days for the vegetarian menu, you won't be disjointed!

I dined at Oriole in 2016 - the year they opened - with a friend. We knew then that they'd receive a Michelin star. Surprise, they have 2! Anyway, I finally returned a few nights ago to celebrate getting married. I did a pescetarian menu, though I am aware that the Wagyu dish is life-altering. Everything about the journey is perfect - from when you arrive, to the recommendations, to the food itself. We thank the staff of Oriole for a memorable evening. And also a huge thank you to the wonderful table next to us, who we found had left the best gift ever, when the bill arrived! Still a top 5 dining experience.
Food was 9.5+.  A bit small on portion but really exceptional Wine paring was a 10Service was a 10It was our first time. Really great for a special occasion.
As good an experience as we have had in any restaurant, in any city, in any country
Great inventive menu and wonderful service. Good for small numbers and foodies. Menu and wine is expensive, but on par for their status.
Outstanding as always.  Cannot wait to return and see what magic Chef Noah and Team can create.

The most unique Restaurant I have lately been!!!Intriguing entrance, ambiance- on point, team- is TEAM :) Menu :) OMG admired every course like exhibit  in art museum at first and only then turned into Ratatouille to indulge the unique combination of flavors and imagination!thank you for being there and don't ever loose your imagination and passion!!!Will return!!!
Had a fabulous experience.  Loved almost everything that we ate.
Simply amazing way to celebrate a 20 year wedding anniversary.  We were taken on an effortless food journey paired with amazing wines.

A truly beautiful culinary experience!  The staff was passionate and knowledge, and they welcomed our questions.  The food was by far the highest quality and best prepared we've ever had, and the beverage pairings were perfect.  Thanks to everyone at Oriole for an unforgettable evening!

I had never experienced better service than we received at Oriole.  Will definitely return. Everyone was amazing from Marylin to the entire staff. At times it almost seemed that I was watching an amazingly choreographed ballet. Extraordinary experience far beyond what was expected even for a Michelin Star restaurant
The best meal of my life! Also the best service! Highly recommended. Plus it‚Äôs byob ;)
Oriole is a very special place and a wonderful way to celebrate a special occasion.  The food presentation could be in the art Institute.  Thank you for the great experience.
Amazing!  Some of the best food I‚Äôve ever eaten. And tremendous service!!  Perfect night.
Absolutely SUPERB.
Perhaps the best meal I have ever eaten
Great place for a night out with someone that is extremely special to you!!
Wonderful experience. We celebrated our anniversary with our son.
Very expensive but very delicious. A wonderful birthday night dining experience.

The most amazing and delicious dining experience. Their food is art and carefully crafted to bring flavors and textures together for the perfect bites. The service and stellar and you feel welcomed from the moment you walk into their cool, low key side alley. It almost feels like a secret club. Worth it!
The best meal in Chicago and the US! Worth every penny

It was a singular dining experience. Easily the best meal of my life. The service showed minute attention to detail. Each course was well timed and a perfect amount to enjoy. Thank you so much for a memorable evening.
The food was delicious. The customer service was outstanding. I would definitely recommended. Parking was easy to find also.

Wonderful. Everything was delicious! The only negative thing worth mentioning is that they priced the vegetarian tasting menu at the same rate as the omnivore tasting which I feel isn‚Äôt comparable cost wise. The vegetarian tasting menu should be less expensive. As an example, during one of the courses my husband had A5 wagyu steak and I had a beet...not nearly the same price, yet paid the same? Other than that, the ambiance was lovely and the staff was very friendly and attentive.
Outstanding service, delicious food, beautiful presentation. Absolutely worth the money!

Oriole is one of the top restaurants in my mind. We spended a wonderful Valentine's Day here. Excellent food and drinks. I highly recommend to have the non-alcoholic beverage pairing, which are perfectly matching with the food. I will definitely visit there again in the future.
S√∫per recomendable. Todo riqu√≠simo y la atenci√≥n excelente. Volveremos a nuestra siguiente visita a Chicago sin duda
Without a doubt the most expensive meal I've ever had...but the waitstaff was something to behold and the foold was sublime. Worth the splurge.
The food is really good as I expected. The dish with foie gras is fantastic and delicious. Great environment with professional and friendly service!
Very attentive service and nice ambiance. There were surprises with every course.
This was my 17th time there, so I‚Äôm running out of ways to say how fabulous Oriole is (and I like to think I have an expansive vocabulary).  Incredible, as always.  Cannot wait to return.
The best service I have ever had at a restaurant. It was an amazing experience.
Food is so bad as a Michelin 2 stars

Wow, wow,wow !!!! From beginning till the end everything was delicious, rick in flavor. Service wow, cocktails wow, atmosphere wow!!! Highly recommend!!! Words can not describe, you have to taste it, hear the story of each dish and feel its deep flavors of very interesting ingredients.Its  12 dishes course and Hope in future they will have options to choose menu with extra courses 14 or 16 dishes.Art of food experience was amazing , looking forward to eat there again soon!!!! Very soon!!!!!! Especially when they adding new dishes and changing menu seasonly,cant  wait to try new stuff there !!!!!
Amazing food and service. Had the reserve wine pairing which was delightful.
Extraordinarily good food, genuinely nice and engaging staff, wine pairing spot on.  Will return.
Impeccable and exquisite. An absolute delight. Chef Sandoval and his wife Cara have created magic. Can‚Äôt wait to visit again soon!

This was simply one of the best meals I have ever enjoyed, and I select that verb since in high end restaurants, quality doesn't always come with such enjoyment. The amount of food and wine was just right; we had eaten enough and were not drunk, even with the wine pairing (standard). It is impossible to say any dish was inferior to any other; all seemed perfect (and were presented on beautiful dishes too). The service was attentive but not intrusive. The space was elegant and comfortable and we scarcely noticed anyone else. Oriole equals Alinea in quality but is a very different experience, not theatrical, not startling, but full of pleasing surprises. I hope to find an excuse (and the means) to return ‚Äì we're truly fortunate to have such a restaurant in Chicago.
Incredible food and outstanding service. Pricey but it‚Äôs worth it for a special occasion.
Excellent food and service!
Fantastic dining experience as always.
Food was great. Outdoor seating was wonderful and nicely spaced 6ft apart. Our waiter was outstanding
A lovely experience and we were so happy to be back at Parc and sitting outside!
This was our first Covid outing and we felt safe and well cared for..The trout almandine was spectacular
Always my favorite Birthday spot!
Always excellent The Go- to place In Philly. Always a scene and exciting.Good food. Best bread offering ever.

Food and wait staff were great as usual. The host and hostess however were rude. Forcing people to wear a mask outside (in the fresh open air) is comical. I understand taking proper precautions due to the pandemic, but they clearly know nothing if they think wearing a mask outdoors is saving anyone. They also asked us to leave our table after 2 hours even though no one was waiting to be seated.
David was wonderful!
Amazing experience,
My husband‚Äôs birthday

Smaller menu than in the past (I miss the lamb) but solid French favorites with American touches. Steak frite still a pleasure.  Cocktails good although limited (summer menu). Attentive service outside.
My sever Talbert went above and beyond to ensure i enjoyed my experience! He refered his favorite items, was very attentive and all around awesome!
Patio dining on the park.  Cannot be topped as  must try in Philly.  Excellent food and servixe as always.  We needed to get out and enjoy the just opened outdoor dining.

Dining during the Yellow phase in the city some cases has been something to really prepare your self for . The staff handled the task with ease . We enjoyed the evening and the meal was everything we have grew to expect .See you again soon
Perfect afternoon
Fabulous afternoon‚ù§Ô∏è
Very good food and drink. The service was very quick and everyone that waited on us was kind and knowledgeable.

Decided to get away from DC for the weekend with all the craziness of Corona virus, Philly was awesome, not busy at all, tons of free city parking next to the major landmarks.  Hotel (Kimpton) recommended Parc to us, we got there right as they opened up at 10am, we were sat promptly and Ryan was at our table in a minute. Food/drinks was on point, but Ryan was excellent, not too intrusive but always close at hand for questions or needs. Flawless execution of service and settings. Highly recommend Parc but even more get Ryan!

My parents took my wife and I here for our 1 year wedding anniversary and I cannot think of a better brunch place in Philadelphia to celebrate. The food, service and ambiance are excellent and my wife and I are going to try and come here every couple of months.
The food and service was excellent.  Would definitely go again.
Birthday celebration

Stopped in for brunch after seeing some really good reviews.  Parc did not disappoint!  Great testing brunch cocktails, coffee and yummy options coupled with a wonderfully friendly waiter made this a terrific experience!
Retirement breakfast celebration
Great food and great service as usual for this Philly staple.

Parc never disappoints, whether for brunch or dinner.  Our entrees were incredible, the highlight was the Lobster Risotto special, so amazing!  Everyone loved their meals from start to finish!!! Parc is always solid, one of our "Philly go-to's"!
This place is wonderful.  They made my birthday special and food is always outstanding.
Like being in Paris!  Lauren was so welcoming...had a lovely table, delicious trout almondine served by Margi (took great care of us!).Definitely recommend!
It‚Äôs still a great place to go for a drink but the food has been on a major downhill spiral although the bread basket is still a highlight
I would absolutely recommend this restaurant and fully intend to visit again should I return to Philadelphia. The Trout Alamandine is the best fish I have ever had in my entire life!
Thank you for making the birthday a wonderful experience! Love the food and the service was fantastic. Will definitely be recommending Parc to friends.

Have been dining at Parc for >10 years. One tradition a friend and I have to to celebrate her birthday there for lunch and the house carafe of white wine.  There 3/8 to celebrate her 70. I had made reservations in advance and our table was a small round tacked onto the end of bench seating, no more than 8 inches from the shoulder of the diner next to me. We ordered the wine and waited and then told that they didn't have the carafe of wine that day.  The server did not offer a substitution, which seems to me would have been the right thing to do.
Excellent meal as per usual! Noise level high as usual too but great place indeed.
Best brunch in the city of Philadelphia, hands down!

Loved our first visit to PARC!  Wonderful ambiance, quickly seated at a table that we requested.  Food fabulous, wine wonderful, homemade bread and dessert amazing!anxious to return!  Our server Breslin was the best ever !!!
Always good food....Menu needs to be updated with new offerings. Spotty service and a bit of "attitude" from the server. Loud as hell
NEVER a disappointment....food and service excellent.....
Always a great meal. You can not ask for a better place to enjoy a meal.
I think it would be beneficial to have a kids menu with a few more options.

One of my new favorite restaurants in Philadelphia!  I loved the lively atmosphere, the attentive wait staff, and the sublime baba au rhum I had for dessert.  I will definitely come back during my next visit to Philadelphia.
It's just like your in Paris, looking out on a beautiful park having divine, authentic French food. Great wine list and wide selection.
Best dining experience I‚Äôve had. Excellent quality and very tasty. The service was attentive and personable. Just a perfect experience.

It was the best birthday ever! The staff was so enjoyable they definitely were apart of making my experience a pleasant one. The food was magnificent!!! Highly recommended. Per Se knows how to make a girl feel special üòç

3 days later, and I am still thinking about the food. It was everything you would expect from a 3 Michelin star restaurant. We went for my birthday, and the menu had my name printed. I received a signed menu, along with special treats at the end of the dinner. I have been recommending Per Se to everyone!

The food was excellent, if not particularly creative. The Wagyu beef was out of this world. Service was seriously disappointing, ie: I had to request the same glass of wine twice, and when it finally arrived, food sitting on the table, it was the wrong one. No apology, but rather an excuse that the wine was ‚Äúprobably married with something else‚Äù(!) was given. Seriously. The waiter was a touch smug and casual bordering on unprofessional. A thousand dollar meal needs to be perfect. This was not. We have eaten at other 3 Michelin star restaurants and this one didn‚Äôt hold up.
Absolutely one of the best dining experiences. Everything was impeccable!

We were delighted to be able to get a reservation at Per Se for dining on our wedding anniversary.We arrived early with a view to having a pre-dinner celebratory drink but were told in an off hand manner that there was nowhere for us to sit and that there was another bar outside of the restaurant we could use so thought it could have been handled better. Since our last visit the bar area within Per Se has been turned into tables for dining so they have increased their covers.When we did get in we still had to wait for our table and so sat at a high bar area. The tasting menu was great with a lot of choice and standard of the food was excellent again so we weren't disappointed. The staff were very professional and happy to chat - getting the balance on this is quite difficult in my opinion and after a rocky start  they certainly succeeded.This is a very special restaurant and although expensive a place for celebrations.
It was excellent from start to finish.
Absolutely amazing! Best date ever!!!
It was my husband‚Äôs 40rh birthday. They surprised us all the time. Amazing.
Per Se exceeded my expectations. The experience is worth the price. I hope to dine at Per Se again sometime.
Just ‚ÄòFabulous ‚Äò in every way! A huge treat and well worth it!

For me this is ‚Äúdestination‚Äù dinning. I go to NY  often and it‚Äôs nice to experience the top restaurants once in a while. This was semi short notice so the only time available was for Lunch on Saturday. Everything about the restaurant was super outstanding, especially the service, which is becoming rated these days. Unfortunately we were next to a table, they‚Äôre not that close, of four that included a 12-13 year old boy. It‚Äôs not that children are bad, it‚Äôs the failed parenting strategies that have forgotten about the seldom seen and never heard theories of children in upscale public places. I wish they would have a grown up only policy.

This is a dining establishment beyond compare. Prepare to be pampered while you take in view of the NY skyline and relax in the glow of the fireplace. All waiters are graduates of a culinary school who will help you create the dining experience of a lifetime. 12 plates and an assortment of desserts are served to order at your leisure. The cuisine is original, and diverse with flavors that coax and tease the taste buds. The quality of ingredients is unrivaled; so much so that "Bread and Butter" is an entree - "A smoked Paprika 'Parker House Roll' served with Diane St Clair's Animal Farm Butter." Diane has 10 cows that she milks and hand churns the butter. No detail is left to chance. All chairs that are not required are removed from the table (before you arrive) so as not to disturb the intimacy. There are as many servers as there are guests who move stealthily to present your next palate-stimulating tasting.No matter your requirements (allergies, vegan, etc) Chef Keller and his staff will ensure that you literally have the meal of a lifetime.

We had easily one of the best meals we have ever had at Per Se.  The tasting menu was incredibly well put together.  Each course seemed to improve upon the one before it.  The service was even better, with very attentive (but unintrusive) staff who took care to explain the dishes and get to know us throughout the dinner.  The pace was prompt, without being rushed and worked through the menu in just about two hours.  Capped off our experience with a kitchen tour and personal compliments to the chefs. Can‚Äôt recommend Per Se enough!
Amazing! There are Michelin restaurants and then there is a Per Se.

It is quite refreshing to enter a restaurant in NYC and have it meet your expectations. Per se did exactly that. The staff made us feel comfortable from the beginning, there was nothing rushed. The view of central park was simple and beautiful. Now the food, memorable, had a range of flavors in every dish, and also thankfully left us full and happy.

Outstanding personalized service combined with incredible food. We were treated like royalty throughout the meal all capped off at the end with a tour of the kitchen escorted by the maitre d‚Äô, who couldn‚Äôt be more friendly. Not just a meal but a memorable experience!
I need to say Awesome service, every lovely server treat us like a friend!awesome food, both me n my husband love it, hope coming back again!
One of the great experiences in my life that I will remember for evermore.It exceeded my expectations and I am so happy that I was able to get areservation.
Lovely food, ambiance and service

Dining at Per Se is really beyond words.  It's an experience where 12 or 13 delicious, delicate and melt in your mouth courses are presented in a huge variety of plates, bowls and vessels of all kinds by young men and women who seem to appreciate being a part of the experience with you.  The fabulous three-hour treat was not stuffy but very fun.  Taking a tour of the kitchen and wine cellar afterwards was a double treat!
It was amazing. Food, service and ambiance were 5 Star.

With 3 Michelin Stars and already haven visited French Laundry, another Thomas Keller restaurant, I had high expectations for Per Se.  And my expectations were met!  Stunning, dramatic, yet classy ambience, spotless professional service, creative and delicious cuisine.  Just a very special night and experience with friends.

This was my first experience at Per Se and I was so excited to go! My husband and I are junkies for Michelin Star restaurants and this was at the top of our list. Definitely met every expectation of a Michelin rated restaurant.

Holy guacamole! Chef Keller clearly pays attention to detail as every dish is specially curated. This ain‚Äôt yo‚Äô mommas cookin‚Äô! Grab your napkin and hold on to your britches because there ain‚Äôt no stopping when you‚Äôre on this food train.
Fantastic for a special date or occasion
Besser gehts nicht ! Essen und Service einfach nur perfekt.

Per Se was perfect. My wife, sister-in-law and I had dinner there at the end of a trip to NYC. It was a chilly evening and they put us next to the fireplace which was very cozy. The food was great. The service was impeccable. They were willing to accommodate changes to the menu if a particular item wasn't to our fancy. We were there for three and one half hours and it was among the most pleasurable dining experiences we have had. It is definitely a special occasion place. Go there when you aren't in a hurry and want to enjoy the best.
simply incredible!!!

Still one of the greatest spots in NYC. Bill maybe be a bit high but great memories are priceless! Every dish was a hit and the ambience was amazing. Very comfortable and enjoyable experience. Def get the supplements.
From start to finish our experience was flawless.
Amazing food and amazing service. Truly spot on. I do not think there could have been anything improved upon. Laurel provided a very memorable experience.

Tyler the Maitre d' elevated our experience like no other restaurant we've ever been to. From helpful insider tips on other food NYC hangouts, to staying at the table for casual conversation, to a one-of-a-kind full tour of the kitchen, he was absolutely incredible. We loved every minute of our stay at Per Se and found it even better than its sister, French Laundry. All four of us would rate it as one of the best dining experiences we have ever had.
Celebrating my wife‚Äôs birthday. Fantastic food and everything along the way. They have everything thought out from drinks to food it was sublime
Loved it.  Top 10 ever
Excellent food experience, courteous service, quiet and comfortable environment, food is missed. It is worth going to many times!

We celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary with a trip to New York and a degustation dinner at Per Se. Our expectations for the dinner were high going in and Per Se exceeded them. The food was phenomenal, the service was attentive and the whole occasion just truly memorable.

This was by far one of the most amazing dining experiences I have ever had.  The food was just incredible; but, the service and the experience were amazing as well.  Of particular note, was that we arrived with our 12 year old son and the restaurant staff from the front entrance and throughout the evening were so amazingly friendly and attentive to him as well as to us.  It made for a truly wonderful dining experience that we will never forget.

Amazing everything which is not surprising for a Michelin 3 star restaurant but in terms of value I think the vegetarian/pescetarian menus should be priced as high/represent the same value as the standard tasting menu. However overall one of best meals I‚Äôve ever had!

Excellent attentive service from beginning to end. Complementary champagne to help us celebrate our special occasion to tour of the kitchen in the end, dining at Per Se is an experience, not just dining.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Not only is the restaurant special, they make every individual feel welcome and special. The food is spectacular and the drinks are wonderful.  The Polo Bar is a must and my go to restaurant for any occasion.

We always save the Polo Bar for our last night in the City! It never disappoints. The wait staff is always so respectful and friendly. The food was divine. And, as always, it‚Äôs a great place to people watch. Can‚Äôt wait to return!
Very nice place, unique. Recommended to all people looking for something else .

I cannot recommend the Polo Bar enough. My boyfriend and I (not famous in any way) happened to dine at the Polo Bar the same night as a number of big name celebrities. There was absolutely no fuss and we felt equally as important and valued to our servers as anyone else in the restaurant. Food was also divine, I highly recommend the chocolate cake :) Thank you, Polo Bar, for a terrific experience.

Very nice location, very good burger with lots of fries. The cheesecake tastes great and comes with fresh strawberries. Pricing is pretty reasonable. Service pays good attention and is very handsome. A nice place, especially for poloplayers.
Food wasn't that great but worth it to visit once I didn't really like the server who had kinda rude attitude (He was keep trying to make me order fancier meal options..)

this place is a hoot! i have always wanted to go, but being there made me wish i was straight edge...can't believe that drinks can be over $30! however, the decor and the popovers help provide a bit more value to an otherwise fun and delicious, yet overpriced, whitebread new york experience.
Wonderful Birthday dinner for our son's 21st Birthday!!!

I was very disappointed to say the least about my dinner here. The atmosphere was disappointing and I couldn't believe that the family sitting in front of me had their kid playing video game on his iPad at the dinner table. It was horrible and the couple sitting beside me was weird, anytime they coughed she kept apologizing that they didn't have any disease or nothing, it wasn't like I said anything to them.  The food wasn't great, only the cocktail was good. Overall, based that you had to have a reservation to get in here and then you see this, it's appalling. Places that don't require such a strict reservation policy have better class of people as patrons than this place. I wouldn't go back or recommend it.
The BEST! Love the Polo Bar!!
Just Great! We‚Äôll be back!
Always a must when I¬¥m in New York. I love the atmosphere and the food is good and not too pretentious.

For such an ‚Äúaffluent‚Äù Resturant, the guy who works at the reservation switchboard is of very low quality and standard and has no etiquette. Just his attitude and horrible telephone skills are enough to turn you off this place altogether. I would pass on this Resturant as there are far better quality places with amazing friendly staff who have people skills training. Def would not go back here!
Amazing dinner. Waiter was one of best in City.
The experience was great.The food was delicious, well served and the atmosphere excellent!

Great evening with friends. Service was perfect. Bar and wait staff were welcoming and  front of house was super accommodating when we were a tad late. Food quality is excellent. And those bar snacks, delicious.
Good food great atmosphere but very costly-55th and Fifth

Service was excellent, Michael was the best waiter we‚Äôve had in the several times we‚Äôve visited here.  Food was really good and fairly good choices, they‚Äôll help if you need to tailor a menu item for specific reasons.  Nice cocktail options, and some varied gin selections.
Amazing service and totally delicious.
Cozy and chic Excellent service and reliably good food

Start at the beautiful bar on the main floor.  Although expensive, the drink are creative and accompanied by a trio of delicious snacks. Arrive at least 30 minutes before your dinner reservation to relax and enjoy the experience. Move downstairs for an old school dinner.  The staff will be happy to split dishes in the kitchen.  The corned beef sandwich and burgers are exceptional.  It is a great place for a meal with friends and family.
Anniversary
I love The Polo Bar. Want to make plans for ny birthday next year!!! I love you Ralph Lauren!
The food and the experience were both amazing, we couldn't have asked for a better night!
Excellent ambiance and service; we loved our dinner, especially the popovers! A wonderful place to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary!
Best restaurant, impeccable service, and delicious food. Special occasion, date night, or just for a good meal, it‚Äôs perfect. Excellent cocktails. My favorite is the Vesper Martini!

While the room is warm, decor nicely done,  & tables well-spaced, the food was very disappointing.  The popovers were delicious, but after one, we were not offered a 2nd, & without realizing it, our bread plates were removed.  We ordered what we were told were"must-haves" --Shrimp Cocktail, Franks in Blankets, Corned Beef sandwich, Roasted Cauliflower, & none we agreed, had any distinctive flavor.  The experience for people around us, seemed to be focused on what celebrity might walk into the room.
I have waited a year to get in this place. It was worth it! Great friendly, fashionable scene. Very attentive service. The food was very good.  Can‚Äôt wait to go back.
Stunning decor and atmosphere. Food and service were both excellent!
Excellent, would highly recommend, best total experience over a week of tasting NYC !!
It was my husbands birthday. He enjoyed every bit of his meal.
A lovely Sunday evening dinner with friends. The space is beautiful, food excellent and service perfect!
Outstanding service and food. Fantastic cocktails !!
We love the Polo Bar. Great spot for a drink, and the food and service never disappoints.
Great food and ambience. A little noisy. Staff is very attentive and VERY professional I highly recommend.
A must go place in nyc!!!
One of the most exciting and exhilarating  One of the most exciting and exhilarating experiences I have ever had dining.
Classy restaurant, excellent service.
Fantastic place. Get there early to enjoy a cocktail in the lounge. Great
Family dining early evening Very enjoyable very good service and excellent food . We had the New York strip and burgers All was well prepared and delicious
