column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Great place for breakfast in the terrace, food was excellent. Service a little slow, but OK.  Price of the menu certainly on the high end category.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Classic LA.  An oasis.  Great food and service.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: The service was so bad which makes everything else terrible. So dissapointed.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Whether it's for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, meals at the Polo Lounge in the Beverly Hills Hotels are always a treat.The service is exceptional.The food is delicious. Try the McCarthy Salad and Apple Cobbler.And the relaxed ambiance can't be beaten.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: this is the best restaurant to go to the service was outstanding and the food was delicious and the food was served hot to your table and the servers were also were very respectable and very nice people .I would more than be welling to go to the polo lounge again again thank you for the outstanding food and service rudolph loehndorf.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: amazing place , excellent food, spectacular service!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Always the best :))).  Daughters Birthday

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Great food, consistently good place for drinks and dinner

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Such a beautiful relaxing place for a great meal with impeccable service.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: polo lounge is a must for anyone staying in Beverly Hills, super historic and lots of rich heritage, very knowledgeable staff.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Vacation visit...

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Went to just have a small snack and some drinks. The environment felt very pretentious and the staff seemed to care more about high end guests vs people just wanting to experience the Beverly Hills hotel. I made reservations serval weeks in advance and then felt a little uncomfortable where they sat us. Also waiter forgot to bring our appetizer which ended up being the only thing we ordered because we were tired of waiting. It‚Äôs a beautiful place but I‚Äôve been to many many high end restaurants and I‚Äôve never felt more uncomfortable. I was even dressed well and carried a designer bag just to try and fit in more but that didn‚Äôt seem to make a difference. I don‚Äôt need to go back. Ps the chips and salsa and guacamole are awful. Don‚Äôt order it. Besides that it was a beautiful hotel and their waiters seem very well trained. Overall I‚Äôd give it 4 stars.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Excellent and I look forward to my next lunch meeting at the Polo Lounge.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: David was a fantastic waiter and the ambiance can‚Äôt be beat! They surprised all us birthday girls with candles and cake. Such a marvelous afternoon

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: The Polo Lounge is always a treat

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Amazing as always!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: The service was impeccable and the food was amazing. What a special night!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Amazing! If I lived in the area I would be here everyday!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Burnt burger

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Got there about 45 min early than our reservation time to have a drink at the bar. Checked in with hostess. At reservation time, had to check in with her again as she kept seating multiple two tops before calling us over. Had to stand at hostess stand and wait...Absolutely awful service. Waiter was present only at the table 3 times. Water never filled. Had to ask about specials. Pre ordered souffl√© and never asked about coffee or tea. Shocked at how bad the service was.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Top of the Top. Quality service, quality food. Extraordinary experience. Worth it!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Hi - I made a reservation for my daughters' bday, but the server forgot the cake! I reached out to the restaurant and they got back to me IMMEDIATELY with an apology and an offer to have a special bday dessert on them - we can't wait to go back!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Service was excellent. Food was average when it should have been exceptional for the high price. Ambiance was nice although my seat was by the waiters‚Äô station which was a little uncomfortable and there were plenty of empty seats. If you want to experience it go but be willing to pay a high price for average food. Hotel security yelled at us for taking a photo of the iconic building. We were doing so respectfully and there was no sign preventing this.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Perfect as always.  One of our favorites.  Tried the McCarthy Salad this time - Delicious!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: As a part of a yearly Christmas tradition, my husband and I have spent the last few years at the Polo Lounge. It is something we‚Äôve always looked forward to and it pains me to say that I do not think we‚Äôll be back after the disappointing service. Our reservation was at 3pm and while I do have knowledge of break time and transition from lunch to dinner service, it does not justify the lack of follow up, service, or attention that we had on Wednesday. The server had forgotten a beverage, never to return after. We had to reach out to a backwaiter to get the bill and subsequently left after as we were barely tended to for over 20 minutes.Sad to say that it our tradition has ended at your beautiful restaurant.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Arguably one of the most iconic dining experiences in LA. The food never disappoints and the drinks are delicious. Highly recommend for your dates and special occasions.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Terrible service.  The place was slow at 2:30 and it took us over 20 minutes to even get our drinks and then  no other meaningful service until the food was received.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: I went booked this through my reward points. I used the app and pulled up my $10 reward card. They wouldn‚Äôt take it at the restaurant. They ended up taking $10 off after I talked to a manager but now I lost all those points I could have used at a different restaurant.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Romantic and magical! The food was beyond! Highly recommend!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Festive but the food is offensively overpriced and service was lacking

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Overpriced

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Loved the Christmas tree with the cars and animals.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: Always Amazing !!!!

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: The food, service, and ambience were all fantastic.  The services provided by the professional management and staff are the main reasons that we keep coming back.   The old world elegance is a rare thing, and we value their focus to make sure that everything about the dining experience is excellent.   I highly recomend this restaurant. Do take an Uber Black to the restaurant/hotel, however, as a validated valet ticket just lowers the valet fee from $20-$15, which is certainly a disappointment after spending hundreds of dollars for dinner.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: We were visiting LA from Portland.  We met friends from Seattle to celebrate the Thanksgiving Holiday.  We ate at Polo Lounge on Thanksgiving eve and had a blast!  It‚Äôs such a fun atmosphere.  We loved the live music and the tables in the bar area were all singing along.  Our server was so fun and attentive.  Aside from the fabulous atmosphere, the food was amazing.  My recommendation is the rigatoni bolognese.  It‚Äôs out of this world!  Everything we tried, outstanding.  The Polo Lounge is our new favorite spot and we‚Äôll definitely go back when in LA.  Oh and if you‚Äôre a red wine drinker, try the Austin Hope Cabernetü§§.

column1: Polo Lounge @ The Beverly Hills Hotel
column3: My family and I are fans of the polo lounge and have been coming here for many years. On Saturday Nov 23 we began our dinner with the Russian Ossetra Iperial caviar and champagne cocktail which is the best in L.A. County. We continue with the Chilenian sea bass<, Black truffle pasta, and Prime Filet Mignon. We ended our dinner with the Chocolate Souffle and the best Grand marnier souffle we've had in a very very long time. Service was impeccable.
Amazing  as always
Father‚Äôs Day
Small portions, high prices for good but not excellent food. There are numerous places in Napa which are both better values and have tastier food.

My appreciation to the staff for moving my wife and I inside, after that, dinner was up to Press standard of excellence.  Note to the restaurant, eliminate the horrendous outside seating, between the flies, the greenhouse type heat and the thrown together seating, it is not enjoyable and totally detracts from your reputation.  Also, you might want to consider normal size steak portions on your short menu.  Beyond that, our anniversary dinner was great (after moving inside).
Fine dinning experience
Thanks for a great dining experience.

The restaurant, we knew would have amazing food and an incredible aesthetic, which it did. We also assumed the the staff and waiter would be solid, but our waiter was above and beyond amazing. It saddens me that I don‚Äôt know his name, feels almost disrespectful, but he treated us so well, and was a huge part in creating a memory that my new wife and I will always remember. Please continue finding staff members like that, because they set you apart in terms of having high quality meals. Sorry this is long, and I do hope someone reads this, because my honeymoon with my wife will always hold this memory, although a simple matter, was so incredible. Thank you for a wonderful experience. We will be back and we will recommend this restaurant.
Super excellent!
It was great to enjoy PRESS at lunch time. Same great food and service.

We had dinner tonight at Press and we were looking forward to an excellent dinner. Our server was very nice and we Were seated promptly. The restaurant was not very busy and we looked over the menu and list of wines by the glass as well as an iPad loaded with 60 pages of wines. We ordered an appetizer and it was ok but bland. We then had a glass of cab and a Chardonnay that were recommended and they were awful. The cab tatted tainted and the Chardonnay from Mayacamas was really odd tasting. We ordered some fish and a steak and they were not very good. The halibut was tasteless and served cold. The sauce was even worse. The steak was served medium rare after asking for medium well. The flavor was not good either and it was served sliced. At this point we decided to leave. This is our third poor experience at Press over the past 18 months. It was our favorite spot in Napa but sadly this was our last visit. We can no longer recommend Press.
The food was amazing. The wine list extensive and very reasonable.  The Somm was super helpful and friendly.  Only issue was it felt like our server didn't want to be there.
Incredible restaurant. Somehow it keeps it‚Äôs amazing personal experience and first-rate service through the COVID-19 restrictions. Bravo!
Everything we had was fantastic.   The Press Gin and Tonic is the best.
Overpriced
Underwhelmed for the money. All the courses, felt contrived and overly complicated.

My husband and I had dinner at Press for the first time on a Saturday.  It was such a great and amazing experience. The staff were all wearing mask. Mask are required to walk to your table, and if you leave your table. We did not have to wear a mask while seated at our table. Our server was so nice, helpful, and attentive to our needs.  I really enjoyed his down to earth personality.  My filet mignon was cooked to perfection, it literally melted in my mouth.  My husband's dinner was the special of the night and he was very pleased with his dinner.  I have to say Press has the best Coke I've ever had lol! I highly recommend Press.
A delightful evening - superb food, great service, very personable staff. A well worthwhile visit.  Thank you.

So glad to see this restaurant reopen. New menu under the talented hand of Philip Tessier and Darryl Bell is so good with an emphasis on seasonal and local. Wine list as always full of great choices including rare older vintages making it fun for special occasions. The rice pudding currently on the dessert menu is the best I‚Äôve ever had. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Great experience here. Sat outside and were allowed our pup with us which was sweet.Food was dope, unexpected flavours and interesting takes on classic dishes. Will come back for sure.
Among our favorite 2 or 3 restaurants anywhere.  No other restaurant compares to the service at Press, and their food is innovative and delicious.

Chef Philip Tessier has been an incredible addition.   We have always loved Press but his new and  improved menu is terrific.   Incredible attention to the food on the plate.  Great flavor and balance- and beautiful.

Omg! We loved it everything was perfect!!! The food was exquisite and the service was phenomenal! We came to celebrate our anniversary and they made it extra special!!! Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è we will definitely be back!

I was very excited to return to the restaurant. I mentioned that this reservation was special because of an anniversary and a 60th Birthday. We looked at the menus online ahead of time and read all special do‚Äôs for reopening like wear a mask etc before arriving. The host had no clue it was our anniversary..., they didn‚Äôt call us to let us know of the restricted menus. I had it all plan from their website and open table. I didn‚Äôt get the Chateaubriant  that I had planned to eat. The sommelier came at our table but didn‚Äôt pour our wine. She just made a comment that it was a great bottle and amazing vintage. Our server was great, we made him relax . Overall the vibes we weird, a bit tense.
Press continues to provide excellent service with unique additions to their steak menu. This during the challenging times of a restrictive opening.
Nice to get back to PRESS. I‚Äôm glad we‚Äôre able to dine in person.
Wonderful experience.  The sommelier was wonderful and the entire staff was welcoming.   Food was delicious!

Second "dine-in" experience post-Covid, and although different in many ways, the Press Team delivered on all the points that matter! The food was (dare I say) better than before, perhaps extra time and thought have gone into the menu during the break. The scallops (newly added) alone were worthy of a 3 Michelin Star menu!   Service was a little on the slow side, but given the circumstances, we didn't mind just being "out" together and eating our food hot and fresh when it came to the table!

Thank you for remaining open for us while we were visiting and with the new rules regarding COVID-19, etc recently announced by the governor. We had a wonderful meal and the service was amazing for our first visit. Thank you for a wonderful and relaxing experience in the midst of all the strange and not calm times. We will definitely return an another Napa trip!
Take out is delicious and so easy to order online!
We loved our meal and the ambiance and the great service!  The whole team is very kind and gracious!

Great beginning to experience.  Great bartenders and server was very engaged early.  Main course was served undercooked.  Server never returned.  No one asked if the meal was ok.  GM asked if we wanted to box things up instead of asking why most wasn‚Äôt eaten.  Server returned with desert menu and seemed put out we asked for the check.  UnimPRESSEd.

Use to be one of our favorites and still love the staff and service.  But the food seems to be getting worse and the prices higher.  Nothing special about the food which is lacking in flavor and quantity.  One bright spot on the food is the deserts are getting better.  Hoping the rest will improve
The new menu items presented were outstanding in variety and flavor.  As always, the service was personal and welcoming.  It is our "go-to" place for a special dinner.
Really fantastic dining experience. It‚Äôs a bit pricey, but it‚Äôs not trying to hide that fact either.  One of the best meals we had during our visit to Napa!
Would like a broader variety of sides, the bacon sampler is excellent, steaks over wood makes for very interesting flavor.  Definitely pricey.

Went on a Saturday night. We waited more than 15 minutes for our first drink to be served at our table. Food was very mediocre. Expected great service and great food for the price point ‚Äîextremely disappointing.

Had a fantastic early dinner in the bar area (at a table). Our favorites were the rib eye cap and wagyu flat iron. Incredible flavor, quality and seasoning. Enjoyed the decor and service. can‚Äôt wait to come back.

Press is one of my personal favorite restaurants in the Napa Valley.  The service and the food quality is outstanding. Charles, is a fantastic Manager and an incredible person. We loved our dinner. Thank you!
The manager has a unique attention!! I love it
Great service and great food!

The food was interesting/intriguing, certainly more suited to a tasting menu.  The wine pairings were also good, but heavily weighted to whites; I would have enjoyed tasting 2 or 3 more reds.  The service could not have been better.
Wonderful food and great service. Hope we come back soon.
Wonderful non pretentious  meal and service at Quince. We enjoyed the experience.
It was amazing! We had a perfect dinner and the wine pairing was exceptional. They even surprised my wife with a special dining opportunity in the kitchen, which made her birthday even more special.

This was the best dining experience we have ever had...and we have been to the French Laundry.  The service was perfect, there when you need it and not there when you don't.  The food was exquisite and beautifully presented.   The noise level was low and the room had high ceilings and was softly lit.  It was awesome.  Our wait person was Kyra and she was a perfect delight.  Very attentive and knowledgeable about the cuisine and wines.  She was awesome.   This restaurant is a high recommend for foodies and/or a romantic celebration.
An absolute dream. Every detail on point. A very memorable dinning experience.
Overall fantastic experience

Whole evening was excellent. Food, service n silverwares to wine glasses n cocktail glasses.Thank you for the special menu with my wife‚Äôs name which made a little more memorable.  3 ‚≠êÔ∏èHowever, black napkins can replace the white would for black clothes.Need grab bars in wash room for handicap people.  I am.Lastly just a note to Mike. Betsy would like to have her Tupperware back.  Its bern too long.  üòäü§ô Mahalo.Chris and Paul......Betsy
Very memorable meal for all of us.
Very disappointing,The service and food quality goes downhill compared with last year !!!!!!!!!

An exquisite dining experience where every detail is carefully chosen for its flavor,color and artistic intent. A meal worth savoring and sharing with someone you love. Expensive but a bargain considering the labor, discipline and passion put in by Chef Tusk and his staff.
Ten delicious courses.   Tried foods I normally would pass on and was so happy with the flavors.

The experience was incredible, the service impeccable, the food is from another world to experience the mixture of flavors that explode on your palate and transport in a dream place, a thousand congratulations to the chef is magnificent

Quince lives up to its reputation.  Expensive?  Yes.  Worth the price?  I have to say Yes, again.  We went in the middle of the week, so not crowded.  Service was wonderful.  At first, I was concerned that there were too many different servers and wine masters attending to us.  But each had a specialty, and a story to tell.  Juan, in particular, provided insight to and history behind the cutlery and china.  Robert paced us through and described each course expertly.  And the food--well, there was nothing that was not perfect.  Oysters in a cream and nettle sauce.  White asparagus prepared two ways.  Wagyu beef--both American and Japanese bred.  Additional treats besides what is listed on the day's menu.  By the time we arrived at the beautiful dessert trolly, I could hardly eat another thing.  Definitely take your time.  We were there for well over 4 hours, and enjoyed every minute.

We have been enjoying a few 3 star Michelin restaurants in the past, and we really enjoyed Quince. The service was remarkable, the food was consistently great throughout the tasting menu and the wine paring was very very well selected. I am not your typical desert lover, but I was blown away with those as well, and the praline cart at the end was an amazing finale! Thank you - you exceeded our expectations with leaps and bounds.
We have now been to 8 Michelin 3 star restaurants and the consensus of our group is that Quince is the best.
Amazing food and great service. Recommend for Birthday and Anniversary!
Really nice
Too many sweets after main courses. Unfortunately I got sick later in the evening.
Extraordinario todo  nunca hab√≠a proba una carne como la de aqui, todos los platillos perfectamente balanceados los postres son una delicia comprendo porque tiene *** Michelin
A special place and meal, wonderful staff!  Maybe a few more options on the main course entree such as a seafood.

In a word: Overrated.  The service was a good but way over the top and made us feel uncomfortable due feeling like our every move and word was being monitored.  The food was good but for the price? Nah. Out of 10 courses, we loved 2 or 3 of them and the rest were good but not worth the money and prestige imho.
Legendary. From greetings upon arrival, to the chocolate to go when leaving. Extreme attention to detail. Exquisite flavors. Unique experience. A must-go
Total ripoff , For 2 ppl was charged 950 for tasting menu i really wasn‚Äôt impressed on.Never come back again.
A lovely evening. Fantastic meal. Outstanding service. So many deserts! Was so satisfied and happy!
super attentive staffs, wonderful atmosphere

From the moment you walk in and are greeted by the dynamite staff to when you leave with a warm cup of hot chocolate waiting for you at the door for you walk outside, Quince just leaves you with the best culinary experience to remember for years to come.
Excellent restaurant with great service, however, very pricey.  Buyer beware.
Best dining experience of my life. We will be back!
Excellent food and services. We were even invited to visit the kitchen, had one course there, and took picture with the chef.  Great experience!

Good food but not one of the best, well trained staff offering a well rehearsed service, but not genuine, way overpriced for the experience. There are as good restaurant around for a third of the cost.
Excellent service from the beginning to the end
Disappointing.  After second course, there was a forty Minute wait for next course.  After that the timing of service was spotty.  Wine selections were spotty and main courses did not wow.
Exceptional in every aspect! Amazing experience! Worth every penny! ~Thank you, Chef Musk! Well deserved three-star Michelin!!!
Birthday family dinner

The food and service are simply exquisite. They were incredibly accommodating. The courses are well paced but you should definitely plan on coming with an empty stomach. Most elegant restaurant in the bay area.
The best Michelin 3 star restaurant in the world
Elaborate dining with prefix menu
Best dining experience in San Fran. Highly recommended.
Awesome experience The eating in kitchen was very special!

Very "hip" place - loud, crowded, bar packed.  Food and service were both good.  Couldn't hear across the table, so don't go to have a conversation with your dinner partner.  Started annoyed with 6 texts, 2 phone calls, and 1 e-mail asking me to confirm reservation.  Each one answered.  Over-hyped place - won't go back
Partner enjoyed the food, then the bar with quite great  characters and conversation which made the night complete.
Fantastic as usual!  Raouls consistently delivers an amazing food and ambiance experience.  I‚Äôd recommend it to anyone and everyone!
Ever mouthful was perfection!! Love this place it‚Äôs So consistent for great food quality and service!

This cozy but very loud restaurant is home to perhaps the most outstanding Steak au Poivre I have ever had. The cut of meat was excellent, cooked to a perfect medium and crusted in just the right amount and consistency of pepper... served with a perfectly seasoned sauce of exactly the right consistency... and of course accompanied by a basket of crispy Frites! It doesn‚Äôt get much better than this! Exactly what I would expect from an Alsace heritage which, arguably produces the best chefs in all of Europe!
Food was delicious, overall great experience
Food and cocktails were fantastic.  Steak au Poivre was amazing.

This was an amazing find on this past trip. It had an old school feel given all its history in the city. My son LOVED the burger. This is a kid who doesn‚Äôt like sauce or much adornment on his burgers so the meat has to be spot on - this burger didn‚Äôt disappoint AND the pepper sauce was so good, he ATE ALL OF IT!!  All the food was divine and definitely a staple for our yearly visits toNYC from now on!!
One of my NYC favorites!!!
Loved everything
The food and lively atmosphere is always fantastic!
Great evening to enjoy my nieces birthday!

Always a great time at this legendary place
My favorite place in the city!!
Fabulous burger -- worth the hype! The fries were also a pleasant surprise too.
Overpriced but not remarkable.  The waitstaff was curt. I would not go back.
Exceptional service and food at this well known restaurant. Really enjoyed our evening.

Good food, Poor service; table not ready, then after being directed to the bar were told we couldn‚Äôt transfer the bar bill to our table. Waiter was slow and inattentive, didn‚Äôt provide plates for the bread, didn‚Äôt once check in on the food, had to be asked three times for a drinks refill and provided dessert menus but didn‚Äôt come to take an order for 15 minutes....
Great service and food! If you note a birthday celebration in open table they remember and add a candle to your desert which is great.

Fantastic night at this iconic new york restaurant.  The steak au poivre was perfectly cooked and delicious.  The choice of sides was great and the grilled broccoli was really tasty.  A huge wine list was also good with a massive selection of french as well as us wines.  Would definitely go again next time in NYC.
Great service. Nice wine menu. Delicious food. A true neighborhood gem. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again.
YOU WILL BE CHARGED $100 to cancel reservations. Still a great place!!

Wonderful old school French brassiere with classic French cuisine done extremely well.  From the steak au pouvrie to the pomme  frites to the profiteroles you can‚Äôt go wrong.  Excellent service, as well.
Sexy crowd and the best steak au poivre in town. My go-to spot for a fun night out.
80th Birthday
Beautiful space with interesting artwork. The food and wine were great and the ambiance was lovely. Service was the best.
Raoul's will always be our favorite place. The staff and food (especially the burger) are the absolute best.
Great burgers. My neighborhood favorite!

I LOVE RAOUL'S!  My husband and I meet for late dinners here and always roll home full, tipsy and elated.  The service is really always outstanding.  Everything from the bar/ host staff's greeting to the experience at the table makes us feel so well cared for; I find the interpersonal style of the team to be very direct, professional, and effective, but also always warm.  This place is such a New York institution; it's an absolute privilege to enjoy it from time to time.  Thanks to the whole damn team!
Wonderful meal from beginning to end
Never disappoints!

Amazing classic French style restaurant.The food is exquisite and the atmosphere fantastic. It‚Äôs not for those looking for a quiet night out as noise levels are high but I wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Efficient staff, eclectic artwork and food so delicious that my mouth waters at the mere thought of it! Go!! It should be illegal not to!

Raoul‚Äôs is the best. It‚Äôs our regular go-to because while the food is really great (get the frisbee salad no matter what else you do)- the people are incredible and make you feel so welcome and at home. Plenty of celebrities come to this old school restaurant that has stayed popular for over 40 years but they treat  everyone wonderfully and care more how you behave than who you are
Best steak au poivre ever, great Cosmo, fab music, cool scene. I will definitely return. Sometimes I look so hard for something new.... so glad I chose a classic to celebrate my husband‚Äôs 50th.
Tremendous spot.  A+ food, service. Traditional and current. Love it. Rivals the best.
Great food, ambiance, service.  Hands down our favorite restaurant in NYC.
One of the best burgers in town.
The food is great and good value. I like the ambiance a lot. Dark with a European feel. Waitstaff are all competent but there are big inconsistencies in servers.
Excellent meal & service. Best Indian food I've ever had.
Very tasty, though there are other trendy, high end restaurants where I do feel like you get more bang for your buck than here.
Excellent in every way. Amazing food, service, room, noise level. Only knock for me personally was dessert, but that is more my tastes than their execution.
Great modern take on Indian food.  Looking forward to my next visit.
Once again, we all had great meals and great service. Rasika is the best indian food in town.
The food is delicious. I would recommend the restaurant to others.
Nice place. Good food. Always on our list for when we are in the mood for Indian food.
Outstanding food and service each time I visited.
Exceptional food and service!Outstanding experience.
Creative food, great vibe and service. Liked trying Indian beer.
Nice restaurant, food was good, not great. Didn‚Äôt understand what all the hype is about, but will give it another shot in the future.
Never been disappointed. Just fantastic Indian food with a modern flair.
Amazing delicious food! Great fun for a night of fine dining!
The food here is amazing.  Particularly the fish dishes (cod and bass).  I would eat it daily if I could.
A must-try if you love Indian food when you're in DC.
Dining at Rasika is an every-year holiday event. The service, ambiance, and food are spectacular. I always order the black cod and I'm never disappointed.
Fabulous food- and I mean everything we've ever eaten here.Great service and the decor!!
Absolutely delicious food!  Great service and lovely ambiance. A DC must!!
Excellent service and amazing food. Consistent great quality.
Delicious food options, albeit pricey. Nice for a date
Rasika is by far one of the best Indian restaurants in the DC region.  You will not be disappointed.
Best Indian restaurant in the dc area.  Sometimes hard to get in so reserve well ahead.
Hands down the best Indian food I've ever had.  Never fails to impress.
Alway a great place to eat -- you cannot go wrong.
This is one of the best Indian restaurants in all my experiences with Indian restaurants.
Loved the everything on the tasting menu. Nice ambiance.
Great tapas sized servings good for sharing a lot of dishes
I loved the Palaak Chaat. Food was great. Would recommend for a slow dining experience.

I love this restaurant. The flavors are bold and delicious. The service is outstanding every time I go ( I have been to Rasika 3 times now). I highly recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner in DC (either location is great).
Service was great, food was good but portions were so small and none of the dishes come with rice... you need to order rice and pay for it.
Food was mildly spiced and excellent.  They handled a large party of 20 or so very well.
Many good dishes; however, my experience here, with its modest portion sizes and sometimes too subtle flavors, left me missing the experience I get at a good, traditional, American-Indian buffet.
This is my favorite Indian restaurant. Love, love, love.
Good. Hidden gem. Food was good and so was service. Beautiful place. Not expected.
Delicious! Great service and ambiance. Would recommend for a special evening out.
Excellent, unique, Indian food and lovely ambiance.
A little pricey but the food and service are consistently fantastic
Great meal! Tried the tasting menu so explored many dishes.
Excellent food and service.  An authentic dining experience.
Great ambiance, food selection, and variety. Great service by wait staff and managers. Attentive but not helicopter-ish. Great for intimate groups (4-8).

What a fabulous experience. From the moment we're greeted at the door we feel like royalty visiting somewhere else. What an atmosphere in the dining room. Expert wait staff, and the absolute finest food in Cincinnati - and that's a high bar given the alternatives available. Go with the the 3 (or 2) course menu and wine pairings for an unbelievable taste experience.  Not something we can afford very frequently but we get there for the big events.
Excellent food and service. Duck and lamb were excellent!
Always great. The Rabbit is phenomenal. Service and ambiance can't be beat.

Jean-Robert defines elegant dining in his several venues across town. Restaurant's impeccable service is utterly unobtrusive and the servers are well-informed. We have dined there on several occasions, both in the restaurant and in the bar, and have come away pleased. This time we opted for the 2-course dinner with pairings, and while the food itself was well-prepared it was not the perfection we had come to known. The wine pairings, though, were superb, as were the selection of in-house pastries for dessert.
Great slow dining experience to appreciate delicious food and wine.  For those that appreciate fine dining, classy atmosphere and are willing to pay for it.
Wonderful! Menu gourmand was exceptional ! Decor and ambience perfection. Can not say enough good things. A must

Best restaurant in Cincinnati with beautiful ambiance, diverse menu beautifully presented food offering good value ( bargain compared to large cities) impeccable service,  No one does fine dining better than owners Richard Brown & Jean Rober

An awesome menu. Perfect setting. Brilliant presentation. Great tasting dinner. Fabulous wait staff. And...all of that plus Jean Robert de Cavel in the kitchen. I could not ask for more, but I did...all of this in a very friendly. "non-stuffy" atmosphere. PERFECT!Put this winner on your restaurant "bucket list" for sure!
Simply the most elegant restaurant in Cincinnati.  Best food between New York and Chicago.
Amazing food!
Everything was wonderful from staff to food. Nice ambiance.

L has an attention to detail that is unmatched in the tri-state area.  Outside of NYC, there are few places that I've seen that can execute to this level of perfection.  Every detail of the dinning experience, from the grand bar and service, to the entry of the magnificent dinning room, to dinning service - all done with grace and flawless delivery.  No detail in the dinning experience is trivialized.  The thoughtfulness is seen throughout a perfectly choreographed experience.  Their attention to GF was outstanding.  I'm grateful to have this set of amazing restaurateurs in Cincinnati that can have this level of execution.Thank you, team L for another wonderful experience.

Having had superb dining experiences in the past, there is not much more to say except it is still superb. Service, food, and ambiance continue to be in the top tier in Cincinnati. For a very special evening at, by the quality standard of the restaurant, a very reasonable price, one could not find a better place to dine.We will go back often.
Everything was delightful....music agreeable, but a tad too loud...
Restaurant L is a very special destination and we had a wonderful evening!  Be prepared to spend time there, enjoy the atmosphere and excellent service, as well as the exquisite cuisine.
An experience! The ambiance is outstanding and the food is delicious. Service and taste were at a level I've never experienced before.
Just a wonderful experience. This is why it is one of the very best restaurants in Cincinnati. Expensive but worth it. Service was great!!!
Wow!  Tremendous service and food!  The chef was amazing and greeted our group a couple times to explain the menu.  He was fantastic!!
L is my wife's favorite " special occasion" restaurant.   The gourmand menu was superb as well as the service.  Thank you Max and Richard.
This is our favorite restaurant for special occasions.  It was great to see chef greeting guests.  Everything was superb and outstanding.

First time there, met a friend for lunch.Was offered the Friday express lunch in the lounge so we decided on that. First course was soup or salad and second course was a Pho burger or chicken crepes for $12.Delicious!! Will go back again for dinner.

What a gem in red neck Cincinnati, the place is somptuous, the service perfect although a bit too fast, they wanted to close early, with just three tables that evening. The show is the inventive food of the French chef, at the level of a  star Michelin if the inspectors knew where Cincinnati was! A bemol to this otherwise perfect evening: the wine pairing done with perfectly low quality boring wines. Not acceptable for such gorgeous food.
Love the restaurant.  When I want a casual night out with friends, I go to the bar area.  Couldn't be better.
A wonderful experience from start to finish!
Everything was delicious. Ambience was great and the staff was fantastic.
Everything was perfect, as expected.  One table of six got a little loud periodically.
Exactly what should come with fine French dining....great cuisine, great wine, attentive and gracious service.
Outstanding preparation and service.

Every visit to Restaurant L is a wonderful experience. The food, service and staff make this a visit to be enjoyed and savored. The presentation is wonderful and the food is excellent. Love the wine pairing option. This enhances the flavor of each course. The room is beautiful and the ambiance special.

AAAAMMMMMAAAZZZZIINNGG!   It was a perfect date night the food was fabulous!  The staff was great and informative!  We had the Gourmand menu and it‚Äôs was wonderful from start to finish.  The dining room ambiance was great
The service was exceptional as usual. Only one error, a colleague asked for more bread which never came. Food was amazing.
This was a wonderful dining experience ! The food was excellent and the service was outstanding !
We each got the 3 course Prix Fixe menu. What a great way to try multiple delicious food.
Beautiful and delicious, a great experience

What a great choice to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We have always enjoyed the Orchids but it has not met our expectations in  quality of food and service.  We decided to try Restaurant L this year and were pleasantly surprised.  There were many mixed reviews regarding L, but nothing but raves from us.  The room was beautiful and the service was superb.  The food and presentation outstanding.  We chose the three course dinner with the wine pairings  WOW for both. The flavors of each course were wonderful and the venison hit the jackpot.  The wines worked very well with the food and certainly enhanced the flavors of the evening.  We certainly look forward to return visits.  In our book it is the best restaurant in Cincinnati.

3 course prix fixe with wine pairing. 5 star Euro experience from start to finish Chef came to  each table to greet and check in. Staff knowledgeable and very open and personable. Richard Brown is wonderful historian of restaurant industry in Cincinnati as well as NYC and Europe.

Nothing can beat their Friday express linch in the bar.  2 courses for $12.  Of course we included a bottle of wine and desserts too.  The soups here are always heavenly and no one does salmon like this place.

We went to L's to celebrate my sister-in-law's retirement.  We had great quiet evening where the staff continued to excel in everything they did.  The drinks were outstanding and the menu was better than expected.  I'm looking forward to my next visit to L's, to see what's new on the menu.
While we enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and felt no rush, some of the service did lag a bit.  However, we were greatly accommodated and we are happy to recommend Restaurant L to others.
My wife and I had a wonderful Christmas lunch. The 4 course tasting menu was superb! Always a wonderful time at L. It is a very special place.
Absolutely fantastic!   Sat outside and we were covered by the passing rain shower.   The food was delicious and service top notch.   So happy we found this restaurant!
Amazing experience overall! Fantastic service and fantastic experience.
Old reliable. The most consistently good restaurant in Chicago.
They have a decent wine collection. Good service too.
The service was amazing. The entire staff was extremely friendly and attentive. The food was delicious. Loved it and will definitely return.

This is a very cozy neighborhood restaurant that has a terrific menu to please a variety of tastes. The help is exceptional--friendly, helpful and efficient. I have dined here many times and will continue to do so! It is a bit pricey but worth the $$ since the dishes are so delicious.
Perfect neighborhood spot worth leaving your own neighborhood to visit! Delicious food, great ambience, professional and friendly service.
Very accommodating, will custom prepare a dish if necessary.  Authentic cooking and great neighborhood atmosphere .
Best Italian restaurant in the city!

Everything was so good; the wine, the complementary bruschetta, arugula salad, prosciutto pizza, and surprise birthday tiramisu. Friend was late for our reservation, no problem. We  shared a pizza, no judgement. Very friendly, genuine service -  attentive and unobtrusive. Genuine Italian fresh, quality food full of flavor- the cooks have the gift! Welcoming, soothing, and lively atmosphere. A real gem. Highly recommended.
Lovely spot with so many great food choices it was hard to pick!
Excellent everything! Would recommend for any event or just dinner. Value is excellent, great wine selection and the food was best I‚Äôve had since leaving NJ. Will definitely be back.
Always such a great meal and outstanding service.
Always love Riccardo's.  Friendly staff and delicious food.
Absolutely love this place. Classic italian, delicious food, low key setting.
I am always amazed at the quality of the food and the excellence of the service.

This is one of our favorite restaurants of all time.  We live a five minute walk away and always ask ourselves why we don't eat here more often.  The service is helpful and friendly.  The food is outstanding.  Never had a bad time here.
Food is wonderful and the service was exceptional. Made us feel special.
Excellent neighborhood restaurant. Exceptional food and super personable and professional staff.

Food and service were excellent. We came on a VERY cold night and were seated just in front of the door and asked if we'd be frozen out in that location. We were offered a 20-30 minute wait for another table but they said we'd be OK. The restaurant has a long entry between the outside door and the inside door. There is a sign asking people to make sure that the outside door is closed before opening the inside door. A member of the restaurant staff spent much of his time by the inside door to make sure that guests observed the request.
Great pizza, good wine selection and friendly neighborhood spot.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Lincoln Park. Cesar, JP, Juan and all of the chefs and staff are top notch ‚Äî friendly, courteous and always provide great recommendations, superior service and delicious meals. I cannot say enough about how much we adore Cesar! Riccardo should be very proud of him and all who make this restaurant so great! And Riccardo himself is the best of the best of all chefs in Chicago and a lovely, kind, intelligent, amazing person too! I do not know many who have his passion, kind heart and amazing talent!!!
Food and ambiance was of the highest quality.  Highly recommend this place.
A neighborhood gem. We come often for the authentic food and excellent service. I‚Äôm from New York City; the size and vibe remind me of home.
Wonderful and quiet New Year‚Äôs Eve dinner. Simply delicious.
Best small venue Italian in Chicago!!!  The food is always great and the service is even better.
Birthday celebration. Great place to enjoy w friends. Great food and service.
We love Riccardo Enoteca. Really really love it. Special occasion, every day. We always have a reason to go.

One of a few restaurants open on Christmas Eve, we had a great meal here.  The Milanese style pizza was revelatory with its crisp, light crust.  The lasagna and the lobster fettuccine were fantastic, as were the scallops.  Excellent wine list, too.
The food is always delicious and inventive. And the staff, charming. Our favorite neighborhood spot.
Great local italian with exceptional service. Staff are so welcoming and attentive.  Nice wine list!  A place you can return to again and again knowing you will have a wonderful evening.
The bolognese was out of this world! Can't wait to return
The staff was amazing, the atmosphere is Welcoming, but the food stole the show. DELICIOUS!!
Service was excellent.  We had the Napoletana and Vegetarians pizzas, bean soup, and gnocchi. Delicious!   Spectacular wine list.   And very nice ambience.
Great food, great wine list and service. Adorable little restaurant. Great evening out with the family!
Riccardo Enoteca is always a delicious meal! It‚Äôs a wonderful restaurant in Linvoln Park!
Waitstaff is excellent. Food was wonderful.
Holiday Zoo Lights
Great menu
My new favorite Italian place. Great veal parmigiana.
Fantastic restaurant with innovative food.  Packed every night.  Tip - go and wait at 5.30pm when they just open and you can sit at the bar!
Incredible food, incredible service. Would go back in a heartbeat but very difficult to get a reservation.
Another amazing place....excellent food and experience.
Always a solid choice.  Creative menu, smart wait staff.
Absolutely loved the place.  Our waiter was very nice and helped us make good menu selections for it being our first time visiting.
Top notch culinary experience, yet you may come away hungry
Fabulous.  Great for foodies, anniversaries, theatre.  Just great food and wine
the food is delicious. ideally located and tolerable noise level

We rolled in at 5pm without a reservation and sat right away at the bar. We shared a tomato bone marrow butter toast and also split a pasta dish and a chimichurri rib eye as well. It was all delicious. The bartender was friendly and attentive. Try Pep in your Step for a drink, it was outstanding
Outstanding service and meal.  Always a treat to come here.
great food small neighborhood rest. need reservation
Nice hearty food in nice ambiance. we get takeout all the time. try the roasted broccoli !
GREAT.  Attentive, delicious, innovative.  Save up your $$$ and colories for this one.  Its absolutely worth it.
This place is worth every penny.  Its creative visually and stimulates the taste buds beyond belief.

Creative dishes, fresh ingredients, service was absolutely fantastic!  The tasting menu was a fun experience, wine paring was a nice compliment.  My partner and I shared the pairing which worked out nicely.  Will definitely return!
Waitress who had a bad attitude from inception It made the dining experience very uncomfortable
This place is phenomenal. My only complaint is that maybe the seating could be a little more comfortable but the food and wine pairings are so good that it doesn't really matter.
The food was very good, the service was outstanding and he atmosphere rustic and enjoyable.  I will return.
Glad we went! The Staff was very friendly and energetic and always helpful. Rich Table is a "must try".
Husband 40 birthday

Our server, Dana, was fantastic! When I told her that I brought a ‚Äúbig wine ‚Äú to share with our friends, she immediately offered to decant the bottle. We had a symphony performance after dinner, and she made sure that we were able to leave the restaurant in time to make our curtain. Dana was friendly, efficient and knowledgeable regarding the menu.  She made our evening more enjoyable. The food was top rate. We shared appetizers and each had an entree. We especially liked the porcini donuts, rock cod, and rib eye steak covered with onion rings. Looking forward to returning in the future.
We‚Äôve come here for Anniversary a few times now. We always have a good meal. Excellent food. Always tasty. One of our favorites in SF.
Very Imaginative cooking, served very "warmly" professionally, totally non-pretentious totality. Quite enjoyable and special.

Excelllent food and a highly trained staff who know the menu and knows even better how to make you feel at ease.  A fantastic experience from start to finish. We will be back - if we can get a reservation, that is!
Bday, great atmosphere and vibe

Yes, this is a great restaurant. We had the tasting menu with the pairings. There were three of us and we basically got the entire menu and each dish was fantastic. The pairings suited every dish and the best part was each of us had a different dish with a different pairing and it was a true in depth and varied tour of mostly local wines and beers and ciders. A very fun evening. Hope to return!
Loved it! Delicious food, attentive staff, what more does one ask for.

Great night and food at Rich table. Per ballet meal. All dishes were exceptionally good from the signature donuts, to the soft shell crab and the various pastas. The lasagna was unusual and good, the bucatini with peas and mint a nice blend with cheese topping.
My wife and I were passing by San Francisco, heard great review about this place. The food were amazing, we will definitely come again.

Great night and food at Rich table. Per ballet meal.  All dishes were exceptionally good from the signature donuts, to the soft shell crab and the various pastas.  The lasagna was unusual and good, the bucatini with peas and mint a nice blend with cheese topping.

First time to RT ‚Äî we were not disappointed! The buccatini was our favorite pasta dish. Highly recommend. We ordered the hush puppies and perrogies as well, both of which were excellent. Most people around us got the porcini doughnuts though, probably should‚Äôve had those as they seemed popular. 10/10!

Great food, but overpriced, and wine list is crazy. Starts at $60, and wine wasn't even that nice. Also charged for bread and butter, which is always annoying. Great menu, but you really need a large group to do it justice by sharing. There are too many courses for two to enjoy.

This was one of the best experiences I have ever had.  There are a lot of wonderful, unique restaurants in San Francisco.....but this one is particularly special.  I recommend doing the chef's tasting menu.  Also, the Rich Table cookbook is a lot of fun.
Our dinner and dessert with Tiffany and her associates was phenomenal - can‚Äôt wait to go back!  Thanks so much, everyone.
a little bit salty. The ingredients are all fresh and special.
Food and drinks were amazing and service was wonderful.
You guys are the best!!! Keep doing it!!!! Thanks!
Amazing funky food. ‚ÄúFit for foodies‚ÄùIf you‚Äôre from out of town, don‚Äôt miss this spot
The food was delicious and the service warm and helpful. The server‚Äôs suggestions were perfect in terms of portions and dishes.
Anniversary
Outstanding!!!
Excellent food and service, and the bagpipes were an exceptional treat!
Service and food are always great.

This is my favourite Chicago restaurant.  Great service, food, beverages, and ambiance.  Tonight I had the sea bass special--extraordinary.  And I never miss the brussels sprouts, with lardons!!  Yummy.  White tablecloth, sophisticated service.  Makes you feel good.
Always a great experience and quality meal.
Good overall experience. The crabcake was a little weird with the crispy strands around it but was ok. Burger excellent.

Never thought I would dine at an RL restaurant and feel like my group was a burden.  From the moment we walked in the door we were met with an attitude.   We are in Chicago for 3 nights and wish we hadn‚Äôt wasted one of them at your restaurant.  Hopefully you can learn from this.
My absolute favorite ladies lunch spot.  Took my 88 year old mom and our waiter made her feel so special.
Everything went well. Missed Joseph but Seamus and Henry did a great job of filling in. We were well pleased.
We love dining here! Best, most accommodating staff in the city, in an incredibly beautiful room. Oh yeah and the foods awesome!
A great time was had by all!
Great waiter, excellent service.

This was our first time at the RL Restaurant and it was fantastic! The service was impeccable, the food was absolutely delicious, and the ambiance in the restaurant is perfect. They even took notice of my ID and realized my birthday was in a few days, and I got a birthday dessert! This is a restaurant where you truly feel taken care of from the moment you walk in the door until the moment you walk out. I can‚Äôt wait to go back!

Repeat visit for me. Love the ambience, location right off the Mag Mile and the burger! Came with a few people after a work cocktail party looking for some real food. Not quite a fancy occasion, and the host was great about finding us a table in the bar area. The service is great, not too stuffy but attentive. Great wine by the glass list, and always love this delish RL burger.
Great vibe, excellent service!
Great ‚ÄòOld Fashioned‚Äô cocktails followed by delicious food serviced by a very friendly team. The ambiance is unique making this one of our favourite places in Chicago.

Both Jose Vazquez and Jaaffar Sabbar were superior.Jaaffar Sabbar connected us to the food and to the RL brand.  He went well out of his way to provide exceptional service. We‚Äôll definitely return and ask for Jaaffar.A perfect evening.
Extensive menu & high quality service

The hostesses and Flavia were terrific. Tom and assistants did a great job and ensured all was wonderful from start to finish. It is so nice for us to have backup for Joseph The Hreat. Tom and Aramis are great backups so we always have a delightful dining experience!!
Loved every sip/bite. I ordered the espresso martini, shrimp cocktail and roasted vegetable pappardelle. Delish!
Excellent as always.
This is our favorite restaurant in the US! We love going to RL on any occasion. Highly recommend you go. the service the food and everything about RL is wonderful!
it's perfect, every time.  thank you!  AMAZING crab and avocado salad too.

From the time you enter, until the time you leave satisfied, you feel the Ralph Lauren magic! The decor makes you feel you have arrived. The service makes you feel special. The food makes you feel like a king or queen! You won‚Äôt be disappointed!
Great atmosphere very chic place to dine anytime
Cozy throw back to the 1970 feel of warmth and cozy restaurant.. sort of wraps it‚Äôs arms around you!
Siempre un gran lugar!!!! La decoraci√≥n y el ambiente con sensaci√≥n de refinamiento. Accesible de precio y servicio excelente!!!!

Loved my table. Loved the always pro and delightful service. Loved the Bollinger Grande Ann√©e (though I definitely didn‚Äôt need a champagne 101. got that covered ;)). LOVED that mushroom and kale salad. Made two more lunch reservations for next week!
Excellent wine and beer list!  Today enjoyed Moody Tongue Carmelized Chocolate Churro Baltic Porter brewed in Chicago!  Delicious!  Enjoyed the Clam Chowder!  And Chicken Salad!
Something has changed- not sure what.Fries were really terrible - better available in McDonalds.Steak and fish were excellent.Did somebody change the chocolate cake?
Excellent ambiance, great service and the best lake perch in the Midwest!
Excellent food and service.
My friend and I lunch here at least once a month and it never disappoints. See you next month!
Always love RL when in the city Great place to see and be seen ‚ù§Ô∏èDon‚Äôt we all want the RL lifestyle #veryralph

I wrote in our Gold Coast posting requesting what we thought was our favorite restaurant and I posted RL. In the space asking why I said because of Joseph and Flavia plus the other waiters and servers who all make it a great experience. You haven‚Äôt dined our until you‚Äôve been served by Joseph!
Good food and overall good service. I‚Äôm definitely coming back for more!

Ambiance and service were great.Food was really average.Tuna tartare was blend and totally uninspired... pieces of raw tuna with pieces of avocado on top of over salted fried cresson... the calf liver was mushy and tasteless Same thing with the beef tartare... but hey the oysters were fabulous Wait... that‚Äôs the only thing the chef didn‚Äôt actually make!;)
A classic atmosphere that invites all to experience their food and excellent service...
Food and service was very good.  Had to wait about 20 minutes for our table and they stuff absolutely as many people as possible into the room.

My wife and I have been to RL many times. I've reviewed it before. Simply put, It is our favorite restaurant in Chicago, the one place we go every time we are in town. My favorite is the Crab and Avocado Salad. It was excellent again (an avocado half piled high with lump crab meat with lightly dressed greens).My wife likes the Filet and the burger. She got the burger this time and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  She also lived the Brussels sprouts. Always good. Consistent. We love the atmosphere and the location is great for us.
For obvious reasons we could not make it to the reservation but we did order RPM thorugh Doordash and it was still very good.
Service was great. Food was delicious. We loved everything about the experience.

Very exquisite food and very good quality! Sometimes it‚Äôs nice to splurge once in a while, especially in one of my favorite cities. Side note: when you reserve for big groups, I would suggest two people in the group reserving and then coming in person the night before or a few hours before the reservation to see if there‚Äôs a possibility to sit together. The hostesses were very accommodating. Thank you!

This was my second time going to this location and was an attempt to change my initial poor decision. Service was very attentive and friendly. We started with the focaccia and meatballs. The focaccia was delicious and the meatballs were just not my taste consistency-wise. For dinner we shared the gnocchi and wild mushroom risotto which were both delicious. I would recommend this as a stop for a good meal and beautiful ambience.

One of the best dining experiences I have ever had. The food and drinks were absolutely amazing and there was a wide selection. Our verbal was extremely educated, attentive and outgoing. The pricing is also extremely affordable and reasonable. Hope to be back soon! Thank you RPM and staff!
Good food and great ambiance!!!
Very nice experience, food is excellent.
Birthday celebration
Dre, was amazing. Best service ever. Everyone ask for him. The food is always dependably great.

We had a very fun experience at RPM Italian. The dishes were very good. Some of our favorites were the Mediterranean Octopus, Brussels sprouts, meatball appetizer, and swordfish. The cocktails were also very well crafted with a long list of bourbons, ryes, whiskeys.
It was great!
Outstanding food! This was some of the best tartare we've ever had & the homemade pastas & ricotta were delicious. We will definitely return next time we're in town.

We were there celebrating a very special birthday and RPM Italian is the guest of honor's favorite restaurant and he goes here all the time. The girl that seated us had an attitude and had a look on her face that she would literally rather be anywhere else in the world to the point where one of my guests had to ask her if she was ok, I'm not sure if she was having a bad day but it was very visible on her face and she acted annoyed when we asked if we could have another table but there was a woman that I wish i got her name because she was amazing and she found out that maybe we wanted a round table and she moved us to the round table. She also brought us a variety of readers when our waitress only brought one pair that were too strong for someone that needed it so I appreciated her so much because I would not have been happy with our experience at all if it wasn't for her. You could tell she cared about our experience which I really appreciated. Also there was a misunderstanding with our waitress on the salads and who was splitting what so we had to order another salad because the way it was split up (which I appreciated that they split them for us), there was a person that was left out and was not brought out a salad. Other than that, the food was outstanding but maybe it was just a bad night but I think service needs to be taken up a notch because that is also a very important part of the dining experience.
What an amazing restaurant! The wine list was spectacular and the sommelier was very knowledgeable and directed us to an excellent Tuscan red. I am vegan and there were plenty of options!
Great food! Great experience and service was excellent!

The server was very rude and the food was cold.  She would rush back and forth by our table and never stop to ask how our meal was.  I have dined here many times and have always enjoyed the experience but was highly disappointed by our server.  Not polite or accommodating and rushed us.  Sommelier was excellent and took great care.I had guests from out of town that I have been raving about the restaurant and was embarrassed about the experience.
Pasta was too al dente, but sauce was great and service outstanding
Wonderful!  Great food.  Matthew was our server.  He was so great.
The staff was outstanding despite the presence of two badly inebriated guests in our party. They couldn't have been more helpful and generous as the pair eventually left dinner
This was my second time there and RPM did not disappoint. The wagyu tartar was amazing. The artichokes were flaky and the sauce with it was a marriage made in heaven. The pastas were outstanding.

Great time and awesome experience. It is sad that we couldn't use our points because that is why we went there. We had never been told.before hand and it should be explained before hand. Bad customer experience.
Had dinner with two little kids, felt welcomed. Food is delicious, small portion but good quality.
Our waiter was phenomenal.   He truly was the best waiter/server I have ever had and I travel for work so that is a lot of people I am comparing him to.   He needs a raise and promotion to a manager.
Good time. Great ambiance!
Seated us 30 mins after our reservation with no apology.
Our server was amazing!! She told us all about the specials and how to order the beat way in order to enjoy your meal. She really knew her stuff!
It was my daughter‚Äôs birthday they treated us like royalty, and the food was amazing!

Ambiance and overall experience was good. Food was ok. Definitely not the best Italian I've ever had, but not bad. I wish they didn't grill the focaccia and left it soft... And the cheesecake definitely need some citrus to cut the sweetness. The texture of the pastas was great, but the sauces are in desperate need of flavor. The gnocchi needed a creamier sauce in our opinion... For a cheese and pepper (cacio e pepe) sauce, it was very oily.
Had a great waitress and loved the overall ambiance of the space. Great food with well executed ingredients. Loved how special all our desserts were as well.
Always excellent, but our server was particularly fantastic!!

Disappointing both in food and service. You really wouldn‚Äôt know RPM Italian and RPM Steak were run and owned by the same people. I had very high hopes for Italian considering how amazing Steak is....totally disappointed.Staff was rude, not very friendly (like at all) and maybe even snobby. Food was so bland and lackluster. Wish I chose a different restaurant for our short trip...
It was wonderful!
Superb on every way!!!
Fabuloso, el servicio muy bueno, la comida excelente, el ambiente incre√≠ble
Very good! Loved the ambiance and cozy booths no to mention the fantastic food, especially the truffle garlic bread, gnocchi, chicken parm and desserts.  Will come back!

We had the best time! Robert, our server was amazing! He was so kind and lovely and fun! Dan, the somm helped us pick the most amazing wine for our meal and I can‚Äôt stop thinking about it. And the bar manager was also awesome for his brief time stopping by! Food was awesome we got the prosciutto service, beef carpaccio, bone in ribeye, gnocchi, & sides! So good! For being pretty corporate & making the servers wear white which I think is mean considering how much I would spill on those, it felt personal and everyone gave the perfect amount of attention. I can‚Äôt wait to go back
Excellent food and service! The pastas were delicious, the desserts are outta this world

Incredible!!!!! We were treated like royalty!!!!  Food and service, ambiance, hosts, everything was perfection!  I have not been this impressed with every aspect of a dining experience in a very, very long time.  Cheers RPM, you rocked it!!!!

We celebrated my mom‚Äôs 70th birthday.  We were seated right away at a great table.  Outlet waiter was very attentive & our meal was amazing.  Such a well run restaurant!  Will be heading back for sure!
Always amazing. Meatballs, warm ricotta toast, chicken parm and carbonara every time.
Great service and great staff.
The grouper special was delicious!!!  Our server was attentive. Nice wine selection
Great food and owner was very friendly and engaging. Will definitely come back.
Paco makes everyone feel welcome and the food is always perfectly done.

As usual, everything about my experience at Rudy & Paco‚Äôs was phenomenal.   The quality of the food is unsurpassed.  The server, Franco Perez, was the ultimate professional.  The attention to detail and unique, delectable dishes paired with an upscale, elegant atmosphere makes Rudy & Paco‚Äôs one of the most absolutely delightful places to dine anywhere.
Delicious food Perfect service Nice atmosphere not noisy Overall fantastic Wish there was a Paco and Rudy‚Äôs in Houston

The grilled snapper with creole sauce was excellent and I will order it again.  The bourbon selection was very good with some hard to find bottles.  We enjoyed the dinner very much and will return soon.

Rudy & Paco Restaurant & Bar is a great place to relax and dine.  The service is outstanding as is the food.  Paco introduced himself and was gracious and friendly.  If you are looking for a nice, quiet, relaxing place to enjoy a meal with friends this is a great choice.
Good food, good service, high priced for what you receive.

Still a good choice for better food and atmosphere over 99.9% of island.  I have to say I am disappointed the last few times in as long as I've been going (practically since it opened).  I am greeted by owner as feeling forced (like he HAS to say hi as I'm there next to my husband) but warmly greets my husband like it's a male thing. It may seem petty to some but as a long time customer (I'd not go anymore bcuz of it but my husband loves it),  I feel unwelcomed and unease.  I do not know why as it was not always the case. One wants to feel welcome and comfortable when dining out. It is my only real gripe as food and service are mostly on point.

Always the best. We had the grouper special last night!  So fresh and tasty. Always count on Paco for great fresh fish with daily specials. You need to make reservations and remind your guests of the no shorts policy. You won‚Äôt regret your visit to Rudy and Paco‚Äôs.
Food was amazing.  Service was stellar.  Would highly recommend!!
Alex was a great server!!!!!!
You expect a quality experience at Rudy & Paco's and you always get it.
Excellent as always
Always a pleasant experience!
This is an amazing restaurant with amazing food and top notch service. It's not inexpensive but it's worth every penny.
Fabulous! We had the best time! Great food and great service!

Impeccable service with amazing food!  Good variety of cocktails that were hand crafted and perfectly balanced.  Seafood was fresh and not overwhelmed by sauce and/or cooking method.  Dessert was perfect!
This is our favorite restaurant to visit when we are in the Galveston area.  The staff, ambiance, and food are always excellent, without exception.
Four friends reunion that Rudy and Paco Restaurant made so very special!!!
We really had a good time with our dining experience last Saturday. The person attending the table was very professional, nice and helpful. The food was great. Overall was an excellent dinner.
Attention to detail was magnificent! The servers bringing everything out together along with drinks even! Outstanding! We even met Paco!
Classic restaurant with delicious food and attentive service.  Great for special occasion, date night and celebration.

Rudy and Paco Restaurant is one of our favorite restaurants any where and our favorite Galveston restaurant. Our trips to Galveston are never complete without a couple of Rudy and Paco meals. Our waiter Alex, always works hard to give us the best possible experience. I had the grouper with lump crab and it was delicious.
Awesome food, service, wine selection.  Owner came to tables to inquire about how we liked everything.  Great food selection.  We will definitely return when in Galveston.
Paco and his crew NEVER disappoint!Thanks again for a wonderful evening!Erin and Bill Alexander

Wonderful service, friendly staff and excellent meal had by all. I had the scallops which were  prepared to perfection. My wife had the redfish topped with crab meat - absolutely wonderful. Highly recommended and can't wait to return to Rudy and Paco for a fine dinning experience.

Love this place!  Fantastic empanadas, shrimp and pasta was so fresh and grilled gulf red snapper with cilantro cream sauce, yummm.  They have the best bread pudding (outside of my own). I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed.
Hands down one of the best experiences for dinner. Food was fantastic!
Went for a lunch date. Several selections to choose from, all very good. The setting was quiet and the service was excellent.

This is the first time the food was very disappointing. The rib eye wasn't just fatty (which I love). It was stringy. Definitely not a high quality steak. And tough. Broccolini was undercooked. The lump crab accomoanying the steak was, well, lump crab. For the money, we would have paid well for a high cut of beef and Alaskan king crab legs. I seriously have to think whether I would ever come back.  The swrvice, however, was great. Rebecca was attentive and kind.

One of the best experiences we have ever had. Our server,  Valeria, was perfect. The owner, Paco, visited our table several times and even took us on a personal tour of his other restaurant, Vargas, across the street.
This is a superlative restaurant.  If you have the opportunity to eat here, do so.
Birthday dinner! Food was fabulous !!
Anniversary

Our server Nicole was perfect. The food was very good. We especially enjoyed the BT Camerones, the Crab Bisque and Ribeye. The many reviews I read said that the owner visited every table. We were celebrating a very special anniversary and did not receive a visit from Paco, even though the restaurant was not full. Oh well, we made the most of our anniversary, even if the restaurant did not.

We just Rudy and Paco! We had an early Valentines dinner there and it made the evening so special! The service is at a level above anything in the area, the food is delicious and the value is very good for the level of service and food. Highly recommend.
The food and service was perfect as always!  Highly recommend for an occasion or just wanting a great meal.
The service was spectacular! The food was marvelous!

We had gone to the Saddle River Inn a few times back during the reign of owner and master chef Hans Egg. Therefore, we were somewhat sceptical of what new owners Jamie Knott and Peter Lioia would do in order to sustain the immense tradition of this fine establishment.Well, skeptics no more. The new owners have masterfully sustained legacy dishes (read: Maribar) and interlaced new and creative dinners and appetizers alike.This is to say nothing of their par excellence dining room staff. The wait staff, host, support, and coat check are all extremely professional, lively, and not the least bit pretentious or robotic.Lastly, we always end our visit with a walk around the wonderful grounds and adjacent areas. The pictures additionally prove the resounding point that this legendary spot remains strong.

This was our second visit under the new ownership.  First class all around from the service, food and surroundings.  Menu prices are reasonable given the food quality.  However, the specials were priced high.  A Dover Sole was $68.  Seems a little steep.  Our main courses ranged from lamb and pork to halibut and shrimp risotto.  All were excellent.
My husband and I had a lovey dinner.   The food and the staff were superb.
Fantastic ambient, romantic setting. We love how cozy and rustic the place. We are 100% coming back
Excellent food and service
Always a wonderful meal and experience. Cannot say enough. Wish I could get reservations more often
We were celebrating my husband‚Äôs birthday.  He enjoyed it immensely
Always an outstanding dinner. Only problem is getting a reservation at the Saddle River Inn. We like to have dinner there about every 2 months, but availability is limited.
Saddle river inn never disappoints. Food was outstanding. Cheese plate finish. Amazing. Great place for special moments

It was good to return for our anniversary. It had been many years. Nice ‚Äúelegantly rustic‚Äù setting. My veal chop special and my wife‚Äôs fish were excellently prepared. Service was efficient and attentive. Kale Caesar was different and tasty. Nice citrusy merengue dessert. Pricey, but very good food and a nice special occasion place.
This was our 2nd dinner at the Saddle River Inn; we like to go for a special occasion and it is definitely worth it.  The food, service and ambiance are outstanding
Always the best.Two terrific sirloin steaks with all the trimmings. The ladies both had fish dishes. Great service and ambiance.Nice relaxing non rushed dining experience.
This place is amazing. Great service. Great food. Very nice setting. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again!
Best place anywhere, we go as often as possible and would choose to go here more than any other restaurant. Reservations are challenging at times but what great restaurants aren‚Äôt.
Anniversary
This could be the best restaurant I have ever been to service and food was outstanding. The only thing missing is a liquor license
This restaurant never disappoints. Nick was our server. He was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. It was a great meal.
Hands down the best place in NJ for any occasion!
All around lovely and delicious. A bit of a wait in the small waiting area was awkward, but besides that it was fantastic.

I‚Äôm not one to have a broad pallet for food. I mostly stick to the things I know.  I figured since this was a special occasion I‚Äôd try the 5 course tasting menu.  What set me even further out of my comfort zone, considering it‚Äôs a blind tasting.  Well , I couldn‚Äôt have been more pleased with my choice. Since we both got the tasting we each got a different plate at each course. We decided to split each course and the food was absolutely amazing. I got to eat many foods I‚Äôve never tried before and i can‚Äôt speak more highly of the chef‚Äôs talents. Crab, Scallops, lobster, lamb, carpaccio, halibut, BLT, duck, everything was amazing. I will definitely be returning and highly recommend. All the research my girlfriend did to assure this was the place to eat, did not disappoint.
best NJ restaurant I've been to, romantic ambience, excellent service,  top notch ingredients and food preparation,  super professional staff, yet friendly
Excellent food. Tye is great server.  Only wish we could get in on a Saturday
Excellent service. Food is consistently well prepared and inventive. I appreciate that we are always promptly seated.
A superb meal in every way. The best duck breast I‚Äôve ever had.

The Saddle River Inn is still one of the top restaurants in Northern New Jersey. The food is incredible. I had the duck breast and it was perhaps the best duck I ever had. My wife had the Salmon special and it was just as good. The service is impeccable. Although the prices are higher than most restaurants it is BYOB so the value is still very good.

Delicious! We had the special of the night, bone-in ribeye steak for two, and it was better than any steakhouse I have been to.  For appetizer, I had the squash capriccio and it was delicious and gourmet.  My wife had the Sichuan noodles  and loved it.  This is a special place perfect for romantic dinner!

Always flawless in food and service. I think they can do a little more with upstairs decor.  The mirror looks dirty & dingy. Love the downstairs more. Our favorite restaurant. Anthony is very welcoming!!
Great service and excellent food! Very accommodating to my gluten allergy!

We had a truly perfect dinner here on Valentine's Day. Very comfortable seating tables not too close together. Service was very good and food was delicious. We shared the octopus starter and both had steak, the Kansas City special and the filet. Very nice ambiance, got dressed for the occasion and we weren't the only ones. Nice to see people making dinner a special night out again. Would highly recommend.
Excellent as always.  Never disappoints!
Place is the best everything always amazing
The best restaurant in New Jersey and possibly the tri-state area. The food is superb and the service attentive and professional.  Worth the cost and wait for a reservation!

I love going to this restaurant. This was our 4 year in a row that my husband has taken me to The Saddle River Inn for my birthday. He know it is my favorite. Just by my ratings, you know how I feel about this restaurant.

We love the Saddle River Inn.  Came here for an early  Valentines Day celebration. Ty was our server.  Service was professional and attentive but not pushy. Our meals were excellent. Atmosphere perfect. We will be back.
Always the best.  We‚Äôve been going for many years!
This place never disappoints.
Saddle River Inn never misses. Absolutely my favorite place for a special occassion.
