Great place, service, food ! We will come over and over again! Haven!
The food lives up to the hype. Such a great place for a special occasion.

Great restaurant for sure. The prices unfortunately make it a little less of a regular venue, but you definitely get everything you would want and then some. Currently I rate it the best restaurant in the area, and if not certainly top 5.
It is a great restaurant. The food was great and the service very attentive. We really enjoyed it

Our waiter mispronounced French food on the menu, was inattentive and showed poor manners. For example, both my husband and I ordered aperitifs. Our waiter asked my husband if he wanted a refill, but failed to ask me, when my glass was also empty. He presented the desert menu to my husband rather than me, cleared my husband‚Äôs plate before mine, apparently not aware of proper protocol to attend to the lady first. To summarize, our waiter acted as if I did not exist. Disappointed in the service.
As always, everything was perfect. The food, the service, the atmosphere
Just excellent.
Amazing food!!! Best restaurant in Raleigh. This is a hidden gem
Pretend to be FrenchShould be closed completely Folks should be doing something else

Very disappointing evening. The food was still good, but not worth the money. Service was noticeably poor, while outstanding service has long been a hallmark of St. Jacques '.We had ordered a special dessert, as has been our habit. Clearly the new chef had no idea what he was supposed to do, yet the order was taken and I was not called about it ahead of time. We will most likely not return.
Lovely!Server was perfectly attentive & professional. Food was divine!

French food is not my usual go to but Saint Jacques is definitely the place to go for a special evening, whatever it may be.  The french wine and seafood dishes we ordered were excellent.  My friend ordered the pitterfoiles which she said were devine.  Our server was fabulously informative, friendly, and attentive.  A perfect evening!
Late lunch with my niece. The great food added wonderfully to the flow and spontaneity of our conversation. Thanks. Katharine
Dessert was awful. Server was going to take it off of the price but I said no. Should've reconsidered.Dan
It was a wonderful experience.  Service, food and presentation was superb
Service at Saint Jacques is excellent.  Food is delicious.

Excellent service, almost all the food was excellent except for the beer tenderloin.  My husband asked for it medium rare and it definitely came out well done.  We opted to not send it back as to not ruin the evening plus the overall taste was excellent.  Just expected better for a steak that costs that much.

I‚Äôve eaten here before..... best French Restaraunt in area ..... was here for Valentines Day.... prefixed menu.... I knew it wasn‚Äôt going to be the quality of the normal menu, but did expect it to still exceed other restaurants.   I was very disappointed.  Clearly focused on profiting on a special occasions by sacrificing the quality of their product.  I‚Äôm sure the chef knows since they taste what goes out of their kitchen.
We've dined here for over 10 years and have never been disappointed.
Sweetbreads were overcooked. Potato au gratin with lamb was watery and had to be sent back.

Cocktails, appetizers, desserts & presentation were outstanding. Entree which was a puff pastry with seafood tasted like the chef made a mistake with the black pepper. I questioned the taste but the server did not offer to check on the sauce. Of course, this was the priciest portion of the meal. Expect to pay about $100 + each for the meal.

Celebrated my daughter‚Äôs birthday there and we had a wonderful time. We lived in France for many years and my daughter was born in Paris so a French themed birthday felt appropriate. The atmosphere was comfortable, noise level was good so we could hear ourselves talk. Not a big place but the tables were spaced well so we didn‚Äôt feel like we were on top of anyone.Food was delicious, service was friendly and attentive. We all agreed that it was an enjoyable experience
We celebrated my husbands birthday here and it was fantastic. Service was prompt and everything was delicious. We will definitely be back and will be recommending to friends.

We have LOVED Saint Jacques in the past, but I had a bad dining experience over lunch last week. What I was hoping for as an indulgent treat turned into a virtual nightmare. Ambiance: There were three VERY chatty and loud women in the restaurant, to the point where I could hardly hear myself think. I discreetly asked about their meal status (wrapping up, etc.), and the lovely waitress shared that they had finished - not so. I had to endure their political and gossipy conversation for an hour - could not wait to leave. Food: Again, we typically love this restaurant, but my seafood soup was gritty and the entree very rich. My posting is not so much as a warning about their food, but a heads-up to check out how loud the restaurant might be during your dining experience.

Lovely lunch and Birthday celebration!  Quiet restaurant with delicious array of baked bread, nice wine choices, delicious mussels and on the Birthday girl‚Äôs dessert plate- chef had written joyeaux Anniversaire in chocolate- a nice touch!
My husband and I celebrated his birthday there and very much enjoyed every aspect of the experience. Highly recommend the lamb and scallops.
We enjoyed our dinner very much.  We read about the restaurant in Walter magazine.  It was refreshing to find an authentic French restaurant in a strip mall.

Decided to try this place based on other reviews. We were not disappointed.  It is quaint, although located in a strip mall, they have done  good job of making the inside feel warm and inviting.  The attention to detail was nice.  Things like seating us apart from other diners when the restaurant was not yet full (we were there at 5:30) and offering dark linen because we were wearing black were appreciated. Aso,asking about allergies before beginning service, and waiting for our complete order so that the plating of all courses could be expertly timed.   Our favorite was the coquilles st jacques appetizer.  The beef bourguignon was hearty and delicious and my filet was actually medium rare which almost never happens. ( I do wish i had felt more adventurous and ordered maybe the fish special, because I decided I do prefer a good amount of char on a grilled steak, but that is personal preference. ) The butter cookies to take home were a lovely touch.  Overall a wonderful experience and we really appreciated a quiet spot for  conversation at the end of a busy week.  Perfect for a date night.
As always, food and atmosphere were fabulous!  This is  our restaurant of choice for special occasions!
It had been 20+ years since we had been to Saint Jacques. Obviously new owners, chef, etc. Still the best French food in Raleigh. Delicious!
I was very surprised to find such a lovely French restaurant in a strip mall! Service was excellent, food was beautifully presented and tasted great.  All around a great execution!
First time visit for my wife and I recently.  Delightful first experience.  Delicious food and outstanding service.  It's definitely not just another restaurant.  I'd highly recommend it!
Salmon was exquisiteBeef bourguignon excellentEscargot top shelfService great
Amazing food and great drinks! It was our first time and it will definitely not be our last!
Excellent food and service.

Had dinner on Saturday night, service was slow.  Only two beers for selection. Out of menu items and restaurant was only half full. To top it off after two hours our lamb was served ice cold! Extremely disappointing.

Amazing service, the food was spectacular, not a huge beer menu but I didn‚Äôt really expect one. Everything was great otherwise can‚Äôt even take a star off because it was so unimportant when we got everything else.
Excellent food and service, with a friendly atmosphere.
I took the wife on a diner date to Saint Jaques and we really enjoyed ourselves. The food was excellent.
Well worth the money! It was an absolutely delightful experience.

Selected this restaurant for a lunch birthday celebration.  Would definitely not recommend.  The facilities are run down which was the 1st clue.  The service was just okay and food middling at best.  Salad was fresh but vinaigretee was bland - basically like eating plain lettuce out of the bag.  Escargot main tasting element was the parsley.  Stingy with the bread - one tiny piece at a time unless asked for additional.  French onion soup okay - had better at the Outback.  Bourguignon meat was tough and salty with very little vegetables.   Saumon R√¥ti √† la Cro√ªte de Basilic was terrible - birthday girl picked this and didn't finish 1/3 of the dish.  Cr√™pe Saint Jacques was ok.  Needles to  say we didn't order any dessert.  Don't waste your money!
Very helpful, attentive and courteous staff. The food was excellent and presented very well. Great for a special occasion.
Absolutely the best sushi in Dallas, incredible service, and great ambience. Also, the way they have taken steps to keep the patrons safe is noticeable ... and certainly appreciated.
My friend had never been to Shin Sei. When I used to live in the area I would go 2-3 times a week.  First time I sat in the lounge/waiting area by the front door and had dinner. Everything was great!
Always one of my favorite restaurants in Dallas.

Our Saturday evening dinner experience was great. From the convenience of valet parking, to the cozy atmosphere, to the friendly and  efficient wait staff and finally to a deliciously prepared meal, all our expectations were met or exceeded. We will be back soon.
Food was great and I enjoyed the ambiance and decor, wish the portions were larger but you can certainly taste the quality
Great time
Don‚Äôt sit couples in the bar
Favorite spot. Think food wAs not as great as usually is. But I‚Äôll be back again for sure
We took our family for my daughter‚Äôs 12th birthday. GreAt to get out again and Shinsei was lovely!

The food was outstanding, but the service was slow. The ambiance - horrible. Too loud and seems cheap. For the same money you can get equally good sushi (or better) at several other shushing places nearby with much better ambiance and service.

The restaurant was spotless and we were greeted by all of the friendly staff.Tammy guided us through the changes  in menu.Mike enjoyed the swordfish.   I had (seriously) the freshest best tasting soft shell crab. That was a delightful surprise.We enjoyed our evening.Jan
Excellent food and service!
Always a favorite. This place is doing everything right with extra precautions to keep you safe and comfortable.
Awsome foodThursday Duck Night is our favorite Very safe and clean everyone wears masks and glovesWe really appreciate their service

This was our first visit to Shinsei and our first post pandemic foray to a dine in restaurant.  We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and I didn‚Äôt want to cook. The food was delicious!  We tried several different things and shared everything.  Of what we tried, our favorites were the pork buns, miso black cod, and Alfred roll but everything was wonderful.  The challenge will be deciding what to order and what to reorder on our next visit.  The staff was very conscientious about wearing masks and gloves and cleaning between customers.  We felt totally safe.  I highly recommend Shinsei!  Please support them during this weird time!
It was great! In a time of necessary social distancing and extra measures to make people feel safe/comfortable, they did a good job. The food was delicious!
Great food and great service! I really love sitting at the bar! The bar tenders are fun and friendly.
As usual the quality of food was stellar and the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.
Great food and wonderful service.
Celebrating getting out of quarantine
First time out since Covid began, and we stayed for close to 3 hours! Food was fabulous (our two favorites are the fried rice and dragon lady pressed sushi) and service was great.
Everything was amazing.
Food was amazing and the service was great!

Excellent experience. They did a wonderful job keeping everyone  at least 6 ft apart (social distancing), most employees had their masks on properly (not all, some had their noses uncovered and delivered food or water). The shishito peppers were disappointing, we ordered blistered but they were only cooked until soft, there was no blistering. Everything else was delicious. Love the presses sushi!
Great stuff for first day open again
Great place in the neighborhood to eat early in a time of anxiety.
Always amazing.
Our server was wonderful! We had a large party with a few small children and he could not have been nicer to them. The food was delicious!

My husband and I always love this place! Because their food is always consistently delicious, I took a leap of faith and tried sashimi here for the first time. I loved it. We love to order a bunch of little plates and share to get a variety of flavors and plates.
Brought my fianc√©‚Äôs vendor from Arizona here. He is a world traveler and foodie. Shinsei is always one of my go-to‚Äôs. I love sharing it with friends. Always spot on!

I needed quality time w friends after my Dad passed away, so our dinner turned into a few hours of me crying and being indecisive. Our server was so patient and kind. Food was amazing as always. Loved seeing Casey back and visiting w Elvis. Shinsei will always be one of my top three go-to places.

This place is awesome - the food is amazing... the atmosphere is great... we stuffed ourselves on dumplings, brussel sprouts, and steamed buns- be sure to order the Thai fried rice... just go easy on the Vespers-

Amazing food with an amazing atmosphere. You can‚Äôt go wrong with the Shinsei Sashimi, Crispy Rock Shrimp, or the Short Rib Potstickers. For dessert, we wanted a taste of everything so we had the cotton candy, pumpkin bread pudding, and the chocolate cake spring rolls (must try!)
Fresh, delicious food, impeccable service, and a fun atmosphere. We‚Äôll be back.

We had never been there until last weekend and have been there again during the week. Absolutely fantastic! Everything we ordered was delicious. Outstanding service this includes the waitress and the very sweet hostesses ! Even Caleb the manager worked with me helping us get a earlier reservation. Cant wait to go back very soon!
Way too loud to enjoy our meal with friends
Awesome as usual!
Great ambience and food. We come here often for date night or with friends.
Great vfm. Smart but casual. Only the risotto disappointed otherwise the food was really good. Loved it!
Tastey food good ambiance.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Very good sushi

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: This is neighborhood gem.    Quality is always super high.  Staff is extremely friendly and helpful.    Ask them for help. Daily specials menu is critical.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Shu never disappoints!  The food is fresh and delicious and the staff is really friendly.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Delicious as always!! My favorite sushi restaurant!!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Great food, great service! Very cute location, highly recommend Shu

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Love Shu - the staff, sushi chefs, everyone is so chill & nice for a busy, really great/ solid sushi house. Love all the options and every dish is so yummy - love their dressings on the fish, so complimentary, fresh & flavorful

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: The best sushi in LA! Everyone we came across were hospitable, respectful and kind. We will definitely return in the near future!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Always good black cod. Small portions and need to order side soup and rice for the price it is pricey.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Great location!  Good quality of the fish.  Just the tables are too close to each other.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Better than serviceable. I'd give it 3-1/2 stars. The tempura appetizer was first rate, the spicy tuna was fine, the soft shell crabs were below par (fishy and not delicate).Beware of Saturday parking. There is a free valet but the parking can be a mess. Part of a decent set of restaurants halfway between west side and the valley.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Very small, tables are uncomfortably crammed next to each other. Sushi however is the best.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Consistently great fish and always wonderful, warm service. A classic spot.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: We dined this past NYE 2019.Sushi omakase-style was spot on!Server was excellent!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Best Shusi in. LA AT ANY PRICE

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Overall, foods were overpriced Very noisy and crowded.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: The fish is excellent. Items other than sushi are best saved for another spot. You will certainly pay for what you get but you're getting some of the best sushi around.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Service was exceptionalSushi fresh and great

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Best sushi! Fresh and great quality. All the dishes are unique and delicious. The service is amazing and the staff is so nice. We dine here once a week!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Always wonderful sushi. Fresh and delicious. Solid service. Fun place.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve had this waiter before and he is just horrible. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s a young Asian man, and he always forgets everything! Forgets to let us know they are out of certain dishes, forgets to put in to go orders, forgets what we ordered.  The food in general is great and I always leave a good review for this restaurant, but this waiter is just terrible!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Quality, neighborhood, and service outstanding

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Birthday dinner for boyfriend. The brought us a alive, yes I mean alive lobster on a plate that almost landed on my boyfriends lap. A little too much! But we appreciate the innovation

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Best experience!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Chidori is the best!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: We love coming to Shu sushi! Best time

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Great food, lots of choices, wonderful neighborhood gem. Never disappoints. √∞≈∏Àú≈†

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Excellent service and the food is fresh and prepared to perfection!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Terrific, as always!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve never had a bad experience at Shu. The food and service are consistently good.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Love this sushi restaurant!High quality fish. Unique dishes. Amazing and attentive staff.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Noisy and expensive but delicious and fun.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: We have been coming Shu for years, ever since the Drago Group took over.I can honestly say it has to be among the 4 or 5 best in all of LA.Reservations are a must!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Wonderful sushi.  The salmon was incredible.  Very fresh.  The server was attentive and helpful.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Always the ABSOLUTE best and gold standard of sushi and setting in LA!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Love this place.  The food is excellent, the service is first rate and personal.  The ambiance is relaxed and friendly.  Always an enjoyable experience.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Amazing sushi. My new favorite sushi bar.

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Always a great experience

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Excellent food and service

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Great service and amazing food!!!

column1: SHU - Sushi House Unico - Bel Air
column3: Great food!!!
Nicole was wonderful‚Äîoffered suggestions which were delicious!!
Rachel was wonderful!  We went for Father‚Äôs Day/my husband‚Äôs birthday and she made it very special.  She was also very knowledgeable about the bourbon selection.
A great gem! Best food and best atmosphere in cincy. Highly recommend!!
Sotto is my favorite restaurant in Cincinnati. The food is so fresh and favorable, my taste buds awake from slumber at Sotto!
Truly one of the absolute best restaurants in Cincinnati. Sotto delivers a sensational experience every single time. I really can't speak highly enough of this restaurant.
Nichole was made our experience excellent

The music was extremely loud.  I was there with a party of 7 people and could not hear 80% of the conversation due to the music.  Other than that, everything else was absolutely perfect, good food, good service and beautiful setting.
They are really doing well. Felt spaced and spread out but still with the same ambiance.  The food was as good as ever.
Glad you all are back open. Great food and service
Hands-down some of the best food in Cincinnati. No joke. Get the donuts‚Ä¶ Even if you‚Äôre stuffed, it‚Äôll be totally worth it.
We celebrated my husband‚Äòs birthday dinner here and the food and service were amazing.
So good! Creative yet simple dishes, absolutely delicious!
Amazing!!! Our waiter Michael was the best. Great service, great food. Can‚Äôt wait to go again!
Love Sotto! Food and service was outstanding as always!

My husband and I tried Sotto for the first time to celebrate our second wedding anniversary, and we both agreed it was the best dining experience of our lives! The restaurant has a great ambience, the staff was friendly and thoughtful, and the food was excellent and a great value for what we paid. Couldn‚Äôt have loved it more!
Can always count on an excellent meal at Sotto. Food and service did not disappoint.
Food was as great as it always has been.  Social distancing and safety guidelines were adhered to as well.
Totes amazeballs. Speaking of balls...get their donuts.

Delicate and crafted elegance.  Ingredients are the star... especially when combined And presented in a way that highlights their essence.  This is a must eat type of place and we are very fortunate they have weathered this economic storm.
As always everything was amazing, food and service!
Great food and delicious

Highly recommend this restaurant!  I am so glad this was our last Hurrah Meal!  Before the closing due to COVD19.  Service was excellent and we noticed  the great attention to detail as always.  BTW they have the best cocktails in town!  Hats off to their mixologists!
The best Italian in the City.  One of the top dining experiences in the city.
Just an amazing time. Food, atmosphere, value.
Sotto is one of the best restaurants in the world.  I have been about a dozen times now and it is consistently the same amazing quality in both food and service.
We had an amazing night. Service was great. We were able to hang out and catch up. The food was amazing as always. Thank you!
Good luck getting in, but if you do, you will very happy with the excellent quality of the food and service.
Food was delicious and the service was amazing. Our favorite was the gnocchi.
We always have a wonderful experience here and it‚Äôs our favorite spot. This is our go to for all occasions, especially birthdays and anniversaries. They never disappoint.
Really enjoyed the food, portion sizes, ambiance, and service. Music was a little too loud for me, but maybe better when there are more people.
Amazing food, great service.  Can get expensive, but for an occasional treat, it is well worth the price.
Amazing food and wine! Service was excellent as well! Would definitely recommend!
Always one of our favorite meals.  Lots of fun flavors!
Had a quick working lunch at Sotto.  Food and service was great!  The only challenge was the noise level...hard to hear each other across the table.

Took a client to lunch with co-workers.  Usually we enjoy the food.  The service was outstanding-except he did not ask for drink orders, I had to ask for a club soda-everyone else just had water.  The bread and the goat cheese with hazelnut honey were good starters and the donut at the end I always a treat. One of my co-workers asked for gnocchi as an appetizer and the server was able to get the chef to make it even though it was not on the menu HOWEVER instead of being small gnocchi pillows of deliciousness it came out in one big glob!  Weird to say the least. My salmon was cooked well but I did not like the bed of flavorless faro and beets. One of my co-workers had the Panini and he indicated it was not very good. One diner did enjoy his cappellacci with short ribs.   I was disappointed in Sotto for the first time I had not eaten there for about a year with this same client when it was much better.
Sotto had an amazing food selection for great value! Very kind and hospitable staff with much knowledge of the menu. Will definitely recommend for a great dining experience!!
Cacio e Pepe is a must starter plate.  The short ribs ravioli and the branzino were excellent. Patrick is an excellent server!
Incredible atmosphere, excellent service, and the most amazing food you'll find anywhere in this city. Top notch experience, which made for an unforgettable night out for our family!
Food was amazing as always.
Great food, wine pours by glass & cocktails are way too small for the $$
Charming restaurant with Piedmontese wines, condensed menu with well-executed and delicious food, as well as warm friendly and sincere service.
The family style meal was a fantastic way to spend an evening with friends. The staff was also attentive and friendly. Will definitely do  again... and again.
It was for my bf‚Äôs birthday. The food was so amazing that we were both blown away. Def a good choice for any type of celebration.
excellent, as always!

Absolutely exceptional! We did the tasting menu with the wine pairing and were in heaven. It was more food than we could finish but we took everything extra to go so we could enjoy the amazing leftovers the next day. Ambiance was cozy, service was superb and the wine paired perfectly with the food. Highly recommend!
Amazing! Some of the best service I've had, ever! Beautiful romantic ambience, amazing food, great wine selection. Highly recommend this spot :)

The tasting menu was an outstanding choice for our table of four.  We got to indulge in all of the offerings family style and were not disappointed by the variety and flavors.  The amber negroni cocktail and barolo red wine were memorable as well!

This was our second time dining at Spinasse and it did not disappoint. The pastas were as delicate and delicious as we remember. The service is always top notch and they really went above and beyond this time. The first time we dined, there was a bit of a mix-up with our credit card but it really was no big deal to us. Spinasse provided us with a free appetizer during our dining experience this time which really showed their genuine care for their customers and patrons. By the way, the complimentary poached egg appetizer was AMAZING.All in all, a delicious meal and definitely reinforced our decision to keep coming back!
Thank you for the best meal yet - complete with wonderfully kind service. Always feels like home.
Great ambience, food, and service. The pasta is amazing. Excellent wine selection but a little pricey. It can be noisy.

We have had dinner at Spinasse 4 or 5 times now and we love it every time. Incredible food that is different from your normal/typical Italian food. They feature "Piedmont" style Italian and it is unlike any other restaurant with top quality. Simple recipes that are executed to perfection.When you go, you MUST have the butter sage pasta. It is worth the trip by itself!
Our server was attentive and courteous. Food was excellent! Will definitely come back.
Great food, great service and ambiance. Never disappoints!
Stunningly good pasta.
Great Piedmont cuisine and wine. Be treated by staff that knows the menu and cares.
My first time here.  Very impressed.  One of the best restaurants in Seattle.  Inventive menu, great atmosphere and good value.  Definitely will be back.

Food was amazing and service perfect. A little disappointed that hot tea was not available, but hostess was happy to provide hot water to sip after a full meal. Honestly, some of the best Italian pasta on the west coast.
There are many Italian restaurants in Seattle and I have eaten at many of them, but Spinass's agnolotti (the evening's special) were squisito...tiny, tasty and just plain perfect!
Very good place for a intimate experience, good food and ambience. I recommend their antipasti sampler and the porkchops.
As always, an excellent meal and service.  Thank you for making our friend's birthday special.
As good as always. Great food, service and wine. One of our go to spots in Seattle.
Lovely atmosphere and fantastic linguine. Would venture to say the best Tiramisu that I've come across. Will most definitely be back as soon as possible!
Spinasse is by far the best restaurant in Seattle. The food is phenomenal and the service is unmatched. Love coming here!

Remembered my last experience here several years ago as an excellent meal. This time, was not as impressed. Although I very much enjoyed to antipasta dishes- stuffed pearl onions and a well-plated beet salad, my partner's entree pork chop was fatty and rare. And I was hoping to a flavorful pasta that could be a vegetarian entree but it seemed to need more seasoning. Still enjoyed the ambiance and service, but hoping next time I'll enjoy the dinner options more.

Everything was exceptional. The host could have had more of a personality but that‚Äôs just a personal opinion. The server was great - very friendly, helpful, and efficient. The food was all flavorful and well presented. If you‚Äôre visiting Seattle this restaurant is a must.

Small portions of food which did not taste good.  My hubs and I each had a cocktail, and they both tasted like mouth wash.  Dessert was delicious, and the service was excellent.  It had a nice atmosphere, but we were a little too close to our fellow diners.
It was good. One of my favorite restaurant for date night.

We had the best experience as Spinasse, I would highly recommend to anyone in the Seattle area. We got a last minute reservation, the food was the best pasta I've ever had. Our server was also incredible, so kind and friendly. He let us test wine's and gave us a complimentary dish. Highly recommend.
Exceptional!
Absolutely delicious food! Excellent service!
This is one of our favorite places we've been!
Went for the best pasta in town and was disappointed . Pasta was glued by excessive amount of parmesan and slightly overcooked... definitely not aldente ...
It's is a bit expensive and if you are vegan/ non-egg vegetarian there isnt many options.

The food was absolutely FANTASTIC!  Our server recommended a great combination of dishes which we did.  The pasta just melted in our mouth, and the pork chop was so tender!  Our server was very attentive, we so appreciated her service!  Thank you - we'll be back!!

Year after year, meal after meal, Spinasse continues to demonstrate why they are in the top Italian restaurants in Seattle.   David brings his special touch to every dish leaving the kitchen.  A way wonderful neighborhood restaurant with global reach.   Every trip to Seattle must include a stop at this gem
Great restaurant with great food, service, and wine list.  Angela, the wine manager is exceptional, and provided a great wine recommendation.
Always consistently good! Lots of new dishes, but a lot of the classics too. Great wine list!

Very nice ambiance perfect for a date night. On the  overpriced side. The appetizers were much better than the actual meal (we got the sample of all 4 and it was excellent.) Both pastas we feel like we could have made at home pretty easy- they were nothing special. They were still good though
The food is always so amazing and good, veggie and gluten free options too
awesome,  great night for our anniversary.  will be coming back soon.

We do this every year for our anniversary and it never disappoints. Perfect pairing of  wines to moan-worthy dishes. Made even more notable this year as we were the last seating before the Corona Virus shutdown. Thank you to all the staff that made this special. Our hearts go out to you. We'll be back as soon as you reopen!
This wine and food pairing experience is a must if you are coming to wine country!

If you are in Sonoma and able to get a reservation, do it! The food was incredible, the wine impeccable, the hosts were funny and knowledgeable. It was one of our favorite things we did during our visit. You won't regret it!
One of the best lunches I have ever had. There were only 16 places at the two horseshoe tables, so intimate and participative. Wine and food pairings were spot on. We completely enjoyed it.
Best experience we had in Napa or Sonoma in combining wine and food.  Can't wait to go back again.
Even though the food was supposed to take a backseat to the wine, the food itself rivals that of many Michelin starred restaurants albeit without a lot of choices.
The wine and food pairing was fantastic.  Don‚Äôt miss if in the area but schedule in advance as it is very popular.

Outstanding in every way. Excellent food and very knowledgable staff. Makes learning about wine fun. Gorgeous setting. Our guests were so impressed on this their first visit that they joined the WineClub.
Fantastic food, wine and staff. I would highly recommend a visit.

Celebrating our Anniversary and had to make this one of our stops. Love it here. Food  and wine pairing is just perfect. So enjoy the small venue because you really get to know the other guest for the seating. Every time we come it‚Äôs special. Great value and delicious!

This is always a new and exciting culinary and viticultural experience.  I highly recommend this experience to everyone, the team is amazing! The food is lovely and so filling! I only wish they were closer to my home, I'd go weekly as it's such a value.
Fabulous food paired with amazing wines, beautifully presented in a most entertaining and engaging way.

Third time and never disappointed.   Food pairings were perfect.  Hosts were helpful, perhaps a little more about the wine and a little less shtick. Could have taken a little more time.  All in all still the best experience in town.  Hope you take the suggestions as opportunities, not criticisms.

We booked the wine and food pairing and it was the highlight of our trip to the Sonoma Valley. The food was amazing, the wine was amazing, and the staff made the event educational and fun without any wine snobbery. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Mother-Daughter trip

This is what a wine and food pairing should be!  More than just a bit of meat or a bit of cheese, these were chef creations that really allowed one to appreciate the wine being tasted.  On top of that Tamara and Andrea were superb hosts that really added to the experience.  We will assuredly do this again!
This is a great way to enjoy St Francis' wine.  The food is amazing and service always enjoyable!  This was trip number 3 and I can't wait to go back again.
FABULOUS ‚ù§Ô∏è
I‚Äôve been to alot of food and wine pairing, but by far this is the best one. Big portions with lots of flavor. Both hosts were very knowledgeable and so polite. I will be back!
Have been several times.  Never disappointed.  Jonna Schafer.
Our annual visit for delicious food and wine.
The food and wine tasting at St. Francis Winery was amazing! I highly recommend it, everything was delicious and the service was exceptional.

The wine and food pairings were perfect! It's a very intimate setting, with only 16 people participating at a time. The hosts are very knowledgeable, funny, and attentive. I would definitely do this again!
Wonderful wine and food pairing!  Every course was perfectly paired and quite delicious.  We highly recommend the St. Francis wine and food pairing.  They never disappoint!
Could not been nicer event to take a friend for her birthday.  Food, wine, hostesses could not have been better!  The winery is itself is intimate and inviting.  Only pleasant memories on all count!
Delicious food and wine with a fun atmosphere!
Just fabulous!! The girls were so knowledgeable, the food was out of this world, and the wines were fantastic!! A vert enjoyable experience.

We drove two hours to go to this pairing and it was well worth it.  The wine and food were so good and the pairings just took it to the next level.  Combined with the relaxed, friendly and informative service, plus the beautiful welcome center overlooking the vines and hills well... let‚Äôs just say we plan on coming back.

Excellent wine and food pairing coupled with good explanation by the friendly staffs. Speaking as a one who is experiencing this for the first time, I had an enjoyable time and would definitely recommend St. Francis Winery & Vineyards. In fact, I would visit again if I am back.

We were very pleasantly surprised by the January 31menu, which was different from that posted on line and which we had enjoyed the last time we were there in November.   Apparently, St. Francis is searching for a new chef, but we would never have known this was the case, had we not asked about the menu changes.  The sous chefs did an outstanding job.  There was no indication that the executive chef was not there.  We have enjoyed this food and wine pairing for years, take all of our out-of-town company there, and recommend it to the people we meet at various other wineries and events, both in Sonoma and Napa. In our opinion, this is the best experience for the money in either Sonoma or Napa.
An intimate setting of about 12 guests. Excellent food, outstanding wine. The 2 presenters were both very good. Great value, 5 course lunch paired with wine.

The staff was very attentive, knew their wine, and kept things interesting. The food was excellent and, of course, paired perfectly! I recommend going at this time of year. It isn‚Äôt as crowded and you can actually visit with staff. Loved it!!

This is a wonderful experience for anyone who loves wine and food.  I have been to three tastings and the menu was unique at each sitting.  The wines are delicious, and, you are served a variety of reds and whites to match the flavors of the food servings.  The hosts always give you a full background of the wine and food service.  The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming which adds to your enjoyment.

This was one of the best food and wine pairing experiences we have had over the last 10 years! The staff was knowledgeable and entertaining. The food was exceptional and paired wonderfully with the various wines. The winery is in the process of some upgrades to their facilities and we can hardly wait to return when they are completed. We would highly recommend this experience to  others.

This was our first time visiting St. Francis and I would highly recommend it. The hostess were great and very well informed. The food along with the wine pairing was delicious. A great way to spend an afternoon.
The wine and food pairing at St. Francis was fantastic!The staff in the dining area and tasting room were knowledgeable and personable .
I have been to The St Francis food/wine tasting many times.  It is always a delight.
We enjoyed the food and wine pairing, the food was great and the wines were excellent.  The staff spoke about the wines and the service made the experience even more enjoyable.
Food was excellent as were the wine choices. Pretty hard sell to join their wine clubs. They do not allow you to buy wines outside the clubs at the lunch--you can later...kinda silly.
What's not to like?  The pairings were great, and sometimes perfect.  It's a relaxing environment, not over-the-top, but high quality.
This is our go to restaurant for the best food and atmosphere. Always the best!

This was my first visit to your restaurant. I ordered the filet and added the crab imperial to my steak for the additional $14 (?) I ate less than half my Steak, 1 or 2 bites of the lump crab. Our waiter was good but busy so another server asked if he could box up my dinner. #1. The box was given to one of the other guests at my table , fortunately they came back to my home for coffee and dessert and we were able to make the switch #2 when I opened my box to put the leftovers in a plastic container my crab imperial was NOT included with my leftovers and that really angered me because I purposely saved my crab to be enjoyed Sunday! And the extra that I paid for was waisted! I immediately called your restaurant but of course got voicemail and so  I left a message about my experience. Of course I did not hear back from anyone. Honestly, I didn‚Äôt expect to hear back ! I had heard so many good things about your establishment and was happy that we were able to FINALLY GET A TABLE! But my experience left me disappointed.Sincerely , Sandra Morlino
Why didn't I get points for this reservation?The food was great and was matched by the same great service.
Went here to try out their AC restaurant week menu. We had Joanne as a server and she was outstanding! She was super friendly & courteous. We will definitely be dining there again soon!
No comment at this time. It was a nice time for us
Always a great time at Steve and Cookies. From the hardworking, friendly, and knowledgeable staff to the amazing food and ambience. Had a wonderful experience.
It was an enjoyable experience the wait staff was very informative and very very helpful.  Oscar was the best.
Very nice meal, service a little slow.  Took about 3 hours in all.
Everything was great! The pineapple martini was to die for!
We didn‚Äôt even realize that it was Restaurant Week in AC and was pleasantly surprised with the options.  Every single thing was delicious!!
We had dinner on during restaurant week. As always the food was delicious and the service was spectacular. This is one of our places to dine for dinner on the Jersey shore.
Stephanie, our server was excellent, very friendly and attentive.  She couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating.  Food was also excellent. Would definitely go back.

Food and service are excellent.  Unfortunately the noise level is barely tolerable. The Restaurant Week offerings, though not inventive, were really tasty. We will return, in the off season of course.

If you like a restaurant with great food, service, and atmosphere, this is the place for you!  If you like white tablecloths this is the place for you!  What makes it interesting is the fact that each room has its own ambiance.  I cannot say anything negative....

as always the experience at Steve and Cookies was excellent.  the food was excellent as usual. that is why we go there and encourage others to do so. other than Smithville Inn  too many other restaurants in Atlantic County are consistently inconsistent
The food was delicious and our server was excellent.
Always fantastic!  Get the pork chops!  They are the best I have ever had.
Food and service were great! best meal my friends and I have had in awhile, will definitely be back!!!!!
Everything was delicious! The drinks are pricey and the parking lot is too small but the food was perfection.
Great food and service.   Love the peanut butter pie for desert

Fantastic, as expected. Love, love , love this restaurant. Everything was great, food and service. They have the best lobster mac and cheese ever. Would dine here on regular basis if it weren't an hour drive.
The service was excellent as was the food.  The room was packed but the noise level was very low.   They know what they are doing here.
Food was excellent as always!  Service staff was prompt, knowledgeable, and friendly. My husband said the grilled romaine salad with fried oysters was the best salad he has ever had!
Surprising!  Much more of a dining experience than simply not wanting to cook & going out.  Piano music set the tone for an unique night out.
The food was good, the ambiance was quiet.. but we went on a Monday. We look forward to trying it again in the summer. The restaurant itself was beautiful!
Great food, service and atmosphere. Perfect for a date night or special occasion!

We went for Atlantic City Restaurant Week and every course was outstanding!!! Every course was the normal size and the service was also on par. We can‚Äôt wait to go back!! Our new favorite restaurant!!!
Best restaurant I the state! You can't get a bad meal here, service, food and ambiance is excellent.

We are restaurant week groupies, Sunday is usually Steve and Cookies. It never disappoints. I am always amazed not only at the quality of the food but also the attentiveness of the wait staff, because they are BUSY.  It is a joy to dine here.
The pork chops melted in your mouth, excellent meal with friendly good paced service throughout the meal.
Consistently great food.  Well presented.  Great service.  Warm and friendly staff and ambience.  Can‚Äôt go wrong!!!

Once again going to Steve and Cookies was a great experience, window seat for 4, nice view, quiet spot and the food as always was excellent, can't say enough about the stuffed Pork Chops! The service was right there and helpful, I will be coming back again.
The server was great n attentive and made suggestions on the menu for restaurant week. I would definitely go back just to eat there, because the food was great n the atmosphere.
Went for restaurant week and had Lobster Mac and Cheese, the Pan-Seared Salmon, and the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie. All delicious, and the ambience made for a perfect date with my fiancee!
We enjoyed our delicious dinner and desserts.  We appreciated the birthday treat, too! Our service was excellent - courteous, knowledgeable, engaging, efficient, considerate!
Food was fantastic

We went to our family‚Äôs favorite restaurant toCelebrate our Son and Daughter‚Äôs birthdays.  Although we try to go to Steve and Cookies as often as possible every time we go it is outstanding.  This meal was six of us, and everybody enjoyed everything.  The food and service, as always were outstanding.  The pace was relaxing and enjoyable.  The consistent excellence is the reason it has been our favorite restaurant for many years.
Food was great but the prices are outrageous! It was $90 per person and we had middle of the road priced entrees, a glass of wine and one cocktail total and two appetizers.

The theory of rural inflation is proven once again. This is a very good restaurant serving very good food but it can‚Äôt possibly be one of the best 100 restaurants in the United States. I have eaten in and reviewed fine restaurants around the world and there is no way that this falls into the top class. What keeps Steve and Cookies by the bay from being a five star restaurant? 1) Presentation. It is barely above the dreaded ‚Äúfood on a plate‚Äù category, it is far short of artful. 2) Attire of assistant waiters who all wear printed black tee shirts, fine at the shore but it is not the dress of a 5 star restaurant. 3) Blatant racism in work expectations. Waiters almost all seem to be white work at a good pace and take the time to be pleasant, assistants in black tee shirts work at a frenzied pace of a car wash as if expecting to be fired at any second. Almost all of the sub class appear to be Hispanic. This just isn‚Äôt seen anymore. Very good meals and very good service in a rather plain atmosphere, solid 4 star stuff.
My favorite restaurant!  Does not disappoint!  Excellent all around.

My partner and I celebrated my birthday on a comfortably enclosed patio, near a heater.  Our meals were beautifully presented, delicious, and the atmosphere was magical. Standout dishes were the halibut and the duck. Frankly, everything tasted great. Dessert was a wonderfully minty chocolate chip ice cream, apparently made on site. The service was quick and amiable.  My partner and I both agree we had a memorable evening and plan to return.
Fantastic dinner!
This was the perfect place to stay and eat for our wedding anniversary.  Not sure I‚Äôll ever find a more beautiful place to share with my wife.

Phenomenal setting with exceptional service, and great food. Very romantic lunch for my husband‚Äôs birthday. Would recommend to anyone. Very personable waiter who stopped at nothing to make us happy and welcomed. Highly recommended
Outstanding environment for a special dinner with family, a mate, etc.  Great food, great service.

ONLY comment, but important!!!! We were in the inside room......SOOOO dark!!!Waiters had to shine a flashlight on EVERY food presentation, that is rather crazy!!!So as you are eating, you are literally guessing what you are picking up on your fork.This is NOT romantic........candlelight of soft lighting would be preferable.
nice lil place in the hood, cozy and off the beaten path

$50 for corkage for a bootle of wine, we think it‚Äôs a little bit too high, I think. And the fact that they put us in the cellar instead of the main restaurant when we made a reservation almost 3 weeks before was t what we expected. Maybe because we were just a 2 people party. All the rest  was great
Beautiful place with very friendly staff! Food is great but need to pay attention to different menu‚Äôs if you choose to sit indoors or outdoors.

Service, as always, was top notch. Our party was very pleased with the food but I wasn't thrilled with the halibut.  I found it overcooked and the asparagus cold. The chicken, the chestnut soup, the drinks and the desserts were fantastic. I asked at the time of my online reservation to be seated in the courtyard (we are frequent guests) and a little disappointed that it seemed to be ignored as it looked like there would have been seating available. Nonetheless, the ambience of the terrace was wonderful.
Outstanding service, food and atmosphere!Wait staff was awesome and attentive.
Fantastic food and staff.  Service was very nice.
A magical place to celebrate my birthday. Staff, ambience and food were wonderful.

Breathtakingly beautiful buildings, grounds and views. Food was mediocre, service a bit slow considering there were very few patrons at that hour. Unfortunately, we were seated next to a very boisterous couple that spoiled some of the ambience.
Anniversary dinner!
Mike provided extraordinary service and made our special dinner very special. His assistant, Al was also wonderful!
Everything, from the greeting at the entrance, to the table itself, to the level of service, to the absolute perfection of the meal...I will be thinking of this for a long time to come.

My fianc√© and I decided to join San Ysidro Ranch‚Äôs Stonehouse for an early Valentine‚Äôs Day celebration. We had an absolutely spectacular evening. The dinner, the service and the ambience was truly stunning. Many of our dishes were prepared right in front of us. The entire dinner was a culinary masterpiece. Afterwards we walked the beautiful gardens and we‚Äôre memorized by the truly magnificent property. We will certainly be back as soon as possible to enjoy the rest of the menu.
We went here for the night after our wedding. It was extremely good food and very romantic. 5 stars!

Great meal and service as usual. Busy Saturday evening with well dressed diners enjoying a beautiful night under the stars of Montecito. The scallops and halibut were delicious paired with the Brussels sprouts and the squash. Goats milk cheesecake for dessert with coffee. Wonderful time.
Fine dining at its best. Very attentive staff. Great ambience. A very enjoyable experience.
Amazing location, food, service, atmosphere. Great experience and a magical setting.
Wanted to order caviar, out of caviar.  Please put one steak on the menu.
This is best restaurant ever  great service
We had a beautiful night with impeccable service and delicious food.
Marvelous!
The atmosphere is outstanding, but we go down from there.
Excellent, attentive service in a beautiful outdoor setting.

We went for our anniversary and had a magical experience. We arrived early, ordered some wine and then walked around the grounds, climbing the hill to watch the fiery sunset. The grounds were covered with beautiful flowers and emitted intoxicating smells. There were lights in the trees and people strolling causally and enjoying the sights. From there we went to dinner where we were escorted onto an enchanting patio with a view of the ocean. The service was amazing and our food was some of the best we have ever tasted. We had Brussel sprouts, a nice salad, halibut and filet mignon. We ended up with chocolate souffl√© and the homemade mint ice cream. Both were so yummy. We both agreed that the entire experience was one we will always remember.
We celebrated an anniversary...the staff were wonderful!
This is our second time to this restaurant, and both times have been fabulous!  We would come back to Santa Barbara just for this experience :-)
Beautiful, location, romantic, with incredible food and great service. Recommend getting the classic steak Diane, which is flambeed tableside. Exquisite!

We love this restaurant, but thought the brunch offerings were just okay for the prix fixe.   Lobster Cobb was good, not great.  Chicken and waffles looked really good, but couldn‚Äôt fathom paying $75 (includes, champagne, appetizer and dessert).  Will definitely be back when it‚Äôs a la carte!
Oh my!  What a beautiful night at Stonehouse. The service and the food was outstanding!

I proposed to my girlfriend earlier in the day, and we came here to celebrate our first dinner as fiances. It is an incredible restaurant for a variety of reasons: the food is incredibly supple and delightful, the service is European and professional, and the location is unbeatable. To any considering a post-engagement dinner, this is the spot.

Perhaps most unusual, our guests arrived early and went downstairs to the bar area (Plow & ??). They asked if we had arrived yet and were told no. In fact, we had arrived early and checked in upstairs. As a result, we didn't connect with each other until almost 30 minutes past our reservation. They said they asked at least once and were told we hadn't arrived. Other than that, everything was wonderful.

It's amazing how what started out as an excellent evening with great service by the waiter Michael and the lobster bisque being delicious, could turn so quickly into a completely negative evening with poorly cooked main course and an argumentative situation with the manager.  Of course he and the chef were right and I as the customer was wrong.
We came up for a weekend at the Rosewood Miramar and always enjoy dining at the SYR
On a clear, warm day eating at Stonehouse is tremendous.  The view of the valley and ocean, the food and service, along with an excellent wine list, one could not find a better place for lunch.

Major issue was the intense heat from the outdoor heating lamps.  Twice did the waitress mitigate the situation by decreasing the intensity of the adjacent heating lamp, another waiter for an adjacent table would increase it for their other guests on other adjacent tables.  The intense heat made this guest quite uncomfortable, taking away the ambiance of the rare occasion
Great service, even better food. The best sushi in New York easily, if not America. Try it at least once and it will change your perspective on food entirely.

After watching Jiro dreams of sushi and the fact that Nakazawa now has a star, my expectations going into this meal we‚Äôre very high. While many pieces were tasty, for the price there are better omakase experiences in the city. Exceptional attention to detail is lacking. Moths flying around the bar and Ikea cabinetry take away from what should be a refined experience. The publicly in the press seems to draw tourists rather than local regulars.
Best sushi of my life. Cried when it was over
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday and it was fantastic.  Everything from the food to the ambiance was fantastic.  Can‚Äôt recommend Sushi Nakazawa enough.
Great food and great experience
Such a great experience. Service was friendly, attentive, and thorough. The sushi was some of the best I've had. Will definitely come back again.
Melt in your mouth sushi! First class service. Bar seating is a must for full details of all you are eating. Awesome experience. Perfect sushi lover birthday dinner.
Extraordinary
Lasciate da parte tutto per un paio di ore e concedetevi questa straordinaria esperienza. Il conto √® alto ma laQualit√† non √® da meno. Se volete un vero ristorante happiness andateci
Fabulous in every way. You must love sushi and respect the artist at work.
it doesn‚Äôt worth for the price paid, the omakase had no surprise , just ordinary sushi to me & too rush the timeÔºÅ

Our 50th bdays celebration was well noted. We got some extra un√≠ and bday candles in our lychee sorbet! Missed Nakazawa San, but didn‚Äôt expect to see him on a Monday. A great special occasion place that spoils sushi eating anywhere else.
Lugar excepcional . uno de los mejores Susi que he comido
Food itself is high quality and sake also very tasty. Delicious. But somehow doesn‚Äôt match my expectation. Chef seems not pay attention enough.
Another super high end experience

La miglior cena a base di sushi della mia vita, una delle migliori cene in assoluto.Dimenticate i pur buoni uramaki fusion e colorati di alcune rinomate catene milanesi.Qui c'√® la pi√π pura tradizione del sushi in forma di nighiri. Non dovete scegliere nulla, solo sedervi al bancone (possibilmente, perch√© √® certamente pi√π interessante di una cena al tavolo), guardare i  maestri al lavoro, ascoltare il nome del piatto in giapponese, prontamente tradotto in inglese dalla cameriera alle vostre spalle e poi gustare ad occhi chiusi.OK, non √® cheap, ma non √® neanche un ristorante qualsiasi. Il servizio √® di alto livello e la qualit√† eccezionale. Nessun serata al giapponese sar√† pi√π la stessa, dopo questa esperienza!

The sushi bar was a fantastic experience. Every piece of sushi was unbelievable, the sake carefully selected and the service was impeccable. I was worried it might be a bit stuffy but everyone was so kind and welcoming. It was truly memorable.
Exquisite omakase experience, the food & service is excellent and the attention to every detail is truly impressive.
Terrific and unique experience to sit at the bar and enjoy a curated 20-course dinner.

EVERY SINGLE TIME we come here, we are transported, healed, fed and showered with the best attention.This is food as art in its highest form.We are extra grateful to Chef for remembering us and welcoming us and to Anthony Arvin for the spectacular wine journey on Monday night. THANK YOU THANK YOU! We cannot wait to come back.
Incredible experience! It was delicious. Must visit for Japanese food lovers. The best sushi me and my friend ever had. Will back definitely.
Wonderful. Best sushi experience ever
Great sushi with acceptable omakase pricing.

Outstanding in every sense of the word ! Felt transported  to some exotic place in some far corner of the world , yes Tokyo!  The sushi was simply delicious, I could go on forever , service beyond stellar , a fabulous evening , will definitely go back
Could not love the experience more - despite the fact that
Their food wasnt good, not even compare to other more price friendly restaurant.
Best tasting sushi I‚Äôve ever had in my life.  It was Semi mind blowing

Fantastic Sushi experience! Highly recommend this if you want a five star omakase experience from an experienced staff! We've been here many times and every single time is an amazing experience!  Wish we could post the entire course but definitely get any and all add-ons if you only plan on going here once!

As a huge Sushi Nakazawa fan, I was more than excited to take my brother to lunch at the sushi bar for his birthday. I was lucky to eat here last year and had an absolutely fantastic experience - which made me even more dissapointed in my most recent experience. My brother has celiac disease, which can be an issue at other restaurants, but Sushi Nakazawa reassured us that accommodating his dietary restrictions would not be an issue - we made sure to call ahead of time, remind the host, and checked with our waiter twice. But unfortunately, within an hour after eating, my brother was extremely sick. We had the same exact meal and I was completely fine. When you're paying the prices that you do at Sushi Nakazawa, and have been reassured that they can handle customers with celiac, it's quite frustrating when they fail to do so. The next day I called the restaurant to let them know what happened and the host kindly said they would have management follow-up, but 2 weeks have passed and I haven't heard anything - not even an apology. Shocking when you expect high quality customer service from a restaurant of this quality. This truly is an amazing sushi restaurant, but if you have dietary restrictions, eat at your own risk.
As close to Japan as you will find in New York.  Innovative touches on fabulous traditional sushi.
Mind blowing and Amazing Perfection in every bite, expensive but well worth it.

I had 7pm dinner at the bar with my husband for our anniversary. Our dinner experience was first and foremost time well spent together, made sweeter by the cozy ambiance, tasty omakase, delightful tea, and thoughtful service. We enjoyed watching the chefs at work and our exchanges with the staff were brief. If this is the kind of thing your after, go for it. Looking forward to our next meal at Sushi Nakazawa!
Food was great!
Nakazawa was everything we expected.  Could not have asked for a better experience.  Will be back again and again.
Really exceptional!
Really delicious
This was the best meal that I've ever had. The salmon was out of this world.
Arguably the best Sushi Restaurant in NYC. Delicious from start to finish!
My favorite place in the world. It‚Äôs a religious experience.
Late Valentine‚Äôs Day celebration. Wonderful food and atmosphere and knowledgeable staff.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: I am sure if we had gone, it would have been extraordinary. Great food, wine and service. Looking forward to dining w Carl after the virus is gone.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Jesse was wonderful as usual. Kitchen staff rocks. Love this place

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Just the single best restaurant experience in the Boston/Cambridge area. If you can get a reservation, gab it. You will be happy

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: This is our third visit and it is our #1 restaurant in all of BOSTON. As soon as the menu changes we will go back. We always take fancy restaurant afficiados and they are blown away by the food.Staff is wonderful and knowledgeable about every morsel served. Same with wine.And for what you get the price is reasonable, unlike most high end restaurants today.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Thank you to our server Olivia and our host Jesse. Thanks for the birthday candle. Sorry we missed Chef Carl. Congratulations on the Beard nomination

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Such an amazing email, every single course was perfectly made, interesting, and delicious. Our service was top notch. We chose to do the wine pairing, I highly recommend! There's some amazing food being created at this restaurant, if you're looking for something truly special you should come here!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: One of the best new places we've eaten in Boston area! Outstanding service, very knowledgable about al wines...truly excellent!!! Bravo!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Wonderful 5-course fixe price dinner with paired wines.  Each course elegant with food combinations most interesting.  Great service too.  Expensive, but worth it.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: We had a lovely time at The Table -- the food was inventive and delicious, and the atmosphere was friendly and casual.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Top notch experience from walking in the door to leaving. Service was impeccable and attentive.  All dishes that came out were beautifully presented and a full work out on our taste buds. I can‚Äôt wait to return with friends that haven‚Äôt yet enjoyed The Table.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Loved this very special restaurant. Not only was the food creative and delicious--it was served by the most well informed, pleasant group of people...Very happy you are part of the restaurant scene here!!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Excellent food. Several of our dishes were exceptional. The coursing/timing was off sometimes, but they have a small service staff and they are preparing everything fresh so that's to be expected. Otherwise, we thought it was really wonderful. The people were very nice, the setting was intimate and the food was fantastic.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: This restaurant is a gem. On our fifth visit it has never failed to amaze us with inventive and polished dishes which taste wonderful and are excellently paired with wines.  The time spent developing and perfecting each dish is evident in the flavor and presentation. Kudos to Carl and his staff all of which are delightful.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Chef Carl does a great job showcasing high quality ingredients!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Amazing as always

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Outstanding food and hospitality! Jesse was not only a stupendous host but shared some wonderful wine and knowledge with us during the meal. Max and the kitchen team served up course after course of delicate, ambitious and just extraordinary flavors. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about the entire experience. Thank you to the entire team and enjoy the night shift tonight!! Cheers!! Your good friend, George

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: This is the best restaurant in Boston. Chef Carl is a genius and Mary makes some of the most creative and delicious desserts I have ever tasted.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Apps and dessert were very good.  Lots of extra 'goodies'.  Entree - both the scallops and the steak, were fairly mediocre for a place charging top-end.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: The Table is a wonderful restaurant for special occasion dinners. The prix fixe menu rotates every six weeks and reflects an eclectic set of courses employing ingredients and techniques from around the world. There are two dishes offered for each of the four courses, so go with a loved one and taste every offering. I've gone twice so far and each of the eight dishes I've tried has been creative and excellent. The noise level is low enough to talk comfortably but the tables are separate enough to keep conversations private. You can tell that the staff team is tight knit and enjoys working together. They are supremely knowledgeable and engaged with each other and the patrons, and with little separation between the kitchen and the tables, you can see the food prepared with care. All in all, an ideal restaurant experience. I will go as often as I can.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Delicious, creative, delicate, but spicy. Interesting takes on fine dining in a relaxed, friendly and comfortable atmosphere. Really special.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Always great food with a new menu every 6 weeks.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Wonderful all around experience. Highly recommended for foodies.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Fantastic food and service. Always have a great evening here, can't be happier this is in our neighborhood!!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Great for date nights. I wouldn't recommend for parties over 2 since you only get 2 choices on each course but food is GREAT!  Very small place so reservation is a must. The team is very knowledgeable, which is always a bonus.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Excellent menu and wine flight- a delightful dining experience

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Amazing in every way.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: We wanted a fabulous meal to celebrate a special occasion and The Table was totally up to the task!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Really great experience hard to get in, expensive nice for special occasion

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Awesome food and servicePleasant seating arrangements, good wine listMore food than we expected !

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Cute little place, no cocktails, small menu, venison was good, service was average.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Amazing food and amazing service! The staff was very knowledgeable and it made every dish that much more intriguing.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: As always an amazing meal.  Each course surpasses the previous and the wine pairings were sublime.  The desserts blew us away....they have always been good but this time was by far the best.  Already booking our next reservation.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Attention to detail, unique flavors and textures, may be the best food in boston overall.  Very knowledgable wait staff.  Nice extras for a hospitable touch- like amuse buche, and take home granola bar.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Unfortunately a mixed bag here.  The food was very well prepared but the menu is extremely limited -- just two choices.   If you didn't like tripe or skate wing (and we didn't), you were out of luck.  However, the real problem was the truly horrible music and the volume at which it was played.  I like everything from Metallica to Bill Evans.  This was just loud noise with a heavy bass.  My guess is that it was there primarily for the chefs in the open kitchen, but it was blaring throughout the tiny dining room.  It was the kind of loud noise the CIA would use to extract a confession.  It ruined the experience completely.  The value proposition is poor at best at $150 a person with beer, no wine.  The chair are hard, no table cloths, and the decor was essentially nonexistent.  A few plastic flowers.  Overall, a huge disappointment.  Excellent bread and butter though.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Wonderful composition of textures and flavors! Superb!

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Overall excellent although our table was underwhelmed by the marinated mackerel and I thought the skate-sauerkraut combination didn't work particularly well (although each element was very good separately).  The wine pairings were tremendous and the service was excellent.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: This was a repeat visit and we enjoyed the dinner. The chicken that was served was very tasty but was not elevated to a fine dining experience.  Serving chicken as part of a fine dining menu is risky and this time it did not really paid off. My preference is that the restaurant stick to higher quality meats.  Also, I love bubbly wine with my meal and the only choice by the glass started at $17/glass.  I would like to find also quality sparkling wine choices in the $11-12/glass range too so I can have a couple without breaking the bank.  We will keep coming back always hope for a better experience.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: We had ordered vegetarian dishes.  They were all very flavorful and delicious.  We will be coming back soon.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Came here for my birthday with my girlfriend. Parking was a little difficult, since we had to find it on the street. The restaurant is a small, and well furnished place. The wall decorations were appropriate and added to the experience. The open kitchen was fun to watch as well. The food was what we expected. It was fantastic, and the reputation of the restaurant is deserved. However, there was an intangible missing from the food that kept the meal from entering the upper echelon of meals I‚Äôve had. That said, I‚Äôll gladly return when there is a special occasion that calls for a meal to match.

column1: The Table at Season To Taste
column3: Tee Table at Season to Taste offers a 4 course fixed menu with complementary wine pairings for an additional charge. As a couple we like to order one of everything on the menu and as each course arrives each have half of the 2 dishes. This means we get to taste everything - and believe me, you don't want to miss anything. The food is different every time we go and the wines are always interesting. The waitstaff can tell you the details of each one and why it goes with the particular dish. It's not overbearing wine-speak it's genuinely interesting information. It is not inexpensive - but it is worth every cent. You leave with a complimentary, home-made granola bar in your pocket feeling replete and well cared for.
It was great experience as usual from the service to the food . As usual ! So glad it‚Äôs opened for outdoor dining!
Food was amazing as usual and service was just as good. Conner was very attentive and polite. We had everything we needed without even asking.
The food was delicious and service was amazing! I had the scallops and my fianc√© ordered the fried chicken. It‚Äôs a tad pricy but was definitely worth it after not going out to eat for 3 months!

Our waitress Tatiana was wonderful! The food was phenomenal, particularly the mushroom risotto and tuna crudo. And the patio at sunset is simply magical and whimsical. Will absolutely be dining again :)
Came to see daughter in Philly.  Perfect meal, service and atmosphere.  They have social distancing down as well.

This was one of several vistits  to Talulas, but all that more special as it opened following Coronavirus. The food was as great as always and our service was perfect. Sitting outside off Washington Square, eating amazing food, and relaxing in the atmosphere of this beautiful garden made the past three months of social distancing disappear. You can never go wrong at Talulas but tonight was exceptional

Post COVID19, this was my boyfriend and I‚Äôs first true date night out. Luckily, we were able to celebrate our 6 month anniversary together in the outdoor garden of Talula‚Äôs 6/15! Although our reservation was delayed/late by 30 minutes, the staff was super friendly, very apologetic, and professional. As a nice gesture, the beverage manager gave us each a glass of Prosecco on the house. We were extremely appreciative and understood the longer wait time given new social distance guidelines. As an aside, this restaurant frequently surprises you with beverages, desserts, etc on special occasions (I have had this happen on 2 prior special occasion dinners). Talula‚Äôs food, service, and ambience (as per usual) was off the chart! Thank you for being an amazing date spot and being one of my favorite restaurants in the city! Heavily recommend this gem in Center City
It was so nice to eat out again!  Beautiful outdoor setting with plenty of social distancing. Almost felt normal...

I‚Äôve heard of Talula‚Äôs Garden many times as one of the MUST dine places in the city... I had even seen photos and was delighted at the opportunity to go for my birthday. I think that some of my expectations were let down, as it‚Äôs as pretty but I think I expected a lot more ambiance from ‚Äúthe garden‚Äù than it offered in design. It was also much TOO dark. We were in the most lit area (right next to the light wall) and we had trouble seeing. Just to exit the restaurant my one friend had to use a flashlight. It‚Äôs definitely not disability friendly at all. The staff was nice, the food was great. Overall it was a lovely beautiful night, and the food was very satisfying. We ordered the beef short ribs (4.5 ‚≠êÔ∏è), scallops (3.5 ‚≠êÔ∏è) and beets (4 ‚≠êÔ∏è). I‚Äôll say the one uncomfortable moment was when waiting for the check to sign, I noticed a manager or higher up kept staring us down as if we were over staying out welcome. This kept on after we signed. It was a party of 4 at 9:30 at night, and we had barely stayed 65 minutes at that point with a 8:15p reservation. It was extremely uncomfortable, and honestly made me wonder if it was racial possibly with us being probably the only or one of the only tables of POC. Hopefully not related but who knows.
Best place in Philly!
Our dinner at Talula‚Äôs was absolutely amazing. The ambiance is beautiful and the food is 10/10. Definitely recommend the cheeseboard and delicious garden salad!

I went to Talulas‚Äôs with a group of ladies for the first night out and open on Friday June 12, 2020 and everything was perfect! From the servers attentiveness, patience, spirit and knowledge on the menu by which she offered us great recommendations to the manager who ensured that everything went perfectly and tasted great to the food and drinks also being incredibly delicious. Everything was perfect from service to manager to food and even ambience and it really contributed to our first night back out after being in quarantine for so long. We are even thinking about making Talula‚Äôs a every other Friday group dinner things because we had such a great first experience here. Thank you Talula‚Äôs team for taking care of us and we will be back!
So great to experience outdoor dining where the food and environment were both great!  Service was thoughtful and accommodating.
This place is one of the best in Philadelphia.   They are being careful, so we felt completely safe - and as usual service and food were excellent.

Dined Sunday for  brunch as we wanted to go out and support the hospitality industry during this very difficult time. Service and  food were both excellent. The staff was kind enough to send out complimentary dessert to our table as well.  Thank you to the Talula‚Äôs team.
Visited our daughter who is a student at Temple. Took her here for a birthday brunch. Everything was fabulous! We will definitely be back!
Food amazing, service outstanding. Went for brunch had a wonderful experience.
Best food and service in the city . Anna was a phenomenal server and my wife and I had a great time

So it was Friday the 13th of March but we were feeling so lucky! Weather was cooperative and we were able to dine at one of the last patio tables under a heat lamp. Everything from the ambiance, service, timing, food and drink was superb! Highly recommend and feeling grateful we took the chance for a wonderful date night after work.
Wonderful as always.  The team there takes great care of my husband and me.
The food was amazing. The atmosphere was cozy and aesthetic.  Our server (Connor)was highly informed and helpful. Aimee Olexy stopped by to check if every was fine. It was truly a perfect evening.
