One of my favorite places.  The cheeses are excellent.   The side vegetable dishes, al dente.  We licked every plate clean.

The food was exquisitely prepared and presented.  The service was very attentive and our server couldn't have been nicer.  They brought out a little something extra for dessert for my mother's retirement with a congratulatory note penned in chocolate.  Thanks so much for a very nice time that topped off our day!
I‚Äôll be back
Service great.  Food, not nearly as good as last time.
Phenomenal menu & food. The drinks were tasty as well. We definitely will be back in the future!
Food is delicious and very fresh. Overall great vibes with a fun but cozy atmosphere. Can‚Äôt wait to come back and enjoy a meal outside in the garden. Will definitely be back!
Sat us in a corner of the bar at a table next to the server station and walk up. Im very tall and people were tripping all over my leg the entire night.
We sat at the bar and enjoyed everything about our dining experience!  Highly recommend and will ho back in warmer weather and sit outside in the garden!

Birthday dinner for a special young lady in my life...my daughter. Chef tasting meal was delicious. Will return to try some items from the main menu in the warmer weather and sit out in the beautiful courtyard.
The food was fantastic; the service from Elijah even better.
Always amazing. I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough.
Wonderful experience! Delicious food, top-notch service. Highly recommend the Perfect Plate cheese platter and the duck for a main course. We had a cozy, romantic dinner!

It was extremely overpriced and rushed. It seems like anytime we make reservations on Open Table we get a seat by the door or kitchen, like restaurants save their crappiest tables for open table online reservations. But back to Tulula's Garden: the food was outstanding, but it was obvious they wanted to turn over our table. The $7 beer came out of a can.
Great meal and service, just would have liked more gluten free options on the menu.
Incredible as always! Excellent service.
Everything was perfect. Will definitely be back next year when we go to the Flower Show!
Amazing food, exceptionalService.    The restaurant is quite noisy but that is typical of a Stephen Starr restaurant.  If it was quiet, it would detract from the good mood

The duck dish was the best I've ever had. Each mouthful was a surprise  as different flavors continued to emerge with each bite.  I am a foodie and this dish would win Top Chef!  The servers were attentive and the manager was very personable.  I look forward to my next meal here.

I love the food and ambiance at Talula's Garden, and the servers are very warm and knowledgable.  However, this is the second time that I've arrived and been directed to the worst table in the restaurant (this one in front of the front door, which opened every 30 seconds and let in a large gust of cold air), and have had to ask for a more suitable table.  On both occasions, the host accommodated me (and there were multiple better tables inside the restaurant), but I shouldn't have to ask.  It feels rude and inhospitable, which makes me not want to return to the restaurant.
Everything was great as usual! We always look forward to a quiet dinner with excellent food. It‚Äôs one of the few places we can go and always know the service and food will be above and beyond.
One of our favorite restaurants in the city.  It has been consistently good since the day they opened.
Another fantastic meal at the Metro, great food and service!TG
Elegant dinning experience.  Great service, excellent food, love wine selection.

The filet was different. It didn‚Äôt taste bad but it didn‚Äôt have any flavor. I‚Äôm not sure it was cooked on a grill? I‚Äôm not sure it came from a cow? Had grill lines but no flavor, No juices. It was 8 ounces but only 1‚Äù tall. Nothing like normal filet photos and for $50??? Everything else was fine but left with NO taste in our mouths. Probably won‚Äôt return.
Wonderful dinner. Wonderful service. Perfect evening.

I can say that I‚Äôm never disappointed when I eat at the metro, it definitely was quieter this time most likely because there were less tables in the restaurant but that didn‚Äôt change the quality of the food. It is by far One of my first choices because I know the quality will always be there. The wait staff goes out of their way to make your dining experience pleasurable with the Appropriate amount of attention.
Always good service and delicious food in a quiet and pleasant atmosphere.
Excellent Service Trevor waited on us and he was very responsive and knowledgeable.
This is a great restaurant and the good is always delicious.
Me and my husband were celebrating our anniversary and everything was perfect!
Excellent food & service. Favorite restaurant in town.
Love the Metro!  Great food and wine. Always comfortable visiting at the table. From rolls through dessert you will have exceptional dining at Metro
Still without a doubt best dining experience ever.
Perfect. So very happy to be back at the Metro! OKC‚Äôs best.

The Metro is truly one of okc‚Äôs best dining experiences. The relaxing atmosphere is truly a throwback to the elegant dining of the past mixed with everything you like about present day eateries. PS; you don‚Äôt need to cash in a bond to eat there.
As usual.  Food was superb!   Oliver our waitress was as all the stall at the metro excellent!   On the spot service and professional etiquette !   This is our special night dinner place !
As always - an excellent experience. Owners  are very hospitable !
Had our anniversary dinner there and everything was wonderful. We had the filet with red wine sauce and it was perfect. Love the ambiance of The Metro...it never disappoints!

The Metro consistently offers a wonderful place to eat and celebrate a special occasion.   The service, quality and food selections are top notch.  So glad they are back open.  I have really missed you!
Anniversary!
As usual, the food and attentive service - superb.
It was there first night to be open since the shutdown. Everything was wonderful üíï
Good service good food attentive owners best restaurant in Oklahoma City.  Glad they are back.
Great food and service
Exceptional service and cuisine in a refined, tasteful setting.

A standby in the OKC dining scene.  We wanted to support local restaurants and this was a great choice. Although we asked waitstaff to allow us time to enjoy our wine before food came, we should have just waited and ordered 15 minutes later.  I know restaurants love to turn tables, my friends could have used a little longer drinks time.  Otherwise-  splendid food and a delicious white Bordeaux.

Our evening at the Metro was positively wonderful. My wife and I did not get a chance to celebrate Valentine's Day together this year, but the month long wait was entirely worth it! Every aspect of the experience was so well done, that we can't seem to stop talking about it. We were visiting from out of state and found them online quite by accident. After seeing the marvelous reviews, we made our reservations and were so pleasantly surprised. The food and beverages were superbly crafted and served. The servers were well informed of all the menu items as well as the specials. The service was prompt but subtle - never intrusive. We do hope to return again.
It was just time for a wonderful, delicious, dining-experience at our favorite place, The Metro. It did not disappoint.
Food was excellent like always, but we had a server who seemed fairly inexperienced and our service wasn‚Äôt excellent - still love The Metro though!!!
Consistent and wonderful!

We looked for an upscale dining experience and found Metro Wine to be exactly that. Great service, tasty food presented nicely, and with prompt service. The rolls were outstanding, music quietly playing, and nice artwork to view.
This is my second home..love the people and food
Excellent, professional service from the hostess to our server. And the food was tremendous.
Great meal and atomsphere
Always a favorite for date night!  Love the wine flights and bread.
Wonderful as always!
The food and service were excellent as always. The staff is well trained and most accommodating.
One of the best, if not the best, restaurant in the city. The food is always delicious and everyone is very friendly and helpful.

Metro is one of our favorite Oklahoma City restaurants. It's never fails to serve quality food and drinks. I personally had the Kimchi and sous vide beef served with buns. It was tasty. Could have done without the mustard seeds. Favorite meal is the veal Milanese.
I reserved and expected Toscana not Toscana BarVery disappointed
Went to this classic American Italian spot. Since they will be closed for two months to do renovation their food options were a bit more limited. All food was very good.

We had a wonderful Holiday lunch with our son, Jonathan visiting from Madison.He frequented Toscana before he was born, when I had lunch with friends and business related.He loved the Cotaletta Milanese. I make the Austrian version "Schnitzel" for him.
Food was mixed, some dishes very good, other not so goodExtremely noisy, too small to have an open kitchenThe the place is clean but when I entered I could some kind of odor, sort of musty
Grwat, as always
A classy dinner with delicious food. The black truffle and burrata pizza is to die for!
Great, always consistent and delicious
Best restaurant in LA!
Toscana is the Best. Top quality.  Food, wine, service, everything
My pasta while tasty was barely warm. At these prices they need to do better. Otherwise I enjoyed my time there.

Always outstanding food & ambiance! The Maitre D' greets you at the door with a warm genuine smile making you feel like so welcome. We were celebrating our sons 26th Birthday and our waiter Mark went out of his way to make our night special. A 10 every time!
Even though our reservation was a bit delayed because people were not leaving the restaurant, the hostess was very nice and did her best to accomodate us. Food was amazing and very nice service.
Service was impeccable and the food is so delicious!
Amazing as always!
As always, a terrific experience.
Lovely branzino. Good wine, but quite overpriced. The veal was magnificent, though very very expensive.

Arrived early for our reservation, and was greeted warmly. Only waited a couple of minutes before the table was available. The staff were all great, and the atmosphere was fun and comfortable.  The food was delicious!
Efficient and tasty.
One of our faves!!!

We went to Tuscano‚Äôs today for lunch. We had great service from the minute we walked in. Our server told us the specials, my husband opted for the seafood pasta which she said was excellent ,I had the orchestra which is small pasta shells with Broccoli, sun-dried tomatoes and garlic. We both enjoyed our pastas& We can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Wonderful as always! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Everything excellent but noise level too high.  Can't do anything about it but it is distracting
Great food and service.

A new wine list includes man regional wines  in the $50 to $100 range, considerably less expensive than the Brunellos and Barolos, that are exciting and satisfying.  The food was excellent.  I always include a small bowl of spaghetti, with butter and Parmesan, not on the menu which arrives just right, not too large a portion and al dents.
This restaurant is always outstanding!  The artichoke salad is next level, pasta are insane & the dishes all feel clean & light.
One of the best Italian food in town
Love the food! Service was excellent... can't wait to go back!
Toscana has been our favorite lunch place for 28 years.
loved it. Fabulous food and the wine selection was very nice. Great service!
One gets used to the off hand manner of the maitre d if one has been away for a while. We were put at a table smack on the middle of the room. The waiter was charming. Food was good as always.
Good food and great service. What else do you want.
As always, OUTSTANDING. Best Italian food in the west coast.

We felt very rushed and unattended to. We were told certain tables by the windows were reserved, when in fact I witnessed a walk-in seated there. They brought out appetizer at the same time as the entree. I had dined here some time ago, but now I see no reason to return again
Awesome food and service.  As always Toscana lives up to expectations.  Highly recommend!
Delicious food, wonderful service, gracious always
Excellent waiter. Great food. Best table! Loved it
The best!!
Upscale twists on homestyle Italian food. Very friendly and welcoming service
Great food and service.
Welcoming, friendly service, perfectly seasoned and prepared food.
Excellent in the new location. So much closer ! Very young chic clientele !
An excellent dinner. Loved it

Everything was superb. Quiet night with the coronavirus causing folks to stay away from public places, but come on out and eat! Nice wine list, friendly staff. So glad to have Townsend in Rittenhouse neighborhood.
Lovely dinner and wonderful drinks. The staff is delightfully helpful and respectful.  Overall, a great dining experience.

We really enjoyed our recent visit to Townsend.  We both ordered the chef's tasting menu and staff was very accomodating about changing out one of the dishes that was something we don't eat.  Each course was delicious.  We also enjoyed the wine pairings with each course.  A great choice for a special occasion meal.
Wonderful restaurant at a new location, food in top shelf and service is pretty good. A little louder and less intimate then it used to be but still great all around

Wonderful food and service as on Passyunk!  We had a beautifully timed dinner to celebrate and the best temperance cocktail in Philadelphia so far.  Miss the old charming ambiance a bit, but will definitely be back.

We were greeted promptly and seated.  There was a table of 5 men and 1 woman that was very noise.  The men kept trying to talk over each other and getting louder.  We complained to the server about the noise.  She agreed they were way out of bounds but there was nothing she could do.  There was a dying poinsettia in the window sill next to our table; it almost spring.  We had to signal to order cocktails.  The food was very good and the wine was very good.  The variety of food was excellent and they prepared a salad course for my wife which was not on the menu.  It was very good.  Pricing was good.  I would recommend that they spend more training on customer service and attention to details.
Wonderful dinner!
The food was just OK. The Bronzino was soggy indicating it had been frozen too long .The gnocchi was overcooked although I thought the sauce was good.

We ate upstairs on a Tuesday night. We were able to talk and hear each other! A remarkable and delightful surprise in a restaurant these days.We four foodies agreed this was one if the best food we'd ever ate. The experience was further enhanced by our excellent waiter, Harry.All in all, a wonderful evening.
It was lovely and we definitely will return. Delicious!! Excellent service!!

Glad we arrived early on a Saturday, seated right away. After that it went down hill. Waiter not very professional, no offer of fix menu, had to refill water ourselves. Too casual about everything.Overall good was good, not overly salty, cooked correctly. Just not a wow taste anywhere. We had escargot, gnocchi,duck and halibut. Had hoped service improved since opening reviews, once it's was full restaurant we waited for most everything.
Great tasting menu!  The halibut was incredible, the filet mignon cooked perfect, and the soup tasty.
Everything we ordered was wonderful. No complaints, want to go back soon.
Amazing spot, excellent service, food was phenomenal and  truly a dining experience. Can‚Äôt wait to go back. Chef Todd acknowledged my request to meet him and talk about the restaurant.
Special event dinner for 2 birthdays and my son passing his CPA exam. Great food, delicious wine list, very knowledgeable and friendly service. Pricey and totally worth it.
The whole meal was wonderful. The oysters simply melted in your mouth, cooked to perfection, simply lovely!  Cannot wait to dine there again!
Average compared to the many fine restaurants in the neighborhood.
It was delicious BUT VERY loud.  The acoustiscs need improving as everything else is wonderful !!!
Quality experience on all levels- food, service and ambiance

Simply one of the best meals I've eaten in years and the cocktails were exquisite. The only downsides to the experience is that the ambience isn't great. The food and drink far makes up for that fact . This place absolutely needs to be experienced at least once

Pleasant surroundings if a little stark, quiet and comfortable.  Service very good.Best dishes were the squash soup and the scallops. The foie gras was unevenly cooked, one portion just right, the other  undercooked. Both had an off taste in the sear.  The sweetbreads were very well prepared. The duck was well prepared, nothing unusual but good nonetheless. Overall a good experience . More likely to return to Bibou.
Great ambiance but the portions were to large!  We were told they were portioned for each individual to order each course but by the time the main course came we were half stuffed.

We eat at the bar about once a week, but on Saturday night, we took my mother for dinner, and she liked it so much that we switched her upcoming birthday party to Townsend. Great food on a menu that's always kept fresh. (I had Broiled Oysters, Rabbit Gnocchi, Halibut)   Great service. Great drinks (Manhattans! - thanks Mike and Kevin).
Excellent on all counts. Will definitely return to explore more of the menu.

Everything about our dinner was outstanding. Our server, Amy, was knowledgeable about everything on the menu and steered us In the right direction for each course we ordered. Every person who came to our table to serve us something were also knowledgeable about everything! We loved it and can‚Äôt wait to come back. Beautiful restaurant!
Fantastic food!
The food was good, but consistent not warm.We felt awckward to send it back to be re-heated, and again it was reallt tasteful, jut not  hot.

This may be a great spot-  but only after they fix some startup problems.Our table was not ready at our reservation time but there is under zero space to wait - except at the overcrowded bar (with others waiting to be seated) so we hung out in a window area. We had a wonderful server who took our order for a nice bottle of wine (from a moderately interesting list). A runner then brought us the obligatory bread basket along with an amuse-bouche of vinegared beets, one of which he  overturned onto the table linens - but made no offer to even cover the large and expanding beet red amoeba shaped stain with a napkin.Our first courses - a nice potato potage and baked oysters with (I recall) Pernod were quite well prepared. Our mains, a duck breast and a fish with a leek and other vegetable pur√©e were both well prepared - but suffered from an obvious many too many minutes late delay in getting from the kitchen to the table. We passed on desert as nothing on the limited selection spoke to us.This is a work in progress. Most of the ‚Äúrough edges‚Äù we felt were managed around by a wonderful and obviously experienced server (who we well tipped) but it‚Äôs hard to not get the feeling that the front and back of the house need some more time working together.Last - it‚Äôs a fine dining restaurant.  It needs some acoustic treatment as the noise level was close to that of a sports bar until later in the evening when the number of patrons was at a minimum.We will give it a few months and return.

First time at the new location (but several times at the old)- so my advice now is - ask for a table against the wall or upstairs.  The window tables are very cold in winter and the one nearest to the service station is distracting. The food - well, I just don't get the hype!  It's good but not spectacular in any form.  Sweetbreads were overly large and thus contained significant cartilage.  Tuna nicoise was grainy... in general the entire meal was overly salted.  Maybe I'm being picky but for a top place it was disappointing and all this was reflected in prior visits.

Seating was swift when we arrived with our reservation (which we made 15 mins prior); the food was all fantastic - from the amuse-bouche to the sophisticated dessert. Everything was so fresh and extremely well executed. It's a masterclass in French cuisine.

I have never left a poor review. We were really looking forward to trying Townsend as we have heard great things. However, the food was extremely mediocre - some lukewarm, some so hot as if out of a microwave. It lacked any real flavor. The foie gras mousse was gummy like glue and the duck was questionably duck. The only thing actually worth eating were the oysters. Our meal was so disappointing we immediately walked to Friday, Saturday, Sunday where we know we can get a top-notch, perfectly executed meal with staff that don‚Äôt seem like robots. Just having a reputation for good food won‚Äôt do much unless you only serve people who would be happy eating at Applebee‚Äôs every night. We won‚Äôt be returning.
Everything about my evening was outstanding! The food was incredible, the service was spectacular...best meal I've had in a long time!

Outstanding meal and cocktails were divine! It was restaurant week and that can be hit or miss in some restaurants. Townsend was better than expectations! We have eaten at Townsend when the restaurant was located in South Philly and thought this meal was even better. The ambience, the complex yet clean flavorful dishes and creative cocktails should not be missed. We live in the city and have become foodie snobs frequenting many restaurants that have had the 'hype' and were disappointed.   Townsend did not disappoint- we will be back!
We really enjoyed restaurant week menu and portions were generous unlike many French restaurants.  Very nice wine list.  Excellent service and good ambiance.
My new favorite Center City restaurant! Great for any occasion.

Went for restaurant week and both got short rib both were overcooked/tough but one was significantly more overcooked and dry. Wasn‚Äôt worth sending back cause than not eating at same time. Everything else was good
The food was delicious and the service was fast.  I will be going back to Townsend restaurant in the near future.  Highly recommend.
With reservation I would recommend but also realize this was RW.

We are regulars at true food. My daughter and I both commented we didn‚Äôt know if there was a new shop or something had changed with the cooking. We order the new appetizer the lettuce wrap made with jackfruit. It was very salty.I ordered the shrimp tacos in a lettuce wrap. There were two small tacos and nothing really on the side  except a small side of lettuce. A far change from their fish taco that used to be on the menu. I feel like the prices have gone up the portions have gone down and so has the quality of the food. The concept of the restaurant is amazing and it used to be one of our favorite spots for lunch or a quick dinner.
Really good and healthy options. Great for Vegan and gluten free options!

I love true food but this time was not their best effort. We asked for gluten-free pitas and we‚Äôre given regular pita chips. After we asked multiple times the waiter finally came back and said that he did accidentally give us regular. Could‚Äôve been a big issue had we eating them without questioning him. Our bill was incorrect, our pizza was not cut all the way through. Lots of issues and I‚Äôm hoping they work through this challenging time because it‚Äôs one of my favorite restaurants.
Samantha, our server, was extremely professional and  aware of our needs while maintaining new standards.
Great service, very clean, social distance guidelines in place
Great ‚Äùre-opening‚Äù experience. Everything was excellent. Food, service, spacing of the tables. We felt very comfortable.
Great place
Always great and attentive service ...drinks and food fresh and tasty. Outdoor option is such a treat.

Unfortunately, the lettuce in my lunch salad was wilted and even slimy in spots. Not appetizing at all. Outdoor seating could have been better with the addition of flowering plants in the planters next to the tables, and street noise made conversation difficult. Overall, not the experience I used to enjoy at TFK.

Food was good.  Servers and other employees were nice.  Only issue was that hostess had her mask pulled down below her nose at all times and sometimes below her mouth, too.  This is not acceptable during COVID times and especially not when all customers need to wear mask (I am happy to do this) but you are speaking with and seated by someone who doesn't have their mask on properly.  Hopefully mgmt. will correct this.

Food was excellent... We thoroughly enjoyed the charred cauliflower, then the winter immunity bowl with chicken... The food is so good, clean & awesome taste... Service was perfect... Thank you True Food Kitchen you guys are truly awesome... I wish you were in mu hometown - I'd be their everyday!

Food is delicious.  The ancient grain bowl was my favorite.  Specialty cocktail list also really good.  Love the vibe/decoration in the restaurant, it is thoughtfully designed.  Tenny took care of us and is a wonderful person.
Great preparation. Greatbtaste
Great spot. Super food and wonderful wait staff.  Would go again!
Great food and ambience. Service was excellent. Will come again!
Great time with a friend I haven‚Äôt seen in a while. Always love coming to this lovely restaurant.
This is one of my favorite spots in the city.
We had fantastic service from a trainee called Steven, who was attentive to our hungers and thirsts but had a light touch for checking in. Food great too.

Really enjoyed this restaurant! Have been once before but went back this time with my family who is visiting. Service was great and everyone seemed to like their food!Only complaint might be the dessert (flourless cake), which seemed a little dry, but other than that it was a great experience!
Service was terrific.  Really good, healthy fare.

Lunch with a friend. We enjoyed the 2 appetizers we ordered, flat bread and cauliflower. I enjoyed my 1/2 bowl ancient grain with salmon. My friend had the beet burger and was not wowed by it. Service was slow but realize they were having a shift change. All were very gracious and helpful.

We experienced extremely long wait times for our food when we had guests in town last month, but decided to come back to meet a local friend for lunch who lived nearby. After writing a review after the last experience, True Food Kitchen's Assistant GM reached out to personally apologize for the experience and encouraged us to contact him if we dined there again. We did and the GM, Brian, made sure to stop by during our most recent visit. Our experience was great and Brian made sure to take care of our party. It's very refreshing to see an organization do everything they could to turn around a less than stellar experience. Mistakes and off days certainly happen, so we appreciate when a group can recover and make sure to create a good experience going forward. Food was great and service was great also including for our young son.
I am Vegan and was joined by a Carnivore.  I had the Winter Immunity bowl and he had the Beet burger.  Both of us loved our meals!

Ratings for food and overall would have been 5 stars if the food had been served hot.  My soup base bowl and the tomato soup for my dining partner were both dissatisfying lukewarm.  Both were delicious but soup should be hot, not lukewarm, especially on a cold winter day.  Our server was friendly and helpful when answering our questions about menu items.
This was my 4th time there 6 weeks. The food was delicious - as always!

This place is excellent in all respects, we really enjoyed the delicious food and they have so many options. Easily satisfied my vegan wife and the seafood lover in me, all of it was amazing. The service was also fantastic, very fun and attentive but not overly so. Highly recommend!
This was my first time dining here and was food was delicious. I will definitely return and recommend to others. The guacamole is a winner!
Excellent food and serviceWell locatedI would highly recommend this restaurant
Amazing food!!Get the bowl!
Food was great, service was great (my waiter wasn't the best, he wasn't bad, but was just okay), everyone else gave great service. Music was nice.
Absolutely amazing!! Always delicious!! Valentine‚Äôs menu was GREAT!!!! Can‚Äôt wait for the Spring menu to come out.

We had out of town guests that we brought to True Food Kitchen because of dietary needs (plant based diet), and they enjoyed the food tremendously. However, we also had two children in our party, and the wait to receive our food, even a couple of items we ordered right away to feed to the youngest child, took an extremely long time to come out. Our server assured us, after a long delay once he took our order, that we were the next ticket up, but from that point it was even 20 min before our food arrived at our table. In all, we waited about 45-50 minutes to get our food from the time we placed our orders.Personally, being local to Chicago, I don't know that my family and I would dine here again soon because of that experience, but we may consider bringing guests if they had dietary considerations. The food was excellent, though.
The servers can be a bit unresponsive, like not bringing tableware when asked. But the place is otherwise awesome.

We were running about 20 minutes late and the staff here are very accommodating.  we tried the communal table which was second-guessing first but decided to go for it.  We ended up using the smaller table and literally was elbow to elbow with another couple, so with that, I wish the chair was a little bit farther from one another.The food was good, the flavor was there.  The drinks were amazing.  If you are a vegetarian, this is a good place to go because of their options.  I would definitely go back here again.
Great service!
Sea bass was fantastic as was the gf chocolate cake.
True Food is the epitome of the way we are eating right now!  Delicious, wholesome food served in a just-right-vibe atmosphere where everyone is happy!  Can't wait to go back!!
Delicious clean meals with interesting ingredients. Could be flavored with more punch, but delicious just the same.  Recommended!
Healthy food served by friendly staff

I love coming to True Food Kitchen every time I'm in NYC! Eating there makes me feel like I'm putting the best fuel into my body, not to mention everything I've had there is absolutely delicious. I had the breakfast bowl and my boyfriend got the immunity bowl - we were both thoroughly impressed :)

This restaurant not only has some of the best unique and quality sushi I have ever tried but the service was outstanding.  Uchi has taken the time and paid attention to the importance of social distancing, wearing masks, and cleanliness while continuing to provide an amazing dining experience.  All of the staff are well-trained, knowledgeable and were a pleasure to converse with.  Thank you for the experience it was truly memorable and we will be back again.

First time dining at Uchi Dallas, It was good to be able to enjoy a restaurant but I believe the safety precautions made a higher-end dining experience not so inviting.   Soy Sauce, ginger, and wasabi in packets made the experience and price of service not worthy to dine during these times.  The Happy Hour Menu for drinks was below expectations.  The food tasted good with many flavor combinations. Hama Chili flavorfulHamachi kama was slightly over burned around the edges and still served to us. Wagyu beef Hot Stone was a great experience with good flavorEdamame was good/ some pieces were burnt walu walu was goodBiendo could be rolled tighter but was very tastefulPork Rib/ Salty Coconut Tapioca Fantastic
Great service. Quality food. Server did a good job of crafting a custom menu based on preferences.
We love this place and we try to visit once every two months or so , we drive two hours to visit Uchi but is worth it , it never disappoints.
Excellent omakase and service. Will definitely return.
Food was great, but we felt rushed due to the fast timing the food was brought out.
Uchi is the best restaurant in Texas hands down. The staff is amazing and the food is unforgettable.
Best service and food in Dallas. This is the only place I missed during quarantine.
Everything we tried was fresh and amazing! Cannot wait to go back!
Fantastic experience.
Stellar food.   Stellar staff.     We just moved from Miami and are so happy to have found this place.

Exceptional in every sense of the word. From the food to the service, just exceptional.  Our waiter remembered our previous orders and every person that approached our table wished us happy birthday.  Chef Rhonda is a mad culinary genius!

Johnny Helped me with my reservation to celebrate my son's 30th Birthday This is his favorite place!!! Johnny was amazing My son and his girlfriend had a fantastic dinnerThanks for making it so specialJohnny your the best!!!!

It is always pleasure coming to Uchi and seeing the friendly faces and great smiles amongst the entire staff. The food is amazing and definitely worth every penny, they have my favorite staff amongst any restaurant I‚Äôve ever gone too and I always get excellent customer service. I had the pleasure of having James as my server and would like to thank him for great service and recommendations on drinks and dishes. Thank you to everyone at Uchi!

My brother was visiting from Chicago and we had the Chef‚Äôs tasting menu. Absolutely EVERYTHING was incredible. Service was impeccable and food was creative and inspiring. It‚Äôs nice to feel a little bit of Dallas again. Please thank the entire team for a memorable evening.

A wonderful dining experience!! Service was great.. food was delicious loved all the suggestions and your guiding through the menu. Laura was our server and the other team members made it a overall great night out !!
Times are weird and unpredictable right now. Didn‚Äôt feel that way at all, at Uchi. It was still an awesome experience with all the special care taken for the guests and staff.
This is my favorite restaurant in all of Dallas! Thank you, Uchi!!!!!
Very quick and efficient service. Very high quality sushi. Good wine list too!

It was my wife's birthday and I've heard nothing but great things about Uchi.  Unfortunately, with the Pandemic, we were not able to go inside, so I made a reservation for pick up.  It was well worth it!  This was literally The. Best. Sushi. We've. Ever. Had!!  We can not wait to dine inside when available.  Service wise, the staff greeted my car and had the food at the scheduled time as reserved.
We missed dining in
The food was fantastic! Thank you Uchi for staying open and continuing to creat delicious meals during this quarantine. Especially loved the Sakana Mushi. We‚Äôll be back soon!

Over the top and more in this pandemic we are in. I‚Äôm very thankful that I could get the best sushi and sake tonight. I just closed the sale of my house and wanted to celebrate properly and I just don‚Äôt have the option to belly up to a table to throw down. Ordering and pickup to go was so smooth and easy. Can‚Äôt wait to be able to sit and enjoy Uchi in Uchi.
Quarantine Uchi is just as good as in restaurant Uchi!!! it was perfect and we will definitely have another fancy night at home soon!
I love Uchi, and I was happy to be able to support them during this time. Their system for takeout is easy and efficient. Can't wait to come back when restrictions are lifted.
Awesome experience!
The food is delicious! We appreciate Uchi‚Äôs high standards even during a pandemic!
Creative rolls, great fish, good people!
As always, great food and service.  Best sushi in Texas
Even during the quarantine, the staff was so friendly and helpful! They made the to-go process easy and we were still able to enjoy delicious food at home.

I ordered takeout from Uchi to treat myself during the quarantine and the team went above and beyond to make the home experience as amazing as possible. All I had to do was close my eyes to imagine I was back in the gorgeous dining space. Can‚Äôt wait to get back and eat in person! In the meantime, takeout it is!
It wasn't the same without Stephanie, helping us out, but the food was epic as usual.
Great great food! Would definitely recommend for a night out with friends.

We sat at the sushi bar, as I love the expert it brings with watching the chefs create masterpieces.  We had Charlotte as our beverage server and Ka (sp?) the head chef as our food expert.  It was my husband‚Äôs first time there and he has wanted to go back almost every day!  It is phenomenal!
Awesome experience as always...Great food and excellent service.

Always such a great experience at Uchi! We weren‚Äôt able to get the server we requested initially, but James took amazing care of us. We visited Uchi to celebrate our anniversary, as we have been doing every year in recent years, and had a phenomenal evening. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

The dinner was fantastic, the atmosphere was fantastic and the service was pretty great. We tried the ‚Äúservers suggestion menu‚Äù and it turned out fantastic. The only issue we had is our server was pretty adamant about not needing soy or wasabi because the food is prepared to be exactly what the chef wants you to taste. I totally understand that especially managing a restaurant myself for my job. However, my girlfriend and I genuinely just love soy and wasabi and we had to ask a couple times for it and eventually just asked a different server for it. We are down for suggestive selling but sometimes we just want what we like as far as additives. Nevertheless, our server did a great job picking out our food and leading us in a great direction. One of the best meals I‚Äôve had since moving to Dallas very recently and one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in general. Thank you Uchi for a great time and experience.
The food NEVER disappoints however this time we had a server that made us feel rushed and wasn‚Äôt very welcoming.
The best food I have ever had. Service was perfect.

Delicious seafood and wonderful service with nice ambiance. Some of the dishes had a repetitive flavor, and the deep fried selections were overly greasy. We let the waiter help with our selections and he did an admirable job, but next time we'd stick to standard rolls and sushi because the seafood is top notch. We arrived during happy hour, which was the only reservation we could get--it turned out terrific because they have great happy hour options. We'd definitely recommend Uchi Dallas, despite the few quibbles.
Unparalleled service, sushi, & ambience.  There‚Äôs no spot that can compare in all of Atlanta.
Michele is the best!!

The food is always excellent and of the highest quality. But tonight was unusually special as management had thought of the unique idea of placing mannequins at the tables and bar seats that could not be used because of the Coronavirus. Very clever indeed and the evening that much more enjoyable!
The best place in Atlanta.
Birthday dinner
Everything was amazing as always. The food was spectacular and the service was exceptional.  Really dig the art
As usual..an excellent meal
Every time I go to Umi I fall in love all over again! Michelle is the best service person EVER!!! We never use a menu, just tell Michelle to bring food...and it‚Äôs always amazing!
Favorite place to eat in Atlanta.  Jon and Hector are the absolute best.  Amazing food and drinks but the staff is the reason we keep coming back
Umi was great!!
Incredible dinner. Umi never disappoints.
Everything was wonderful and they were very accommodating to our situation.
AMAZING. I wish I could come here everyday. Best sushi I have ever had. Great service and atmosphere. Will be back!
Great food!
From food to service everything was excellent.
Excellent service and food. Thanks
Love Umi...food, vibe, and service are excellent!
Michelle our waitress is always so welcoming and cheerful! She always knows exactly what we want! WE LOVE it at UMI!
Food was so great - service was great as well. A bit loud but the food makes up for it. I‚Äôll be coming back here for sure!
Great, fresh and incredible sushi !!The customer service was amazing and UMI is a 100% recommendation for meüëè
Great place to go; a must do if you like sushi.  The lobster toban-Yaki was scrumptious as was the sashimi, fois Gras, and seared wagyu sushi.
5th Wedding Anniversary was one to remember. We both love Sushi and Umi more than delivered! A date we‚Äôll always remember.
Great client dinner
I‚Äôve had the opertunity to eat sushi all over the US . This place is the best . The food is unapologeticly expensive but amazing and worth it
We had to wait almost 30 minutes to get the table
By far the best sushi in Atlanta!! Worth every dollar. We frequent this place for our special occasions.
The best sushi I‚Äôve had in Atlanta. Impeccable service. The toro is next level!

It was completely amazing!  The food was incredible and the service was over the top.  There is no other place we will go for amazing Sushi in Atlanta!  We will be back soon!  Thank you for another great evening!
It was perfect! As usual. Best sushi!

We had to wait about 20 minutes after we arrived for our reservation, but once we were sitting, everything was delightful. Recommend the chef‚Äôs selection nigiri, its a small portion but the best sushi I have ever had. Kind and attentive waitstaff
Been here several times, one of the best in town.
Food was off the charts!    The staff was super knowledgeable and helpful!   We will definitely be going back for special occasions!
It‚Äôs like e
Delicious. And. Fun!

Looooove UMI absolutely love the tuna carpaccio and yellowtail carpaccio apps! Highly recommend this place the food is wonderful and never disappoints. Love the Miami feel music and just an overall wonderful spot. We have done this for date night but I‚Äôd love to do a girls night too! Angel food cake is the beeeest! Incredible friendly service that gave the best recommendations. Just overall amazing!
Valentines Day
Awesome as always
Food was decent and fresh.  No wow factor. Service was horrible.
Wonderful restaraunt. Staff, food and ambience is terrific.
Food was excellent

We totally enjoyed our dinner at Upland.  The entire evening was perfect.  The food was outstanding.  My husband never likes the menu when we go out and he loved everything we ordered.  We shared a salad, pizza, pasta and chicken.  Our waiter, Sam, was fabulous and the manger, Jennifer, came over and she was delightful.thank you for a wonderful evening.Susan & Alan Fishman
Overrated! Burger ok, pasta came cold... very poor service!!!
Great food, great atmosphere. Shame they ran out of the hen of the woods mushrooms!

Eh--underwhelming.  Was super excited to dine here but the the menu was just OK.  Not a lot of interesting options.  We had also called ahead to make sure they had vegan offerings.  They enthusiastically said yes.  Their vegan option at brunch?  Potatoes.  Just potatoes.  Many better brunch options in the city.

This is a wonderful restaurant!  The food is fantastic and the atmosphere very cozy and friendly.  The staff are responsive and efficient and helpful.  Their is a nice price range.  I had the salmon entree and my husband had the pork -- both were delicious!  Cocktails were perfect.  Upland, to me, seems to have something for everyone.
Disappointing.....  barely any lamb in the lamb dish, a ridiculous amount of lettuce basically covered the plate.....  very little seafood in the ceviche.....

Excellent food. We had a slight issue with the service - the salmon needed to be cooked through more, and the served acted like we were asking her to summit Mt. Everest - but it got fixed in the end. A good place for a business lunch (which is why we were there).

We were there for Sunday Brunch to celebrate my daughters birthday. Upland had great ambiance and good service but all 4 meals (pasta, quiche, eggs) came out room temperature. Flavors were great but no excuse for food not coming to the table hot at this restaurant.
The couple next to us was extremely annoying and ruined the experience basically. It would have been just okay otherwise. I probably would not return. It was nothing special.
Everything was wonderful except the shrimp and rice dish. It seemed to consist mostly of shrimp shells (creepy) and not much shrimp meat at all.

I visit New York around 4-6 times a year.  I am always looking for new places to eat and saw Uplands on a list of brunch spots to try.  This was my first visit to Uplands.  It was in a great location and the restaurant itself is spacious and beautiful - not typical for many restaurants in the city.  Food was very good - we went with the server's recommendations and were not disappointed.  My husband had the fried chicken sandwich and I had the Egg and Tortilla.  I asked for scrambled eggs instead of fried egg and it was no problem.  We had mimosas and Bloody Marys and then finished with the Donuts. We wouldn't normally do that but the donuts were recommended.  Enjoyed the experience from start to finish - we will definitely be back.
Loved everything about it. Food service and decor were all absolutely perfect.
I went early with a friend.  We ordered a few appetizers and some wine.  Nice sized portions and very fresh food.  Excellent service.  Will definitely come back

I have been coming to Upland since it first opened and it has been a consistently good experience in terms of both food and service.  Unfortunately on my last visit our server was SO RUDE and put us on edge for the entire dinner because we were nervous of being barked at!  She tried to take our appetisers away when we were half way though and when we said we weren‚Äôt finished yet, she decided she would change our plates for some unknown reason...then a minute later our mains arrived so we ended up not actually being able to enjoy the rest of our appetisers!  It was quite embarrassing because I had a guest in from out of town and got them to cancel their reservation at L‚ÄôArtusi to come to Upland instead!  I really hope it was a one off be side I really do enjoy Upland, but next time I will think twice before returning since New York is full of great restaurants with great service.
Expensive. Noisy.  Pizza was burnt.  My friend asked for a slight modification in her meal (a vegetable instead of the rice) and the waiter didn't even try to accommodate.  Highly overrated.
The service was truly terribly. Our server was very stuck up and almost acted like it was a burden to serve us. The food was also overly salty. My favourite thing was the caesar salad.

Our server was grumpy and I was surprised because I have usually had really lovely service.   It kind of bummed me out.  I loved our meal despite him but it bothered me a lot, I have been in food service and I know when someone is over it, it shows.   Otherwise Jennifer made it right by coming over to check on us!
We agreed that this is our favorite NYC restaurant, hands-down.  Impeccable food and service, both enjoyed in a beautiful and quiet room. We will keep returning.
Wonderful brunch, great drinks and very professional staff.

We went to Upland for a celebratory engagement dinner with both sets of parents.  This place is incredible.  Every dish is well thought out and you don't need to spend an arm & a leg for a truly great meal like other places in NYC.  Highly recommend the hen of the wood, tomato soup & caesar salad
Such a fantastic meal with fantastic service!!
Great vibe and great food. Loved that you could have a conversation
This is usually a fave but was quite disappointing.  Our waitress tried to rush us and my main dish (salmon) had strange sides.

Pizzas and salads are great.  I had the feta spinach omelet, but it did not have much feta or spinach in it.  The slice of bread given the side was truly hard as a rock, so could not break or bite.  Otherwise it is a great place.  Service, ambiance and staff are great.  Will skip the omlette next time.

I love this restaurant. The atmosphere is clean and crisp and appeases anyone's taste/style. The wait staff was incredibly kind and my server was specifically awesome. I took two friends and I would highly suggest this as a restaurant to take someone who is in town for the weekend. We shared an order of donuts at the beginning and the jelly donut was the best I have ever had - huge shout-out to the pastry chef :) All three of our meals were pretty stellar - my one and only hesitation is that it can get quite costly but with that being said, the portions are quite large and we all three had food to-go for later. Thank you!!!
Such a treat. The food is inventive and great. And a fun vibe.
Food and service were great. Two outstanding pastas. Beautiful space with a great vibe. Great meal always consistent
Would never go back because of noise level tho good excellent
The food is unique and delicious... the cocktail drink menu was very good!
There's a reason Upland is always one of my favorite restaurants in the city - they always deliver great food and experience
We had a great evening here. Great food and service , and a really lively buzzy ambience. All you want from a restaurant !
Great food! Great location! Energetic noise level!
We went for a casual meal. The service was great. I spilt my espresso martini and they made me a new one straight away
Great dining experience! Will visit again!
Great food! Love the decor!
Staff was great but the burger was terrible.

This was my second time here and both times, I really enjoyed it. I came for my birthday brunch and we were a party of 4. The first table we were seated at wasn't great, but they let us have a booth and it was much better. The hostesses were very kind and accommodating. Service was good - I always had water in my glass. The atmosphere is so lovely and comfortable! The food was excellent. The sausage and kale pizza is phenomenal. Usually I don't like thicker pizzas but this one managed to be thick without being too heavy or soggy. The crust was crispy and the flavor was out of this world. We also enjoyed the burger very much. The fried chicken sandwich was a bit on the small side but very tasty. Overall, great experience and would go back.
Enjoyed brunch at Upland this last weekend! Food and service was fantastic!
Always the best!
We had a great dinner --our usual favorites: the 'nduja pizza, the skirt steak, the little gem salad ... all fantastic.  Also an amazing wine list. Fabulous.
What a gem of a restaurant!  Truly a fabulous meal.
I love this place, if it weren't so difficult to get a reservation, I'd go more often.
Food is amazing - difficult to get a reservation or seat at the bar.

One of the few restaurants that actually gets better with age.  Each service person, from the water boy to the manager, glides around attentively to serve patrons.  The wine list is small but select.  pours are very large.  I loved my duck breast, which is always served medium rare (perfect).  Staff is very attentive, with one staff dedicated to just polishing wine glasses.  All details combine to make this a 5 star restaurant.  Others agree, which is why at 5:15 pm on Thursday it was jammed with couples.
Great local spot, excellent cocktails, vibrant energy and location.
This was my second visit here and everything was great! I am adding to my list of favorite Philly restaurants. My favorite thing I ordered was the crispy artichokes.  Delicious!
25th anniversary I the food was delicious
Vernick never disappoints!  Everything from the appetizers, to entrees, to wine was outstanding.  One my favorite restaurants in Philadelphia!
As always, dining at Vernick is a wonderful experience. Very good food, drinks and pleasant ambiance. Looking forward to returning for another dinner
Loved sitting at the Chefs counter. Awesome experience!

Everything was delicious! The foie gras was probably our favorite of all the small plates we got. The menu was excellent it was hard to make choices because we wanted everything! The cocktails were really good too; strong and refreshing. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Vernick was incredible. Service was outstanding! We had a variety of dishes and were not disappointed by any of them, and some were down right amazing. Definitely worth the wait for a reservation.
Anniversary

Outstanding original menu creations each with their own x-factor. The white truffle tagliatelle special is indeed very special.  Well thought out wine selections by glass or bottle compliment the plates.  Servus is first rate - attentive, comprehensive, but not overbearing.
Everything was incredible food and service Can‚Äôt wait to go back
fantastic service, food, and drinks.
Was just okay. Don‚Äôt get all the hype.
Amazing experience. Well worth the wait!  Outstanding execution. Terrific service.
One of the best Restaurants in Philadelphia and absolutely wonderful fare.
Britten was exceptional again.. everything was spectacular top to bottom
We just locked the food. If you have mobility issues ask to sit downstairs

The pumpkin toast, roasted cabbage, and curry shrimp were spectacular. The ravioli was good but it was weird that it was just one giant one, also for the price it wasn‚Äôt much. The mushroom toast was good but I think it would have been more enjoyable if it was warm and not served cold. My friend enjoyed the oysters. The service was great! I went to dinner with a friend I haven‚Äôt seen in a year and is in town for Thanksgiving and it was nice that they recommended that we take our time ordering and that there would be 15-20 min between each plate, so we could really enjoy our chatting over the sparkling wine (which I never heard about until dinner tonight!). Definitely will return to Vernick with my husband as I think he‚Äôd enjoy it.

Outstanding restaurant from the moment we walked in until we left. The staff was exceptional, our server was on point, and the food was even better than I could have hoped for: inventive, exciting, and most importantly, delicious! Well done!
This is the best restaurant in Philly. The most creative and fresh ideas i've seen. I'm a vegetarian, and there are many options!
Anniversary
Service was amazing. Food was delicious although I felt a few of the dishes were on the salty side (the mushroom soup amuse bouche, sea urchin with scrambled eggs, gratin that came with the sea bass)
Dinner was excellent, as always!
Loved everything!!! Omg the best!!Can‚Äôt wait to go back.
One of our favorite restaurants anywhere! We dine here whenever we come to Philadelphia (we live in NYC) and have even talked about hopping on the train just to dine here!
The food was very good admittedly a bit pricey for what it was. I did find the food was extremely rich.
Gorgeous menu, beautiful presentation, great wait staff, noisy but worth it!  We‚Äôll go again!
Fantastic service and incredible food. I can‚Äôt wait to go back!

Unbelievable experience, food was exceptional and service was too. I've been trying to get in here on previous trips to Philly and it did not disappoint. One of the better meal experiences ive had in awhile

This is an AMAZING restaurant.  If you consider yourself a foodie then you MUST go here.  Everything we ordered and everything that was complementary was absolutely delicious and wonderful.  I wanted to keep eating and ordering dish after dish.  I went to philly for a few days and was doing research to find the best place to dine and Vernick is the place!  I live in NJ and eat in NYC all the time and I would definitely go back to Philly just to eat at Vernick (I revisited yesterday and it was delicious). I ate at the chef counter a second time and would recommend eating there just to see the chefs work like a well oiled machine with everyone moving with precision and dedicated passion.I went a second time and this place is AMAZING.  The chefs are rock stars and had another amazing enjoyable dinner.

Awesome all around experience! My wife and I are huge foodies and haven‚Äôt been so satisfied since dining at California Grill, Victoria and Alberts, and Flying Fish. Everything was spot on and perfect. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
First time visit - enjoyed ourselves very much. Highly recommend.
Excellent service and wonderful tastes! Entrees lacked the luster that I had hoped to continue after our toasts and small plates.
One would be hard pressed to find a more delicious meal, it was superb! There is always room for improvement so if I could improve anything... well... the service could be a tad warmer.
Been here many times amd have never been disappointed.   Looking forward to our next visit.
Everything was fantastic. The service,the food and the atmosphere.A true  5 star experience
Everything about Vetri was wonderful. From the service to the granola goody bag‚Äîwe couldn‚Äôt have celebrated a 21st birthday any better.

I was there to celebrate my son and his wife having gotten him through graduation with a Doctorate in Physical Therapy from Arcadia University.  We were all very much impressed with Vetri Cucina.  The food was outstanding (and ample), the service was impeccable, and it was an altogether outstanding experience.

An amazing evening from start to finish. The staff were so warm and welcoming. The meal was a modified prefix menu. By modified,  I mean that specific foods of interest were included while foods noted to be of lesser interest were not included. The beginning was with a creatively tasty aperitivo, served with fois gras pastrami on a slice of brioche, high temperature baked and charred cauliflower, smoked duck breast and crudities with a balsamic mayonnaise. Then the serious food started.... hamachi crudo with a creative use of citrus to give it sparkle, onion crepe, with perfectly caramelized onion that took 2 days to make. We tried six different pastas, all delicious; however, for me the ricotta ravioli were incredible.... light as a feather, creamy, and, again, set off with a creative use of citrus In keeping with the season. The real showstopper were three perfectly cooked and sauced Nantucket scallops, topped with a generous serving of ostera caviar and tiny house-made potato chips. So good I felt we should eat this dish on our knees. Entrees hadn't even been started at this point. Spit-roasted goat... tender, juicy with crunchy skin and a salt-baked bronzino were secondi. Desserts were equally amazing. We ended up eating on and taking the others home for the next day. Bravo to Vetri Cucina!!!
Seriously delicious eclectic cuisine... we shared many unique courses and wine pairings that we loved! If you love food and unique experiences this is the place

I had high expectations for my birthday dinner. I was so not disappointed. From the moment we arrived we were greeted and felt welcome. The food, oh it was sooo very good. I got to try things like froe gras and white truffles. I have eaten at many fine restaurants, but this has to be number one. Yes it is very expensive, the most expensive of any restaurant I have ever visited... but oh so very worth the experience.
Vetri never disappoints!  And their Friday lunch is a treat and a bargain!
Once again, a memorable dining experience.Some of the best dishes I have ever had.Grazie

From start, and I mean very start with a personal phone call right after I booked thanking me for my reservation, and throughout the evening, every aspect of the dinner was superb, without any air of snootiness one comes to experiences 5 star restaurants. Very special, yet comfortable and accommodating.

Great service and excellent job with wine pairings. Food was not great. Sauces were all very similar (brown butter based). Also, concept of wait staff picking our menu choices sounds fun in concept, but my wife and I agreed that our experience would have been better had we got to pick our own food. Glad we had the experience, but wouldn‚Äôt hurry back anytime soon
Always great! We love bill!

I'm not sure which was better: the food or the service.  The entirety of the meal was the best I can remember.  Being greater with a drink and snacks.  Amazing service and presentation.  And the quality and execution of the meals was second to none.  Hope to be back soon.
Best lunch experience - always.  Worth taking a Friday off.

From start to finish our evening at Vetri was exceptional. Of course the food was delicious and beautifully plated but our wait staff made the experience that much nicer. They were attentive without being intrusive and we were impressed by the knowledge of our dietary restrictions. All agreed that this was our best meal in Philadelphia.
The best dining experience in the city.  Unique flavors, perfect service.

When people hear about the cost of my meal, they cringe and obviously do not understand "value". When a product or experience is extraordinary, then there is no concern about cost and that makes a great value. This was a dining experience without compare. The food was fantastic from start to finish, and the wine was a perfect compliment. The service was fabulous and the servers absolutely helped to make the experience special. It was my 25th wedding anniversary and my wife and I shared it with my 3 daughters.  I hit a grand slam with my choice of Vetri Cucina! Thank you all for making it a very memorable, lovely and satisfying evening!
Best food in the city, state and maybe northeast!
This restaurant was a great experience for foodies looking for a fancy night out. It is a great way to try new things and the homemade pasta was perfect!

Excellent experience. Outstanding, detailed, creative, delicious food with an Italian focus.  It also is a home-y unpretentious setting which is perfect. The desserts were the best we've ever tasted. Would consider again for a very special occasion.

Delicious meal, service so over the top that it was a bit much or uncomfortable at times, felt a little robotic/insincere, but it is a very formal place. Great experience, something to try once and the food was phenomenal. Price tag a bit extreme. For dinner for two and bottle of wine on the less expensive side of their offerings, bill was $440 not including tip. When comparing to the nicer, expensive places like some of the Steven starr and steakhouses in the city, it‚Äôs more expensive.. but again, an experience! And despite the tasting sizes, they sprinkle in lots of extras and you leave stuffed!

The most fantastic food in Philly, but if you do the tasting menu, be prepared to consume a LOT of food! So unexpected, we are big eaters and have never been beaten by a meal! We surrendered before the last savory course, and before cheeses and dessert....these were not large portions, but there were many courses. I suggest getting up and having a brief walk outside at the 5th or 6th course! If you can afford an expensive meal, this is worth it.

once again, this is my favorite restaurant in the world! the food is so good you can't believe it. everything about this place is top notch. of course you pay for it but why not live a little. I highly recommend this for any occation.

Food was amazing. Waiter let us try wine by the glass before selecting. Plus his service and attention were top notch. Each course both of us got a different selection chosen by the chef which let us try a majority if the dishes. Cannot wait to go back.
Superb in every way!
How was my meal?  What more can I say then the BEST Italian restaurant in the entire Phila area. Including ACNJ.
My friend and I enjoyed our lunch.The food was great, service attentive.- - but still rather pricey.The place could use a good cleaning.  But , overall, a lovely meal with happy (holiday) vibe.

Vetri Cucina delivers perfection in dining. Atmosphere, food and service just perfect. The decor is casual elegance. The service is highly professional never affected. The staff are attentive without being over bearing. The sense is they want you to have a wonderful dining experience. The food is inventive but never pretentious. Flavor reigns via superb ingredients in well conceived dishes. This is truly a world class restaurant.

My wife and I dined here as part of an anniversary celebration. The restaurant is warm and quiet-a great place to have conversation and enjoy the meal. We were served a lovely cocktail-an Italian spritz-while the staff asked us about likes, dislikes, allergies, etc. We were given the option of choosing from their tasting menu or to be surprised. We opted for the surprise-but did not do the optional wine pairing (too much alcohol for a couple of light-weights!). My wife has very distinct food dislikes and I am very adventurous and chef was marvelous at meeting both our preferences! The portions were small and manageable, the food was gorgeous and delicious. The service was gracious, friendly and attentive but not cloying. Definitely worth going for a special occasion!
Great special occasion but will tip a hole in the wallet!
Amazing! I've never been so full but I just couldn't stop eating. Expensive, but well worth it.
Love Love Love! Best Birthday Dinner ever. Thank for the amazing food, wine, and above all care to everything!
Bill, our waiter, was fantastic!
One of the best meals I‚Äôve had! If you‚Äôre in Philly, definitely eat here.
Superb attention to detail by The Culinary staff and front-of-the-house staff was marvelously accommodating.
One of the best dining experiences you'll have.
Always an outstanding culinary and service experience with a mix of old favorites, new dishes and wonderful wine pairings!

I have eaten recently recently at L'ambroisie, Le clarence, garance, Tour d'Argent, Restaurant du Palais Royal, Le Gabriel, Gabriel Kreuther. vetri is an old favorite of mine. I have eaten here 10 times. The food was mixed. Within the tasting menu format, 3 or 4 dishes were brilliant. A few very ordinary.The service was also very mixed. Our main server was really good, but the others were poor. Compared to lunch at "Restaurant du Palais Royal", vetri was inferior, and poor value.

An incredible meal! The food and wine pairing was SO good! The service was phenomenal as well. And it was really cool that Mark Vetri took the time to make the rounds and spend a couple minutes talking to us. Fantastic overall meal, a must if you are in the area! Cheers!!

Very good, not great.  This is due to the temperature of the pastas and the main courses.  Without exception, every dish came to the table lukewarm, like they were sitting around in the kitchen and not made to order.  For the price, I would have expected better.

My favorite part of this whole experience was constructing the tasting menu. Our server, Tara, came to our table and announced we were to have a discussion regarding what we enjoy eating and what we do not. Was there anything we felt we absolutely needed to try? Any ingredients of which we are particularly fond? I wish every restaurant with an unset tasting menu did this, it's brilliant. Ultimately, we did not choose any particular courses, so it was a surprise, but a surprise built around our tastes. There were six main courses, 3 bread courses, an amuse-bouche, and a couple mignardises. Every other main course had an additional entree we shared. Our tasting menus were completely different from one another, so we were able to try each other's entrees as well. Overall, we tried a little over 20 dishes. All of them were exquisite and definitely on the richer side. I was pretty full about two-thirds of the way through.What made the experience amazing, food aside, was our brilliant server. Tara is an absolute food genius, emotionally intelligent, and easy to understand. Her knowledge is vast and gave an immediate answers to every question without missing a single beat. Playful and understanding, she intuitively knew when to give us space as well as when to swoop in with another brilliant display. Truly a magical night and reunion with my father, made special by Tara. P.S. I'm sorry for tripping you, I still feel guilty!
Excellent culinary experience. Superb staff and support.
My favorite boston restaurant.  Great atmosphere, food, service, and value.  Highly recommend.

Yvonne‚Äôs is my new favorite Boston restaurant. The space is unique and comfortable but with a wow factor. The small plates menu is very well balanced with meat, cheese, vegan options. Our party of four ordered 10 plates and each was uniquely seasoned, spectacular in taste and presentation. ‚ÄúHolly‚Äù our waitress was a fount of knowledge about the menu but also Locke Ober, the men‚Äôs club previously in the space for a very long time. We all enjoyed learning about the interiors and renovations. Don‚Äôt change a thing!
Jessica needs to time down her attitude. Awful customer service.

We have been wanting to go to Yvonne‚Äôs for a while and it just never seems to happen.   I have to say it was worth the wait. The menu has lots of short plates and we had many.  Every single item we had was delicious.  Don‚Äôt miss the fritters!   Just an incredible experience.  Our server wasn‚Äôt the best but she has lots of other staff helping and they were all great.  For the ‚Äúfeast‚Äù we had the brisket which was totally worth the wait.   Can‚Äôt wait to go back and try the few dishes we didn‚Äôt eat.  Can‚Äôt say enough great things about this place
Special place, amazing ambience, incredible bar, delicious food

There is no better place to have a special holiday dinner.... this has become a tradition for four of us ... the food is spectacular  in taste and presentation and everyone from entering the restaurant to wait staff is super nice.... unpretentious and great people... thank you !

One bartender let my wife sit there for 7-8 mins without asking her if she wanted anything... Paige the other bartender was good and we‚Äôre glad she was there. Our service at the table was very good, would just avoid that one bartender (sorry, didn‚Äôt get a name)

We're big fans of Yvonne's, and while we don't go as often as we'd like, when we go our experience is excellent.We went because it was our anniversary, and our server helped make it even more special.  He recommended drinks and other menu items, took pictures for us, let my wife try a drink to be sure it was what she expected.  Great service!Our reservation was early, so it wasn't super busy, and relatively quiet.  Seemed like a good time to go if you wanted a reasonable noice level.  Dinner on a Thursday - Saturday can be quite noisy.For new visitors, think of it as mostly small plates for sharing.  Well seasoned, good quality.  We loved the lamb, the beef tartar, and potato snacks (the menu name escapes me).  The desserts didn't measure up to the rest of the menu, and were just ok.We spent about $100pp and felt like it was good value for a special occasion.

I came here with my boyfriend for our anniversary dinner. Yvonne‚Äôs really went above and beyond! I had indicated that it was our anniversary on opentable and take gave us some complimentary champagne to start off the night. The food and drinks were amazing and the service was great as well!
Very romantic. The food was superb and the service was excellent. Prices were good as well.

I have only been to Yvonne's once and I tried to return just a week later but they were already booked! The food has a lot of flavors and came out as it was ready -- I highly recommend the hummus and shrimp!
Really cool vibe and great food.
Definitely recommended for cocktails, but could get better food for the same price elsewhere.

We were really enjoying our evening at the bar, the drinks were great and the ambiance was perfect. But once we were brought to our dinner table the night changed. Our host escorted us past several open tables in the main dining area through a clandestine passageway into a completely different part of the Yvonne's that I was not expecting. Although intrigued at first by the completely different decor, the dark space and thumping techno music just wasn't for me. It was too loud and too club-like for what we had in mind. Given how different the two sections are, I wish the host, the website or someone gave us a choice of seating space in advance. The food was great. Not rushing to go back.

We have been making Yvonne's a tradition to begin our evening's prior to the opening night at the Boston Ballet and have to say that the menu changes are wonderful - always great to change things up! The food is, as always, creative and delicious! The cocktails are fabulous and the wine list is excellent! We love Yvonne's and look forward to our next evening there!!

Such a great place, dishes were delicious and well thought out. Hit all the right taste buds and drinks were top notch!Recommend the steak tartare toast, lamb ribs, tater tot squares.Josephine baker was a delicious drink to end the meal!
Awesome spot for a Friday night! Our server was the best, had great recommendations for both food and drinks. Will definitely be going back soon!
The food was way over priced and very over spiced.  Too hot and too salty!!
Very accommodating of our vegan diner; great food, service. Will definitely return
The food and atmosphere was great.  The service was just ok, not slow, just felt like we were putting them out with our order....
Food and Ambiance good.  Service amongst the worst I have ever experienced

I love the food and ambiance at Yvonne's, which is why I keep coming back!  I know they get busy on weekends, but I wish the waiters wouldn't rush the food out quite so fast.  It can feel like quick table turnover is being prioritized over dining experience.
Very cool ambience.  Fabulous cocktails and wine.  Outstanding service.  Will definitely be back next time I visit Boston!  Highly recommend!
Yvonne‚Äôs is such a great. AMAZING ambience, tasty food and delicious drinks. Perfect for a special night out!
Consistently good meal.  Usually quite bustling but nice and quiet on this Sunday night.

Amazing meal at Yvonnes! We had our first date here over a year ago and on this visit they somehow  managed to seat us at the same table. Yvonnes remains one of our favorite restaurants in Boston. Incredible food and ambiance.

BAMM!  Another great meal and dining experience... the staff is A-plus as is the food.  Viper CHOP..yummy.  Tater tots... so good and a reminder of childhood.  Just a great time all around ... if I had to change one thing it would be the new martini glasses (get back to traditional)...
Matt was a great server,  enjoyed the experience, and sharing the small plates

We loved it.  The decor and overall ambiance were perfect.  We had an early dinner before a concert at the Orpheum Theater but it didn't feel early.  We sat at a good sized table in the library among the books and cool artwork.  The lighting is dim and comfortable and plenty of room at the table.  Atmosphere was loud but not too loud--I felt like we could talk without being overheard and vice versa.  They offer some really fun drinks.  I ordered one that was spiced up for the holidays.  Delicious, a little pricey, but justified for a night out in Boston.  We ordered several small plates and snacks.  Everything was delicious.  Easy walk to the concert afterward.  Highly recommend!
The room is elaborately decorated and evokes a speakeasy vibe. Service was attentive and friendly. That's it. The food was assertively mediocre. Not going back for food, but perhaps for drinks.
Wonderful meal. Inventive. Bustling atmosphere!
AMAZING SPOT!!
Food was fantastic at Yvonne‚Äôs but the ambiance was sub-par.  Very noisy Restuarant, more like a club than a place for a romantic dinner.  Food was outstanding.
Great food, and  service.... INSANE noise level for a Wednesday at 6:30pm.    Great for friends dinner, but not for a business or casual-catch-up-over- dinner.
We loved Yvonne‚Äôs üòäüëçüèª

The ambiance was excellent and the food wonderful! Loved the tuna. The only complaint I have is the slow service that night. No menus, no water and no attention until we had to (friendly) ask for attention three times until one of the waitresses actually attended to our table.

We went here for my birthday on a busy Saturday night and Michael our waiter was outstanding! He was friendly, super helpful, and attentive. If we could request him again next time we would! As always, the food, drinks, and atmosphere were perfect!
The food was amazing and the staff was very professional. Defiantly good for a special occasion or a date. Defiantly going to be recommending this place to my friends!
Everything was wonderful. Specialty cocktail presentation was awesome!

First time at Yvonne‚Äôs for a date. Great experience overall, we grabbed drinks at the bar and were seated per reservation once the time came. The service was good and the drinks and food were outstanding. Will come back!
Amazing food. the lamb was cooked to perfection

We absolutely love coming to Zahav! Our only complaint is the wait time for a reservation but it is for good reason, this is THE place to eat in Philly! My husband and I have been several times and most recently took our parents to enjoy the experience. If you are looking for true Israeli cuisine, this is the place for you! The food is beyond delicious, authentic and the overall vibe of the restaurant is fun and fresh. You won't be disappointed!
One of the best meals you‚Äôll have (possibly ever) hands down. It‚Äôs worth it for the food alone but the service is impeccable.

I'm not sure if we were there on an off service night but from when we arrived to when we left our experience was less than stellar.  You arrive & its quite chaotic, table wasn't ready upon arrival for our reservation for us & many others waiting in front of us.  Our server was the highlight of the night, she was great throughout our experience.  One of the items we came for was the famous Slow Cooked Lamb Shoulder.  When asked about it for the tasting menu, we were told they were out already, for a 7:30 reservation which is ridiculous when you can get bar seating without reservations earlier & can order it.  Our experience continued downhill from there.  Drinks took forever to come out & our food was coming out under cooked, over cooked & cold as we watched the table next to us who sat down 15 minutes after us & took forever to place their order get their food before us having also ordered the tasting menu.  Our steak looked well done while theirs came out right after ours looking as if it was just pulled off the grill.  They left & paid before us.  The "pusher" responsible for reviewing & releasing the food wasn't doing a great job.  We watched tables around us get food at completely random times with long waits, short wait & no cadence.  The food was rather forgetabble. We have an Israeli restuarant in Chicago that across the board all their dishes were better especially for the price.  The hot hummus was the best part of the meal.  Reservations are so hard to get & the fact you don't get asked during your reservation if you are interested in their signature dish would make one assume you can't request ahead of time but first come first serve.  There is no information regarding any of this on their website.  If you are going for that dish, get a bar seat or make 5pm reservations.
